I ordered a chicken taco and a carnitas burrito. I loved the burrito, the carnitas were very tasty and I am glad they don't use rice. Less carbs for me.
The reason I'm leaving 3 and not 5 stars is due to the fact that the chicken in my taco was dry, had cartilage stuck on it, and just wasn't packing any flavor. I'm a fan of chicken, and sorry to say that I'll stay away from it when I do go back. I'd like to go back and try some of the other meats in hopes that it's only the chicken that's dry.
author: Ethan A.

description: Tacos and burritos are fine enough but the line and the crowds are not worth it. The owner is super nice and the workers do a very good job of cleaning up around as people leave. However, If I had to do it over again I would have passed on this place.
author: Eileen O.

description:
Let's cut through the hype. Best Burrito in the World might be overblown. However, I eat here at least once a week (carnitas super burrito baby). Here's the skinny.

1. The burritos have no rice which makes them more flavorful and less gut-pain-inducing as other taquerias.
2. Their meat is excellent. Cooked to perfection. I can't vouch for where it is sourced from.
3. They steam their wraps (not grill) unless you ask for Dorado style, so it is a little rubbery by default instead of flakey like Tacqueria Cancun or Farolito. I personally like both styles.

These burritos are great. Consistent, not to big, not too small, with quality ingredients. 

They're the best in my world, if not the world.
author: Adam B.

description: My husband and I have been coming to this place for years and years more than ten years actually and this place is always really busy but worth the wait.  The food is excellent! The staff is always nice. They know us already. We love this place!
author: Glenda C.

description:
BEST DAMN TACOS PERIOD. I've been eating tacos here for 31 yrs. The veggie tacos are worth the wait. Just recently has this place become super duper popular, its probably yelps fault actually. It's their beans so much flavor, and all that sour cream and cheese. Be prepared to pay about 5$ a taco. The burrito is also good, but  the tacos are the stars. 

They are known for making their tacos with two tortillas a crunchy fried tortilla and a soft one. This is optional, but necessary.

My partners' favorite taco is the carnitas. He buys three, one for later.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Hands down best burrito I have ever had. Just plain delicious goop inside a tortilla. The lines are long but it moves fast. I'm also a fan of their strawberry agua fresca.

It's cash only so come prepared.
author: Lily L.

description: We actually got seating. It was 25 min wait on a busy day but it was worth it!!! My al pastor super burrito was hot, flavor packed, and ginormous. Definitely worth waiting in line for.
author: Caroline T.

description: Best carne asada in the city hands down!!! Voted best burrito in the country but I think their tacos are what's up. My favorite is the el dorado taco with carne asada and avacado on top. Is this a very expensive taco? Yes. Is it worth every penny? Indubitably.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Yum! This place has definitely one of the best burritos I've ever had. Go for the carnitas super burrito which is just the regular but with sour cream, guac, and cheese! Make sure to get it el Dorado style which means they grill it on all sides so the tortilla is crispy.

More pricey in comparison to El Farolito (it was about $10 including tax) and also smaller in size (I was able to finish the whole thing!) Their burritos also don't come with rice but you don't really miss it! The burrito is super flavorful and tasty without it. Chips are extra unfortunately and don't come with the burrito.

Definitely worth a visit if you're in the area but personally I still think El Farolito has the best burrito!
author: Fiona Y.

description: Food was okay, tables dirty, extremely  overpriced and cash only. Don't pay 20 bucks for a burrito and a single drink. The owner should get a credit card machine if he wants to charge that much.
author: Sergio R.

description:
I love me some Mission burritos. LOVE. El Farolito is usually my jam. So much so that often times when I roll in to the city, I'll hop off BART at 24th and Mission just to grab a burrito on the way to my hotel. So of course with a local guide on hand, I have to check out some of the other lauded offerings, and La Taqueria is squarely on that "must try" list. 

Impressed? not really. My burrito was just okay. They didn't grill the tortilla, so it was soggy about halfway through eating. The meat flavor was good and overall I like the simplicity of meat, beans and pico. but honestly, for the wait and the hype, I guess I could have expected more. Maybe I ordered wrong, and I assume thousands of people can't be that incorrect. So I'll likely come back and try the tacos. 

But on the basis of a burrito alone, I think Farolito and CanCun are better options.
author: Don B.

description: Great meat a bit on the pricier side but worth it since there is nothing close to it in San Francisco. Tacos are the best thing here I get the super steak tacos! I would not recommend getting the burrito here since its around  $13-14 for a super steak burrito plus they are small.  Cash only!
author: Kevin A.

description:
This place was recommended by a friend (local) and it absolutely delivered! As a vegetarian, I was very pleased with their super vegetarian tacos. Our party also got super chicken tacos which were just as good. Some tips: 
The guacamole is just avocado, but still worth the price.
Lines get CRAZY here, and so does the self seating. Be ready to leave with your food or be on the prowl for a table as you wait for your food. 
The watermelon acqua fresca is out of this world, and so well priced!
author: Tom S.

description: If you are in San Francisco, if you are craving authentic Mexican food, you'd better march your booty right into La Taqueria. I cannot get their chicken tacos and salsa off my mind. We will meet again.
author: Camille F.

description:
La Taqueria has always been popular, but ever since they won the "Best Burrito" award, they have gotten crazy busy, deservedly so.  I avoid the weekends and go on the weekdays.  The last time was on a Monday around noon, and there were only a few people ahead of us--and we even snagged a couple of seats at a bigger table in the back of the restaurant.  

To me, the carnitas is the best.  La Taqueria's burritos are not as large as some others in the city, but they are tasty.  Sometimes I get the Super Taco--which has all the flavor, but no rice/filler, which I consider a plus.  That with a pina (pineapple) aqua fresca, and I'm a happy camper.  Try it--you will be too.  The aqua frescas come in some cool flavors like strawberry, watermelon, and tamarind.  I like the pineapple the best, but you should try them all, at least once.
author: Ces S.

description: Long line to order. Chaos inside. Long time waiting awkwardly in the madness for your sub-par food. The meat was cold. My chicken had weird cartilage. There are a dozen or more Mexican joints in the neighborhood that are all-around much better
author: Lukish D.

description: This place is all hype. Waited 45 minutes for what I thought would he an amazing burrito. What I got was a salty, flavorless mush wrapped in a tortilla. Not worth it. One star for the cantaloupe aguas frescas. The was good.
author: Dayana A.

description: This place has been the best Mexician food place for decades in SF. The lines and numerous food magazine and TV show write ups support my claim. But personal it is my favorite place when I get the craving.
author: Tony D.

description:
Carne Asada Burrito, 'Super' -- $11.XX

My credentials: (1) overweight, (2) lived in and travelled extensively through Mexico, (3) born and raised in LA, and have eaten more burritos at more places than any healthy human should in their lifetime. 

I was turned onto this place after reading about it on four thirty five. It was truly exceptional. Probably the best carne asada burrito I've ever had. I prefer a riceless burrito and this delivers. The tortilla is the sort of soft, chewy flour kind you dream of. Make sure to get it with sour cream, cheese, and avocado. And please don't tell my wife that I went.
author: Bartleby S.

description: I liked La Taqueria, the food was great and the atmosphere was very nice. Add to that, prices are reasonable. Authentic place if you are looking for one. Truly one of the best Mexican food restaurants in the Bay Area....highly recommended.
author: Sam N.

description: The best burrito I've tried in the city, just the perfect spice!! Wonderful, good price.
author: Enrique B.

description:
This place is next best in a vegetarian burrito to TACO BELL! I began eating it and all I was eating was gobs and gobs of sour cream, flavorless guacamole and a few pinto beans for probably four bites and I gave up! What in the hell was that? I got up and left and will damn well never return OR tell a single soul to either! I haven't a clue how anyone can go "nuts" for this if they're vegetarian! There's no rice...or cabbage or even salsa in mine! Disgusting. 

GO TO el farolito on 24th ave and mission if you want real Mexican food.
author: Maddy B.

description:
Ok... So I heard somewhere that this place might have the "best burrito in America," and I put that in air quotes because this was most definitely NOT the best burrito in America. 

Before you burn me at the stake and throw me to the wolves... Let me plead my case.

First off the ONLY ingredients in the burrito and the taco are 1. Meat, 2. Pick de gallo, 3. Beans... That's it! Literally those three ingredients.. Nothing more... 

No rice, no cheese, no fries, nothing else 

You can get a "super burrito" but the only thing super about it is the guacamole and sour cream.... Wut?

When I asked for a burrito with no beans the lady said so just meat and pico de gallo? 

I guess my American brain somehow assumed rice was an automatic part of every burrito equation. 

NOT TRUE.

I need rice... Maybe it's the Asian in me.. THEY DON'T EVEN HAVE RICE IN THE STORE! 

What kind of devil witchcraft!?!? 

AND if you want to substitute meat in place of the beans (which they have a menu item for...) they charge extra!!!!! 

It's 2016 DAMMMMITT! How you gonna not carry rice PERIOD!?!? 

Whatever...

I did give two stars to la taqueria one for the horchata and one for the quesadilla... The cheese was bombbbb 

BUT THEY DONT EVEN PUT ANY OF THAT CHEESE IN THE BURRITO!!!!! IF YOU WANT CHEESE AT ALLLLLL

YOU HAVE TO PAY EXTRA!!!! 

Blasphemy...

I very much wanted to like you la taqueria... But I don't....

 And that makes me a sad burrito 
Just like your guys burrito... Sad.
author: Norman F.

description: That was the most "tendered" meat that I have eaten in the US. Definitely a very tasty tourist trap! Since I was there after the work, the queue wasn't that long, and I was able to find a place to sit outdoor :)
author: Meric D.

description:
I finally visited the famous La Taqueria on a Monday afternoon (around 2 PM) for a late lunch and the place was PACKED. When entering, I found all of the seats taken and a bunch of people standing around either waiting in line or waiting on their order; honestly, it was pretty hard to tell where the end of the line was. It ended up being at the very back of the restaurant, winding its way to the bathrooms.

The wait in line wasn't actually that long since the restaurant seems to be fairly efficient taking and making orders; they better be with so many customers. I ordered a carne asada super burrito, dorado style (as suggested by many other Yelpers) and to my surprise the cost was nearly $12!!!! Now, for a taqueria, this is pretty expensive in my opinion. I've had plenty of excellent super burritos around the area for $7 or $8, but have not seen the price go into double digits very often...Even in Palo Alto, where everything is much more expensive, $12 for a burrito would be considered a bit much.

Considering the price and the reputation, I had pretty high expectations for my burrito. Once I picked it up and unwrapped it, I found a deliciously-looking, golden-crusted piece of food that I was ready to devour. Ordering the burrito dorado style was definitely a positive; the extra grilling that they do gives the tortilla a nice crispy texture that works well with the filling. Other than this, though, I found the burrito to be just OK. It wasn't particularly spectacular to me. Everything was quite delicious, but since my expectations were raised by the price and what I had heard, I was a bit underwhelmed in the end.

I definitely recommend trying out the place and ordering your burrito dorado style, but if you're looking for great burritos at a cheaper price (as burritos should be!), look elsewhere. There are so many options in the area. This place seems to be a bit hyped up.
author: Mason J.

description:
Quite possibly the best tacos I've EVER had. The Super taco aka "Dorodo Taco" is THE BEST. A handmade hard shell taco wrapped in a cheese melted soft tortilla FILLED (I mean overflowing) with meat, some beans, quac, sour cream, and salsa. This isn't like your average "street taco" that skimps on the meat and you munch on lettuce. This is a beast. I'm a big guy and two does it for me. (Maybe 2 1/2 if I'm ravished). Huge, delicious, warm and fresh, and SO DANG GOOD. 

Also, burritos and the horchata is good.
author: Austin H.

description:
Such a great burrito! I got the Carnitas Regular burrito and a large horchata. The meat was cooked PERFECTLY! The horchata was the perfect level of sweet and creamy. 

I would definitely come back here. The atmosphere is a fun change from other places in SF. The employees are sweet and helpful. I can't wait to come back during my next visit to SF!
author: Ava S.

description: The carnitas was super tasty.  However, they did a crap job wrapping the burrito:  it leaked, then fell apart.  Add in the super long wait and it's just not worth it.  Oh, also, the burrito was small and cost $10.90.  Tasty only goes so far.
author: seth c.

description:
LONG LINES. 

I came and there was a line around the restaurant and out the door. They know what they're doing, so the line moves pretty quickly. Order first, then pay. Wait a little while before they call your number and pick up your food. There aren't enough seats, but you can definitely stalk out a place on a communal table or just bring it somewhere else and it. 

I ended up getting the super carnitas dorado burrito. Super means adding sour cream, avocado, and cheese to the meat, beans and pico de gallo from the regular burrito. The carnitas are delicious - definitely a great addition. Dorado - means grilled which creates this great outside texture on the burrito. I've never had it that way before. 

Overall, long lines and honestly not a big enough burrito to justify the price. But for a burrito itself, it isn't bad!

Protip: get in early, get it dorado style to get it grilled which makes it fabulously delicious.
author: Nina Y.

description: So it may not be the "best burrito I've ever had", but it's easily in the top 3. I've been here 5 times now and have never been disappointed. Honestly the only problem I have is having enough cash to stop in. The portion sizes are great and there are plenty of options. My favorite order is the carnitas super burrito. Sometimes the wait can be a little meh but always well worth it
author: Chris E.

description:
I have no idea why FiveThirtyEight rated this place so highly. It is just okay. There are better options in the area. The meat and beans were very bland. I would look foolish if I told my mother "this is the best burrito place in America!" She would stare at me and say "Ay mija. Como seras....."

Also, I do not understand when taquerias add pico de gallo but not rice. You need the rice to soak up the juices or else the unthinkable will happen. Your tortilla will get soggy and will fall apart. Yuck. Get it dorado.
author: Cindy C.

description: Crowded, noisy, long lines (we didn't even go on a busy day and the line was out on the street), poor ergonomics (you wait in line while brushing elbows with seated diners), prices aren't that cheap, and yet, despite all these things, I have to give this place five stars.   Good food is good food, even if you have to fight for a seat while you wait in line.   I ordered the burrito with cow tongue "dorado" style (they grill outside of burrito golden brown), and was treated to tender, flavorful bites of perfectly seasoned beef, fresh salsa, and just the right amount of seasoning.  I was able to try a few bites of the carne asada burrito as well and was equally impressed at the tenderness, juiciness and flavor.   Going to this place will remind you that a good eating experience should just be about great food and the friends you bring along to eat it.  Which reminds me of another hurdle to jump, bring cash cause that's all they accept.   Old school.
author: Ben B.

description: Oh boy oh boy this burrito is delicious! Some folks did mention the lack of rice but I actually liked it. Rice is just filler and keeps me from being able to finish a whole burrito. I got the super carne asada burrito dorado style (toasted on the outside). The beef was delicious and oozing with gooey cheese. This burrito hit the spot. Came here for lunch on the weekday and the line wasn't long but the place was pretty packed. LOVED this burrito!
author: Lisa D.

description:
I have been enjoying La Taqueria tacos for years. I don't live in the neighborhood anymore but still make a point to stop in when I'm in town.
My recent visit was a real disappointment. The interior tortilla was over fried and hard to eat. The pico de gallo was mushy and bland. Used to be bright, fresh with cilantro and onion. Lastly the avocado that used to be rough chopped and fresh is now runny guacamole. 
In my opinion they've gone from great to just okay. Such a disappointment. I hope they can bring back the fresh, bright flavors and attention to detail that elevated a deceptively simple taco.
author: Shareen D.

description:
THIS PLACE IS CASH ONLY!  ATM in back though.

So I realized that I hadn't written a review for this place and it's hands down the best taqueria food I've ever had.  I started coming here during undergrad after a friend of mine mentioned the awesome super tacos.   The place has never let me down.  It is always tasty and hit the spot for me for a solid week back when I was pregnant (if you've never been pregnant that sounds disgusting but if you have been - you get it.   

We came earlier today for my mom's birthday and it was as good as ever.  My sons and nephew devoured their first ever tacos from La Taqueria (regular carnitas and chicken for them).  My hubs loved his super carnitas burrito as did my mother - she's super health conscious and eats like a bird but she downed this burrito.  I had a pair of super tacos.   The carne asada is always seasoned well, the chicken is always tender, the lengua and cabeza are also tasty.  However, the carnitas at this place are the best I've had ever.   

Order the tacos dorados otherwise you'll end up with a mess.   The aguas frescas are also really good; strawberry, pineapple, watermelon, mango - you can't go wrong.  I can't speak to the vegetarian options bc well, I'm not a vegetarian.   Oh and the people complaining about no rice in the burritos are nuts - that's just filler and dries out the rest of the burrito.   El Farolito can keep their lettuce and rice, I'll take La Taqueria any day.
author: c c.

description:
Delicious tacos!! Place is small, so it's always a race when it comes to finding a table to sit. Long lines at times but so worth the wait and the drive!!

You can take Bart here, it's just up the street from the Mission exit. Just walk up 2 blocks.

And this place is cash only!!!
author: Yvette P.

description: One word FIRE so bomb had all the tacos they offer and it was amazing. My favorite was the beef tongue ! Visiting from out of town will always make this a stop. Really packed and busy so be prepared to squish and wait but it's beyond worth it. Oh and get them super style with cheese !!!!
author: Ashley W.

description:
the food here is pricey. the people who work here mostly have an attitude because they know its a popular restaurant and they can thus be snobby about this.  I like proud chefs and restaurant workers but it would need to be the pride out of good reasons. Here, I think they are just proud because they let the fame and hype get into their heads.  

I ordered the beef tongue taco and corn quesadilla - turned out the corn quesadilla looks and tastes like a corn taco...  ordered a flour quesadilla to go for my hubby and he likes it but said its a bit greasy.  

we could def taste the freshness in the food.  but after the trip to new mexico and mexico, one would not think they have the best tacos or burritos in the world as they have claimed to have.
author: Shuting Z.

description: Steak tacos w/ the crunchy inner layer tortilla is perfection! Make sure you order Dorado style.
author: Wes L.

description: Eh. Ive had better burritos. The place was packed even though we went at an odd hour. The beef burrito el durado style was good but nothing really special. Do not get the chicken taco they simply threw on a huge chunk of dry white meat chicken. It was awful. Get the pork taco. Very filing.
author: Prima Z.

description:
My friends and I came here on a Saturday at about 3. Luckily, we found a parking spot close by, because we had to feed the meter due to the wait time. It took about 15 minutes to stand in line and another 10 to get our food, but the wait was worth it. 

I got the carnitas and carne asada tacos dorado style with guacamole and cheese and washed it down with a mango fruit drink. Every bite melted in my mouth. It was messy, but hey, that's what napkins are for.  

Sure, it's more than I would normally pay for a couple of tacos, and the line was a pain, but when visiting a city like SF with great restaurants everywhere, it comes with the territory. Similar to Phil's BBQ in SD, for a weekend visit, it's fine, but it would be a pain to deal with the wait times and parking hassles on a consistent basis.
author: Jay D.

description:
Favorite burrito place in the city.

Crispy (Dorado style) Carne Asada (Pretty tasty, not super salty and oily) Super Burrito

One of the few places I don't feel like dying after eating their burrito.

Or you can go with their Tacos which are quite filling. 

Just be warned the burritos do not come with rice and prepare for a long line at before noon and around 6.

If you have a problem for the amount you get for the price (and stop with the WELL WHERE I COME FROM THESE ARE 2 DOLLARS because this is San Francisco), then feel free to go somewhere else. This is a Quality over quantity spot.
author: Dylan T.

description: Food was delicious but small portions, the biggest burrito was small. You probably have to eat two of them to get full.
author: Javed A.

description:
First time here and it wasn't too packed. There is no organization where to line up. Everyone was standing around the cashier and there was no line. Very confusing. 

My go to burrito shop has always been to el Farolito so I we'll compare the two burritos. 

The burrito here costs $11 vs $8. 
Burrito here is only 2/3's the size of the burrito from el Farolito. 
Flavor here is pretty bland. 

Even if the burritos from both shops were the same price and same el Farolito is top dog!

Only way this place gets five stars is if you compare this place with Taco Bell!
author: Stanley C.

description:
Another taco joint in the Mission, do you see a pattern here?

This place puts beans in their tacos.  It took a few moments for me to digest that, but it's actually not bad.  If you order it 'super', which is what I did, you will also get sour cream, cheese, and guacamole.  Not the tacos I am used to, but this is the Mission so who cares?

The quality of the beef, carne asada is really good.
author: S K.

description: Waited over an hour for a super quesadilla with carnitas. What I got was soggy guacamole and beans wrapped in soggy and cold tortilla
author: Miracle B.

description: When I was visiting San Francisco I was told this was the place to go for burritos. Located in the authentic mission district, this place did not let me down. The burrito did not have rice which I think helped make it so light and I didn't feel lethargic as I normally do after putting back a whole burrito. It is cash only so make you have some money on you because you will not want to miss out on one of the beat burritos.
author: Denise H.

description:
La Taqueria absolutely delicious! After finding this place on a list of top 10 burritos in the nation, I came here with my cousins and brother. It held up to its reputation. I had the chicken burrito and my fam had the carne asada burrito. The meat is so tender and cooked to perfection. The tortilla is nice and warm filled, to capacity, with avocado, sour cream, beans, and rice. I also had the strawberry agua fresca as well as the watermelon. They were really refreshing, especially on a hot summer day. You can taste how fresh the fruit is. The strawberry one was a bit too sweet for my taste because they added sugar.
Expect for there to be a wait for food and tables. The restaurant is always packed, and rightfully so. The cashier moves pretty fast, so I would totally wait in line in the future. 
Only reason I have to deduct 1 star is that they don't have a spicy salsa. I love spice and its hard for me to go to a Mexican restaurant where the spiciest condiment they have is pickled jalapeno. Please don't let this stop you from stopping by and missing out on this great food.
author: Sudeep R.

description:
One of La Taqueria's customers who was eating by himself gave me his beer and his table. Great guy! 

The food was good too but when served with a side of hype and having fierce competition from the south bay (LaVics and Iguanas) I'd have to say the best I can do is 3 stars.
author: Michael C.

description:
If you're coming here between Friday afternoon to Saturday night, be prepared for a long line that goes outside!

My friends and I usually go here before we go out to the bars to have some food in our stomachs. The food is really good, much better than a majority of taquerias along Mission St. The burritos are so huge I can never finish all of it. Their tacos, on the other hand, I feel are hit or miss. They're either amazing that you want more, or the meat is on the drier side. It doesn't help that 9 out of 10 times they run out of the meat I want, such as lengua or al pastor. I'm thinking, "it's only 6 pm and you're already out?" Also, when you order beers, I feel like they always forget to get you them. I have to ask for my Pacifico or Corona every time I pick up my food. Frustrating but anyways...

I've really tried to love this place, but these misses won't let me. I don't know if it's because of the hype and their numerous awards on the walls that are telling me otherwise, but I keep coming back.
author: Erika P.

description:
This is the best burrito in America? Are they drunk and/or high?

La Taqueria won the prestigious honor of best burrito in America, but I'm not seeing it. I can understand the whole "no rice" thing, no worries there. But when half of the small burrito is pico de gallo and the other half is sopping wet (not marinated) carne asada, you know there's something wrong. Seriously, the burrito was dripping liquid every bite!

Add to the fact that there was a 20+ minute wait for this thing, and this place just isn't worth it. El Farolito still takes the prize there.
author: Casey S.

description:
This place is wicked good. If you're after a juicy burrito, this is your place. Get your tacos and burritos dorado style and thank me later. 

If you are looking for less juice and more flavor/spice, El Farolito may be a better spot for you. 

They also have good chips and salsa, and good guacamole, which seems to be lacking at the other taquerias. 

It's busy, so be ready to wait. I enjoyed playing with their social media display while I was waiting.
author: Grace Y.

description: We had the super vegetarian burritos and loved them. Make sure to ask for hot sauce. Goes well with corona beer.
author: Pratik R.

description:
The hype continues to be real at La Taqueria. I have a lot of respect for a restaurant that keeps up the quality for so many years. Even though the lines can get a little insane the staff keeps it cool and personable, one of the cashiers is makes me crack up every time I visit. One of my favorite restaurants in the Mission for sure.

I go for the super burritos, but the tacos are really tasty too. While you're waiting to pay you can get a pretty amazing show of food prep, quite the precise operation they have.

Atmosphere: 
Full house in here - long communal tables in the middle of the room with some smaller tables on the sides. A few outside seats if you're lucky

Try: 
Carnitas super burrito

Tips:
Cash only
Wait to take a seat until you have your food, it helps everyone nosh sooner :)
author: Taylor S.

description: Pretty good tacos and burritos. But I have to be honest, I failed to see the "must go eat there" factor.
author: Rosa T.

description: Came here while on vacation, the food was amazing. I definitely think that this is the best taco place I have ever been to! Prices are reasonable, nice and friendly staff.
author: Em R.

description: La Taqueria's super burrito is the real deal.  Don't let the haters scare you off. Went early afternoon on a Saturday.  Lines not that bad.  Avoid peak tourist times.
author: Chester K.

description: Hands down one of THE best taquerias I have ever been to. The food is expensive, but well worth it. I got the asada burrito. They don't put rice in their burritos, however that doesn't matter. It's like you can taste the rich flavors of the avocado and meat so much better without it. This place is so good that I would drive from Vallejo to SF just to get their food!!
author: Monique B.

description:
I come here almost every weekend. There is usually a line for this place, but after you try their burritos, you will not even mind the line. 

I always like to get the steak burrito. I really appreciate the quality of the meat they use. You can watch them make it in the back. They use large pieces of meat and they cut them up for your burrito. There is no mystery there. The prices are also very fair. 

The burritos do not have rice, but that does not stop me. The salsa, beans, and meat are enough for me. 

It can be hard to find a seat some times, but since eating burritos are a fairly quick thing, seats usually will open up. Great place and definitely should give this place a try.
author: Lydia H.

description: As a native south Texan, I didn't have high expectations of a taqueria in San Francisco, but boy was I blown away! I got the carne asada quesadilla with pico de gallo. It was the best quesadilla I've had in a long time! The place was packed and after my first bite, I understood why. Fast service, great prices, and amazing food. Definitely one of my favorite meals in San Francisco.
author: Melida N.

description:
La Taqueria has had my heart for over 20 years.  Back in the 90's, everyone raved & raved about La Cumbre.  I thought it was good, but overrated.  Next up?  Pancho Villa.  Again, good, but didn't win me over.

Like Goldilocks trying everything until she found the right one, there I was still on the lookout for the best taqueria in the mission.  

Then I tried La Taqueria.

My search was over.  

I'm a carnitas girl.  They do carnitas to perfection.  Tasty.  Juicy.  Tender.  

Portions are generous.  2 carnitas tacos for me turns out to be 2 meals.  

There's a line most of the time, but it moves quickly.

The mild pico de gallo is a must, & pico de gallo is not even my favorite.  I prefer smooth salsa.  Their green salsa is muy caliente.  Your sinuses will clear.

They won best burrito in America 2014.  No surprise, really.  The walls are loaded w awards & accolades from the likes of Zagat, Sunset, San Francisco Magazine, Yelp, & the SF Chronicle...just to name a few.

My favorite taqueria forever.  They deserve all the accolades they get.  Easily.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
pleasantly surprised... after hanging out in the city decided we wanted some good ole mexican food...  couldn't find my regular spot we were familiar with~ guess gentrification is truly a thing in the mission.
It was a little wait but well worth it.  
Not a meat eater but the vegetarian burrito was very tasty, thought I would miss the rice to my surprise I forgot it wasn't in there... The beans were so good!!
The only thing I missed were the chips~ thought they would come with the meal, next time I'll remember to order them...
Will be back soon~
author: deborah s.

description: Wow, the carnitas taco was SO GOOD! The place was jam-packed as expected right around noon but still managed to find a seat for two. Cash only, hm. Will return to try more things!
author: PaulaHeidi C.

description:
This is my favorite taqueria. I have been going there for so many years. But last weekend was so disappointed with the food. There was 6 of us we ordered our food. They were preparing our tacos but they don't call you until all of them are done and by the time you get them some of them were cold. They put all tacos on top  counter all the pple in line are putting their nose by the tacos that are waiting to be picked up. We ordered a chicken quesadilla for the kids n they just put a chunk I mean a chunk of chicken breast inside they didn't even shred the meat also they burned the tortilla. I ordered a corn quesadilla but it was a tostada quesadilla I was I didn't order a tostada they just put cheese , meat on top of one crunchy tortilla. I was surprise they don't know how to make quesadillas.   
I love this place but was not happy with our food this time. Place is super packed no where to sit.  They make all the food in a hurry.  Se hace con amor la comida.
author: Lupe M.

description: When we walked up I knew it was going to be a good place because the line was out the door. Wonderful tacos. I got one pork and one beef, my husband ordered a chicken burrito. It is a cash only place so be prepared, we stopped as the last leg of our trip and were limited on cash. There is an ATM there. You can order the tacos/burritos "regular" or "super". We got them regular but I can only imagine how incredible the sour cream, avocado, and cheese addition would have been.
author: Hannah B.

description: This place has the greatest burritos known to man. The burritos are filled with juicy meat, creamy guac, and zestful salsa that leaves you hungry for more! You should definitely experience this magic. Just make sure you are patient enough for the long lines. It'll be worth it!
author: Abenezer M.

description:
Food here is really good. One of the few places out here that serves good Mexican food. The Cabeza tacos are one of my favorites. The Carne asada quesadilla is also really good. 

The only reasons I am giving  4 stars instead of 5 is due to the fact that you can almost never get a seat at meal time and they only accept cash.
author: Natasha A.

description: They have decent food but they are highly over priced! Also their closing time should be 8:30 not 9pm  they always close 15-20 minutes prior to their posted or actual closing time. I seen people get  turned away even when they drove all the way from Sacramento just because they close early for no apparent reason! So if you plan on coming here make sure is at least 1 hour prior to their closing time.
author: Nancy R.

description:
Their strawberry mango agua fresca is delicious. Their horchata is pretty good, creamy and not too sweet. 
The tacos come w beans which I am not used to. They were giant and they weren't bad.
The regular burritos come with beans, meat, and pico de gallo. If you make it a super it comes with guac, sour cream, and cheese. The carne asada wasn't bad, better than El Farolito and a few other places I have been to. It kinda reminds me of Chipotle, though. Don't get me wrong, I love Chipotle but I guess I prefer SoCal style tacos and burritos.
author: Heejin L.

description:
Did it live up to the much ballyhooed hype? No. 

It was good, but best burrito in the country? Not by a mile. I loved the food, but I think it was the classic case of hype vs. reality.
author: Bobby H.

description: I finally tried the super carnitas burrito dorado style- apparently the best burrito in the country- and while it was quite good, it didn't make me want to cry and call my whole family on Facetime - which is what I had experienced with the super chicken quesadilla in the past. This one was a little more .... regular. I dunno if the burrito was just having a bad day and didn't feel like exploding with flavor in my mouth, or maybe I just set the bar impossibly high that a burrito would have trouble jumping over. Either way, I respect La Taqueria's food and I will come back yet again before I leave SF to enjoy my staple super chicken quesadilla.
author: Bhavi A.

description: If you love delicious Mexican food, run to La Taqueria. When you get there, embrace the line. It will be there and YES it's worth the wait. Now I'm a newbie but I'll tell you what I learned. Make sure you ask for El Dorado style whether you are getting a taco, burrito, etc. I had the carne asade tacos with most everything on it. It was hands down the best meat I've had in a very long time. The taco was served in a crispy tortilla which was wrapped in a soft taco. I don't know why it's magic but I promise it is. Get two tacos and they will fill you up. My only regret was not taking a picture before I devoured them. I also had the strawberry agua fresca which was the best one I've ever had. Bring cash. Enjoy!!!
author: M H.

description: Tacos were just ok! I can't understand why there is so long lane. There is nothing special with this place. It was good but $15 for two tacos in Mission is kinda overpriced. And also keep in mind that it's CASH ONLY.  Definitely not worth 30 min wait.
author: Kate E.

description:
Apparently, writing a review in Spanish gets you filtered.  So let's try this again.  They're famous for having the "best burrito in america" and the employees and Yelpers recommend the carne asada.  (Or the carnitas.)   Well, whaddaya know, that burrito is f*cking incredible.  I think it's the tortilla, which is almost so soft it's gooey like it's dim sum.  Oh right, remember to get whatever burrito you're getting as a "super" burrito.  And to do it before 9pm!  Unlike the other famous taquerias in this neighborhood, they close nice and early before the drunk gr!ngos come out.  

You could also be a little counterculture here and get the quesadilla (replete with some greasy magic on the outside) with lengua.  It's pretty baller too.
author: Aaron M.

description: Their burritos are a little small but they are damn good burritos. The owner is really sweet and was giving out roses on the night I went.
author: Kristina N.

description: Ehhhh, maybe it was all the hype but I was very disappointed. First of all, it was the worst vegetarian burrito I've ever had. It was all sour cream and guacamole, which --while delicious-- is not very substantial. The place was PACKED, and if you're lucky enough to find a seat people will be standing on top of you like a seat-vulture. It's also just a cluster, ordering is confusing and the staff does not give a crap. Everyone else in my group got tacos and they were happy, that's the only reason they get three stars.
author: Jenny M.

description: I have been eating these tacos for years and they are consistently the best tacos in the Bay Area. Muy bueno.
author: Michael S.

description: A little busy but worth the wait! Tacos are double what I typically pay in Oakland - enjoy the carnitas and chorizo tacos mucho
author: Aaron H.

description: Food is great especially the al pastor. The carne asada meat is ok, felt like it was smothered in salt. Service is ok, kinda slow, but it is dirt cheap!
author: Carlo E.

description: The best ever.  Literally nothing comes close to La Taqueria.  I have been coming here since I was a little kid and nothing has changed except the menu is now a tv screen and the prices have gone up.  The price is still definitely worth the quality!! 5 stars, no comparison.
author: Brett S.

description: In an area (The Mission) known for its Mexican American community, and cuisine The El Dorado Taco rains supreme in a packed field of competitors. Their Horchata is also some of the best I've had in the area, and even the ice is good (it's the small ice balls that are nice to crunch)
author: Branden N.

description:
I'm normally a taco girl but who am I to pass up the best burrito in the country?!?

Super carne asada burrito (without beans) was life changing. The meat was super tender with no fat or gristle, the salas inside was super fresh, not too much sour cream, and TONS of avocado-just the way I like it! 

Be ready to stand in line, wait for a table, and be armed with plenty of cash cuz this place ain't cheap ($13 just for the burrito, chips and salsa are extra) but it is totally worth it! 

Next time I will try an El Dorado taco and agua fresca.
author: Rachel C.

description:
I was so excited to try this place.  I paid over $10 for a super burrito which is way more expensive than most places. When I got the burrito I noticed how small it was. I said to myself this must be a mistake. I asked if this was the carne asada super burrito and they said yes. All I could think of was what a freaking rip off. A Taco Bell XXL Steak burrito is much cheaper and had much more steak. It's not as good as a taqueria burrito but at least I know what I'm in for. I was so hungry and was in a rush otherwise i would have asked for my money back. I guarantee I will not be ripped of here ever again. That is because I won't ever set foot in here again. 
Flavor wise, meh. It's a burrito and nothing special. It barely had any avocado and steak. Lots of beans. I've had much better burritos at other taquerias.
author: Erick M.

description: American style tacos. I was hoping to eat a much more traditional Mexican taco but instead was disappointed! Overall, wasn't a bad experience
author: Omar Z.

description:
First thing, if you are planning on getting food La Taqueria, you're going to have to wait. The wait is around 30 min so you'll have plenty of time to figure what food to grab.

It's a fairly simple process. Choose tacos or burritos and choose the type of meat you want (chicken, pork, chorizo (sausage), beef, and few more "adventurous" options). I went with the carne asada burrito with fresh pico de gallo, sour cream, guac, and hot sauce.  The carne asada was the best protein I've had from a tacqueria, ever. It was tender, juicy, and you could taste the smoke from the grill.

If you don't mind waiting in line for awhile and you happen to be in the Mission District, this place is a must. The only downside is the lack of seats so make sure you have a buddy to claim a table for you!
author: Marvin E.

description: I came here for my weekly cheat meal with my partner. I ordered two super tacos Dorado style and he ordered a super burrito Dorado style. I'm all about secret menus  (In-N-Out anyone?). I did have to do some convincing to explain to my boyfriend why this was exactly what we wanted. And boy it really didn't dissappoint! It was probably the most delightful pair of Mexican goodness I've ever encountered. It was so good, that I'm willing to claw my way back over the deadlocked Bay Bridge during rush hour traffic, to eat them again! But I probably won't do that because I'm too lazy.
author: Tiarra E.

description:
Came here for the first time for a late-r afternoon lunch on a Friday around 2ish pm. The place was packed, but we were able to find two seats at the counter outside. We each had a super burrito, one carne asada and one chicken. The meat was excellent on each - very luscious and largely sliced, but for a $10 burrito - I wasn't too impressed. The burrito comes with pinto beans, fresh salsa, a bit of gauc, sour cream and no rice. It just felt a little limp and lifeless. Kind of like getting a grande burrito from taco bell, that kind of not-so-dense feeling. It was good, but it wasn't as filling as a super burrito should be. I did like the salsa verde available on each table, and the small fountain soda for $1.50 isn't too bad. 

I'd rather try a nearby taqueria next time than come back again.. just yet.
This place is also cash only!

And, it was my first time here and it was a little confusing on how to order. There's a long line in the front that starts at the register to the back, with a woman who stands on the customer side of the counter to take your oder on a pad, to which you go up and pay. But in between, there's two pick up stations where they call your number that intersects the line.
author: Ravo Y.

description:
If you like Mexican food then you need to give this place a visit. Its like a right of passage thing in SF. That said, i found the burrito a-ok. Nothing special as one may be led to believe based on the ratings. 

I had the chorizo regular burrito. I like the mission style (no rice) but besides that the meat was good and the rest of the ingredients are about what you get at every taqueria. The tortilla was fine, i was hoping for the fresh hand rolled tortillas which have a warm fluffiness to them but they tasted nothing like that. The tomatillo based picante salsa was also good but nothing special. 

On the price side, this place is a bit ridiculous for a taqueria. $8.50 for a regular burrito is as expensive as it gets even for SF. 

Perhaps i dont have an appreciation for the historical significance of this place (having invented the mission style burrito and all) but i could not help but feel like this place is just overhyped.
author: Aditya J.

description: No matter what anyone says, La Taqueria is the BEST place to get burritos in San Francisco. I loooveeeeee this place. I've only ordered the carne asada burrito and taco, but it's been great every single time and I don't feel like I need to try anything else. Unfortunately i don't like beans, so when you ask for no beans they charge you extra.. because they don't use rice in their burritos. So their logic is well we're putting more meat in there. Which i guess makes sense... lol anyway, their juice is also really good. I tried the cantaloupe juice and it tastes fresh. I can't get over how good this burrito place is. you won't regret trying it!!! The only downside is the longggg lines they have during lunch.
author: Kelly S.

description: Food is good, service is fast for the amount of customer they. The cashier is pretty rude, she's been there​ for a long time. If you are close friends w her you you can skip then 20 min lane (I am no that lucky) so made line to see 2 parties walk straight to her an order. 1 of which right in front of me. I wont be coming back.
author: Jerry P.

description: Life changing burrito here. Could you even imagine a burrito without filler (rice)? It's quite an experience. The chorizo and guac just shine through like you've been doing it all wrong. Give it a try and make sure you know what you are ordering before you get in line...
author: Billy D.

description: This place is overated person taking order was fn rude because the were overwhelmed and under staffed and this place is known for thier burritos lol best Mexican food is in LA hands down and have read other people's reviews that live there and theu dont seem as if they like it either oh and there kitchen looks dirty and it smells ...SouthSide
author: Rudy S.

description: So we went on a Friday night .. busy but still fast .. we both ordered the  burrito which is nice since it's not filled with rice .. it's nothing spectacular it's just fresh Ingredients cooked well .. the down fall was we ordered cheese in our burritos and was charged the extra but had not received it other wise they would have gotten 4 star so this is why I give it a 3 .. burrito was a fresh burrito .. seasoned nicely but nothing to go crazy about .. but there bottled tomatillo salsa was nice and spices and flavoured very well.. that's was my highlight ..
author: Ivraan K.

description: The quality of taste is through the roof. The red/green salsa is divine. Best in the city.
author: Landen B.

description: I have been going here since I was a little girl and its hands down the best burrito in town. The people are great. It's a fun atmosphere. I have tried the other taqueria's in SF that people say are equivalent OR better and I disagree. This is by far the best place to grab a burrito in the city. Go hungry!
author: Rachel G.

description: Super fresh and vibrant flavors. Hyped for good reason.
author: Matty R.

description: Food is average. Good but comparable with other Taquerias in the area except more expensive ($4 a taco vs. $2 tacos couple stores down). Overhyped as expect a long line during rush hour. Likely won't come back unless I'm on this side of mission and don't want to stray too far from Mission Pie.
author: Jude N.

description:
Finally.  A taqueria that focuses on quality over quantity.  Don't get me wrong, quantity is very much important but it should never be put before quality.  Both the chicken and steak burrito are stellar. Order the "regular" version if you prefer being healthy and the "super" version if you feel like indulging.

The service is also lightning fast; so even with the average 10-15 people in line,  you'll be fed soon enough.
author: Michele L.

description:
Seriously not the best in my opinion. I thought I would give this place a second chance since it received glowing reviews and awards for best burrito in SF. I ordered a carne asada super burrito (spicy)  -w/o sour cream and chips (extra cost)  It came out to just under 13.00 I received a genourous serving of chips compared to size of the burrito knowing that they dont put rice in their burritos. Honestly, it was the most bland burrito i've ever had. They forgot to add the cheese, fortunately I asked for extra salsa otherwise it would have been a waste. 
Dont waste your time and money, there are better places to go to for a great tasty burrito - Pancho Villa, El Farolito, El Metate and Puerto Allegre.
author: James W.

description: I've lived in the bay area all my life tried dozens of taquerías but none have Carne asada like them,I feel like I'm eating tacos from Mexico it's that authentic.
author: Fidel A.

description: $11 super burritos? $4 tacos? Wait in line and then cash only? FUCK THAT HIPSTER BULLSHIT!! And fuck Nate Silver, too. He was wrong about the election and he's wrong about la taqueria. There are better, cheaper places nearby. Don't waste your time and money.
author: Gabriel E.

description:
So, as much as I love the tacos at La Taqueria, they got ANOTHER award for best burrito in the world, so I went and got one, again.

SUPER Burrito w/ Carne Asada, Dorado

This is the one!! Last time I got it and wasn't impressed, it was because I didn't order  it right, so listen people, get anything and everything DORADO and, don't be cheap, get the SUPER version of it too. This is the way to go. Some people are not impressed, including some of my family members, but it's really only because you don't know how to order. No shame in it, now you know!!

Still my favorite taco spot, not my favorite burrito spot, and still drive from SJ just for this place!
author: Elias R.

description:
Took a friend here a few weeks ago because EVERYONE knows La Taq is a SF household name for Mexican food!

Whenever friends come from out of town, I always make it a point to pack in as many traditional and unexpected points of interest. At the Mission, we explored Clarion Alley, Balmy Murals, Mission Pie, and of course La Taqueria. We split a veggie burrito (they don't do California burritos here sadface) and it was for a cheap price, but I don't remember exactly how much. We took ours to go, and at them on the way back to our parking spot and through Clarion Alley. 

I wouldn't say that this was the best veggie burrito I've ever had...but the tortilla was probably one of the best. Too bad the to-go foil was sticking to my burrito, and I had hella struggles trying to make sure I didn't ingest any. BUT quality-wise, the burrito was golden...but i wasn't my "TOP 3 MOST OMG BURRITOS" I've ever had. Maybe veggie isn't the way to go, so I wouldn't say La Taq is my favorite Mexican spot in Mission.

It's super quick if you want to order and leave. Dining in is kind of awkward, since it's a crowded space, people are always coming in and out, and the food staff just stare at you as they make the food. Service is smiley and str8up 100% Mexican. A lot of the diners were Mexican too, so I guess that means it ain't all that bad. But I just didn't think the veggie burrito was a selling point.
author: Jodi H.

description: Its really hard to find good Mexican food these days!! this is probably the closest you will get to it!! I would highly recommend this place. The only problem is its way too small and it gets extremely crowded they need to open BIGGER Spot!!
author: Alexis T.

description: AMAZING. Probably my favorite meal when I visited SF. I dream about this burrito and guac. Such a cool place. We waited in line for a little bit but it was totally and absolutely worth it. Please go here!!
author: Nora E.

description:
Ate here for lunch on 10/24.  

I saw this place on fivethirtyeight.com as having America's best burrito.

We walked into the restaurant around noon and there was a film crew taking up about a quarter of the place.  It was the travel channel filming a segment for an upcoming episode of food paradise.

I got the Carne Asada Super Burrito Dorado.  I also sampled a burrito that was non Dorado.  I prefer and would recommend the crispy Dorado burrito.

Also, the green hot sauce on the table is an absolute must try.
author: Scott M.

description: WHERE DO I EVEN BEGIN?! I love this place so much I wish I could live next door instead of .7 miles away. I tried la taqueria under the notion that I was told it was where the burrito was invented. Turns out that's not true, bummer, but WHO CARES ITS SO GOOD. Quesadillas are obviously a staple at a Mexican food place and I mean really how do you screw that up but how do you make a quesadilla even better than normal? Fry it of course!
author: Taylor V.

description: I've been to many taqueria but this place beat all of them. The quality of the meat, the freshness of the pico de gallo everything was amazing. It's probably the best burrito I had so far.
author: Massi S.

description: Incredible Mexican food. Everything I had was amazing. Be prepared to spend more than expected if you've never been there. My wife and I ordered: 4 big tacos, a quesadilla and 2 water bottles and it was $36. After we ate we decided it was worth it. The green sauce is also bomb. Would definitely go back.
author: Maddox D.

description:
Yelp lead me to La Taquiera, as I wanted a good burrito in SF. I was not disappointed.

The place is cash only, there was a line, and a bit of a struggle to find a table, but no worries. The burrito was so worth it.

Got the carnitas burrito with cheese. No rice in the burrito to my wonderful surprise, fantastic salsa. A lot of liquids coming from the burrito, but it didn't make anything taste soggy or watery.
author: Jo K.

description:
Ok, this place is bomb. First time I went I was super let down, maybe the burrito is the wrong thing to order here, but my following visits have all been stellar. Tacos are excellent, the carne asada isnt chewy like pretty much every other Mexican restaurant. The flour quesadillas are a good deal and are soo good. They have an interesting techinique for preparing their tortillas and they come out amazing. Chips and salsa are so good here too. I really have nothing bad to say about this place, its top notch, only thing is the line can be long.

Price is super reasonable, imo its a really good deal. Cannot understand people who are complaining about price! Ive lived in SF for 5 years this is probably on the bottom end of price and for what you're getting its incredible. They could raise the price and I would still think its cheap.
author: Adam M.

description: The super burritos are delicious- very filling. I recommend ordering them grilled. Our order was messed up but luckily they fixed it without it being too much of a hassle. We had to wait about 30-40 minutes in line just to place our order on a Saturday around 6:30. Then another 15-20 minutes for the food to be ready. There weren't enough tables available to sit at so we got it to go. I recommend coming early or late to beat the lines and crowd. The food is really good, but not sure Id wait in that line again.
author: Alexandria C.

description:
the tacos and burritos are awesome but my favorite thing about this place is the mango agua fresca!!! it is SO delicious and fresh. there are so many good taquerias in the mission that are super popular like la taqueria, but the mango agua fresca is what keeps me coming back to this one.

the lines get longggg but it moves pretty quickly. service is also great! they are so nice no matter how busy they are.
author: Terra C.

description: This carne asada super burrito (with avocado sour cream and cheese) was DA BOMB. I enjoyed it more than El Faralitos Bc it didn't have rice in it. Great service and great food. I will be dreaming about this burrito all the way back to FL. Get it dorado style, they'll press it for you and really get a nice crisp on the tortilla.
author: Nilo K.

description: Have you ever had a taco so good it made you rethink your life? This is precisely what just happened. My girlfriend and I just came to La Taqueria after a recommendation from the guy at the front desk at our hotel and we were blown away. I actually said to my girlfriend at one point "I wish getting full wasn't a thing so I could just keep eating this". The super taco has melted cheese, your choice of meat, pico, beans(I opted out of), sour cream, and guacamole and was incredible. I bought two thinking they'd be more like street taco sized and was full after the first. The chips and salsa are great, it's just a basket of chips covered in an awesome pico de gallo. Chips come in handy for scooping up mounds of guacamole from tacos too! The place was crazy busy and seating was sparse so you have to hound down people that are about to tap out but other than that was some of the best Mexican food I've had in a long time!
author: Tyler W.

description:
$7 for a regular burrito? A bit pricey compared to other taquerias but fine. 

Charge an EXTRA $1.40 for a squirt of "avocado"? Disappointing but fine.

Charge an EXTRA $1.20 for no beans? WTF, do Chinese restaurants charge extra for no rice? Ridiculous but fine; it better have more meat!

Charge an EXTRA $1.50 for chips and salsa that should be complimentary? OK, now you're pushing my buttons.

Shrink my $10 burrito to the size of a mini beaver cleaver? http://bit.ly/Ue4nmz

OH, HELL NO... this IS where I draw the line.

Good thing Christmas is just around the corner. 

My gift to La Taqueria? A penis pump and a bottle of Viagra!

OTHER NOTES:
*Semi-rude employees; can I get a smile with my $10 burrito please? Geebus.  
*Featured on Food Network's "America's Best: Top 10 Comfort Foods" for their burrito.
*On 7x7's list for their Carnitas Tacos but $5 for a taco with the works here? No thanks.
*Both quality and quantity has declined over the year. Lengua is bland and sparse. No beans option does NOT mean more meat.
*Way overpriced compared to other taquerias in the area. A meal including chips and salsa and a drink will cost you about $16 (that can feed two people at other taquerias)! RIP OFF!
*No rice offered. 
*Avocado option is guacamole not slices of avocado. 
*No salsa bar. You have to ask for salsa and they give you just one small container. 
*Total hipster and yuppie joint; the only natives are the people working here.
*CASH ONLY.
author: Cherylynn N.

description: I'm usually not a huge fan of Mexican food, but I love this place's carne asada burritos! My husband loves the taco which had an extra crunchy tortilla on the inside.  Don't be intimidated by the line, it's worth the wait and they move you along pretty quickly.  Make sure you ask for "CRISPY" to get your burrito or taco a bit more time on the grill for that extra flavor and bite.  Make sure to bring cash !
author: Crystal N.

description: Not worth the hype. The restaurant won the best burrito award in the nation, but it is completely overrated, and the lines are horrendous (no reservations accepted, nor cash). Expect to wait in line at least half an hour during the week and about an hour during the weekends. You will likely have to leave with your take out burrito because many times there are no seats to sit down and eat. The lengua soft taco was bland, and the "dorado" burrito was just OK. I think Gordo's burritos are tastier. There are many other better mexican restaurants in the area where I'll end up next time I am in a mood for Mexican food.
author: Stephanie M.

description: This was taco 4 out of 6 on our taco tour of the "best tacos" in San Francisco. We ranked this one #1 on our list. The long line moved fast and the tacos were absolutely delicious. I found myself looking enviously at the other tacos despite the fact that I'd been eating tacos all day. I know I'll be back for more.
author: Hideko T.

description:
I'll be honest, I was hyped to try this place out a couple months back. Some of my burrito connoisseur friends have told me that La Taq has some of the best burritos in all of Mission and seeing that I basically grew up in the Mission, I was determined to give this place a go.  It was in the afternoon around lunch time, and my best friend and I came up on some great parking and we thought we might as well go to La Taqueria for lunch. We waited in line, got our burritos, got a seat fairly easily, and we had to scavenge everywhere for a bottle of their popular green salsa because the people sitting at the table we were at before us probably jacked the salsa because they were such fans (LOL). Me personally, i thought it was just like every other salsa verde that Ive ever tried so it was nothing special to me. 

When I got my burrito, I was surprised to see that the burrito itself was not actually that big.  For the price I was paying (more than $10 for the burrito) I was expecting something with a little bit more of a wow-factor to catch my eye.  Flavor wise, the burrito is good, but its not "the best" in my honest opinion.  I feel like the best burrito I had pictured in my mind was a disappointment since this place gets so much hype. 

Maybe I came on an off day? I'd try it again, but Taqueria Guadalajara and El Farolito still take the cake for me.
author: Kai S.

description: Their carnitas burrito is one of the best things I've ever eaten.  Not a lot of room to sit and enjoy your meal, and the line can be loooong, but if you're not in a rush, it's worth the wait.
author: Carlin F.

description:
#1 Burrito in the United States!! 

Everything here is amazing and they have the BEST CHIPS & salsa & guacamole  

You must go try La Taqueria! The prices are cheap and reasonable for the amazing taste and the huge amounts of servings!
author: Christina W.

description: The best beef soft tacos I have had! The beef was very tender and juicy. They really know what they are doing! I love this place so much.
author: Samantha P.

description: This is the best place to get burritos. We go here every time we visit SF. Would recommend "super" and "dorado" additions to your order.
author: Cara K.

description:
I went to school in the bay, and lived there for a number of years post college and all the while, I have heard rumors of this delectable burrito at La Taqueria. La Taqueria is located on the south end of the Mission district, so in order to get here, you have to make this your destination spot because it is not an establishment you can just pop into.

Came here around 2:00 pm on a rainy, rainy Sunday thinking that I could avoid the lunch crowd. Nay. It was insanely packed. One thing to note about this place is that seating is a free-for-all situation. On top of that, the enormously long line winds around the dining area, making for a really cramped eating situation.

The regular burrito comes with your choice of meat, rice, beans, and pico de gallo. Since the super burrito comes highly recommended, I went ahead and ordered their super carne asada burrito which comes with a hefty price tag hovering somewhere around $10 bucks. The super burrito comes packed with good, charbroiled carne asada, beans, rice, guacamole, sour cream, and cheese. I thought the meat was flavorful, but it was a little sinewy with some bites. The thing is, the burrito was good because of all of the extra fixings and to be honest, nothing could possibly taste that bad if its heaped with guacamole, sour cream, and cheese. It was a good burrito, but not what all these reviews rave about. 

I waited maybe, 45 minutes to order my food. Add another 20 minutes to get my burrito. Added together, my burrito endeavor took over an hour to complete. Was it worth the wait? No. Was it worth the hype? No.
author: Trung N.

description:
I read everywhere that I had to check this place out if I love tacos! I ordered two tacos. Apparently the tacos come with meat, pico de gallo and pinto beans. I found that really weird. Usually tacos come with onion and cilantro. It was strange but I still ordered. 

The place was packed!!! Did I mention cash only? I got my tacos and found a seat. The tortilla was cold, the meat didn't have much flavor and the pico de gallo just made the taco sloppy. I was not impressed. The best thing about this place is the green salsa that they have out at the tables. That stuff was YUMMY!!!! I don't think I will return. I was disappointed.
author: Trinidad F.

description:
I'm not sure what it is, but this place isn't worth the hype.

It's good, yes,  but it's the same as 99% of the taco places in Vegas.

It was a little expensive for tacos that I thought were going to be amazing. Ended up paying $40 for six Carne asada  tacos with only three of them having avocado and sour cream.

The seating is very very sparse and the line inside makes sitting inside uncomfortable. This is like a mcdonalds of mexican food. Get your food, eat quick, and leave. People stare at you waiting for you to quickly eat and leave so they can take your seat. Or they keep asking if you're almost done.

Also, they only take cash, so be prepared. Probably won't be coming back here.
author: Maria B.

description:
There's nothing I can say that hasn't already been said...so I'll keep this brief. 

A. Yes it's worth the line.
B. The chips and guacamole are necessary additions...as is their hot sauce.
C. Their aqua frescas are worth it.
D. Some could argue this is the best Mexican spot in California...I'll stay away from that debate...but I firmly believe they are the top 1%. The elite. Best of the best.
author: Gardner H.

description:
If you come to San Francisco you must try the burritos, if you want to try the best burritos you should come to "La Taqueria."
The best burritos on California!
The burritos do not have rice, that way you won't fill up on it. Instead they crafted this awesome burritos with fresh grill meat, home made beans, freshly made guacamole if you choose a super burrito and any other freshly made salsas and toppings! 

So have at it and come over to the best burritos in north cali... Or to my opinion the best burrito in California!
author: Ulises R.

description:
This place is pretty. freaking. good! The line looks long, but they're really efficient. They take your order while you're in line and you pay and they make your food. I got half half meat since i couldn't decide what meat I wanted in my burrito. Carnitas and Carne Asada were really good. I see them cutting fresh carne asada pretty much the whole time, so I had to get it!

Burritos are decent sized. Get it "dorado" style, where they grill the burrito after wrapping it to give it that extra crunch and flavor. 

This place is cash only!! BRING CASH!
author: Carmen C.

description: Unfortunately I do not believe that the meat used inside of these burritos has gone through the appropriate preparations. Specifically, the carnitas option was extremely liquidy and soon after my first bite I discovered a significant vasculature bundle (veins with obvious bifurcation and vessel walls intact). I was shocked at how it appeared because it looked raw and as if the meat has not been cooked at all. This taqueria has officially turned me into a vegetarian.
author: Katrina L.

description:
the funny thing about La Taqueria is they were voted best burrito in the United States. For me it's really about the Taco's. They are a little pricey 22.65 for 2 Tacos and a large fruit drink, well
everyone i have brought there complained about the price till they ate the Taco's.
 Well as far as the burrito go, they are good. They would be the best in the United States if they
would just add rice, yes thats right no rice???
For Burrito's i go to La Tapatia  in South San Francisco, CA. they make all the tortilla's for all the restaurants in the bay Area. both are a 5 star places.
author: Greg R.

description:
Wow! Amazing place!  They have vegetarian option along with chicken, beef, steak, pork. 
 Good portions.  Wonderful selection of drinks like horchata, tamarinda, soft drinks, iced tea, several beers (domestic and imports) and water bottles.  We had two super vegetarian burritos, one regular chicken taco, chips&salsa, a tamarindo, and an iced tea.  The food and the drinks were fresh and delicious - cooked to right temperature and mixed well.  The salsa was just the right mixture and texture of onions, chilis, tomatoes, vinegar, and whatever else would be in there.  The verde sauce in bottles on tables is the real bomb - spicy like verde should be and fresh.

Service was fast (waited 15min in line + 10mins for food) considering we had a long line (about 20ppl + full restaurant) of people who all wanted to share this experience.  The staff was smiling and the owner was there entertaining and welcoming all the customers.  He was down-to-earth and loving with people.  He cut roses for two little girls.  He was caring to few elder folks.  He noticed a woman waiting for table clean-up and called in his staff right away to do that.  He laughed with people in line.  What a passionate man!

The tourists even know about this place.  We met a woman who had been coming here for 30yrs!  The place shows numerous awards - it is also Zagat rated.

It can get noisy with the crowd and seats hard to find at peak times - so plan on being able to eat by standing or take food to a local park.  Also, use the bathrooms somewhere else because the place can get crowded.  If you have a large party or little ones in family, be prepare to compromise in exchange for the experience.  In the heart of Mission with a lot of Hispanic culture.  A great time!
author: Tesh S.

description:
Eaters beware: portion sizes are large. 2 tacos is more than enough for lunch portion. Between 5 of us we ordered, 4 tacos and 3 burritos, and we had 1 taco and .5 a burrito left over.

Flavor is a bit above average, I'm a huge spicy food fan, and even the "spicy" tacos seemed mild.

Service staff was very helpful, friendly, and efficient. Cost was a little high for this Midwestern guy, but seemed very appropriate for San Fran.
author: Ashish P.

description:
Damn Daniel, $10.55 for a riceless super burrito. Its important to keep in mind that no chips are included... 

Its a bit pricey, maybe its just me but i dont see how this place could be so special. Service was quick and the burrito is a little above average. 

F.y.i.. CASH ONLY
author: Abraham A.

description:
Que deliciosa! You know this place is legit when it translates to THE Taqueria. That's akin to saying THE University of California (aka Berkeley). Basically, meaning it's the best of its category. Maybe that was a plug for my alma mater. 

Anyways, this place is the bomb dot com or however that would be said in Spanish. It's a no-frills establishment that relies on its high-quality food to support its reputation. Good thing the food can totally back it up. It's been super well-known for over 20 years and I see why. The fried tacos are greasy, filling, and hands-down the best I have ever had. That means a lot coming from someone who regularly eats Mexican food in Placentia, CA and San Diego. The regular tacos with guac, cheese, sour cream, etc. are also spectacular. 

For the low cost, speedy service, and prime spot in the Mission, you can't beat it.  No complaints from this Bay Area convert with a soft spot for SoCal Mexican food.
author: Salma R.

description:
We went straight from SFO to La Taqueria and ordered the carnitas burrito with sour cream and guac, carne asada taco, and mango agua fresca. The taco was not my favorite and the carne asada was flavorful with some smokiness but a bit dry. The carnitas on the other hand was super juicy and paired perfectly with the thin perfectly elastic flour tortilla, pinto beans and pico de gallo. This was definitely a memorable stop and I will be coming back the next time I'm in San Francisco. 

Ps it's packed even at 3:40pm when we went but they're efficient so the line moves quickly. Do not be discouraged, it is worth the wait.
author: Yukari L.

description: Not bad.  Super burrito was filling and good.  Just not  the best I've had.  Highly recommended IF you are in the area.
author: Stevenad M.

description: This place was really disappointing. After having lived in the Mission for 10 months and always avoiding this place because of the lines, I finally decided to check it out with some friends visiting from out of town. We ordered chicken and carne asada tacos. The chicken was some of the blandest chicken I've ever had and the carne asada was just okay. How is this place better than Puerto Vallarta, El Farolito or even Taqueria San Francisco on 24th/York? I really don't get it. It's also expensive AF.
author: Tomas H.

description:
Don't really understand the hype for this place - there are so many taquerias in the mission area and I have yet to find one that is truly exceptional! I ordered the super veggie burrito and I have to say, it was very decently priced! $5.65 for a huge burrito is a great deal! 

Other than that, nothing about the burrito was super special, but I did like the spicy green sauce that they had at every single table. That added a little kick to the burrito which I enjoyed! If you're getting takeout, make sure to grab some of this sauce on your way out! 

Overall, nothing super special but nothing was bad either, it was just ok Mexican food.
author: Malika R.

description: Tried this place to see what the hype was.  I bought the carnitas and pollo taco.  It was the most plain tacos I've ever eaten.  Even the salsa had no taste. BLAH.
author: Yanny Z.

description:
I loved the super vegetarian tacos (minus the sour cream) so much from my vegetarian days that I had to get them again, and they were just as good as I remembered them.  The tacos are especially good "dorado," which means golden in Spanish and at La Taqueria means that the inner tortilla of your two-tortilla taco is fried to a delicious golden brown and then wrapped with a soft outer tortilla.  

The burritos don't have rice in them, which is traditional, but I like my non-traditional rice filled burritos, so I've only had a La Taqueria burrito once.  I will continue to stick with the tacos.  Tacos dorados here will probably always be one of my favorite things to eat.
author: Lindy S.

description: Seriously the greatest burrito in the world!!! I've tried a lot of burritos in SF and elsewhere, and nothing else compares. They leave rice out so you get more if the good stuff. I always get supreme Asada and the meat is amazing. Fresh ingredients and the tortilla is out of this world. You have to check this place out if you're in SF!
author: Joe B.

description:
Overpriced, and FOR SURE overrated.  Mexican food is one of my favorites, so I was so excited to try this place out. 

20 minutes and approx. $10 later (for 2 stinking tacos and a dollop of guac?), we were left with disappointment.  The tacos were just so bland and lacking of flavor.  I appreciate when Mexican food is not over-salted; that's one mistake a lot of places make.  But this place was the other extreme; it just needed something, anything to bring out the flavor.  So alas, we're still on the hunt to find the ultimate "street food Mexican" we've were hoping for. (Note: we did think "maybe we don't get the hype because we tried the tacos vs. burritos" - but our friends who have tried both have told us that while the hype is around the burritos, the tacos are much better.  Well, I can't imagine how we'd like the burritos based on our experience with the nachos.  It's really a seasoning problem, in our opinion).

Nick's Crispy Tacos (while not in the Mission) have been the best "street food" Mexican we've had thus far in SF.  The "Nick's way" tacos have been the best we have been able to find thus far; man those suckers are delicious - we miss having them just a couple of block away.

Now that we live in the Mission, we're still on the hunt to find our favorite spot.
author: Rachael S.

description:
So I finally tried La Taqueria. The famed "best burrito in the world." And I'm sorry to say, but I left disappointed.

Don't get me wrong- the restaurant was bustling with energy and waiting in line with views of the kitchen wasn't a bad way to spend 10 minutes. Massive bowls of pico de gallo and seasoned carne asada waiting to hit the grill led me to believe the prophecy that yes, this would be the best burrito of my life.

On top of the sights and smells, the owner is beyond charming. For it being my first visit, I not only received a free order of chips and salsa but also a free chorizo quesadilla and a rose! What a way to start the meal. 

10 minutes later when my fateful burrito arrived, my spirits plunged. I had ordered a dorado (grilled) super (add avocado, sour cream, cheese) burrito with chorizo and carne asada and no beans. You know how you sometimes take your first burrito bite to find the ingredients disappointingly stacked in clumps. Well, that's what I thought at first was the case when I noticed there was no avocado, chorizo, pico de gallo, or sour cream. Until I took 3 more bites to realize that no these ingredients weren't hiding, they were completely missing!! Of all 6 ingredients I ordered, they only managed to include 2. Yes, I paid $14 for a burrito that consisted of carne asada, beans, and cheese. 

Because they had been so generous and welcoming, I would have felt like a complete behotch returning my disappointing burrito and so sucked it up, my burrito-loving soul dying a bit with each bland ingredient-missing bite. Yes, yes, I should have spoken up rather than bitch about it on yelp. But for unnecessarily expensive burritos and a 20 minute wait, no one should have to suffer the disappointment of receiving the wrong order.
