author: Lina A.

description: Alright, I'd still prefer if they had black beans and vegetarian options, but I've been working the taqueria circuit and there's just nothing better. My latest discovery: the lengua. Yes, beef tongue. Sounds weird, but I was feeling adventurous, so I got one carnitas taco (can't go wrong) and one with the lengua. WOW. It's unbelievably tender. Seriously, some people might actually find it off-putting, and my friend tried a bite and at first was convinced she just got a chunk of fat. It's not like other meat, but I found it unbelievably good.
author: Chris M.

description: Super Carne Asada Burrito !!!!!!!!!!! Meat juicy and seasoned to perfection Tortilla is soft and chewy Guacamole creamy and tasty ( Yes this is the best Burrito on the Planet )
author: Lib B.

description: The crispy-soft tacos are delicious! Carne asada, chorizo and pollo.. Very good. Try the Serrano peppers too as a side. Be prepared for long lines, crowded, communal seating, it's all part of the experience. I would say minimum of two super-tacos /person, they are small.
author: Sridevi K.

description:
Oh my goodness...

Did I just find the best taco ever!?

It wouldn't be enough for me to describe how delicious these tacos really are with their fresh meats and fresh produce.

I will however encourage everyone to try everything starting with the crispy taco.  So heavenly and so delicious that you too may call La Taqueria the best taco you've ever had!

This place gets busy all hours of the day, so plan accordingly!
author: Hulises B.

description:
If you want to understand the difference between Mission style Mexican food versus the kinds of taco shops from Southern California then you must try this place to have a greater appreciation of taco shop culture.

The process from when you step in to when you order is quite the experience. Start with a long line of hungry patrons. Witness the taco magic and figure out if you want beans or not. The salsa is fresh too. I tried all of them except the veggie one. The pork ones were my favorite.

Explore the mission district and try the best taco in the bay area!
author: Patrick Gabriel L.

description: Just the best. My favorite tacos in SF! The carnitas are spectacular, and make sure to get your tacos or burritos "dorado style", which means they douse your tortilla in oil and deep fry it to make it crispy. For tacos, they'll wrap this crispy taco in a regular tortilla, so you get the best of both worlds. Two carnitas tacos dorados w/cheese and a strawberry agua fresca make me smile. Cash only, and be prepared for a long line. Picking up your food is a crowded mess, but it's a small price to pay for this amazing food.
author: Andrew S.

description:
This place doesn't need any more reviews but I'll give one anyway. 

Best taco I have ever had. 

Period. 

Enjoy :)
author: Steve J.

description:
Ah, the Mission District. Gave us Carlos Santana and of course, the beloved Mission burrito. It's my edible bundle of joy. 

First, the food - absolutely delicious. Any enthusiast will tell you that rice in burritos takes from its taste. You want your black tar heroin cut with some bullshit? Exactly. For the newbies wanting get "black beans" and "guacamole" - go to taco fucking bell. Pinto and refried is served here. 

Honestly, the one star off is for the gringo-fication. Sweet baby Jesus, i can't bare to hear one more comment about "did you hear that this was rated best burrito" - go back to Marin. Yea bros, tell me more about how the account executive managed to fuck up the presentation or comment about the chick you managed to pick up at Dr Teeths last night. Eat your food and drive off in daddy's porsche, dickhead. 

Shit, maybe I'm peeved cause I'm sweating bullets from the awesome salsa and hot sauce? Damn, should've gotten a beer to wash it all down (served there).
author: Kenny H.

description:
The best vegetarian tacos I have ever try, and I have try a ton in different places.
If you ever go to San Francisco, you can't leave without giving it a try.
My husband had the quesadillas and they were pretty good too!
author: Alejandra S.

description: We went around 3pm and it was still very busy. The pico was good and the burritos were overrated. Everyone said this was THE place to get the best burrito. It was okay. Nothing special. Just a burrito without rice, which I actually enjoy rice in my burrito.
author: Yunhwa T.

description: Best torta I've  had! The bread was toasted, yuuummmm!!!!! A LOT  OF CARNE  ASADA! MORE  THAN  I EXPECTED !  EVERYTHING  IS HOTTT and made to order. I dont live in this city  but would  come to eat here next time i visit :)  place is packed and  limited  seating. Must be a popular place to eat!
author: Bekah Cow ..

description:
Disappointing. If you're going to have a sign out front that says "World's Best Burrito" the burrito better be life changing.  The food was good, but by no means lived up to the hype.  The burrito was way to wet and you could not taste any of the individual flavors.  There has to be better burritos in the US than this one.

The one bright spot was the Quesadilla.  This had a perfectly toasted golden outside with a gooey cheesy inside.

The experience was similar to that at similar establishments.  You want to feel like you found a hidden gem (i.e. looks a bit nasty from the outside but has amazing food); however, that is not the case here.  Overall, based on the "world's best" ranking, my group of 6 was excited to try the burrito but we were disappointed.
author: Michael H.

description:
YESYESYESYESYESYESxinfinity. I was a doubter of no rice (highlight/underline/bold was) and don't get me wrong I still love rice in my burritos, but La Taqueria has taught me that I can live and live pretty happily without rice. These burritos are just so good; the meat is perfect and the balance of everything else in the burrito is great as well. You  are still stuffed at the end of the meal and you don't feel as carb heavy as usual.

La Taqueria is not a secret to San Franciscans because they make such great Mission Style burritos. I hope they remain authentic to what they do for a long time.

Also, strangely enough. I must say the Strawberry Agua Fresca is what blew my socks off. Like honestly, I would go back just for it (maybe even over the real food). I took a sip and took a double take at the cup like "WHAT IS THIS MAGIC?" GET IT. I want to try other agua frescas...

Mad cravings for this place always. So right now....
author: Valerie Z.

description:
Such hype! Maybe we ordered badly. But no way was this as great as we had been told. We had the chicken burrito and two tacos - pork and chorizo. Everything was sloppy and greasy and the flavors were not great. Nothing fresh in there - just mushy fast food flavors. 

It was super busy though so maybe we just had a bad day!
author: Gemma H.

description:
I have been wanting to come here for the longest time because I always drive by, and of course I've heard they're supposedly the best burrito in America, and I finally got the opportunity on Monday.  I was STARVING and craving a burrito, but couldn't go to my favorite place because I was picking up my hubby.  I was driving down Mission when it dawned on me that I was near La Taqueria, so I immediately parked and walked over. There was a really long line, but it moved pretty quickly. I immediately noticed the prices were kind of expensive and was rather insulted when I read customers PAY for chips. That's ridiculous and greedy, especially since they are such a busy place. I'm pretty sure they make enough money to throw in a bag of chips. And to make things worse, they don't even have a salsa bar. I'm guessing this is because they feel their burritos are so good they don't need salsa, but they're not that good so get over yourself!!

When my turn came I ordered two burritos: a carne asada and chicken. I wanted grilled chicken, but they're too cool to have that as well, which did not make my husband very happy. It took a pretty long time for me to get the burritos, but it was packed so watev. When I finally got back to my car I ripped the carne asada burrito open, took a bite and....was not at all impressed. First of all, the burrito was small, so thank God I ordered more than one because there was no way my husband and I could share. Second, it was super sloppy!! Stuff was dripping everywhere and it was so loosely wrapped that I'm surprised everything didn't fall out! The only thing I can understand ppl liking is that the meat wasn't overdone, but other than that I honestly did not feel the burrito was above average, let alone the best burrito in America!!

It's all good though! Everyone can keep thinking this place is wonderful and I'll continue going to my favorite place: Guadalajara.
author: Steph L.

description: Super yummy. Great food. Will be back many, many, more times.
author: Aaron L.

description: I got the steak burrito. Best burrito I've had. There was immense flavor in every bite. Also snagged the nachos and some tacos. Tacos were large. Two were a huge meal. The downside is that you may not get a seat. This place is very busy. It's more of a Grab and go. Definitely check it out if you're near the Mission district.
author: Katie G.

description: I've been a loyal customer to this Restaurant for over 15 years.  But after today they just lost a customer!  Pictures will explain it!  Hair!  Gross gross gross!  Better check your burrito on every bite!
author: Sam S.

description:
No rice. No Problem. What I'm trying to say is the burritos here come without rice but that just means they're filled with more meat, guac, and beans which is kind of ok. I mean I like rice but it's hard to complain.

I had a cabeza burrito which was pretty solid but after sampling my friend's lengua one, I'd say go with the lengua instead. It was wonderfully flavorful. Next time: Carnitas.
author: Misha T.

description:
The most mind-blowing Mexican experience I have ever. For your first time I'd recommend tacos and chips with guacamole. The salsa verde is the best I've ever had. Me and my friends finished a whole bottle in one sitting. 
CASH ONLY so hit up the ATM before hand.
author: Danielle D.

description:
After hearing all the hype about this place and trying it for myself, it was aiiiite.

I've heard a lot of folks rave about La Taqueria, and no lie, they definitely have one of the most packed tacos that I've ever had but...$50 for 6 tacos and 3 small cups of horchata just doesn't really make sense. The taco itself was okay but I later found out that each individual item that you wanted to load up on your taco was an additional charge. I mean I guesssss. I'd much rather grab some from a taco truck any day but it's still worth trying since they are pretty hefty. But maybe just one?
author: Annie C.

description: The carne asada steak burrito was delicious because the meat was tender and not hard like most places. The super burrito is the size of a regular burrito elsewhere, but it was the tender meat that you come for.
author: N A.

description: This was the other Mexican place in the Mission area that I needed to try. This place is pretty big and looks newer and nicer than some of the other places in the area. It was also pretty busy as well. The line is a little confusing and snakes around a bunch of tables. But I found it. You order with one lady and then wait in line again to reach the cash register to pay. There was some confusion about what I wanted - and I had to confirm with the lady at the register. Then you wait for your food. The wait is pretty long but there are a lot of people in there. All the tables are full and most everyone is waiting for their food, it seemed like it. Finally I got my food to go and got out of there. I had a carne asada taco and a carnitas taco. I only got the regular tacos, not the super which comes with sour cream and gauc, I think. The regular tacos are just topped with salsa (pico) and onions. It was plenty of food for me. I preferred the beef over the pork but they were both really good. I need to come back for their burritos. But I wanted to try a couple different meats this time.
author: Alison W.

description: BY FAR THE BEST Place to come eat!! It doesn't even compare to chipotle ! The meats are perfection and wether it's a burrito or a taco they are amazing!!
author: Angel O.

description:
I've only had a carne asada crunchy taco here and I really have no complaints at all about it. I like that the crispy taco is basically a soft taco and crispy taco in one, since they wrap the crunchy shell with a soft tortilla as well. The taco is LOADED with meat, guacamole, sour cream, salsa, and refried beans, making it the largest and most filling taco I've ever had. It's so packed with these ingredients that you have to plan each bite carefully, otherwise it'll all drop out.

My problem with this place is that it's extremely pricey, almost outrageous. If you get a taco with everything on it, it comes out to $6, but if you get just the base taco (meat and beans only) it's $3.50. And of course everyone would add things to their taco; who wants only meat and beans? I just don't think that $6 for a taco is justifiable no matter how deliciously great it is.

4 stars for the taco, and 2 stars for the price and environment (because for the price, the environment should at least be a little nicer).
author: Celia K.

description:
I came here on a Monday afternoon with a serious craving for Mexican food after traveling abroad. Despite being a Monday at 2pm, seating was packed when my friend and I arrived, and we had to wait for an open table. Fortunately, traffic in and out of La Taqueria moves quite quickly, so we only had to wait a few minutes. 

I had a carne asada super quesadilla, which more than lived up to its name. The tortilla was buttery with just the right amount of crispiness and flakiness, with an inside of meat and cheesy goodness and absolutely slathered with avocado and sour cream. 

While I wouldn't describe my quesadilla as life-changing in any way, I more than got what I was looking for.
author: Caleb W.

description:
Fantastic.

The burrito is one of the best I've had.

1) No rice / lots o' meat.
2) I ordered it "dorato style".  It's toasted on the grill with oil. Like a really light chimichanga.
3) Guac = best in town
4) No gristle

Must be eaten on premises or around the corner. I got one to go and it was only average after the trip.

Not to like? It's at the top end of burrito pricing in the city. Lines.

My wife didn't love it as much as me, but then again, she isn't writing this review.
author: Rocco B.

description: Best burritos in the city.  Bought a carne asada, carnitas, and chicken just so I could try them all at once and they were ALL fantastic.  I know those are fightin' words here in SF, but I think it's true.  Dorado style is a must.  Bomb.
author: Jesus H.

description:
In our little provincial town, burrito rivalries are kinda like sports rivalries.  You know where your loyalties lie.  You irrationally love your team.  And you HATE the other side.  I know it's irrational.  And probably pretty stupid.  And not objective at all.  But you know what?  Whatever!  That's the whole point of sports rivalries! 

I am a die-hard fan of El Farolito.  So of course this review is totally unbiased.  

Before I tried La Taqueria, I used to always say "El Farolito is the best taqueria in the Mission, in my opinion."  

Well, now that I've actually tried La Taqueria, I finally feel justified in saying, "El Farolito is the best taqueria. THAT IS A FACT." 

Price-wise, going to La Taqueria was a MAJOR sticker shock.  $6.75 for the base burrito, with only the meat, some beans, and I think, salsa?  If you want to add stuff like cheese, avocado, or sour cream, you're looking at paying about $10 for a burrito.

$10 for a burrito?  That is bullshit.  

Taste-wise, the chicken burrito I had was also quite bland.  Definitely not as flavorful as the flavor-packed El Farolito super burrito.  Also, it was dripping wet.  No bueno. 

Size-wise, it's not as big as the super giant-monster that is the El Farolito super burrito.  So, you're not getting as good of a deal. 

I was highly disappointed in all the people who raved about La Taqueria.  I'd heard the hype and was curious, willing to be open-minded about this experience.  Alas, so much disappointment.  Expensive, lack of flavor, relatively small.  

If you're in the mood for a super burrito (which, for me, is pretty much every day), please walk down the block to 24th and Mission and grab yourself the much cheaper, much more delicious greasebomb glorious creation that is the El Farolito super burrito.  It is the best burrito in the Mission.  

And that's completely objective and factual.  The End.
author: Vivian C.

description: Order the carnitas super taco or the meat or veggies of your choice but make it a Super Taco
author: Mike N.

description:
Stating that you have the best tacos and burritos in the whole world is pretty bold and I was anxious to see if they lived up to their self-imposed hype.

La Taqueria was our first meal in San Francisco; we dropped our bags and made he walk over. It's on a busy stretch of Mission and the storefront can easily get lost among the larger, more prominent signs and other activity on the street. The interior of the restaurant is simple - a counter where they take orders and prepare food with plenty of accolades above it and an array of short and long tables with bench-style seats and salsa verde and menus on each one.

The menu is pretty simple and straightforward. I went with the veggie taco and veggie burrito, my manfriend with the carne asada burrito. I can't speak for his meal, but both of my items were good, but not even close to the best in the whole world (or even half of it). My items came with hot sauce on them, but were not hot; I generously applied the excellent salsa verde they make. I was surprised (not disappointed) that they use whole pinto over black beans; at least at home veggie items come with refried or black beans. The inner tortilla on the taco was slightly crunchy like they grilled it extra. I'm not sure if that was intentional or not, but I really liked it.

While not the best in the world, this place has some really solid Mexican food. Just don't come expecting anything fancy and bring cash, they don't take cards.
author: Mary T.

description:
lengua crispy and soft taco (grilled tortilla and soft tortilla is awesome here.
something with their tortilla is really tastly.
the melted cheese on the tortilla makes this taco a lil different that most places.
the lengua was savory and juicy.  yum.
all the food is freshly made and chopped.

salsa on the chips and salsa was more of a let down. tomatoes looked pale and squishy. guac was good tho. very chunky on the avocado end. chips were decent too. the thick cut instead of the thin variety (good for dipping)

lines were not terribly slow for having each taco made to order.
author: Jason C.

description: Delicious spot I always bring guests visiting SF to. The line can be pretty long (usually 30 minutes) and you have to be on the look out for a table. Parking around here is also very tough. The burritos make up for it though (asked for yours to be double grilled! so good).
author: Tom W.

description:
La Taqueria is the gold standard for burritos in the Mission district.  Hands-down this staple has withstood the test of time.  Been coming here since the 80s. Never disappoints!

You'll find everybody and their mother in line.

The steak is top quality.  The tacos are amazing.  Don't expect any rice in the burritos. 

Top Spot!
author: Dan C.

description: I don't eat THAT much Mexican food so I don't know how much you can weight my review but BEST MEXICAN FOOD EVER! I'm assuming that since the other reviews rave pretty much the same things I can't be too far off. Seemed super authentic. Lots of seating (that was packed full, testament to how good the place is I guess), solid menu with adventurous choices (such as beef brains and beef tongue) , and to-die-for horchata. HMM. I usually make recommendations but literally everything was so good. I had one of each selection (taco, burrito, quesadilla) and the chips with salsa. The salsa was beyond chunky and flavorful. Omg I can't think about this anymore I'm getting hungry.
author: Lucy C.

description: I am utterly offended for La Taqueria in that its disgraceful yelp reviewers insulting its greatness. Yes some of the best mexican food in a city like San Francisco will be expensive due to expensive rent and quality for price. The line will be long its a famous food place in San Francisco with amazing food. Get the super burrito if you get the chance and definitely try an agua fresca.
author: Yougottld A.

description:
Read about this place in a newspaper article as THE best burrito place in the Mission District so decided to check it out with a friend visiting from Washington DC.  The write-up had warned us there would be a wait but really don't expect something like almost a half hour just to order. 

We both ordered the allegedly magical asada burrito and I ordered mine grilled per suggestion of the newspaper article we had read. Waited patiently (and were lucky enough to find someplace to sit in the very crowded dining area) for the magic burritos to be ready.  When they finally were ready and at the table, we enthusiastically started to consume them (as now we had been waiting 30+ minutes and were super hungry).  After a couple bites, I could tell we were probably thinking the same thing but were ok scared to mention at the moment so as not to upset the burrito gods so we both continued to eat to quiet the hunger pangs and so we could get the heck out of there.  When we were finished eating, one of us was brave enough to bring up how the experience there was and we both agreed that it was way overpriced, way overhyped, and long lines for an OK burrito.

If this is the best burrito in the area, I won't be eating anymore burritos here or nearby.  I am spoiled by our Central Valley taco trucks and taquerias that most other places just won't do. 

I would go back once more to try the tacos, as those looked much more like they would be worth the wait, at least.
author: Monica B.

description: No trip to the Mission is complete without this place.  There's a reason they've been voted "Best Burrito in America"!  IMHO, though, their tacos are even BETTER!  Everything is so fresh, starting with whatever meat you choose.  I was there last week, and the same people behind the counter were there 15 years ago, and they greeted me with a heartfelt "where you been?"...With food this good, the great service is just icing on the cake!
author: Sudesh P.

description: Supersize burrito with beef + cheese + avocado - is the best burrito in SF. And the long long long line as a sign of quality. Cash only
author: Oleg S.

description:
I got a chance to try this place out recently when I met up with an old buddy of mine.

I ordered the regular burrito with pork carnitas.   It was ok, I felt it was a bit dry and compared to burritos I've had in the Mission, I would hold a higher standard.  

I will definitely give them another try and order a super burrito with carne asada.
author: Will C.

description:
The place can get real crowded so be prepared to be on the lookout for seats. We had the beef taco that was tasty but the chicken quesidilla was amazing. The chicken was flavorful and juicy. It definitely was one of the best quesidillas that I've had.

Try the cantalope drink. So good and not over powerful in flavor.
author: Nam V.

description: The burritos are a great portion and it tastes so freaking good. They need to cut down the prices though. Really? A boring taco for $3?
author: Samuel B.

description: The burritos are decent but pretty small for the price. I'd recommend getting multiple tacos instead; tasted better and more food for your dollar
author: Connor S.

description:
I've never been a big fan of tacos & thus know not alot about tacos, but the carnitas (pork) and carne asada (beef) are, for better of a more encompassing term - just delicious. 

They're available both as a burrito or taco. The pineapple juice is really refreshing as well especially after a sunny day exploring the Mission. Assume (with good reason) that there'll always be a queue, but the people there are pretty efficient and line moves quickly. The old man making the tacos behind the counter is pretty amazing to watch while you wait in line. While we were there, we chanced upon this old-man band who just strode in & started singing Mexican tunes. Amazing.

Love that it closes late as well, so a late dinner is possible when half the world is closed. 

Taking a star off because of all that hype (I'm not so sure whether it's THAT worth it to make your way down all the way to eat it again). But definitely try it if you have never.
author: Esther P.

description:
I really wanted to add to the rave reviews, and give this place a 4+ stars but I can't say this is the best burrito I've ever had. There's just way too much good Mexican food in Cali to call this the best.
Best in the Mission? Maybe a hit because there's few others who compare in the vicinity, but definitely not the best compared to the plethora of others in the Bay and definitely not in the state.
To say it was bad though would definitely not be the truth.
My veggie burrito was good (with guacamole) and my mango fresco was delish too as was the salsa.
They were just not Fabulous like everyone says.
What I liked was that they had live music even if it was just for a short bit on Mon night.
Oh, and bring cash. They don't accept anything but.
Also, try the cookies next door. 
There's perks of being located in the Mission!
author: Kinjal N.

description: Seriously one of the best burrito joints in SF! A must try for all tourists and everyone in the area. The Carne Asada burrito is out of this world! The meat is tender and the ingredients are absolutely tasty! Only 4-stars because of the tight space. It took us forever to find seats. Make sure you go ahead of time to order your food because lines are always long but go fast...
author: Noor S.

description:
First time here on a Thursday night around 8pm and it was packed. Ordering and getting our food took about 20 minutes, but that's no problem. We expected it to be busy and didn't mind the wait.

For $3.95 for a small taco, that taco ain't small! I can usually eat 4-5 tacos to myself, but 2 of the small tacos here filled me up! 

The filling was delicious! My only complaint was that since I had my order to-go, my taco was completely soaked and mushy. It's probably best to eat it on the spot, but good luck trying to find a seat on a busy night. 

Aside from the soggy taco, it was still pretty good and you definitely get your money's worth. Wish there was more cilantro and onions in the taco, however. But for the price, you can't beat it!
author: Weylie H.

description:
To be honest, this was a little disappointing. I expected the best burrito in the universe and it was just okay.

We live near San Diego so we eat a lot of Mexican food- maybe that's the problem. 

Just not a lot of wow factor or flavor. Bummer.
author: X M.

description:
I had the el dorado style burrito, half chorizo half carnitas.

I liked it a lot.  Mostly cause no rice,   I hate rice!

The watermelon drink is great,,with bits of watermelon in it.

The line was all,over the place when I walked in so since this was my first time, ordering was a bit confusing as well,as picking up my our order when they call your number.  Next time I will be more confident.

The line moved fast at noon today, maybe only 5-6 people in line when I left.
author: Foodlover B.

description:
I have to give La Taq the crown for best burrito - at this point, I bring people visiting SF here specifically for it.  You have to go super for the avocado and sour cream - I'm guessing you won't be able to finish it all (20% of people I have brought finished it).  Do we really want to know where the ingredients come from or what grade meat they use? No. If they were getting the ingredients from Whole Foods, we'd be paying for it.  It's good, so don't worry about it. 

This is the definition of San Francisco comfort food right here.  Atmosphere is good but lack of seating is frequently an issue.  The variety of drink choices and quality of food make up for that.  This place is a permanent bookmark and a regular stop for me.  Should be designated as a landmark already.
author: Ben K.

description:
I will never understand how this place can get ANY less than 5 stars ...

Yes, it is on the pricey end but it is way worth it.  The tacos are 2x the size than other places.  The staff is SUPER nice, and one time even opened the door for us on a menu item -- it was like a quesadilla but crunchy and more stuff inside.  Also, I never had any other fresca drink than a Horchata, but there I was able to try the different ones and I have to say that they are amazing!!  The mango, strawberry, and pineapple ... *droooooool*.

Now that I live in NYC I savor every single bite I get to have.  This spot is permanently on my list of places I MUST eat at when I visit home and just writing this review makes me miss Mexican food ... (NYC Mexican doesn't even come close =X.)
author: Pia V.

description:
This has been my go-to burrito spot for as long as I can remember. The ingredients are fresh, the service is quick, and there is no rice acting as a filler in my burrito. Its pretty perfect. And the frescas are delish. My order usually consists of a vegetarian burrito with avocado doused in hot sauce, with a mango fresca. I could eat it every damn day and not get sick of it. 

I was a little sad to see that fivethirtyeight ranked this as America's best burrito, I mean come on, extra competition to get my fav is not fun. BUT, I'm glad to see that this spot is getting the recognition it deserves, even if that means I have to wait a little longer in line. Quality seems just as good as it was before the mad-house, so I can't complain. 

This place isn't for everyone though. Friends have complained about the lack of rice (I don't understand that...make more room for the good stuff!!) or the size not being as "super" as other places have led them to believe is normal, but this is the most solid burrito I've had, and whenever I'm in the mission I definitely make a stop by this spot. 

My only complaint, selfishly so, is that during the winter holidays they close up shop. I'd love to be able to get my burrito fix on my birthday (Dec. 27th), but I can hold out just a bit longer to get the best burrito in San Francisco.
author: Kaitlin C.

description:
Hands down the best traditional taqueria in the mission in all aspects.  I came here for lunch because I had heard about it from a friend, but it truly lived up to the hype.  Even the sign outside says "Best Taqueria in the World" and they're not lying!

When I went, the place was packed and the line wrapped around the inside of the restaurant.  However, they had a guitarist playing music and serenading customers while they were in line.  Moreover, the service was quick and efficient and they were able to make my order (two tacos) within 5-10 minutes.  The cashier (don't know his name but he seems to remember all of the regular customers and locals) was super friendly and enthusiastic and made me feel at home.

I ordered two carnitas tacos dorado style which is their version of a crispy taco.  Each taco actually has a crispy tortilla with a soft tortilla wrapped around that which makes for the perfect blend of savory yet sustainable.  The carnitas were tender and they were very generous on the salsa and guacamole.  I wolfed down these tacos faster than I had ever eaten mexican food (they were that good!)

I highly recommend this place to anyone in SF looking for Mexican food or anyone who lives in the mission.  It's one of a kind and truly a culinary experience through all five senses!
author: Robert T.

description:
Dorado. Flawless... Victory.

Yes, La Taqueria somewhat cheats by going off the standard burrito script, even off the standard MIssion burrito script, and grilling their burritos and skipping the rice. I'm not sure why no one else has caught on here.

Yes, it is neither the most pristine nor the pinnacle of the service experience and it's not going to win a few Michelin Stars any time soon but if you didn't turn around through the neighborhood you traveled to in order to get here it won't be the primary factor.

Yes, you should try a burrito here. I'm not sure if they serve anything else. It doesn't really matter.

Yes, you should come off hours because the queue has gotten worse since Nate Silver's burrito bracket.

Yes, you should still come here despite Nate Silver's burrito bracket win and subsequent public disturbance of thousands of hipsters crying out in unison that they liked it before that and it already went downhill.

Yes, you should request "dorado" or not bother or waste anyone else's time in the queue.

Yes, you should bring cash.

Yes, you should expect a Mortal Kombat-esque bout if you're trying to get more than one or two seats.

Yes, you should, after all of that, enjoy one of the best burritos anywhere.

Yes, you should also go to El Farolito and Taqueria Cancún if you haven't already to compare and contrast, and while the former might have a slight edge due to their tortas La Taqueria is the burrito champion.
author: Sean C.

description: One of the best burritos I've ever had. Carne asada supreme - the meat is flavorful and delicious and everything comes together quite well. Also loved my mango agua fresca. I'll be back!
author: Sara M.

description: I don't know why this place gets so many good reviews, the food was awful!!! We went there because it is rated as having the best burrito in the country and it has crazy good Yelp reviews! We got a carne Asada burrito, carne asada tacos, and a corn carne asada quesadilla. The burrito was bland even with all the toppings they added. The tacos were fine, nothing to rave about. The corn tortilla carne asada quesadilla was just a corn tortilla with a few pieces of carne asada and cheese. I don't know how they can call that a quesadilla. And it was like a $6 quesadilla!!! Will definitely not be going back there.
author: Elvia T.

description: If you're looking to order the lengua taco, it only comes with cilantro and onions. There's a small note on the menu that I missed so when I ordered and said no to cilantros and onions, I ended up with a meat only taco. Luckily you can ask them for their to go salsa, but even with the salsa added, I didn't think it was worth the 20+ minutes in line. I also feel like the taco was a little on the pricey side.
author: Amanda R.

description: I had the beef tounge regular burrito and it's awesome. Love the fact that the burrito does not have rice. The flavours of the meat, the onions and cilantro are just awesome. Highly recommended.
author: Johan G.

description: Heard about this place from some friends that swear they have the best tacos in San Francisco. We were in town and decided to give it a try. Saw the line outside the place and thought it must be good if so many people would wait. Turns out the wait was an hour and a half. I ordered 6 tacos, one burrito and two quesadillas and a couple beers and got a bill for $75!! Holy smokes, was not expecting to spend $75 on tacos. Have to admit the asada dorado tacos were really tasty and the chorizo quesadillas were awesome. I would give this place 4 stars if it weren't for the super long line and high prices. Best tacos I've ever had they were not but a good place to visit if you can spare some time.
author: Lenny S.

description: If you like tacos, Go here! This place makes one of the best taco in the US. Their super tacos are one hell of a package. It's soft and crunchy, meaty and refreshing, rich but light... its full of superlatives without being obnoxious, it's the balance of flavor and careful stack of ingredients that keeps me wanting for more bite out of this little morsel. Must eat taco joint in SF!
author: Dan A.

description: I had to come here. I just had tooooo. Dat internet claims it is the best Mexican food in the United States. I found it hard to believe that it is not located in SD or something...but my yelpiness had to check it out. I believe the hype and will validate whether it is true. I got here an hour before closing and the lines are a mess. I cant tell if there is a food line or waiting line or what not. Luckily there werent that many people on a weekday and finally I found the order line. I judge how good a place is by their carne asada and carnitas so I got a corn tortilla of each and added avocado which was completely necessary. I also yolo'd and got the strawberry agua fresca. Seating is pretty limited inside but I found some outside. It was a nice night so might as well enjoy it and hope not to get attacked on Mission. I really liked that they wrapped the taco so it wouldnt fly all over the place. I enjoyed both tacos but I cannot say that it is the best shiz I have ever had. I preferred the carne asada over the carnitas cuz it was more flavorful. The fresca was bombbbbbbb. I tasted fresh strawberries and seeds and I reallyyy enjoyed that. It is a must! I feel like next time I should get the burrito because I think this place is claimed to be the best BURRITO in the US. Sigh...I was trying to avoid the huge amount of carbs by not getting the burrito and I also wanted to try the meats. A burrito is essentially a taco doe....derp. Same ingredients but different form factors.....bloop
author: Amy H.

description:
This was easily one of the best burritos to ever grace my taste buds. Carne Asada burrito was on point. 

There was a wait for the food, only because so many people want this food. Staff worked as fast as they could and it didn't take as long as the line suggested.
author: Matthew B.

description:
The lines were really long..like really.. on a Sunday afternoon.  There are limited seats, so snatch one fast when u see one! 

The difference between the regular and super taco is that the super taco has the crunchy part inside and more stuff in it like the avocado, sour cream, etc.  The super burrito..you choose your meat, then it has beans (u can say less beans like I did. But if u say no beans, they will charge u $1.20 more for more meat), salsa, sour cream, avocado,  and cheese. I got Carne asada (beef) burrito and lengua (beef tongue) super taco, and carnitas (pork) super taco.  The beef tongue is so soft and flavorful. . Better than the pork. The burrito was alright...nothing much different than other burritos. Highly recommend adding the green spicy sauce  on the table to enhance flavors.  

If u want to try something different or their specialty...try super tacos instead of burritos. 

This place was voted one of America's best burrito. But in my opinion,  I had better burritos.
author: Karen C.

description: While staying in the financial district, we grabbed an über and came to the mission district to try the tacos. We would uber again and come back. Tacos were amazing and the best I've eaten. Have told others we've met to make the trip.
author: Deanna M.

description: We had each of he burritos in a variety of configurations and then tasted one another's creations amidst oohs and ahhs...amazing food! We felt lucky to find this gem.
author: Jason B.

description:
My friend and I went to this joint to fulfill our burrito cravings. 

We waited in line for 20-30 minutes. A lady was going down the line taking orders (like in-n-out). I said my order and asked her TWICE to repeat it to make sure that there were no rice, beans or pico de gallo. 

But guess what?!?! Our burritos ended up with everything I said NONE of. We asked them to correct it but there was STILL pico de gallo! 

What makes it worst is that we ordered TWO super burritos and it ended up being $30ish?!?!?! I asked the cashier and she said we charge extra for no beans?!?!?

HOW ARE YOU GONNA CHARGE ME $1.50 FOR NO BEANS?!?!? 

Overall, this place is gassed up way too much. They're not consistent. It's not worth the drive/commute.
author: Mary Kim D.

description: Best Carne Asada Burrito ever. A couple friends told us we needed to try this place. So glad we did. The only mistake we made was splitting a super burrito, thinking it would be enough. It wasn't. We ordered it El Dorado style. I highly recommend this place and will definitely come back when we're in SF again!
author: Joanna H.

description:
Ok, YES the food is good... But. But. But.

The mango fresca. I cannot even begin to explain just how delicious it was! Definitely coming back to try the other flavors. 

Anyways - the food, yum. Got the super taco and the small fresca for only $8. If you're like me, you can probably eat 3 super tacos but trust me one is enough! Although I did wish I ordered two right after finishing my food, I was glad I didn't about 10 mins later when I started to feel super full. 

If you like spicy, add on the only sauce they have. Sh*t is SPIIIICY. 

All in all, i'd happily come back plenty of times. Maybe not in my car this time though cause the area is (clearly) sketch!
author: Nile A.

description:
The line moves fast as they are pro's

Carne asada tacos with crunchy and soft tortillas are excellent.
author: Peter M.

description: No rice in burritos so it isn't as filling, but the burrito is very good. Is it much better than other places? Probably not and the line is super long. Is it worth trying once, I'd def say so. Doesn't come with free chips and salsa though, so that is a bit disappointing. Also, very hard to find seating there.
author: Victor D.

description: Definitely get the tacos! The beef and pork tacos were amazing, while the chicken was good. I've gone here 3x now since being in SF and have loved the food each time. The place is a bit pricey and has very limited seating, go during the week and on off-peak hours to have a better experience. The food seems better too when it's not crazy busy. I would definitely recommend for a good taco! It's cash only but there is an ATM in the back.
author: Jordan T.

description:
Second time here, would recommend to friends and family. 

Ordered 4 tacos, in order of most preferred to least: 
1. pork, tongue
2. beef 
3. chicken taco 
(pork & tongue were tied in first place). 

If unsure about the taste of meat, ask for a small sample! 

Tried the drinks but found them too sweet, there is tamarind, hibiscus and rice (don't know names). You can ask for tasters of these too.
author: Ashleigh D.

description: hear this place was good so i went in wifh good expectations. the customer service was horrible. it was our first time there and i asked the lady how they made the tacos dorados. i didnt understand her too well and asked her to explain again and she gave me attitude as if i was wasting her time with my questions. the tacos were ok nothing special about them just that they were over priced for what they were. i preffer tacos el gordo in vegas and in san diego for the best taco. the quesadilla fell apart and was to hard to chew. lesson learned wont be returning. the ladys customer service was what ruined the food for me. they need to work on their customer service skills!teo stars just for quickly taking the food out
author: Stephy S.

description:
This place gets packed!!! Crazy crowded!! Hope the food is as good as they say. I've been to other spots and they're prices aren't as inflated, but they're also authentic Mexican food. 
So now that I've tried the quesadilla and taco, I do believe the hype. BUT, you'll have to get past the initial sticker shock. They are at least $1 per item more expensive then the rest of the local "taquerias" in the city. All that said, I would definitely come back, but just go for take out.
author: Ed O.

description: Wow. Carne Asada Taco with chips and salsa. Seriously, wow!
author: Rachel H.

description:
Lines were long and to be honest I was not impressed by their food. I got two crispy tacos that were hard as rocks, my daughter got two soft tacos, and my son a carne asada burrito he was a little disappointed because they don't have rice. Oh and one agua fresca! That came out to about 32 bucks. 

When we  finally got our order they had forgotten my crispy tacos. I asked the man that was cooking for them he said he had given them to me. I told him that he did not and then he sent the lady that takes orders to check my table. She confirmed that I was not given my food and he was moded. I'm never coming back here again. 

You want some good tacos? Check out the taco truck on bayshore located in the shell gas station.
author: Carla R.

description: Great steak burrito. The best part about this place is that they load up on meat and ditch the rice. One of the nest burritos in the city
author: Claudia E.

description: Great burrito but the chicken isn't very flavorful. There was no avocado so we were still staged the same amount for the super tacos.
author: Ann Z.

description:
Carnitas Taco- #4 on the 2013 7x7 100 Things to Eat Before You Die list.

La Taqueria is one of my favorite Mexican places in the city, and they have no shortage of fans since the taqueria is always packed. However, the line moves quickly, and the kitchen is really efficient so you don't have to wait too long for your food. I've only ordered tacos at La Taqueria, and tried the chorizo (greasy and salty but pretty good) and carne asada (solid, but not as good as some other places in the city) in the past. This time around I went with the 7x7 recommendation of the Carnitas Taco Dorado w/Sour Cream and Guacamole (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/la-taqueria-san-francisco-2?select=kq8XxNMoLdq0ZjSZtTx8YA#kq8XxNMoLdq0ZjSZtTx8YA), which was delicious! The taco dorado isn't listed on the menu, but the staff knows what you're talking about when you order it. I loved the added crunchy/crispy texture of the fried tortilla shell with the regular corn tortilla, and the carnitas were juicy and flavorful. Highly recommended! This isn't the nicest part of the Mission, so I'd recommend coming earlier if possible. Parking can be tough but street parking spots are available.
author: Amy D.

description:
A quick quiz question for you. What do I have in common in President Obama?

When you've given up scratching your head, the answer is that we've both eaten at La Taqueria. Once again, I'm indebted to Lorrie M, my local Yelp Elite friend for giving me a personal tour of the Mission in San Francisco

Although we had just had lunch at Pica Pica Maize Kitchen, she insisted that I had to try a burrito at La Taqueria, a must do in the Mission. I love the neighbourhood joint feel of the place. In my native Malaysia, we will queue for good food anywhere. To paraphrase Kevin Costner in Field of Dreams, if you cook it, they will come

Despite the popularity, the line moved fast but I took advantage of the waiting time to take in the happy atmosphere, smell and hear the sizzle of the meats cooking on the griddle and salivate as I watched burritos being assembled

Before long, I had in my grip, a beef burrito. One bite and your mouth is filled with moist juicy goodness from the meat aided by a little drop of hot sauce to bring the flavours alive

I'm not a Mexican food connoisseur but this Mission style burrito had me sold. Just in case MiYun, my personal Yelp calorie counter is reading this, of course I didn't eat more than one bite of the burrito on my tour but took it home for later consumption!
author: Yee Gan O.

description: Pretty much everything positive has been said about this place but I have to just write a quick review since I loved it. The burritos are quite delicious and I wish I would have followed the lead of others and got one to eat there and one to take home. I had the carne asada and my husband had the carnitas. We both opted for the super burrito option because I love guacamole. Both were very tasty and the meat was well seasoned. I enjoy that there wasn't rice because usually places use rice as a good way to fill the burrito. I also love a place that actually has a kick to their hot salsa option. As many others have mentioned this place is cash only but they do have an atm near the restrooms.
author: Megan P.

description:
Food is pretty good but sure is expensive! 

I like that they have several different agua frescas (strawberry, mango, watermelon, cantaloupe, pineapple & tamarind). They of course have horchata but they also had a drink called Jamaica something (hibiscus tea, I think).  I had the Tamarindo agua fresca.  It was okay...seemed a little water down.

I had a Carnitas taco ($3.50). I thought one taco may not be enough so I also got a Carne Asada taco. I added sour cream for 50¢ and avocado for $1.20 (per taco). The tacos were really tasty - meat moist & flavorful. The tacos are larger than I expected so I would've been okay with just one. 

My husband had a Carne Asada burrito ($6.50), which he liked.  

They have a green chile sauce, which was good...but La Vic's orang sauce is better. 

Apparently, their tacos & burritos have meat, cheese, beans & salsa. Extra toppings are available for an additional cost. However, if you don't add anything, and ask them to hold the beans (so just meat, cheese & salsa), they charge you $1.20 to keep the beans. Am I the only one that thinks it's crazy to charge for an ingredient that they're not gonna give you!?!

FYI - Cash Only
author: Rose A.

description: It's a shame that I had to travel all the way to San Francisco for bomb tacos but so be it.  It was a long walk the line was ridiculous and there was no where to sit but the tacos overcame all.  The Dorado style is not on the menu but you must try it. Change your life.
author: Angie A.

description: Can't add anything more that has not already been said, ordered Super Carne Asada Dorado style and didn't disappoint. Personally, I don't care for rice anyway so it is perfect for me. Meat was tender and flavorful, tortilla was crispy perfection. Wish I could knock off half a star for price though, $15 for burrito and soda, with no chips. But hey, it's SF, and if you have a superior product that is what you can do. Portion size didn't bother me, as others have stated, I'll take quality over quantity any day. I definitely will return for tacos, quesadillas, and more burritos with other meats.
author: Jordan S.

description:
Definitely not a locals spot. Maybe if I never had a good Taqueria, I'd think this place was good. Or if I was not a SF native. This is certainly for non local , etc.

I paid $12 (including tax) for a super burrito that was TINY. So small. Also, the proportions of meat to rice, etc were way off.

My friend ordered two tacos, they are also TINY and they are $4 each.

When I was a kid (in the 80s) my mom would tell me it was too expensive and not very good. I recently tried it because a friend at work ( a non local) said it was the best. Where the heck did he grow up?

I won't go back. I'll stick to my go to places. I can get sour cream and cheese at any taqueria. This place is nothing special. Sorry...
author: Joseph W.

description:
If you want to eat Mexican and just want to order basic burrito or Tacos this is the place to be. I ordered the Carne Asada super burrito and It was delicious. They use fresh guacamole and pinto beans. Fast service and great staff. Small place so not to many tables.

Cash only.
author: Rigo R.

description:
La Taqueria:

I made it a point to seek out something great in the Mission and I found it!

I have to give it five stars because lLa Taqueria is exactly what it says it is.

Now, let's get something straight from the start. This is not the place to go get a three day mole or a hand made tamale. 

This is the place to go to get a high-quality, feed your face, delicious burrito, taco or quesadilla. 

The Americanized version of Mexican food consists of several familiar ingredients arranged in different configurations. Basically were talking about rice, beans, cheese, tortillas and some kind of salsa. In Mexico, this type of food is typically known as, "tourist food".

La Taqueria starts with fresh ingredients, prepares them perfectly and combines them in a way that leads to divine satisfaction. Your meat selections are limited to... But they do each one of them right. Because of the super high turnover, everything is fresh.

I ordered the Super Carne Asada Burritto Durado. That's skirt steak, grilled, cut up and placed in a burrito with beans,sour cream,cheese salsa and avocado. (no rice and rice is not an option)

What what makes La Taqueria special is the foundation of good quality ingredients, freshly prepared. 

Gracias Amigos!
author: Mark H.

description:
The first thing I noticed was the sign that self proclaimed their tacos as the best in the world. With this, came huge expectations for the quality of their food. 
I was a bit disappointed in the efficiency of their ordering system. Their were two different counters that food was coming from and with the huge amount of people in the restaurant it only added to the crowd when people would try to grab their orders. La Taqueria is also inconveniently cash only. 

The food itself was pretty on point. I got the carnitas tacos and found that it was spilling everywhere bc it was so massive but I guess every good taco needs some spillage. The food is overall pretty good but not excellent and not the best tacos out there as they claim. Still worth a try!
author: Larissa Q.

description: Delicious! Make sure to get it Dorado style. It's a little chaotic inside, but worth it. The food came out quickly and is fantastic.
author: Steve F.

description: Finding seating and the line situation are not super fun, but the burritos live up to the hype. Always my first stop for out of town burrito lovers.
author: Nick B.

description: I've been coming here since the 90s (and my mom, even before that).The dingy menu placards have been replaced with flat screen TVs and the line has increased in size, but the one thing that hasn't changed is their food which is amazing as ever.
author: Steve S.

description:
Just as a heads up, this place is cash only.  There is a Chase bank a the intersection right near La Taqueria.  

As a first time visit, I was expecting to be blown out of the water based on the reviews on yelp and Thedailymeal.com including it in the top 101 restaurants in the US.  I am sorry, but it was just OK.  I am not sure that I am a big fan of having pinto beans on a taco.  While the taco is massive, there is a lot of bean in it. 

Here are my ratings of the different tacos. I got one of each.

Carne Asada - 4.5 This was very tasty
Carnitas - 3 Just OK
Pollo - 3 The chicken is seasoned but boiled
Lengua - 4.5 This was the best taco
Chorizo - 2.5 Spicey (good) extra greasy (bad)
Vegetarian - 2 Just lacking in flavor
Cheese Quesidilla - 2 Way to crispy and the outside was greasy

In the end, I think that the best taco place that I have been to is still Tacos el Gordo in San Diego or Las Vegas.  

What did I learn today?  Pinto beans to not belong on a traditional street taco.
author: Ryan C.

description: Delicious! My friend and I both got a super burrito with carnitas and they were amazing, the meat is perfect! Can't wait to go back and try the tacos next :)
author: Felicia D.

description: This place is so delicious!!! I had the tacos and it was the best taco i ever had!!! I had the carne asada loaded with meat which is so tasty whole pinto beans avocado sour cream...A MUST try!!!
author: Gina W.

description: Place was super busy which is always an indication that the food is good.  Cash only!  Bring at least $10.00, more if you want a beer.  They have amazing burritos and tacos.  The most filled tacos I've ever seen.  Their green chili sauce is spicy and addicting.  Fast service.  Not a big place but so worth the wait.  Be ready to share a table potentially with strangers.  Huge burritos are $8.00.  Tacos are like $3.50 but you'll want at least 2.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Malia K.

description:
I got a chicken burrito and my friend got a carne asada burrito. It was decent, but mostly stuffed with a chicken breast and salsa even though I got the Super Burrito.
Good quality, but the flavors weren't there for me.
author: Kat E.

description:
It's the trendy spot that lazy food writers like to jump on the band wagon and review. 

So is the food delicious? 

Well it's different.  If you order a burrito it's like going to a Mexican restaurant that has a "wet burrito."  My guess is that many of the Americans that come to this joint don't even know what a wet burrito is and therefore think it's one of the best burritos that they've ever tasted.

Here is some of the things I don't like about this place: 

-I like rice in my burrito - they don't add rice.  
-The portions are small, so small that I've actually had to get a second order before.
-These burritos are loaded with Calories, even more so than most burritos.
-The place is always packed like sardines, some people might like this kinda atmosphere, I don't.
-The prices are quite high compared to other places around the area. 
-And did I mention that I love rice and they don't add any rice?

How about the good sides:

The food is pretty good but then again, the calories is something that I always feel guilty about. 

Give it a try if you haven't, it might be your kinda joint, or it may not.
author: Christiani C.

description:
This place has some great Mexican food. The menu is small and simple, offering tacos, burritos, and nachos. I ordered a super burrito with carne asada and it was amazing. The ingredients tasted super fresh and it wasn't too greasy or anything like that. The highlight of it was the guacamole, that was so good. 
This place is one of the best Mexican restaurants in the area, but the sad thing is that they are aware of this. Because they know that people will go out of their way to come to this place, the prices are pretty high and the portions are much smaller than most Mexican places. My burrito was $8.95 plus tax and it was about 2/3 of the size of an average burrito. Overall it was a good place to get a burrito and I will go back next time I'm in the mission. 

PROS 
-food tastes like heaven
-salsa they have out on the tables is awesome
-guacamole is amazing
-everything tasted fresh

CONS
-high prices
-small, crowded space
-small portions
author: Carson P.

description: Best damn burritos in the Bay Area, and it's not even close. I always go with the super carne asada burrito, dorado style (the grill the outside). I add a large strawberry aguas frescas to drink, which is the perfect compliment. Top off the burrito with that green sauce. Winning formula that never lets me down.
author: Raniel C.

description: We were here for Fathers day. Is it my imagination or was it bland...chicken? it's just ckicken...aren't you supposed to do something to it besides boil it? Guacamole...it was just squished avocado...I can do that...fresh, yes. tastey? no it was..bland...put that all in a burrito.....and it's just bland...I heard to much of this place.. won't be going back.
author: David W.

description: The hype is definitely real this place was bomb as hell that el dorado style burrito is FIRE!!!!
author: Anthony A.

description: I was VERY happy with my Super Carnitas Burrito, which came surprisingly fast even though it was pretty packed inside the restaurant during lunch hour. I'm not really a "burrito person," but this was no ordinary burrito! It was HUGE, had the perfect balance of ingredients, and was so flavorful! And unlike any other burrito I've had, the tortilla had the perk of not tearing or getting soggy despite all the food stuffed in it(I do not like pasty tortillas!). I will definitely be back soon!
author: Eve M.

description:
Cash only!!!!!

Their Carne Asada burrito fully loaded is good. The green hot sauce they have at their tables is highly recommended. Their strawberry water drink is excellent! I tried a corn tortilla chicken quesadilla as well as a flower tortilla carne quesadilla. Both were good but both reminded me of a buritto. There was a ton of meat and little cheese. Different style I guess but good.
author: Danielle R.

description:
I am in love with their Pork Burrito Eldorado with everything on it
It's just right in the goldielocks zone for taste - sooooo good 
What is not included with everything is rice which makes it altogether a more manageable and tasty size  burrito. (who knew)
Dorado means grilled so that is a second special taste enhancer
Don't forget to try the green and red hot sauces in the squirt bottles (sure they are hot but they are also full of taste.they add another dimension try a little)
This is the best thing on the menu . Don't forget to leave room for a slice of Mission Pie's Meir Lemon pie with real hand beaten fresh cream. Just across the corner, They only make it in season and they suffer a much shorter season than I do in the Oakland hills I have Meier lemons all year round - really deflating if they are out. I need to get that reciepe.

For quality and price La Taqueria is right in my sweet zone
author: Joseph M.

description:
I had a burrito to go and it was delicious! I got the carne asada, and the avocado, cheese, and sour cream cost extra. I ordered the regular size which was definitely big enough to fill me up. My friend got the large taco and really enjoyed it. Instead of shredded chicken they give a large piece of chicken. 
It was very crowded but our order came super fast!!! Great place.
author: Lynn M.

description: Just hype, there is 100 Taqueria's in the mission better than this place. Definitely not worth the wait, and I don't see how that employees can still eat tacos when they are so full of themselves.
author: Later S.

description: Awesome burritos! I ordered a super chicken burrito and the meat was so yummy and moist. Add some of the salsa verde they offer at every table and you're set. Took my horchata Togo and now my belly is nice and full
author: Luci C.

description: Very disappointed today ordered a carintas burrito and it was just horrible. Less meat less pinto beans. With the to go line you less of everyting..sadly disappointmented.
author: Wally L.

description: I've been here a few times now. Having tried their tacos and burritos I can say that their okay. Also, their burrito isn't the best in San Francisco. I've been to other taquerias that blow their burrito away.
author: Selvin J.

description:
There are a lot of reviews for this place, so no reason to hash out all the details again, but I'll hit the highlights. This place is one of the best known burrito joints in a place where there probably 100 burrito places in a square mile. If you type "Best burrito in America" into google, thanks to Nate Silver, this place comes up. That's saying something.

The burritos have a steamed tortilla and are filled with meat, beans, and delicious homemade salsa. If you want cheese or sour cream, ask when you order. Notice the lack of rice, which distinguishes this burrito from most of the other burritos in the Mission. As a result, the burrito is a little bit less gut busting than some of the others, which frankly I appreciate. And the ingredients are simply delicious, perhaps standing out a bit more because of the lack of rice.

The burrito can get a little juicy in the middle because of the fresh tomatoes in the salsa. I think that's ok, because I don't mind if it gets a little soft. But if you want to make sure I think you can ask to have your burrito grilled as well. Maybe I'll try that next time.

The down side is that there is a line, and that it can be hard to find a table, but what do you expect? You're not the only one googling best burrito in the mission you know....
author: Brent W.

description: Came here on a weekday for lunch with my boyfriend, only about 4 people ahead of us in line. Almost all the seating was already taken up though. Went here on his recommendation, but he had not tried it himself yet. I ordered a carnitas super burrito and he ordered a chicken quesadilla, and an horchata to split. Line moved smoothly, and order came in a timely manner. While the ingredients tasted fresh, it did not feel very authentic in terms of spice. The lack of rice in the burrito and it's smaller size was a bit disappointing. It was a good burrito, but definitely not the best I've had in the Bay area.
author: Ally B.

description:
Had one super carne asada taco and one super cabesa taco.  Also got an horchata which was watered down.  Added up to $18. Expensive and huge portions -not necessarily a good thing.  And there are beans in the tacos -which luckily I noticed on the menu so I could 86 that out my order with the quickness (that's just gross and wrong. It's a taco not a mini mission burrito.  Surprised there wasn't lettuce included.)  

Over compensating for the lack of flavor in the meat with simply more of it just doesn't cut it for me.  Fresh tomatoes, guac and sour cream just tried to hide it even more.  The tortilla was fine.  Overall nothing special.  It's for a gringo palette.  That's what Chipotle, Baja Fresh, Sharky's , Rubios, Acapulco, Chevy's, Green Burrito and Poquito Mas are for.  And I don't mind Chipotle but to criticize Chipotle and say you're better than that cus you eat here? Please.
author: Nicholas N.

description:
MHMMMMM The Carnitas here are to die for~ Do it. omg SO GOOD. 

Get the carnitas with a side of chips, salsa, and guacamole. Their guacamole is really delicious as well. :)  And last of all, top it off with horchata!

I've gone here 2 times and it never gets old. I think this might be my last meal here 

One caveat is coming here with a big group. Try to go early to find a big table to sit on...
author: Tiffanie T.

description: Very crowded, but the burritos were absolutely wonderful! Tip: ask burrito" dorado" (grilled & crispy).
author: Annelies B.

description: I wish I could give 10 stars instead of 5... Love La Taq, Miguel, and the whole family
author: Shauna F.

description: This place has EXCELLENT food!  The burrito and the atmosphere were authentic and delicious.   Having a meal in the Mission District of San Francisco was an experience all itself.   Loved the atmosphere, the food servers were friendly and I would recommend this place to people visiting the city and locals alike.
author: Christine M.

description: The food is is pretty good for San Francisco mexicana food. Amazing service and everyone is so nice!! Average pricing and clean interior. The ceviche was awesome. I'll be back here for sure if I'm nearby.
author: Jermaine J.

description: neither la or sf have the best mexican food gtfo with that bs advertising on my facebook .... put some respek on san diegos name.
author: Giovanni R.

description:
La Taqueria is fantastic, and is my favorite place in the SF Mission District as far as taquerias go.  The ingredients are consistently fresh, and all the meats I have tasted are juicy and well-seasoned.  I have had the grilled super burrito (i.e. el dorado style) with both carnitas and carne asada.  The lack of rice makes the burrito's components individually flavorful, while the meal is hearty (like Mexican food should be) but not overly filling.  I also recently tried the super crunchy carne asada taco and regular lengua taco.  The super crunchy taco came with a soft tortilla wrapped around a crunchy tortilla, and was loaded with steak, guacamole, sour cream, and salsa.  The regular lengua taco was served traditionally with onions, cilantro, salsa, and slow cooked beef tongue.  Far more straightforward and simple than the super taco, but high quality and delicious in its own right.  

There are two potential drawbacks to eating here.  One is the price, which is expensive compared to other Mission taquerias.  In 2016, regular tacos go for about $4.00 each, super tacos are $7.00, and one super burrito will be about $11.00.  This is San Francisco, however, and most everything is expensive nowadays.  The taste and quality, however will make up for the higher price compared to neighboring taquerias.  Secondly, seating is limited and the place is regularly crowded to the point where you will bump into people and may have to share small tables.  Go for the food, and not the dining experience.
author: Alan C.

description: I mean I have to give La Taqueria 5 stars...it's a must go to spot in SF! For me, this is the best mission burrito around. I usually get the regular burrito and just add guacamole but I don't think you can go wrong with whatever you get. Remember, it's cash only but they have an ATM inside. Great spot to bring visitors who are in need of a SF burrito. And don't forget to smother your burrito with the green sauce!
author: Tracy S.

description: Seriously, these are best burritos in the bay. Get them Dorado style (or "crispy") and you won't be disappointed. Carne Asada is good quality and melt-in-your-mouth tender.  Chips are flaky and perfect--an excellent sign of a great taqueria. This one is famous for a reason!
author: Rebekah L.

description: A-friggin-mazing! One of the best/authentic burritos i'd had since my time in Tucson, near the border! Just the right blend of EVERYTHING! No skimping on anything. The wait is worth it
author: Joseph A.

description: Best best best! This burrito will literally change your life. Get Carne asada Dorado style. I have been searching for a month and can't even come close to this beautiful, tasty mouth watering burrito!
author: Dacen W.

description: My friend/tour guide suggested that La Taqueria has the best burritos in the Mission, possibly the city. I don't know that I would agree, though I also have nothing else to compare it to. Really affordable, my giant burrito was only $11 plus tax and I couldn't finish the whole thing! Heads up: cash only.
author: Theresa R.

description: 5 stars for the Burritos alone! I've never gotten anything else...and I maybe never will! That good. There's a certain freshness to the meat. Get there! Don't forget its cash only.
author: Donn E Van T.

description: Amazing place, real mexican. Carne asada is really good,
author: Ricardo G.

description: A couple of my friends were absolutely RAVING about La Taq so one day a big group of us ventured to the Mission for lunch. This place is clearly great at what they do just based on the long lines and their walls being crowded with awards and accolades. Everyone loved their food  and no one left hungry. I really enjoyed the tacos and bit of burrito that I was able to try! Hope to go back soon. The staff worked very quickly and efficiently. (They have this DOWN.)
author: Stephanie D.

description:
We make it a point to visit La Taqueria at least once every single time we visit San Francisco. My husband found out about it through fivethirtyeight's best burrito hunt - and it pretty much lives up to the hype! I usually get a 'super' carnitas burrito, dorado style (this means they toast the burrito for you, which is honestly the reason it tastes so good!) plus an agua fresca (I've tried the strawberry and watermelon varieties, and they're both delicious). If you like your food on the spicier side, definitely make use of the salsa they have on each table.
The place is usually packed, with lines sometimes reaching out the door but their service is pretty fast so you're probably not going to have to wait too long. Also, they don't accept cards so make sure you have cash on you when you go (there is an ATM at the back of the restaurant if you forget).
The burritos are slightly pricey at around $11-$12 each but i'd definitely recommend trying it at least once just for the dorado style.
author: Nritya K.

description: My friend showtime showed me this place, it may look good but i havent been impressed, id rather taco bell , food quality didnt seem fresh boarderline close call to the health dept.i would try it again if i died and was born again, its bad enough you have to book a field trip to get there
author: T S.

description:
Hands down best CARNITAS I have ever had outside of my own home! 
Don't ask me to go any where else I don't want to hear it! 
Yes, if your order anything else on your dish it gets expensive! (Go put on your own sour cream and cheese at home!) 
Yes, the staff is quick with the order taking - there are not that many things on the menu! 
Yep, super busy during lunch, dinner, and that weird hour called no reason at all we're just busy because we're super good! 

Bam! THIS IS IT.
author: Milan F.

description:
You know a restaurant is pretty amazing if after you're done eating it, and days later, you're still thinking about it.

The experience of getting the food and finding a seat, on the other hand, is quite an ordeal. You line up, order, and then act like vultures waiting for table / seat to open up and pounce on it. It can actually get pretty nasty with other people claiming the seat even though their ass isn't on it. Once you do, just wait for your food and experience a mouthgasm. 

I've had the burrito and the tacos dorado style, and they are nothing short of amazing. I would say that no one individual components stood out, but rather the sum of its parts - I've definitely had better meat at other taquerias. I think what makes both so amazing is the combination of the crunchy shell with the warm salsa and the greasiness of everything. The green sauce available on the table helps add a bit of flavor and spice (ask for the red sauce to get a burnt tomato salsa). 

I can honestly say that everyone in my group that went left with a happy face.
author: Ed H.

description: Delicious, Fantastic, Amazing!!! First time, had to try a few different meats. Got the carne asada, carnitas & chorizo. Meat was tender and packed with flavor! Get your taco crispy style, it's full proof goodness!! Keep in mind it's cash only.
author: Tony F.

description: 30+ years I have been going to this place.  My only regret is they aren't open 24 hours a day.  My favorite is the carnitas taco with avocado and a mango drink.  Don't be discouraged by a long line, it moves quickly.
author: John O.

description:
I ordered a carnitas burrito - with avocado. It was good. 4 stars. I can't really pinpoint anything special about it...but I left satisfied.

Come right when it opens at 11am to beat a mad rush. 

My brother and sister-in-law are obsessed with the carne asada quesadillas, and I have to admit, they looked delicious. I would probably order that next :)
author: Jamie M.

description: This place is the best. Ordering is a bit confusing but the carnitas are awesome and worth the wait. Cash only so dont forget!
author: Phillip J F.

description: This place was buzzing with people during lunchtime and there's a reason why. The tacos and burrito are delicious! My friends and I shared a pork burrito and we each got a carne asada taco. Don't be fooled by the simplicity of each dish, the flavors packed in each make up for it. There's no need for sour cream or guacamole when the meat is made with savory goodness. My favorite meat was the pork but both are worth trying. If only a place like this existed on the east coast....sigh.
author: Joyce K.

description:
I don't know if it's the best burrito in America, but the carne asada burrito is definitely worth trying. I was turned off by the green sauce initially, but I learned to love it. The tortilla is soft and fresh. The last bite was the best bite, full of juicy flavor. Also had a carnitas taco. It was good, but not spectacular. The restaurant is like a fast food joint. Seating is limited.

If you're in the Mission St. area and need a burrito fix, then go to La Taqueria.
author: Jeff G.

description:
I had the veggie burrito, veggie taco, and a corn quesadilla.  All were very good. I thought the price was very reasonable. I didn't have an issue finding a seat.  The wait was about 5 minutes to order and 15 minutes to get my food. It was 2pm on a Thursday so they may have contributed to the short wait. 

The bathrooms were clean. I had to drive around for a few minutes to find parking. Lots of homeless in the area but I did not feel unsafe.

It's cash only. There is a cash machine at the back of the restaurant. 

I went there because it's listed as a must to do when visiting SF. If I had to wait an hour, I don't think it would have been worth it. So if there is a long line when you get there, I recommend going some where else.
author: David C.

description: Was in the Mission and needed a quick place to eat at and came across this gem! Very cheap and more than worth waiting in the line! Line goes by quick and food comes out even quicker while being delicious. My boyfriend and I split the carne asada super burrito with a quesadilla on the side and could easily say its one of the best authentic Mexican restaurants I've had in the city. Highly recommend this place to everyone! Realized it was cash only after already ordering but they went ahead and started the order while we ran across the street to a bank! Great customer service!
author: Evelyn A.

description:
Authentic and spicy Mexican food!
Quick service and nice servers
author: Gg N.

description: Came in based on recommendation and glad I did. I arrived at around 1050 and there was a line of people just waiting. By the time I came in the aroma of the grill already cooking the various meat was amazing. Sketchy area but worth the food.  Definite place to return to.
author: Silvia C.

description: Excellent burrito. I did not have time to make a burrito tour of the Mission, but am told that this is among the best - I find that absolutely believable. My husband and I both had a carnitas super burrito dorado. The meat was awesome, as were the rest of the fillings, and I definitely appreciate the lack of rice as filler. We ordered ours 'dorado' - grilled toasty brown on the plancha - which added an extra layer of amazing flavor. The burritos are actually smaller than I am used to, but since it's largely meat, it still left me extremely full and very satisfied.
author: Alison M.

description:
So much hate on this page over nit picky things. Straight up, you get a very awesome burrito for under $10. Is it the best burrito in the world? No idea but its really, really good. You are alive and well and you have a burrito. Life is good.

I recommend the Carne Asada Super Burrito and ask for it crunchy.
author: Casey B.

description: Had to have a burrito here ever since I heard a guy flew in all the way from NYC on the night of the Superbowl, bought 200 burritos here, and flew all the way back. This place is honestly hype af but the burrito was pretty good and wait time was surprisingly reasonable. Very satisfying.
author: Cindy Z.

description: La Taqueria is great. It was recommended to me by a friend of mine who said this was the PLACE to go for tacos in the mission. Being from the east coast, he compared it to "Katz's delicatessen" in manhattan in terms of how iconic it was. Boy, was his recommendation spot on. I got two tacos (super style loaded with sour cream, avocado and all the extras) - one carne asada and one carnitas and washed it down with a small horchata. Both tacos were gone in 5 minutes. The carne asada is what they're known for, I learned, but I preferred the carnitas. That being said, both tacos were great and so was the horchata. Highly recommend even though the line gets a little crazy sometimes! I'll definitely be back.
author: Chris S.

description:
