description: Excellent tacos! The meats are done perfectly. The homemade tortillas are soft and delicious. It gets a bit crowded, but the line goes pretty quick. Very affordable.
author: John G.

description:
The cashier (quite possibly owner) is so friendly and giving moms roses on this Mother's Day weekend = +1 star

smaller burritos compared to the rest, juicy burritos, no rice in the standard burritos (which i like)...depends on how you like it, i like la corneta better in diamond heights because it is less juicy...but la taqueria's carne is definitely delicious either way
author: Long C.

description:
I stumbled upon La Taqueria the other day while grabbing a slice from Mission Pie. Who knew this small restaurant was so famous!? 

For my first time here I tried the Carne Asada burrito and had it pressed (do it - this is the greatest invention known to mankind). The Carne Asada was deliciously flavored, but the guacamole is where it is really at. It was the perfect combination of smooth and chunky, and I would buy a whole tub if they sold it that way.

A not-so-hidden flavor that everyone needs to try is their spicy sauce. There is a bottle on every table, and boy does it burn. But it burns so good! Better than Tabasco, way better than Tapatio and eons better than Cholula.

While this food was amazing, there is an extremely long wait. The line usually wraps around the tables and out the door so be prepared to wait for 20 - 30 minutes for your food.

Still worth it though!
author: Dennis R.

description:
Best expensive tacos ever 

Burrito has no rice,wtf is wrong with them.
Thats called a quesadilla not burrito
author: Randy V.

description: Without a doubt the best burrito I've had. The ingredients are so delicious and the food goes down so smooth, I always find myself wondering where my burrito went. Seriously though, this place earned the fame it's gained since earning that no. 1 slot in 538's ranking of best burrito in America. Even with the increase in business, during prime hours they manage to keep the service reasonably fast.
author: Ryan A.

description:
A decent burrito option.

I hit up La Taqueria for lunch after I checked out Dynamo donuts because they are pretty close to each other. I arrived around 11 AM so there was no line which was legit. The lady spoke to me in Spanish (yay!) which was great since I need to practice it more =)

I ordered the lengua burrito but didn't get the special since I wasn't feeling the crema, cheese and guac combo. I only had to wait 5 minutes until my to-go bag was ready. The burrito seemed a bit small but it was really packed with meat! The lengua was pretty good but some bites seemed to lack flavor; there was also an extreme dearth of salsa even though I had asked the lady to put it my burrito. The absence of rice was a bit weird too... overall it was a filling burrito but I prefer El Farolito's creations over this.
author: Sam F.

description:
Long line but it moves along ... and I just had to entertain that craving that day before we jaunted over to the Folsom Street Fair.  Had not been to La T in awhile.  Used to make a pit stop on my way to the office on weekends.  Prices have increased but that's usually the case when you get the hoopla that La T did with the pronouncement as the best burrito in America.
What can I say?  Their green sauce is the bomb; can't say I enjoy a carne asada burrito as much anywhere else.  I usually go to Nick's because it's close to my house and La Tapatia because it seems so authentic and their chicharones rule.  Plus the cute girl behind the counter ... lol
My compatriot had never been, had the carnitas fully loaded and felt it was worth the effort so -
You can't argue with success.   Darn good burritos and their success is well-deserved.
author: Terry A.

description: Just ate here for the first time and omg let me tell you, when they say best tacos in the world they are absolutely right. You must get the super tacos hard shell wrapped with a soft tortilla. The line was long bit the wait was worth it
author: Bianca R.

description: So good. A bit pricey for a normal taqueria, but there's a reason it has a constant line.
author: Kevin S.

description: Went here for lunch with some local friends. I was recommended the carnitas burrito dorado style. Omg, it was glorious. Easily one of the best burritos I've ever had. Size was good. Not too small, not too big, just right. With some chips and salsa on the side it was just perfect. Give me more!
author: Philip B.

description: BOOM! If you're in the mission don't sleep on La Taqueria. I'll be stopping here every time I'm in the neighborhood for a burrito to go! #thehypeisreal
author: kalani O.

description:
Pretty good. Def overrated. If the line is snaking out the door, I would just go to Cancun or el Farolito. They have the same if not better food for half the wait. 

If there's no line, worth a try.
author: max m.

description:
Looks like the secret is out.  La Taqueria voted one of the best burrito places in America.  My wife and I have been going here for 25 years.  She's been going for 33 years.  If I can find quick parking, I will be there in a burrito minute.

We love the tacos with carne asada with avocado. The green hot sauce is a must.  I like the carnita burrito on the go....  I think it's great that they serve their burritos with no rice.  You have to appreciate the freshness of their food items.  Absolutely fantastic.   

If you go during the lunch hour prepare to wait in line.  The line goes fast so not a big deal.  Keep an eye out for people finishing their plates to get a seat. You have to hover at times to get the seat.  No worries....everyone does it...

We always take out-of-town visitors here if they want a Mission district experience.  My daughter's friend from Portland requested a stop at this place.  He was not disappointed.  An absolute "must visit" in SF.
author: Axs S.

description:
Bestie was visiting and since I had just relocated to SF and hadn't had the chance to try this place since it's always crazy line ups I decided to pop in with my friend.

First we totally lucked out perhaps being a week night, there was barely a line up well at least till after we got in.

We both ordered the regular chicken burrito! Greeted by a cute shortie she took our order and WOW what can I say, food is damn FRESH. You could taste just how fresh everything was from the beans, to the chicken it literally just melted in my mouth. It was like nom om om om om hahaha

I am happy to say I can now say I have tasted their infamous burrito and will be back!!
author: Sharon L.

description: When ESPN'S FiveThirtyEight named this America's best burrito,  I knew I had to check it out. I've had many, many burritos in my life and this one was just as great as any other I've had. This place is easily getting 5 stars from me. You can tell the food is fresh, especially the salsa because it isn't watery like most others. I had a super burrito with carne asada and chips and salsa. My one thing against this place was that the burrito isn't that big. I was able to easily take it down and it's definitely one of the smaller super burritos I've eaten. Great burrito? Yes. America's finest? Idk about that. I wouldn't crown it the best after just one try. I guess I'll just have to come back!
author: Mani B.

description: LOVE! The tacos were amazing with the flour tortilla's. Cute place to go during the day or at night. Even saw Sergio Romo when there ;)
author: Rhilee G.

description:
Ok, upon review, I was in fact stingy. I should have just ordered all the guac/sour cream/salsa my little heart desired. When I finally went back and did this (admittedly, it took some time because the density of burritos in the area is so great), I did not regret it. Delicious! I still missed rice in my burrito, and the tortilla was a bit soft to my liking, but I must rectify my past review. 

This taqueria is not for stingy vegetarians, but for vegetarians smart enough to order the super burrito.
author: Claire G.

description: Always good. Horchata tastes home made. The important things, like taste and authenticity are always in what ever you order. I love the atmosphere, even though it is ALWAYS CROWDED it doesn't loose it's appeal. And now there is a cantadora here for my listening pleasure. On the days when it's actually hot, they open the big doors and open the place up to outside. Great location in la mission.
author: TreeVera G.

description:
We were advised in Australia to come an eat the best burritos in the world. 

We can, we ate, we loved them. 

Definitely worth the trip
author: Stuart R.

description: I think it's one of the best burritos I've eaten in my life the steak burrito was very good the sauce was decently spicy and well as the pina is super great. However my downside would be that I paid $23 for a burrito,taco, and small drink...seems like a lot but is was still good the flavor..yum
author: Tess J.

description:
Decent affordable food.

Does it still constitute a burrito if there is no rice in it?  Anyway the quote from the table was that "rice is just a space filler anyway".

Unlimited guacamole so I squirted it from the bottle to my heart's content.

Personally I thought the tacos were better than the burritos.

Workers there were nice and patient with me as I took forever to order and kept asking a questions about the different drinks on offer

This review is very disjointed and not so cool or funny.  Forgive me by at least hitting the useful button :p
author: Angela Y.

description:
Probably my fav taqueria ever, hands down. Freshest ingredients.
They're pico de gallo salsa is THE BEST and the green sauce on the table...i basically put it on everything! lol
I usually get a regular carne asada burrito. They don't serve rice, which doesn't bother me at all. They're Agua Frescas are SOOOO good! 

ONLY reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because the parking isn't the best and they only take cash :/

Save a little room for a sweet treat next door at Dianda's ;)
author: Angela Z.

description:
LATIN-AMERICAN FOOD CRAWL IN THE MISSION: Taco de carne asada, agua fresca (horchata, strawberry, tamarind and pina)

There's a reason I never follow lists like 7x7's "Big Eat": They rarely get it right. Case in point, the much-touted carne asada taco at La Taqueria. Huh? I mean, if by juicy meat you mean meat that feels like it's been cooked in stock and is so saturated with liquid that it literally drips off the taco soaking everything in its path, then yeah, I guess this taco sure is juicy. I was under the impression juicy meat referred to the jus encased within a well-cooked piece of meat, not some random savory liquid it seems the meat was used to wipe up like a sponge.

The agua fresca was even worse. Holy sugar, Batman! There wasn't a single flavor that tasted natural and not overloaded with sugar. I can forgive the horchata, but the fruit flavors should not have been this ridiculously sweet. I remember the great agua fresca I had in Mexico, Peru and NYC's Red Hook neighborhood. None of them tasted like La Taqueria's.

The 2 stars are for the quick turnover on a Saturday night that allowed us to snag a table immediately upon entering the restaurant.
author: Josephine L.

description:
So my friend lost an unrelated bet so she had to buy dinner. I was craving mexican food and have not yet tried La Taqueria (she has) so we decided to go there so I could see what the hype was about.

Got super lucky with parking right across the street. We walked in and it was busy but that's pretty much everywhere you go now. She ordered a carne asada burrito and I ordered 3 tacos; 2 carnitas and 1 chicken (just to switch it up). We split the food so I had half her burrito and she had one of my tacos. The carnitas taco was good, not great. The chicken taco was awful. No taste at all. The carne asada burrito was also good but not that great. We also had to pay another $1.50 for chips and salsa. 

Overall I would say the food is good. It is more expensive than other places which takes it down a star and charging for chips and salsa. There are other taquerias in the mission that I would say are at least as good for cheaper. Even though I did not pay, I'm a little appalled at the value for the price.
author: Eddie K.

description: The meat is the star here. No rice, no filler. Be prepared to wait in line (damn Nate Silver), and be prepared to pay in cash. Get some fresh avocado and take it to go. "Best Burrito in America"? Who knows. I do know it is the best on the block, so come here at a non traditional meal time (not at noon, 6 PM, etc.) And don't just get carne asada, the other meats are worth a try.
author: Kevin S.

description: Believe the hype. The best interpretation of Mission style in SF. Being a born and raised Los Angelino, this is a definite step away from a true Baja style taqueria, but it is a fantastic taco. For the burrito offerings, definitely request the Doardo style, which gives the tortilla a nice grilling. Otherwise it's a so-so burrito that turns into a mushy, soggy affair. Parking is nightmarish and lines are long, but do move quickly. La Taqueria is the benchmark for SF tacos with a well-deserved rep. Also a great stop off to and from SFO for travelers needing a fix or when you want to give your visiting friends and family an immediate immersion into The City.
author: Rob A.

description: Had to check out the number one burrito place in the USA! And of course that's an impossible reputation to live up to. So how was it. Good fast service,the line looks long but it moves. Not a lot of room to eat,so you have to work it out. Either get it to go or try and squeeze in one of the tables. The neighborhood of the location is well upper Mission which is no paradise. So how was the food: 5-stars! Note they do not put rice in the burrito. But I must take a 2 stars off,I asked for extra-steak and found it had less steak than a normal burrito elsewhere. A continuous struggle with most burrito establishments:wheres the meat? Yes we had to go back and ask for the chips and drink we ordered,not a big deal but still shows a non-attention to detail. No doubt they just forgot the extra-steak to. But the flavor is off the charts so I definitely recommend. Looking to bump up the rating.
author: Jimmy L.

description: Yum! I can't consider this the most accurate of reviews because I ate the carnitas super burrito  dorado style to go a few hours after I got it. But it was still really good!!
author: Becky T.

description:
When I went to this place it was just... not very good.

First of all, it is ridiculous to charge $1.20 to take out the beans. I don't want you to give me extra crap in my burrito to replace it, I just like burritos without beans! Also, having to pay for chips and salsa is always slightly annoying. Anyways, I stopped here to grab a carnitas burrito with the fixings one day after work. I took it home and started with the chips. Really good chips and salsa! Always a good start. And it heightened by expectation for the burrito.... wrong.

I'm not an aficionado, but I really enjoy Mexican food. The reviews for this place spouted high quality meat spiced perfectly, and I got a wrap full of slop! By the time I reached the third bite of this burrito, it had transformed into a pile of mush and sogginess in the foil. I couldn't pick it up anymore because it was soaked through the tortilla! I used the chips to get at some of the filling, and it still disappointed as nacho topping. The 2 stars is for the crispy chips and good salsa, but I will not return here because the burrito was such a waste.
author: Sarah B.

description: One of the best burritos I've ever tried and the restaurant itself is so cute with a very nice atmosphere. Not touristy at all and very much the hangout spot for the SF locals. Definitely coming back!
author: Hannah C.

description: Omg yeah it was definitely worth going to Mission for this amazing place (I'm talking to you non-locals). I had one of the best burrito (if not the best) I've ever had in my life. I ordered the beef burrito (regular and spicy). It had the perfect amount of spiciness. But to be honest, it all came down to the meat. The meat was so perfect it was unreal. You could smell the meat before you could even taste it. The taste and texture of the meat were absolutely perfect and incredible. The line was long for lunch on a Sunday but finding seats were easy. Also they have someone to take your order while you're still in line. Service was friendly and very efficient. CASH only but they have an ATM machine inside.
author: Nin A.

description:
Ahh! Best tacos ever!  I always get their asada tacos and am never disappointed! So much meat, season and cooked to perfection.
Anyone I've ever brought here asks me when were going back :). 
I know some people think it's pricy but the tacos are huge portions and very tasty.  You get what you pay for and maybe that's why the price doesn't phase me.  
Be sure to try some of their agua frescos the watermelon and cantaloupe are amazing!
author: Julie N.

description: I really don't see how this place has the third best burrito in the country. I tried this place with my family and we were not very impressed. I called in since I read it's pretty busy and had a lot of miscommunication going on with the lady that took my order AND I spoke Spanish. I felt rushed which i guess is understandable since they're so extremely busy but when I got there that wasn't the case. I walked right up and my order was ready (Where one star comes from) only to find out they don't take cards.... Don't really understand why but I had to walk back to my car and get cash. Our burrito's had meat, beans, guacamole (very pain), cheese and sour cream. That's it! No magic salsa or anything different. And pretty small for it being a super we paid $10 each for. I probably won't be back.
author: Gabriela V.

description: This spot and Tacos El Gordo in Chula Vista are at the top of my fast food list. A must when in San Fransisco.
author: Ben Z.

description:
The staff was very nice and accommodating.

However, it was a long wait, cash only, kinda expensive, and really really bland burrito.
author: Amber M.

description:
I'm from Edmonton, Alberta, Canada. All we have here is overpriced, mediocre Mexican. 

Then I went to New York, and I discovered cheap, delicious Mexican. 

But then...

I went to San Francisco to La Taqueria, and I discovered the best Mexican I have ever had in my entire life! Can I just transport this place to my neighbourhood? My gawd. I had a chicken taco, and the marinate was to die for. I'm drooling right now. I need to become rich, so I can fly here anytime. 

Just a note: Thank you to the establishment. My boyfriend left his backpack here, and we returned about 7 minutes later, and it was gone. But we discovered it was safely kept behind the counter! Made our day!!
author: Jeanette B.

description:
My cousin and I were recommended to come here by his brother. This was a great recommendation for sure!

Before heading to our concert venue near the Fillmore, we came here to grab a quick dinner. This place was already packed when we arrived in the restaurant. That's already a good sign for me! I took a quick glance at their taco menu. I was on a mission for trying their tacos, since I was recommend them. The two choices that caught my eyes were the chorizo and  carne asada tacos.

The ordering line wasn't that long after I made my choices. Luckily, seating was easy to find since people were in and out of here. After we found a table, a couple minutes later our order was done. The chorizo and carne asada tacos were stacked with a lot of meat. I have no complaints with that! The pico di gallo gave a refreshing taste to the taco. The flour tortilla was nicely toasted. And with the green sauce that was provided at each table, perfection was in my hands!

I really enjoyed my tacos, but there was one important thing I forgot on my quest. I forgot to order those tacos crunchy! Be sure to order your tacos "CRUNCHY"! At least, I have another reason to go back to La Taqueria.
author: Jay G.

description: What more can I say about this place? The best place to get tacos in San Francisco bar-none! It is cash only, first come first serve seating and they close relatively early at 9pm. When you are the best you can do that. Steak taco is everything you need to fulfill your desires for tacos! I am a regular.
author: Rubin S.

description:
It was so good after we were done eating I went back and got another carne asada taco to go!
The beef was delicious, perfectly marinated. I seriously might have to go back here tomorrow... it was really THAT good. 
This place is legit and the prices are really reasonable. Don't make the mistake of only ordering one taco though, after one bite you'll wish you had ordered three.
author: Jaclyn T.

description:
I don't think this place is all it is hyped up to be. The best parts were the carne asada, how nice the owner is, and a quick moving line. And I normally don't put rice in my burritos, but the no beans part sucked! Also, cash only is pretty frustrating.
Their process is bizarre, too. You have to squeeze through the line to pick up your food. I also agree with the other comments about not being open late! Closing at 9pm on the weekend is really early. 
The burrito was pretty great, but I have definitely had better.
author: Alisha K.

description:
There is chorizo, and then there is FRACKING GOOD CHORIZO. This kindred place, so close to a Bart station, offers THE BEST CHORIZO POSSIBLE! You can even order items with EXTRA CHORIZO... It is no accident I have visited multiple times.

Note: Cash only.
author: Garett T.

description:
Hands down my fav burrito!!!  There is a line all the time for a reason folks!  Do it!  They are super efficient and I love sitting outside at the window and watching them work their magic!  You could tell they all love what they do and you will know it when you see the owner because he knows everyone and is quite the casa nova handing out red roses to all the ladies!   Definitely a great vibe here and always a good meal when you come here!   Tacos are also good, order your taco "durado" style, trust me you won't be disappointed and it's not shown on the menu so you must ask for it.  The green peppers were a yummy appetizer to munch on while eating along with the chips and salsa.   

My bf and I also had "El Farolito"'s burrito and though it was still very good we prefer "La Taqueria" hands down!   The meat is juicier and more tender and La Taqueria burritos are served without rice which makes it even tastier.  I also like that they are a bit smaller/thinner so it's easier to eat.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Ordered the Lingua and Carnitas tacos dorados tonight and I have to say that I was mildly disappointed. The lingua was amazingly tender, but lacked serious flavor. Likewise with the carnitas. I think what detracted from my meal was the fact that the onions on top completely overpowered my palate, masking any flavor the meat had. But if I had to choose between the two - I would opt for the carnitas.  

Things to pay attention to: you have to pay for all the extra fixings (cheese, sour cream, guac...you even have to pay to have them not put on beans!) which could elevate the price from $3.75 (per taco) to an absurd $6.25 (per taco with everything). Also, the guys prepping your meal wear no gloves...I watched the guy making burritos cover his sneeze and NOT WASH HIS HANDS after. I was so happy to have ordered tacos after seeing that.
author: Elaine Y.

description: This place continues to be amazing. Unlike nearby El Farolito, it is also very clean inside and not a complete shitshow at times. Definitely worth going to.
author: Sean B.

description:
This place is fantastic! the Tacos DURADOS!! DO IT! it's the crispy fried taco with a soft tortilla on the outside to hold it together. MY Absolute favorite meat is the cabeza. It is all the wonderful roasted meats on the head, so texture and taste are similar to a really tender roast!!! The fresh juices are amaze ballz. I always get the mango if it is available. 

MY ONLY ISSUE with this place is the lady at the register has continued to charge me $3.00 for chips i never asked for and never received. I caught wind of this and now ask for a receipt. Unfortunately, it gets really busy in there and it is easy for her to tack on those extra 2X $1.50 for chips without you noticing.. SO message to folks, please ask for a receipt.  MESSAGE TO LA TAQUERIA,REALLY!?!? I spend almost $30 for two people to eat tacos in this joint because they are bomb... no reason to be shady and charge extra for something customers aren't asking for. Just sayin.
author: Amber M.

description: We went there recently to check this place out and it was good, but the steak in my burrito was cold.
author: Mrs M.

description: "Some of the best tacos North of the border," --Mexican-born Chilanga Margot Pepper, author of "Through the Wall, a year in Havana"  and  "American Day Dream." #margotpepper.com #lataquería #lataqueríasf
author: Dr. P.

description: I'm not into long reviews. If it's good it's good if it's bad it's bad. La Taqueria in San Francisco is great. Go. Eat. Thank me later.
author: Alex D.

description:
By far the best taco place I've ever been to in the bay. I mean, I haven't been to every mex restaurant in the bay so I can't compare to other places that have been claimed "the best," but to me this place is fucking awesome. There tacos are like, superb (Also heard the burritos are amazing--haven't tried, but I believe it). I showed my ex this place and he showed his friends and his family who showed their friends and now they all love this place. Everybody in my family loves this place, and I always bring visiting relative here.

When I go here, I always get the carnitas soft tacos. I don't think it's really necessary to get the whole shebang of sour cream and guac on it because they kinda overload it (not necessarily a bad thing) but if you're first trying it out, just plain with salsa is just delicious. I don't think I've had horchata here but I always get their strawberry agua fresca. It quenches your thirst after eating and it's just so incredibly satisfying. Seriously recommend this place. I come all the way from the other side of the tunnel of the east bay just for this place. It's not far from bart, though if you for some reason decide to drive I've never had trouble finding parking. It gets really crowded there because it's hella popular and at first you might have trouble finding somewhere to sit...that is, if you have a problem sitting next to strangers. There's long tables in there and sometimes I just see like a couple sitting and not wanting to share the rest of the table or something. Don't be greedy, just share the table, it's not a big deal lol. I've always found seating in there quickly, whether with just my boyfriend or with 5 other people.

One thing that gets me is how it's all cash. I'm a fool and always forget and I don't carry cash because, like I said, i'm a fool. Also, it can get kinda pricey...but I guess you can't reaaaallly complain because 1. you're in the city, 2. this place is seriously poppin so, 3. you get your money's worth. The service isn't too bad, they're not mean, just really busy, so don't take it personally if they seem kinda hurried with the questions.

Overall, this place is the bomb. Tips for first-timers is the whole sharing the seating thing, keeping your ears perked for your number (it gets loud in there), and make sure to get the carnitas tacos!!!!
author: Pearl L.

description:
So we decided to go to the Mission and see what all the hype regarding this place was about. It was a Sunday afternoon and this place was packed. That's usually a good sign.  No seating was available, not a problem, we can stand.  We waited in line and checked out the menu while waiting in the long line. Nothing special on the menu. Typical taqueria food, burritos, tacos, etc. 

I order a carnitas burrito, the wife orders a carne asada burrito, and the daughter ordered a pollo burrito.  It's a cash only business so plan ahead, no credit cards accepted.  My number is called and I push through the crowd to get our food. 

I begin to eat my burrito and I am extremely disappointed.  This place was supposed to be the best in the country?  I have had better in many places. My wife proclaims hers is ok, nothing special.  No great taste, texture, etc. It's just a burrito. Better than a Taco Bell burrito, but not world class.  

Then my daughters burrito caused issues. She had the chicken burrito. Three pieces of chicken were in the burrito. Nope, no little pieces, massive ones.  It looked like a whole chicken breast was cut into three giant chunks and thrown into the tortilla. Um, not good folks.  

So to some it up, the taste was ok, price seemed a little high for what we ordered, quality was fair.  This place was not world class. I have had much better elsewhere.   I won't be heading back. I have had better food just down the street.
author: Mike B.

description: Carnitas, Chorizo, and Carne Asada Tacos are a must have. Get them fully loaded and enjoy. Fast service, open kitchen area and friendly staff. Your search for the perfect taco in SF has ended.
author: Ken M.

description:
Best Chicken Tacos in the Mission.

Long lines. Friendly service so it goes fast.

Cash only.

Definitely worth it/Definitely recommend.
author: Janet T.

description: Bomb burrito. Carne was delicious and not fatty at all. Salsa was great.
author: Georgina F.

description: Ok thats it!!!! I hate all these techies. I have been coming here for years. Great food, good price, nice size. But thats all over!!. To make a long story short. I came here last week to grab a bite. I ordered a super chicken burrito. One it cost me 10.22 and two it was the size of an iphone 6 plus. Well like everything else in the city, you have killed this place. I hate you guy!!!
author: LON B.

description: We wanted to check this taqueria since it's "the best taqueria in town" sure enough it was all just a hype. Ordering line was to long as well a the line to wait for your number to be called. Poor customer service, the lady just collect money without repeating what type of food that was ordered. I ordered food to go so we can enjoy the rest of the city. We had 2 burrito super carne asada and regular chicken which ended up being the same size, flavor was a little of a let down as well. I also ordered a large size horchata which is the same size as a medium cup at Mc. Donald's not to mention the drink tasted like scented lotion or hand soap, the drink was definitely a complete disappointment. Overall purchased caused me almost $30 thinking that you'll get a free Chips and salsa but sadly it wasn't  to top it all it's wasn't even mentioned or offered upon ordering. Won't ever come here again, we would've disputed the drink or the size of the burrito but since I was in the rush I trusted that I wouldn't get disappointed by the meal the enjoy the most. (I'm not the type of person that leaves bad comment).
author: Katharine Faye Y.

description: Came on a Monday and the line was reasonable at  3 pm,  took our newborn baby out and got a seat outside on a sunny day. Ordered a chicken and a carne asana burrito dorado style - crispy grilled tortilla. Would come back and get the carne asada dorado style for sure. $8.50 for a regular burrito, $11 for a super burrito.
author: Sophia N.

description:
This was the spot that my friends and I would go to when we were in high school and the food is still delicious.
-Expect a long line.
-Taco de carne asada is on point!
author: Denise A.

description:
Lovely super burritos! half hour queueing, totally worth it! 
Next time I'll go for the tacos
author: Giulia S.

description: By far the best tacos i've had in San Francisco.
author: Jesse F.

description: Somewhat small carne asada burrito. No choice of black beans. Soupy; fell apart in my hands; rather messy. I was wondering why the lines out front were so long. Still no idea. I guess the old burritoeater.com (old site, rip) assessment was correct.
author: iko o.

description: Best burrito I have ever had. They do not have rice here tho, chips and salsa are great as well.
author: Alex M.

description: This place is an institution for great Mission style burritos.Dont waste your time and go to any other taquerias in SF.One bite of anything they have will make you an instant fan for life.The Tacos dorado are one of a kind.The green salsa a the tables speak for themselves.Try one of the strawberry or melon agua frescas and you will not regret it.Pricey but you pay for quality.You can get a laugh out of Miguel giving all the cuties a rose as they pay for the food.Try this place it's the best for a reason.Voted best burrito in The United States no bs.Tourist and locals love this place.Dont expect to get a giant burrito as they put beans and you choice of meat.They don't stuff it full of rice.It is about ten bucks for a burrito with all the works.What a delight!
author: Kevin F.

description: Delicious burritos!! The chicken is incredible - so tender and juicy, it really made the burrito. This place is SO popular - get in line EARLY if you want your food! I thought the line was long with about 15 people in it, but my boyfriend said he's seen the line go around the entire restaurant and out the door! Another great part is their juice - my boyfriend's childhood favorite has been and continues to be the mix of strawberry and mango. The drink was literally crushed strawberries and mango pieces! SO SO SO amazing!!
author: Mio W.

description:
TY Nate Silver for doing the grueling work of subjecting yourself to coma-by-burrito on our behalf. Put your recommendation at the top of my "to visit" (really, "to eat") list when I stopped by the Mission district in my few days at home. Was not disappointed at all. Whatever anybody has said about the power of no-rice is true--it really did create a serious and concentrated slab of meat and beans and flavor. The wait was short, the carnitas was flavorful, no complaints there. The food itself was well-contained, substantial and filling--not as greasy nor as "gut-busting" as some of the other options nearby, but for me, that's not something to dock a star for. 

Though I did dock a star in my review:
- The place itself is rather small. Seating is limited, and I imagine quite difficult to attain during the more busy hours.
- No credit cards. An inconvenience. 
- My friend's order was messed up (missing sour cream, and may have actually been chicken instead of Carne Asada--the taste and texture was delicious, but not what was expected).

All in all--great price, great food. Best burrito in America? Maybe a bit of a stretch (given the other local options), but a worthwhile trip nonetheless.
author: Weian W.

description:
Maybe it's my Abuelo's voice that calls me in here, time and time again.

The burrito here is the star. Have it your way, there are so many choices.

The staff is friendly, helpful, quick.

What a bargain!

Enjoy!
author: William M.

description: OMG! The carne asana super taco is the $&@!#! I love this place. The menu is simple but the flavor is outrageous. I also love the pineapple drink with fresh bit of pineapple. It's a refreshing delicious way to wash down that perfect mixture of a crispy/soft taco. One bite and you'll understand why crowds gather for this tasty treat.
author: Fay N.

description: Ordered a chicken burrito and chips with salsa. Was not disappointed! Loved it!
author: Jen L.

description:
Truly SF's best burrito. The lack of rice is everything--who needs all that filler anyway?

The long line is worth it. Long live La Taq!
author: Amanda P.

description: Love this spot for some small tacos. Love the open bar of salsas (runs out quickly). You know its a good place when you see so many locals enjoying. Decent prices and they include some tortilla chips with your order. Can't go wrong with carna asada!
author: Carol L.

description: Omg! Best green salsa . Taco with crunchy shell was fantastic too. Definitely going back
author: Maritza P.

description: Though the last thing I want is this place to become even more popular, it has to be said that the best tacos on planet earth come from La Taqueria (well, in SF for sure). Simple, fresh, elegant. The atmosphere inside continues to embody the Mission neighborhood of old. ...and no TVs!
author: J J.

description: Came here for a late lunch and was not disappointed! This place was rated best burrito in the country, and while I'm not ready to make that bold statement, the burrito was delicious! I had a chicken burrito-dorado style- which I highly recommend. Dorado style means they put the burrito on the grill to heat it up so it's crispy on the outside and ingredients are a bit melted.  The burrito doesn't come with rice which I loved-made it easier to eat and less filling. The chicken it it was good although it probable could've used a little more. All in all it's a solid place and I'd recommend anyone come here.
author: Nicole S.

description: Good carnitas and okay carnitas. Super burrito was good but tacos is the way to go. I will say it's overpriced and overhyped. Decent food but again, pricey.
author: Leticia C.

description: I've been going to this place since I was young with my family. Love this place and the food is amazing. Love the burritos just not enough for me. Wish it was bigger. Good thing is that the burritos do not have rice.
author: M M.

description: The best burrito in SF bay area. They make it without rice. I like that better so you don't feel so overstuffed after eating. I've tried the beef, carnitas, & chicken burritos are dorado style.....which comes with grilled tortilla. Sooooo delicious. I've also tried their tacos and quesadillas which are also too awesome. The line is always long but the wait time is short. They work fast so even though the line is out the door. The max wait from lining  by the door (when the line is wrapped around the restaurant) to getting your food is 30 mins on average. It is cash only so don't forget to bring cash!
author: Pam Y.

description: This is a great place for some late night drunk tacos. It can get pretty packed, if you don't mind waiting in line then go for it. I came here on a Friday night and the place was packed. But the serviced wasn't slow at all. Tacos were great, there was a man playing live music and that hyped up the mood in the restaurant (he was just from the street I think). I would generally just grab food and eat it on the street. They do have big tables that can probably fit 8. There is a bathroom, selling coke by the glass bottle.
author: Shirley W.

description: If you want traditional, DONT COME TO THIS PLACE. It's mediocre food with a fairly hefty price for a taqueria. Beans and pico de gallo on a taco? Lemons instead of lime? Don't waste your time, this place is just hype. Incredibly disappointing.
author: J W.

description:
Got a super burrito de carne asada!
What stood out in this burrito was the carne asada. The meat was so tender and flavorful!!! 
I want to say the burrito portion was small.. Only because I inhaled it all.
La salsa no estaba picante, pero tenía mucha sabor ! 


Note**
Parking is hard to find.. And lines are very long !!!
author: Alejandra P.

description: This was a very casual simple place that served the best tacos I have ever had in my life. You have to drink the strawberry juice it was delicious just like everything else about this place.
author: Alex L.

description: Chicken burrito was excellent. Small place and the wait time was around 30 min for food but it was worth the wait.
author: Alex T.

description:
This is the only burrito outside of San Diego that I willingly eat and I've been guilty of coming here once a week for the last month. Carnitas burrito with cheese, sour cream, and avocado done dorado style with jalapenos on the side. Drowned in their green salsa (seriously, 2 of us polished off a third of the bottle).

The older gentleman at the register shamelessly flirts with the girls and it's hilarious (where else have you gotten a rose with your burrito?). If you come at the right time you'll find an easy seat and hear some live music!
author: Lisa G.

description:
Waaaay overhyped place.  Carne asada burrito was decent although definitely on the small side and not very generous with the beef.  Not much flavor in the burrito.  Green hot sauce on each table is very good to add some flavor and heat.  

I am also reviewing El Farolito and giving it a similar rating.  I am not one to eat at chain restaurants, but Chipotle is better than both of then.
author: Fletch ..

description:
I stumbled across this place my first night in town. I was swarmed with taco options in the Mission and didn't know how to decide. Then I passed La Taqueria, which has signs that say "the best burritos in the whole world." Normally I'd take that as a red flag, but the food looked good through the window and there was a decent amount of diners inside who seemed to be enjoying themselves. 

Long story short: holy hell those were good tacos. Get carne asada here. Pay $4 for one taco. It's worth it.
author: Heather B.

description:
Always a great meal and EXPERIENCE  at la taqueria. 

I would say nearly the best tasting cabeza in San Francisco as per tenderness:flavor . 

And the gentleman at the register is always offers service with a kind smile. 

Thanks for another great lunch!
author: Christine V.

description:
Really... I am such a pig. I can shovel down their carne asada burrito as if it we're a mini. 

Been eating here since I was like 6 years old. Every time that I'm in the bay area it's a must!!! Yes, I will drive from So Cal just to get this delicous in my mouth.
author: Claudine S.

description:
As the birthplace of the Mission burrito, San Francisco cannot (or will not) escape the debate over what to put in a burrito. It's similar to the NY/Chicago pizza debate. I don't choose sides in either debate; I love them all. 

La Taqueria doesn't fit the typical Mission burrito mold of a massive burrito filled with everything that costs about a dime. And for that, I love them. Many taquerias serve food that is interchangeable and forgettable, but La Taqueria is unique in their simplicity.

I've been eating here for over 25 years, and tried everything on the menu. And I know everything is fresh because I once saw a cow's head in the kitchen that was being picked clean. Yes, I am recommending their cabeza tacos, which are rich and moist and delicious. I also love their chorizo; it has the perfect balance of spicy and sweet, and I know of no better cure for a hangover than the chorizo burrito and a quesadilla. Of course everything needs to be doused in the delicious green sauce.  

For those who complain about the value, go down the street and buy yourself a flavorless burrito the size of a newborn. I'll stick with the quality and deliciousness of La Taqueria.
author: Jeff R.

description:
Yo! What kind of Taqueria has the guts (tripas) to call themselves "THE Taqueria"? La Taqueria, obviously.  

That should've been easier for you.  You're reading a review of La Taqueria.  Why would I be talking about another taqueria?  Oh sure.  If you knew, why didn't you answer?  No, you kept reading.  You weren't sure I was talking about La Taqueria.  You seriously were on this page, reading a review of this exact place, and you weren't sure I was referring to La Taqueria? 

Holy shit, man.  Just reload the page and let's try this again.

Okay, what? You did it again? You're reading this again? You aren't even letting me get to the review, man.  Anyway, let's start again.

Yo! What kind of Taqueria has the guts (tripas) to call themselves "THE Taqueria"? La Taqu ...

DAMN IT, I KNOW YOU KNOW NOW!  Just zip it and let me finish, jack! 

I've been going here for 12 years now, and while I used to eat meat, I don't anymore and just plain LOVE the vegetarian burrito (and chips).  It's so juicy, affordable and delicious, I don't even miss the rice.  And those chips, man! It's like ...

OKAY OKAY OKAY OKAY SHUT UP SHUT UP SHUT UP I AM WAY PAST THAT

I KNOW IT'S LA TAQUERIA! I ALREADY TOLD YOU. I HATE THIS. I HATE THE INTERNET AND I HATE YOU.
author: Nathan M.

description: The carne asada super tacos are ROLLIN...I really like Corneta too, but the super tacos at La Taqueria are undefeated.
author: Shaw D.

description:
Taco Crawl in the Mission?  You certainly had me at tacos.  My friends and I embarked on an ambitious taco crawl for our friend's birthday festivities.  La Taqueria was our second stop of the night (out of seven!).

This place receives 4 stars for their relaxing decor and ample seating.  The vibe is so much more conducive to group interaction, which I appreciated.  With their open floorplan, and additional patio seating, La Taqueria was a breath of fresh air after struggling for elbow room at El Farolito down the street.  

Just in terms of meat flavor, my carne asada taco ($2.50), though undeniably delicious, just did not compare to unbeatable El Farolito and other taco joints that we planned for the rest of the evening.  However, my friend had a chorizo quesadilla which she thoroughly enjoyed.  I originally wanted to get a Lengua taco, but unfortunately they ran out so must return next time to try the popular item. 

From my extensive list from this one evening, I would award La Taqueria the Best Taco Spot for Groups.

Sincerely,
The Academy
author: Lauren T.

description:
Definitely the better of the two taquerias I ate at while visiting San Francisco.  The carnitas taco I had was excellent - the meat, beans, avocado, and hot sauce were all done extremely well.  Each could be tasted individually and they all complemented very nicely.  

It's no frills counter service, but the staff are very friendly, and the food is very reasonably priced for what you get.  This was worth going back to the Mission neighborhood for.
author: Jesse F.

description: Meh - way over priced.  Chipotle has better burritos, for much cheaper.
author: John G.

description: Sooo, came in with my friends! My friend is OBSESSED with the super shrimp burrito and it is delicious. I recommend the super nacho platter and your classic super burrito! I mean, being in the heart of the Mission, all the taquerias are high quality, but this place is authentic! Free tortilla chips as well! Service is...okay and it is more pricier than other places but that's alright too! Well definitely come back!
author: Lena T.

description:
Finally made it to La Taqueria after trying time and again. Upon arriving I was pleasantly surprised the line wasn't out the door. Especially after hearing about horrible waits. Luckily the line was only about 20 people so I got my food in 15 mins. 

I ordered a regular steak burrito which comes with salsa, beans, onion, and cilantro. I have to say I was a bit disappointed about its size. Much smaller than most burritos (could be because they don't add rice). But it was incredible. Some of the best carne asada I've ever had. Extremely juicy. Each bite was amazing. Top 1 -3 burritos I've ever had. Just a shame there wasn't more burrito. I didn't leave completely full.
author: Mike K.

description: I got three tacos (pork, Chicken, and beef). Each meat was well cooked, but very bland. It wasn't worth eating until I got home and added some extra seasonings. I probably should have taken my friend's recommendation and gotten the burrito since she enjoyed hers (3.5/5).
author: Alex D.

description: Very yummy food here!carne asada burrito was so delicious! We were given samples of the mango,  pineapple,  and strawberry Agua frescas. So delicious! If you want more bang for your buck,  skip out on the 7 dollar super taco and just get a burrito.  Personally,  I liked the burritos better then the tacos... But they are very good too! Very crowded here,  so prepare to wait for seating or just take the food elsewhere.
author: Jasmine S.

description:
Delusional.

Richard Dawkins is right: http://www.amazon.com/The-God-Delusion-Richard-Dawkins/dp/0618918248/

Yelpers are not: La Taqueria's four star average review.

Cannot understand how a $7 burrito with no choice in beans or tortilla garners such widespread praise. Especially with no rice. And charging extra for chips and salsa.

Now there is something to be said for doing one thing and doing it well. Burrito was good, especially the flavorful chicken. But one that justifies the price and worship?

Dawkins said it best.
author: Jason B.

description:
I worked here for a summer during high school. The place was always kept clean and the workers were very friendly. I especially enjoyed the toasted tacos, which they grill for a bit to get them crunchy. Top that with avocado, not guacamole, but chunks of avocado, salsa, and sour cream. Then, smother all that with their green salsa. As for the burritos, with everything! And to drink, a strawberry agua fresca.

While the process of making their tacos has changed a bit, they are still worth trying out, if you've never been. Now, they grill most of their taco tortillas. Before, only a few knew of that and they fried them really good. Last time, they left the tortilla too crispy.

I was there about 3 weeks ago and still enjoy the ambiance and the food. The service continues to exceed excellence, considering the mass of people who line up daily.
author: Jose R.

description: Bravo!!! This taco makes you realize how long u have been missing out on a great food-gasim. I have tried the taco dorado with lengua as my meat of choice and I ended up having a second one, it was that delicious and paired with a cold modelo, it hit the spot! My friend and I walked in starving and we walked out on a mission to walk-off out recently accumulated calories. The staff was very friendly, despite go busy it was mid-day, we were treated respectfully and with much courtesy, we even got a free sample of their "aqua de fresa" which was absolutely delicious and refreshing. Once u check this place out, there will probably not be much controversy in deciding where to for TACOS!!
author: Nena C.

description: I expected more, with all the hype and long line. It's OK Mexican food, filling, nothing to write home about.
author: Brandon J.

description: This place is all that its cracked up to be. The tacos, burritos are the best i have had. My favorite was the carne asada tacos. Very ethnic. I like the way they melt the cheese on a quick fried tortilla and the taco is assembled on it. Price was high but worth the money. Unfortunately didn't get 5 stars because of its size. Very crowded and the line is usually around the small store.
author: Frank M.

description: I am a loyal fan to El Farolito, but this place was closer after doing Happy Hour. This place had a long line, but it moved at a decent pace. There is someone that takes the order before you pay. I got the carne asada super taco. Don't be expecting cheap prices, since the super taco was around $6 dollars, but it was pretty big. The sauce that made it spicy was sooo good with the cheese, sour cream, beans, pico de gallo, and guac. It's a must go to spot if you are in the Mission!
author: Susie N.

description:
Incredibly delicious! I ordered a super burrito with carne asada, which was great. But the best was the mango agua fresca. It tasted more like a fresh, mango smoothie - no artificial sugars added. It brought me back to my grandmother's shakes that she used to make me in India with fresh fruit! Amazing! Even if you're not hungry, you must stop to try the mango agua fresca.

The staff were so sweet - smiling and very patient. It was a pleasure to be around them.
author: Nehika M.

description: If i was sentenced to the electric chair and was offered one last meal, it would be this place.
author: Taras M.

description: Fresh quality ingredients- bean and cheese burrito perfection with usual ingredients of guacamole, pico de gallo salsa and sour cream. Beans are great quality and cooked to perfection, tortilla light and delicious, full of flavor and moisture--could eat this often.
author: Ellen M.

description: #1Burrito? My vote goes for their dorado tacos, the burrito is a different concept. If we really must go there...the Burritos are decent and tasty when it comes to the meat, I appreciate that they do not put rice (as I'm not a fan of it) but they missed basics like cilantro and onion, I  KNOW and this was the "super"...BUT their tacos are bomb, I cannot lie. The carne asada dorado tacos are heavenly!!! That extra layer of fried tortilla with the cheese makes a huge tasty difference! Beware of the line but its worth it, goes by pretty fast unless your stomach is being a food daemon ;)
author: Daniela U.

description: I live really close to la taqueria which is great for my taste buds but terrible for my diet (oh well!) I absolutely love this place. Yes, it's nationally ranked, everybody talks about it... its wonderful. All of the above. But something I love about it besides the food is the overall experience. The staff is relatively small, and everybody that works there is so friendly and awesome. Sometimes you even get free roses :) A mariachi band comes in sometimes too which really just adds to the whole experience. Fight for a table, don't get it to-go because sticking around is half the fun. Plus their salsa verde may be the best I've ever had. I'll be back many many more times!
author: Mandy A.

description:
Yet another place that will forever have a place in my heart as a true San Franciscan (I no longer live there and one fact for sure, I left my heart here). I have been coming here since I could chew my food properly. My family are firm believers of this place and I couldn't agree more. The tacos are out of this world and the burritos will kick your ass in just how tasty they are. Also vegetarian friendly and their basic taco (tortilla, beans, chesse and salsa) will satisfy any craving (as my vegetarian girlfriend describes and agrees) . 

One recommendation I have is to ask them to fry up the taco (dorados) and that will just blow your mind. I'm not sure on how to ask them for this set-up but since I've been coming here for quite some time, they know how I (and my family) likes it, when you ask for "dorados", they fry up the outer shell of the taco, stick some cheese in between the hard shell and the soft shell, and then layer on the beans, and salsa (even better with some meat thrown in!) That is all I come here for and just recently I have been asking for their burritos and a whole new world has been opened for me. 

Their real fruit juices (agua frescas) are to die for and compliment the eating experience. I do recommend having the mango or watermelon and are far superior to any soft drink they serve (and of course they serve classic mexican beer for those who want to have the "adult meal" experience). 

HOWEVER, there are a few faults. There is limited seating and the lines are usually pretty long during lunch and dinner hours (but there is almost always someone going through the lines to ask people what they want to order to get things moving faster). Be prepared to share some tables and benches with strangers but it adds more fun to the dinning experience and don't worry, you guys are, enjoying the best tacos and burritos in the world, there shouldn't be any other care in the world (except for how long your car has been parked at the meter).

So, bottom line----- you must come here for a taste that is out of this world!!!! But don't expect a sit down type restaurant (where you have  "chips" included in your meal. NO. That's extra)  This isn't the place for those kinds of shenanigans. Tacos, and burritos, Thats all you need. (And maybe their quesadillas). :D
author: Carlos K.

description:
parking sucked, so we had to take the food to go instead of enjoying it at the taqueria. there was quite a line we had to wait in, so we knew we found a good spot. 

luckily i stood in line behind a regular and he told us we had to get our tacos with the crunchy shell on top of the soft one ... i can't remember what he called them, glad we did. the tacos were huge & so delicious, but pricey for a little taco shop. we got the al pastor and carne asada... so good! we also got chips w/ salsa and guac ... great call but wish they included more guac on the side. their salsas were great, and whatever they do to that green salsa makes it so addicting, but beware it is SPICYYYY. 

they did mess up on my drink though, i changed it to an horchata but they gave me a jamaica ... i didn't notice til i got home though because they bagged the drinks. 

the man at the front was very sweet & gave me a red rose, it was a nice touch.

I'll def be going back soon!
author: danielle a.

description: I was recommend by a friend and was told that this restaurant was very authentic and that they usually have long lines. I decided to go on a rainy evening and was surprised to find that there was still a long line, but wait times are actually shorter than they seem. I tried the carne asada tacos with sour cream and cheese and also agua de pina to drink. The tacos were so tasty and full of flavor, I enjoyed every bite. The agua de pina was very delicious and well balanced sugar wise. The cashier was happy and seemed to know and joked with some of the regular/returning customers. The prices are reasonable and the staff are friendly as well. I have found my new favorite place to eat!
author: Daniel M.

description:
This is a must stop for burrito whenever I'm in SF. I've tried El Forrio or whatever its called. Seating may be tough at certain times.

The horchata is great it can get thick if it settles in the bottom. 

The carne asada in burrito is not chewy or too big to enjoy like in chipotle. I wont say it like melts in your mouth. Nothing really does that. I always look out of the chewy grizzel that can be a downer in the burrito. It's no problem. I just spit it out. 

The chorizo is very oily but it taste so good. I get the chorizo in taco form. The guag with the chorizo is awesome.
author: Chris L.

description: this best lengua tacos ever! made just like my mamás. if only there was more room to sit and eat your order there and be comfortable. but over all its amazing and if you have not had the opportunity to go and experience it for yourself you're missing out! thank you la taqueria for your continuing service!
author: Audra R.

description: this place was amazingggg. definitely recommend. it was worth the short wait and will definitely come back again if im in the area. I think its the best ive ever had
author: Terence L.

description:
As you can see by the amount of reviews and high number of reviews this place is very popular. When it is open around any typical meal time you can expect to have to queue up and wait in line for your food.

In Sept 2014, FiveThirtyEight website rated La Taqueria as the best burrito out of 67,391 burrito selling places. pretty impressive win for La Taqueria - but is this true? I'll do my assessment of this - is it possible that La Taqueria is the best burrito one can get?  
  
This review is based on a carne asada burrito and a chicken burrito ordered at 20 minutes to closing time. 
One of the big differences in their burritos is that NO RICE is part of the fillings. In fact, they don't have rice anywhere in the restaurant - so if you love rice your SOL. As for me, no big thing - my fav burritos are basically "San Diego" style all meat + a hot sauce/ salsa. However I do like beans, guacamole, cheese, pico de gallo so have no problem if they're in my burrito. So having no rice is not a big deal for me but my wife wasn't crazy about this as it's on her must haves for burritos.
The burrito I ordered was a carne asada with salsa, beans and guacamole. I requested jalapeños to be added to the burrito but they weren't there so I assume you can't get them. So to get to one big issue with the place is - due to the popularity - there is not any variations possible beside the choices on the assembly line of ingredients. Also the place has no salsa bar - which is typical in 99% of the Mexican taquerias I visit. There are ketchup bottles on the tables filled with a green, almost medium heat level sauce, that is a slurry of the ingredients in the sauce.
So after all this, I got my burrito and took several good size bites to analyze the taste. I though as I munched on the burrito it is probably the best tasting beef carne asada I've ever had. I was super impressed with the beef. It had a full beef flavor with a excellent taste of a touch of charing brought out  flavors through caramelization and the Maillard reaction. The combination of the beef with the beans, guacamole, and salsa was truly loaded with flavor and an excellent burrito to eat. Although my wife missed her rice, she was pleased with her chicken burrito that was made up of chicken, sour cream and cheese.
--------------------- bottom line ---------------
So if you like burritos, La Taqueria in the Mission is a must stop place. You will not be disappointed and you will get a great meal in SF at an inexpensive price - the only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because 1) I love my burritos to be very picante (hot) and La Taqueria could not deliver on this point
2) Limited options for one's burrito, no salsa bar.

Is La Taqueria the best burrito place in the USA - well no but it is excellent and defiantly worth a visit - I will be back
author: Mark H.

description: Ive been visiting La Taqueria since I was in college and that was a while back...sooo, I'd say this place has mouth-watering, addicting carnitas tacos.  Get them with everything and add guac...best thing you'll ever do for yourself.  Swear!
author: Michelle H.

description: Every thing you've heard is true! And affordable! Totally my new spot.
author: Meg B.

description: What a great burrito! No rice to take away from the flavor and fill up space that could be used for meat. This place does it well and does it often, expect a line.
author: Mike S.

description: I am a pretty picky vegetarian, and so I was a little unimpressed with the selection at La Taqueria. While it is one of the more inexpensive restaurants, I have found that it is because a lot of the menu is fairly simple and basic. So if you are looking for a more typical burrito, this is the place for you. However I personally like mine to have a little kick, and be interesting, for lack of a better word. I was simply expecting more from a restaurant with such a high rating.
author: Danielle P.

description: I give them 5 stars. Food is amazing best carne asada burrito I've ever had in my life. be prepared for long line before u order so be patient it's worth it at the end
author: Sarah G.

description:
Here's the skinny:
The tacos are better than the burritos.
The agua frescas were too sweet for my taste.
It's cash only.
author: Stephanie C.

description: I decided to try this place since it was named the best burrito place in Sf, but nothing special! The burrito was small, only three ingredients(meat, beans, and pico), and the meat wasn't that good. Compared to El Farolito, this place has a long way to go! EF has really good grilled carne asada and the self-serve salsa is the best! Not to mention, the price is waaay more with it. It was $6.75/8.95(regular/super) here while EF was only $5.75/6.75!! The burrito wasn't bad but it doesn't even come close sadly.
author: Tina P.

description: Worth the hype people! I understand why they are voted to be number 1 in US now! The meat are soft and flavorful, the outside tortilla skin can be greilled (dorado) upon request, the beans was not too strong for people who don't like beans, the guacamoly is not loaded with other thins as it tasted fresh and they give a great green hot cilantro and jalapeno sauce on the table to accompany the food!! The line can be very long but it was worth it I guess! The steak and pork were really delish! Would love to try the lengua and the head next time =)
author: Wendy T.

description: Super Carna Asada burrito. Taco are bomb!
author: Mason T.

description: I had a veggie burrito with guac and sour cream. It was very flavorless. The spicy green sauce made it taste a bit better but overall it was okay.
author: Maria T.

description:
Why do people rave about this place? Even if it was the first burrito I have ever tried, it was very, very average tasting. 

Except it wasn't average. The prices were high (almost $8 for a dinky burrito with avocado), and over $3 for a taco. I would excuse the high prices if the food was phenomenol, but it really wasn't. 

The size was not the size of an average burrito either. Nope, it was a child sized burrito that barely made a dent in my stomach. And I don't eat very much. 

If I waited longer than I did (about a 10 minute wait), I would have been pissed. But I'll just cut my losses and eat at other, actually good places.
author: Mina K.

description: The best tacos in the world so worth the price and wait time. You never go wrong with  super "dorado" taco de asada and a super dorado taco de chorizo. And wash it down with a agua de mango. Always get the tacos here the burritos are good but nothing compares to there super dorado tacos.
author: Jeffrey T.

description:
Was once a great taqueria delicious, tasty, hits the spot! Been coming here since before it became the ONLY place to eat in the mission about 28 years now. 
No longer reside in the area and truly miss this place, you can try to replace it but.... you CAN'T!!! 
Thursday, had business in SF, decided to buy my staff burritos (carnitas - no one makes them better & carne asada) with whole avocados, cheese and whole beans. 
Got back to the office and not one burrito had avocados or cheese - what's up with that?!?!  But they all had whole beans - Woo Hoo!  
Ten (10) burritos with avocados and cheese that I had to pay an extra $2 for and they completely messed up the order. Further I specifically asked for NO tomatoes or salsa on one of the burritos and guess what??? Nope I am not kidding Felicia! 
I am so embarrassed because I have always bragged about this being the best place for burritos, damn $100 wasted. 
I was reading reviews about this place just now before deciding to write one and one of them was completely true - "Although this place is busy, that is not an excuse for completely messing up orders!"  
My advice - check your food before you leave.  Send it back till you get it right, if they are going to charge top dollar then you should have it the way you ordered it!
Me - I plan to live the rest of my life with the previous memories I had of this once great place in the sky, opps err the mission and choose to forget this experience I had as it causes me great stress and migraines - Hehehehe! Ok just kidding, but really I'm good & won't take another chance. One good thing, I will not brag about a place that I haven't been to in a few years
author: Pat H.

description: We rushed over here to make it before the 9PM closing time and it was definitely worth it. My wife and I both ordered the carne asada burrito and it was everything we had dreamed of and more.
author: Masson L.

description:
I enjoyed the food a lot here but the aspect I loved the most was the extremely friendly Owner/Cashier who greeted everyone with a smile, joked around and thanked every customer. 
This place is just slammed with customers all the time for a lot of good reasons.
They don't have a deep menu but what they offer on the menu always comes out fresh and awesome. 
There's nothing fancy or special about the decor and you'll often have to fight for a seat but if your looking for a humble high quality place to eat a quick bite, La Taqueria is a difficult place to beat for the price/quality and customer service! 

O ra le vato! Muchos Gracias to the Owner!
author: Chris L.

description:
I'm not sure why the hype over this place- the chicken is boiled not very tasty which makes the food pretty tasteless. Good size portions! But that's quantity over quality. Seats turn-over quick enough. 

I much rather eat smaller, more flavorful tacos (Lo Lo, Taclicious).
author: S R.

description: Been going here since the mid 90s. Still my burrito (and tacos dorados) heaven. Is it the salsa? Is it the hot sauce? Is it the avocado? Is it the beans? Don't know, but it's the best, however they do it.
author: Quang D.

description: Best Mexican food I have ever had. Got the chorizo burrito and it was out of this world. Price and service were great.
author: Andrew E.

description:
Found this place using yelp. 

We noticed other yelpers provided the menu choice of "el dorado style" (crunchy taco wrapped in a soft shell). So we ordered a take out of

"el dorado style" carnita taco
"el dorado style" carne asada taco
"el dorado style" carne asada super burrito
regular carne asada super burrito

After sampling all the above, I am now a fan of "el dorado style" for tacos. It is so good. However, the super burrito is a little skinny and has an overwhelming tomato taste. I am going to have pass on the burrito and go for two "el dorado style" taco next time. Yum. Can't wait to go back for tacos!

Please note CASH ONLY!
author: Janice T.

description: I've been to a fair share of Mexican spots to eat. This by far is the BEST place for tacos I've ever had. I'm more of a burrito gal but the tacos here are too good to pass up. I wish they was a better way find parking but hey, its SF. The tacos aren't your typical tiny double tortilla tacos, it's massive and so good. This place never disappoints me, except when I can't find parking.
author: Alejandra G.

description: Best Mexican food you can find north of the border. The crispy steak burrito is seriously the greatest thing I have ever eaten. The chips and salsa/guac are dank. The line can get pretty long but it goes really fast and is worth the wait. Also the dude who works the register is hilarious. Love this place
author: Danielle B.

description:
So, while in San Francisco, I had to visit this place. The claim was too outrageous - best tacos/burritos in the world? Who does that?

That said, I found an operation that I had an insane amount of respect for once I got there. It was the fastest, most precise, organized, and well-run line I've seen in years. Every member of their team, which must have been around a dozen, knew their role exactly. Watching the line is enough reason for anyone who might reckon themselves a "foodie" (don't care much for that word) to go here for the experience.

For people from Southern Ontario/Toronto, or anyone familiar with Muskoka - the only line I've seen run like this at "Weber's" up the 400 Highway. [There, you walk into a lineup, and while you're in line you get your order taken, pay, and by the time you get into the place you get your food and walk out - a 30 meter line-up could take under 10 minutes...] This place in SF, is the real deal. In terms of authenticity, imagine Mexico City, and the volumes of tacos that they must pump out daily. 

This, for meat-lovers, should be considered a bucket list item (considering of course, you don't want to go right to Mexico, if you're not concerned about how dangerous its becoming).

I gave this place a 4, because the food is made for volume. It is not as good as it can be. Y'know? The reason it's so good is because it's so fresh. They go through such volume, that nothing sits around for too long. In that sense, it's great, but it's not as good as it can be because of the volume. It's a double-edged sword. I wouldn't change a thing about it though, and I'll go back if i'm ever in SF again.
author: Hunter M.

description: So so so good. I'm a snob about Mexican food and La Taqueria exceeded my expectations. Forget about any other sauce, they keep it simple with one killer flavor of a sweet yet spicy verde sauce. I slathered atop my carnitas taco and was in heaven with every bite.
author: Samantha L.

description:
The Best Taqueria in town.  I've been visiting this taqueria for over 30 years & consistency, quality & price are right on.
I grew up eating here & have introduced my familyThis is always our #1 Taqueria!
author: Michele V.

description: This place definitely lives up to the hype. It makes every sort of best burrito lists out there. The burrito was definitely worth it. All ingredients are very fresh. I got the chicken burrito with sour cream, avocado, and cheese. It was delicious! I also enjoyed the crispy chips and fresh salsa. The venue feels so authentic. Its a great place.
author: Kari G.

description: Lights, camera, no beans...as an Asian this is a no go...pretty lights outside but ya need rice...el farolito on 24th for the win!
author: christopher h.

description: GOAT. Be prepared to wait in line though... Small menu (only burrito, taco, quesadilla), but damn they do it right. I bring friends from out of town here when they are visiting, it is a San Francisco institution.
author: Jordan T.

description:
So I found this restaurant from reading an article about this place and this lady said it was Americas best burrito I guess she has been to places all over the US and this was one of her favs. So I decided to give it a try. My sisters and I took BART because as we all know Frisco is bad with parking and some garages charge grip. The BART exit was pretty close. We went on a Saturday afternoon and it was very busy the line was long but it moved quick. the seating area was very crowded so after ordering we found a spot outside to eat. My sister and I shared a burrito the carnitas and a Taco the carnitas. The tacos come with a crunchy tortilla on the inside and a soft on the outside. OMG it was so good. The burrito was pretty small but the flavor was hella good. The green salsa that was outside where we were eating was not that spicy but it had a good flavor to it also.

I can't wait to go back and maybe this time try the quesadillas.
author: Johanna G.

description: We visited this place last night on my bro in laws recommendation. The streets are crowded in this Hispanic section of SF. Parking was almost impossible but we got lucky and got a spot right across the street. The lines were huge extending outside the restaurant. Not many sitting place inside nor outside and yesterday we decided we will just eat in the car. I got the chicken tacos and they were good (not extraordinary). Other folks got vegetarian and chicken burrito and they loved it. The salsa verde was very very hot. Restroom at the back is clean for the crowd. Note its CASH only here. The lines may look intimidating but moves fast.
author: Manoj N.

description:
Third up in my continuing quest to give the Mission burrito a chance, I stopped at La Taquiria. I mean, I can't exactly call The Mission Burrito Experiment complete after having visited only two burrito joints, right?

To give some background, I was new to the Mission burrito scene and needed to decide if I like Mission burritos or not by visiting a few of the burrito joints in the Mission.

So, I got as close to  my standard burrito as possible; carne asada burrito, with sour cream, cheese, avocado.  This was a step down from both El Faralito and Taqueria Cancún. It was very juicy and dripped everywhere, but juice did not mean taste! The meat was not very flavorful at all.

But, I'm not going to let this temporary roadblock stop me, so stay tuned for the next installment of The Mission Burrito Experiment!
author: Nadeem A.

description: I came here because apparently it's all the rave in the Mission District. The line was pretty long, we waited about an hour to get our food. This food is lacking on the flavor side. I had the chicken taco and I needed salt. (Which wasn't available). The guac had no flavor. For the long lines and crowd I thought the food would be off the charts! Fail. Wouldn't come back. Only upside is the food is dirt cheap.
author: Moe A.

description: So cheap and SOOOO delicious. It is a must stop on your trip in the Mission. You just might not be able to have just one taco though! We didn't wait that long as they are quick to get your order in and quick to hand you your tacos. We each got three with onions and the works and they really hit the spot something fierce! Don't be turned off by the cheesy decor or boring tables - its a gem!
author: Vanessa M.

description: A great place to go in the Mission for a burrito... although yes you have many choices. No frills, cash only, no rice burrito with a generous helping of your protein of choice (love carne asada), beans, and you can opt for more add ons.
author: Brian C.

description:
So, as per my usual habit on my day off, I decided to try a new restaurant. It's been a while since I had a mission burrito so I decided to try La Taqueria. Despite all the awards and accolades this place has had over the years, I had never tried it until today. 

Let me start by saying that when I entered, although crowded, most of the people were not Latino. Always a bad sign. I ended up ordering at the cash only counter my default carne asada super burrito and mango Aqua fresca. This place gets points for having 8 different kinds of agua fresca. Most places have 3. My order was ready promptly but I was surprised to find that in terms of size, my super burrito was not at all 'super'. Not a problem, I'll just eat more chips. By the way, they charge $1.30 for chips and salsa. That's strike 2 in the value category. One of the reasons why mission style burritos and California burritos in general are so popular here because most people can make two meals out of one burrito or at least be so stuffed after eating one at say lunch that they aren't even hungry by dinner time. This was not going to be the case here. $9 gets you a regular size burrito that cannot fill up big guy such as myself. After getting past all of these little negative elements, I was ready to enjoy my $9 super (baby) carne asada burrito. The last bad I'll say is that the tortilla was too chewy and moist. I like my tortilla a little on the dryer side with brown marks on it. Maybe this is just me. 

The ingredients inside the burrito were pretty good. A little too much sour cream for my taste and not enough heat but I know that's just personal preference. I'd say I have an above average heat tolerance so if they made every burrito for my tastes, people would complain. All in all, the taste of the burrito and chips and salsa were not bad, but not good enough for me to come back. You can get a much better burrito a block away. 

Maybe their tacos are better.
author: Rudy G.

description: Solid Mexican food but there are definitely better places to get Mexican food in San Francisco. Keep in mind I am vegetarian so I can only provide a perspective on the quality of the vegetarian options. If you haven't been here before would definitely recommend trying. Make sure to have enough cash since they don't take card.
author: Ashwin M.

description: Great food!  I got the steak burrito and it was fantastic!   Small place but the line moves fast and worth it  the chips and salsa were very good as well.
author: Brett B.

description: I ordered two regular steak tacos and they were yummy! Really good size portions for a cheap price. The salsa was also really good too!
author: monique n.

description:
The line was really long, waited over 30 minutes but it was worth it.
The place is very tiny, so take out would be best.
