I had the immense pleasure (yes, immense) of visiting this place finally after seeing a Food Network special over a year ago. I never really understood the whole mission style burrito thing and honestly I guess I never had it anywhere else so I can't say that this was the best mission-style burrito I've ever had without any comparisons.

But for $7 and some change (oh and I got greedy and got a $4 taco too, shuddup I don't care it was FRIGGIN BOMB ... lengua all the way) you get this non-twinkie sized, well filled with deliciously marinated meats burrito with no rice that will engulf all your senses into the surrender that is food-gasm.

I kid you not, if you haven't tried this place, you must drop everything and go. If you have tried this place and didn't like it, go back for the lengua!!! if you're not adventurous enough for beef tongue ... well ... man up! And if you know this already, say horray with me! I'm definitely feeling deprived, like normal lunches are just not good enough anymore and La Vic's ... what's that? Please, bring me a mission style burrito from La Taqueria.
author: Lorrie M.

description:
While I usually think of tacos as small, these were larger than I was expecting, but wow. Ate WAY more than I should have. I had Tongue, Pork and Steak, and it was so good, I ate all three.

I'm the wrong person to ask about spice levels, preferring battery acid levels in general, but these were nice with just the right amount of spice.

My one caveat is that I'm not sure its a great vegetarian option.
author: Ben T.

description: One foggy San Francisco evening, a genie appeared to me. "Hark! My gorgeous ginger girl (I know this sounds more like Jesus than a genie, but just go with it.) I can grant you one of these two wishes: You could have world peace, with singing children, rainbows and glitterey unicorns abound. Or you can have all the La Taqueria carne asada burritos your little black heart could ever desire. Which do you choose?" "Let the rainbows fall, genie. Set those bitchass unicorns and children ablaze so they may perfectly roast my carne asada. La Taqueria for life!" Sorry human race. I choose these bomb ass burritos over you.
author: Angie H.

description: Had to change thr review....not 0 because i went there forever and a day but down 2 stars because last time i went there was a maggot in the taco....walked out never went back
author: John Paul G.

description:
I am from the east coast and the burrito I tried here was the best I have ever tried.  I ordered the Veggie Burrito with guac, sour cream (Additional cost to add those) and a large Jamaica drink (Hibiscus flower).
Let me just say I have dreams of that delicious burrito, I am so sad that we do not have such great burritos here in Rhode Island.  Although when I go back to SF you best believe this will be the 1st and last place I will visit!
I did not try any of the meat but my family did and they said it was amazing as well so if you have not gone here yet make sure you do!

The restaurant has benches and small tables for seats.  I went around lunch time so I am sure later on in the day you would have to take your food to go.  They also had just opened the doors and it was very full already.  A full restaurant = good food.
author: Karen R.

description: La Taqueria continues to amaze. My son loves the pinto beans (which are so good for him, and also serve as his gateway to ice cream :) , and we love the pollo and the carnitas tacos, respectively, and for many years. Felicidades!
author: Rudolph R.

description: If you're debating on going to this place, grab your keys and GO! The prices are a little steep for a burrito or taco BUT the taste of their carne asada super burrito made the price NO big deal! The carne asada was very flavorful throughout the burrito, NO bland meat here! **there may be a long line, but hey long lines are always a sign of good food right?**
author: Devin L.

description: I ordered tacos, the carne Asada was extremely flavorful and tender, the green salsa is pretty spicy but tasty, a bit pricey but a pretty good size.
author: Brenda R.

description: This is by far the best tacos I've had. The place only takes cash and fills quickly so waiting for a seat is the norm. I had the hard taco wrapped on a soft taco with guacamole, carnitas, and pico de gallo. The food hits the spot when you're craving good Mexican food. Definitely a must try!
author: Alessandro P.

description:
Did you have a bad day?

Did you get your heart broken?

Did MUNI run over your cat?

Get to La Taqueria ASAP and buy a burrito.  I have never heard a sob story that a La Taqueria burrito couldn't alleviate.  We are so luck to have a plethora of delicious Mexican food in the mission, but this is truly the best.  The tacos are amazing as well.  It's hard to say if I frequent this lovely locale three times a week or more...
author: Allyson D.

description:
walked in and this place was packed.  get in line on the left hand side by the cash register and wait for someone to take your order.  I got two tacos - carnitas and lengua.  LOVED the lengua.  surprisingly very tasty and tender.  add the green sauce in the bottles.  adds a nice kick.

couple of downsides to this place.  one is the mariachi band.  there's really no room to have a band in that restaurant, but they come in anyways and play and then put a bucket in your face and ask for tips.  the second thing is the cost for extras.  a taco, no fixings, costs $3.75.  add cheese or sourcream, and that's 50 cents each.  guacamole must be like $1.  add that all up and your taco is now $5.75.  what happened?!  anyways, my point is that it can add up really quickly, so i dropped one star.

if you want to save a few bucks, too, skip the chips and salsa. nothing special.
author: Tina L.

description: Ok, this place does not need another great review, but here it is.  Was in SF for two days with the family and we went to La Taqueria both days for lunch.  Simply the best burrito on the planet.  I knew this because I have been coming here for 15 years whenever I am in town.  But what I did not know is they have amazing beef tacos, as my boys (aged 7 and 10) devoured three each both times we went.  One of the best places in SF and the country for that matter.
author: Sean M.

description: Soooo yummy!! I got the carne asada burrito and LOVED it!!! Very filling. Cash Only.
author: Jessica J.

description: Wife and I were looking for a place for lunch after going to the bakery next door.  I noticed this place had a lot of people inside.  We decided to give it a try.  We were not disappointed.  Food is fantastic!  Simple menu, tacos, burritos and quesadillas.  Cash only, but they have an ATM inside.  So good!
author: Bill D.

description: Carnitas super burrito, dorado style with a large watermelon agua fresca=perfection! Heaven in a foil wrapper.
author: Laurel M.

description: You've heard the Legend. It's true, this is a damn good burrito. First time I've heard of the secret "El Dorado" style, but tried it, not sure why every burrito joint doesn't do this. The tortilla is crisped to perfection. High quality ingredients and juicy burrito makes it worth the wait. Great place if you;re a tourist, then you can say you tried a Mission burrito.
author: Esther F.

description: I was told these are the best burritos in town. This place had all the good signs of a local and tourist favorite, with a super long line and a packed house. I'll admit the meat tasted very fresh and had the grilled flavor it should have. However, the burrito wasn't very big and overall, I've had better. I would go back if i was in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Michael H.

description:
Got the chicken super burrito. The taste was good, it was the most liquid-y burrito I've had. Not worth $8.95. But the horchata was delicious.  
Might come back to try to guac
author: Alexandra R.

description:
This is my buddy's fave taqueria joint in the City, so we decided to grab burritos here for an early dinner. He was saying he loved it here because they don't have rice in their burritos, so I was thinking it'd be like a SoCal burrito. I enjoy both SoCal & NorCal burritos, I appreciate each take lol. 

Anyway, I order a carnitas burrito and chop it up with the cashier. I tell him that I heard a lot of good things about this place, and it's my first time here. He tells me that I need to try their tacos because it's what they're known for, and since I didn't order any, he hooks me up with one for free! HUGE bonus points for awesome service. 

I get my burrito, and demolish it. It's a little smaller than the burritos that I'm used to (probably because of the lack of rice) but it was very flavorful and juicy. It definitely wasn't reminiscent of SoCal burritos, but delicious nonetheless. 

The taco was on HIT! Kind of fried, so it was kinda crispy and a little greasy. But omfg, I will order like 300 of those things next time. One of the best tacos I've ever had in SF. If I lived in walking distance, I'd be fatter. 

Delicious food, solid service!
author: Eduardo R.

description:
How is it possible that with all the amazing restaurants in SF and even in The Mission area, I keep ending up here?  Each time, my friends have been like... 'I know this great taqueria that you're gonna love'... and each time, we end up at La Taqueria.  It is good but, it's just funny to me that it seems to be the go-to place.  

So far, I've tried the tacos, quesadillas and strawberry juice!  All are worth ordering again.  Even if there's a line, it goes fast.  You order, then snag a table when they're cooking up your food.  

NOTE:  Don't get greedy and snag a table before your friends even get thru to order... that messes up the system so that people who have just gotten their food don't have a place to sit and you (foodless and greedy) are taking up a table!  Others will open... they always do. 

Try the strawberry juice... yum!  

See ya there!
author: Susan D.

description:
The best thing featured in the burritos and tacos at La Taqueria are the meats.  The moist and savory flavor of the carnitas and noticeably distinct smokey flavor of the carne asada are quite good.  I ordered one carnitas taco and one carne asada burrito which came out to nearly $15, much to my surprise.  Cheese and guac on both orders were extra.  With everything you thought your burrito should come standard with as being extra charges, you start to feel like this taqueria took a page out of the airline business model and is just trying to nickel and dime you.

Burritos are pretty small, the tacos on the other hand are pretty stacked (sticking with the tacos only from here on out).  Both, although good tasting, still were a little too mushy for my tastes.  Normally I'll also be somewhat uncomfortably stuffed after scarfing a super burrito from a taqueria.  Here, after finishing my taco and burrito with "extras," I still could have eaten more.
author: Erich D.

description:
This place is the best!  I have eaten at a ton of Taqueria's in SF but this one takes the cake. 
The burritos and fish tacos are my favorite with a mexican beer.  It is cheaper to eat here than to shop at the market for the same ingredients and there's no clean up afterwards. The portions are huge and the staff is polite and friendly.   

YUM YUM get some yourself some today!
author: Sun M.

description: Awesome burritos de lengua my dad's favorite I like the carne asada.. tacos are excellent!!!! It's always busy so that means good food!!! Great friendly hard workers!!! A big thank u to u guys!!!
author: Mariela P.

description: Honestly, the best burrito on the planet !  Hands down.  I went to the their San Jose location for years and was sad to see that they closed it down but glad that they kept the San Francisco location.  I love their carne asada burritos and their tacos the cabesa are the bomb.  They are a bit pricier than most places but I think it's worth it.  Their food is always fresh and meats are always tender and juicy
author: Jimmy V.

description: The carnitas burrito is very good...but I live in LA, where great carnitas burritos are pretty standard. Was this in the top five I've ever had? No. Was it worth waiting 30 minutes for? No. Would I go back if I was in the neighborhood and there wasn't a line? Sure.
author: HJ U.

description: A really great burrito! I recommend for a quick bite, as opposed to desiring a sit-down meal. Tasty seasoned meat and fresh veggies!
author: Eddie C.

description: This place was just okay. Everyone says its so amazing, but I would have to disagree. It's not all that it's cracked up to be. Everyone you meet in the Mission says "go to La Taqueria" but it's just adequate. You're not missing out if you go to another taco/burrito place. The line is out of control for what they offer. ALSO, they ONLY take cash, so please beware or that! :)
author: Ashley N.

description:
Being born and raised in S.F. Bernal Heights as a Toddler and in the heart of the Mission from a teen till now. I've eaten alot of food around this city, and of course in this part of town.

So this place, IMO. is "ok" just like many have said here. I'd say the new residents that haven't been living in this town for long of course will jock anything they hear or read. Heck, I can tell my newbie co-worker from Chicago that the hot dogs at 7-11 on Bayshore Blvd. are the bomb. And he'd believe me, and tell all his buds.

So yeah, Like I said La Taqueria is "ok". Its been in the Mission for a long time, and I gotta support that for sure. At least they won't be tearing that down to make some ugly ass high rise loft. Who knows though right? But when I heard that this place was voted the "best"  Would I cast my vote as this place being the best Burrito in the World or whatever.. NO.

I'm not gonna critique the taste, quality of this place etc.. All I'm saying is this place is "ok". I'd rather you try it yourself and search other Taquerias. See what you think.I eat at other Taquerias in S.F., SSF. Daly City. But do I not come here frequently cause I think it's the 'best"? NO.

IMO, there are some other great Burrito shops in S.F.  Even South San Fran has some great Burrito joints. I'd say there's probably 5-6 awesome burritos shops down S.S.F., EVEN this certain truck by SFO Airport has some killer tacos. 

To each his/her own. Enjoy your burritos wherever you like.
author: Eric N.

description:
Freshest taqueria I've ever been to. You know just waiting in line and when you look over the counter that everything there is just freshly made! 

**Secret menu item you have to try is the soft tacos :)
author: Brian Y.

description: Don't be afraid of the cow head taco, it was the best I have ever had. This place is a hole in the wall awesomeness
author: Racki D.

description: This place is DELICIOUS! I recently went here with my boyfriend and after reading the yelp reviews we decided to go with El Dorado style supreme burritos. He got carne asada and I got chicken (carne asada was better). We also got two supreme tacos... one chicken one carnitas (carnitas was better). SO DELICIOUS! By far the best tasting burrito I've ever had! ALSO, you have to try their Strawberry fresca drink! Real chunks of strawberries... its SO good! Love this place!
author: Kelly W.

description:
I've lived in SF for ever...24 years to be exact... and I love The Mission, my home. For a while I would avoid La Taqueria because it's so popular and didn't give it enough credit. SHAME ON ME !  I love this place, screw those that complain about the $6+ dollars tacos, you pay for taste. 

Oh yeah and I enjoy my burrito with no rice and those tasty crunchy tacos :)
author: Claudia G.

description:
I recently moved to the Mission and have tried several different Taquerias in my new hood over the past few months.  So far, none of them have really impressed me and La Taqueria stands out to be the best so far.  My previous review compained about their high prices but I now understand why.  The overall quality of La Taqueria's food is head and shoulders above most taquerias in the city.  The carnitas tacos are delicious and the green hot sauce on each table is perfect with everything.  

I'm still in the process of trying other taquerias in the Mission so there will be more reviews to come.  In the meatime, you'll find me here devouring carne asada burritos with fresh guacamole doused with their fresh salsa verde. YUM.
author: Ray K.

description:
I heard good things about this place and had some high expectations. The carne asada and pollo tacos I ordered did not meet those expectations. :(  They were good, but not great.  

Maybe I will give them another chance if I'm in the area.  But so far I prefer El Farolito in the mission.
author: Juliana K.

description:
I will say this is my favorite Taqueria in town followed by Taqueria Guadalajara.  I wasn't going to YELP this place, but I think I need to, based on the ignorance of some of the other posters on here.  

A common theme is that they aren't big enough.  NEWS FLASH - Authentic Mexican Burritos are more flat in shape and don't come in weighing over 2lbs.  ALSO - Authentic burritos NEVER include rice, and you won't find that here.  All in all, this is as authentic as it gets in the city and they won't compromise for your gringo taste buds.  *Sorry*

Go Dorado style on the burrito.  They crisp the tortilla on the pan prior to serving.  The texture is exceptional. 

For a 2lb burrito with rice, go to Farollito down the street.  For something exceptional, go to La Taq.
author: Buddy Garrity L.

description: This is the best burrito I've had every visit.  The chicken falls apart and is very fresh.  The salsa and guacamole is fresh and generously loaded.  This is a simple burrito that excels in its simplicity.  It is very juicy and a bit messy to eat.  I miss La Taqueria every time i eat someplace else.
author: Greg H.

description: Really good tacos!  I had the Carne Asada taco and wife had Pollo taco. Very fast. Pretty busy but not too crowded.
author: Thaddaeus A.

description: The Carne Asada Burrito, El Dorado style, is probably the best burrito I have ever had. I also asked for the house hot sauce. Wow. I actually dream about this burrito. El Dorado style is when they throw the burrito on the grill for a few minutes. It makes the tortilla a little crunchy and heats it up, melding the flavors. It really is so good.
author: Niki A.

description:
I've read through a handful of reviews and I agree with those that say this is not the best Taqueria in SF, let alone the country.
Just had a chicken super burrito. I was surprised how thin it was. When I unwrapped the foil it literally broke in two because it was juicy. I had to carefully eat it to avoid it breaking apart completely. The flavors were all very good. No complaints about the quality or seasoning. The juice on the burrito though was so much that it was constantly dripping down my wrist into my cuff (long sleeve shirt) and required about 20 napkins to control. This is just too much juice in a burrito.
Since the burrito is smaller than the average Mission burrito I decided to try a taco. I got a regular Carne Asada taco that comes with guac, salsa, meat and jack cheese. This was better than the burrito in my opinion. If Nick Fasanello got his idea here for Nick's Crispy Tacos I can see why - they are both double wrapped in corn tortillas, sfuffed with ingredients layered at the base with jack cheese and wrapped so that they bulge from the front end out of the wrapper. Exactly the same tacos. I'm not sure who came up with the concept first but La Taq's tacos work just as well as Nick's and are a touch more authentic tasting. Other than that though I think they are almost the same thing.
I think La Taq is worth a visit if the lines aren't too long but better Mexican food can be found in many other places in the Mission.
author: Matt H.

description: Great place love this food came from San Jose with my wife at 7 15 on Sunday they close at 8 and I berly made it but its worth it I called on my way and got the order to go ..
author: Jhonny Z.

description:
I saw La Taqeuria on my way to the BART and was hungry so stopped in as I had never tried it.  

As usual I ordered the carne asada burrito like I have been during my trip to the Mission.

Wow another good place for me to get a burrito in case one of my usual spots are full.  They do make good food here but I do like some of the other places in the Mission better.

I have no issues going to any of the places in this neighborhood if someone recommends it as they all seem to be at least REALLY GOOD!
author: Coy W.

description:
So delicious, and while I know it is a pointless exercise to argue about the best taqueria, La Taqueria is the best taqueria. I suggest that if you order a taco (or even burrito), you get it "crispy style." Also, in addition to the classic and fantastic green sauce, there also is a spicy red sauce available upon demand.

Final tip: it gets kinda pricey to order tacos if you add guacamole, cheese and sour cream to each, so if you are into that type of thing, perhaps try a burrito instead.
author: David C.

description: Hands down my favorite burrito place in SF! Love the care asda super burrito and the fact that they use fresh avocados in the burritos. Yes its pricier than a lot of other burrito place but I'm ok with paying a little more for a higher quality product.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Lacks two of the most important elements of a Mexican food place. Rice and bottled coke. What a joke.
author: Mike D.

description: Love this place with all my heart. I grew up in San Francisco and this was definitely the place my family and I would go to if we wanted burritos. I'm kinda bummed that it has gotten so much publicity lately because I remember the days where the line only took at most 10 minutes. I'm happy La Taqueria is getting the recognition they deserve for their amazing food, but it's sad to see they have raised their prices and made their portions a little smaller. Every time I bring friends here for their first time they are never disappointed, so if you're thinking about trying it, definitely do! I just wish it were still considered a "hole in the wall" so that I could have a hefty burrito for the old prices in 10 minutes or less. Haha. Also their Horchata is the bomb! So good, must try!
author: Elena V.

description: The food is just not good. It lacks any quality taste. Plus the majority of the food is overpriced. I honestly would never go there again.
author: Cesar G.

description:
I'm not a huge mexican food fan. Ok... I never eat mexican food because a) I don't eat beans b) I don't like rice and c) I don't like guacamole. That usually makes it a no go with Mexcain food for me. BUT someone special convinced me to give the carne asada tacos a try and being the adventurous eater that I am, I said ok. IT WAS SOOOOOOO GOOD that after I had my 2nd one I wanted to order a 3rd and 4th one. Yum Yum Yummy!  I just got mine without beans and rice and it tasted perfect.

Might have long lines depending on the time of the day you're there. 

Soooo good. Will be back next time for more!
author: Cynthia C.

description: This place keeps it simple and manages to still be awesome!!! The line is always out the door but once you get to the front, food comes at you like a 10-yard touchdown pass. I always order the taco dorados with carne asada. With guac and cheese? Yes please! Just a tip, call ahead of time to pick up your order because it gets pretty damn busy.
author: Kathleen T.

description:
I don't think that anyone in this neighborhood needs me to tell them how good this place is, however, as an out of towner this place is extremely good. I had four tacos because I couldn't decide which meats to get. They were all exceptional.

Come before or after the lunch rush if you can.
author: Jordan M.

description:
My first trip to the Mission included a trip to La Taqueria. I read the reviews but was definitely disappointed in the food. I got the Carne Asada Tacos Dorados which was basically just a greasy, fried taco around a soft taco.

If you can beat the lines, go for it and order the burrito instead of the tacos.
author: Fonz G.

description: Seriously the best tacos! I got one carnitas and one chorizo, super dorado style. Worth the travel getting here. BART station right on the corner!
author: Heather D.

description: This is some legit street food style tacos. The shell in the inside is slightly crunchy and the outer shell is the normal soft corn tortilla. There is a reason why this place is so widely reviewed and I now know why.  The carne asada is definitely the highlight for me. It was generous cut of meat and it had a good char to the edges of the meat. The toppings were fresh and refreshing to contrast the meat.  Also definitely use the green tomatillo sauce to add a spicy kick to you taco. You will love it!
author: Norman C.

description: I've said it once and I'll say it again, Absolutely the best carne asada burrito in San Francisco! But you have to order it Dorado. That's what makes the burrito special, they brown the entire outside. And their salsa is also amazing. Just the right amount of hot and delicious! $9. And $3.75 Tecates.
author: Erin L.

description: I'm not a burrito expert but I do think the Carne Asada super burrito at La Taqueria is one of the best I've tasted. Ever since it won the prestigious honor of having the best burrito in the country, I was curious to try it out. I was skeptical of a burrito with no rice but it came out great. The guacamole is outstanding. If you opt for a regular burrito, add some guacamole as that should not be missed. I wish they offered a baby burrito option as my appetite is small and I couldn't finish the entire burrito on my own. I will have to try the tacos next time.
author: Chi N.

description:
Returned to La Taqueria recently for the first time in what was probably years. It might've been my first sober visit! Anyway, this place is ok but nothing to write home about. Standard basic taqueria menu, typical overpriced Mission prices. My veggie taco was good, but my chicken taco was kind of dry. Enjoyed the $1.30 chips and salsa - once I salted the chips.

I'd certainly return, but it didn't stand out in the sea of Mission options. CASH ONLY!
author: Denise B.

description: This is by far one of the BEST taco spots in The City. The taco dorados are killer, and to die for. This is a must try if you're into Mexican food, and in The City.
author: Frisco K.

description: This is the best burrito I've ever had. Everything from the meat to the guacamole to the green sauce all compliment each other so perfectly. If you're in San Francisco then you should do yourself a favor and eat here. Place is small and usually had a line, but it's all worth it.
author: Edward P.

description: Taco, burrito, chips, all taste great! A bit of wait but definitely worth it! Would definitely recommend to try it out!
author: J Y.

description:
Fuck all these smug, nit picky haters who THINK they know good Mexican food. La Taqueria is the best Mexican food in SF, hands down. Everything is fresh, made to order, and the staff is extremely efficient and kind. If you have a problem with the price, go to El Farolito down the street and buy meat that has been sitting in those silver containers for most of the day. It's still good, don't get me wrong; but you get what you pay for, especially in this case. All the times I've came to La Taqueria it has been crowded, so be prepared to deal with a long line and rude people. But just understand that we are all here to enjoy some great food and take that smug scowl off your face. Plus, the line moves more quickly than expected. I almost always get a carne asada taco or burrito, as it is their staple. Anything you get here will be fresh and delicious, however. This is the best place to get lengua as well, if you're into that (I know I am). The only warning I have for you is to pace yourself. It all looks so good that you may order more than what you can eat. 
So, take this advice coming from a real Mexican who grew up eating delicious homemade Mexican food his whole life: La Taqueria is the best place around to get your taco and/or burrito fix.
author: Brian A.

description: Great tacos, still as good as ever. My favorite is to order the tacos "dorado" (deep-fried outside shell) with beans, cheese, and avocado. Delicious horchata as well, and friendly service.
author: Patrick H.

description:
A friend of ours was visiting SF and we decided to go here on a recommendation. 

I was already sad when the menu didn't feature al pastor as a meat option. *shakes head in disappointment* So I ordered a carnitas burrito instead. Meh. The meat was way too salty. The overall burrito flavor was also lacking compared to other burrito spots in the Mission.

It's not inedible but when there are so many other good options nearby, why bother? Maybe I'll give it a second try again some day but not anytime soon.
author: Shuqiao S.

description:
I came here two weekends ago and all I have to say is this place is CRAZY! I really wanted to leave a soon as I saw the long line. My mom said I don't think so and made me wait with her. THANK YOU MOM for making me wait!!! This place is amazing. I can honestly say that they have the BEST tacos I have EVER tasted. 

The tacos have a regular tortilla and then a fired tortilla with melted cheese on it. Your choice of meet, avocado and a lot more ingredients which make your taste buds dance. While this place is a little pricey it is beyond worth it. We ordered 3 tacos, three burritos and 2 drinks we spent a little over $50. Yes I know it is pricey and it's not a place where you can go all the time but it is so worth it. My mom and I both had 1 and  1/2 tacos and were really full so you can imagine how big the tacos are. I will definitely be coming back soon!!
author: Liz P.

description: Amazing flavors! Carne asada burrito/taco has great smokey taste. Love at first bite. Carnitas have very nice marinade, too! I don't think you can go wrong with anything here. Just say, "everything!" when they ask you what you want in it. ;)
author: Dee C.

description:
Best tacos and fruit drinks ever! I've been going here since I was kid and it has always been fast and consistent. I do not mind paying a little extra compared to other places to have a meal that tastes 5 times as good and with such friendly staff and a lively atmosphere. Also all their meat flavors are good but the best are tongue and beef head. Might seem scary but totally worth trying!

JUST ONE SAD THING: THEY ARE ON VACATION DURING THE WINTER. HOEVER THESE PEOPLE HAVE DONE SUCH AN AMAZING JOB THAT THEY TOTALLY DESERVE IT.
author: Ben U.

description: Just thinking about this place makes my mouth water! I ordered 2 carnitas tacos with everything, carne asada quesadilla and horchata. Very satisfied. Can't wait to go back! Make sure you take cash no credit cards accepted.
author: Lolita D.

description:
Definitely the best burrito I have had. 

I've been told multiple times that the Mexican food at the Mission is amazing but haven't got around to trying it until today -- and it definitely didn't disappoint.

I got a chorizo burrito and decided not to add anything in it, and it was pretty amazing. Very flavorful and filling. I usually do this thing where I eat a burrito till there's one bite left and then trash it but with this one, that did not happen!
author: Karina S.

description: Hands down the best Mexican restaurant in SF.  Get the taco and burrito "dorado style" with any meat. It's just delicious. Don't forget to pour their green spicy sauce on top.
author: Nishant S.

description: Best taco I've had in my life! The tortillas and avocado are incredibly fresh and the flavors meld together perfectly. Don't miss this spot if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Ash P.

description:
it's called "ask for 'em crispy". 

just... do it, ok?

you can thank Kristin P. later.
author: Claire F.

description: love. very crowded, not easy to get a spot to sit and eat, make sure a homie is scoping out available spots to sit at. Line begins from the back of the location towards the bathrooms. look up the "secret menu" options online before arriving. Had chips and salsa (chips get a bit soggy towards bottom b/c of fluids from salsa), chorizo burrito, chicken burrito, cheese quesadilla, and beverages. it was delicious. cash only
author: La B.

description:
This place made me the best beef tongue taco I've had. Seriously. Tender, flavorful and not trying to be anything else but tongue.

I was starving when I arrived here and was shaking due to low blood sugar levels. When paying the cashier, he noticed my tremble and joked, "No need to be nervous!" I told him it's because I'm so hungry, he turned around, grabbed me some chips and salsa on the house and told me to eat. I scarfed down those chips while waiting for my order to be called. When I came back to the counter, he said, "Feel better? Good."

Awesome.
author: Theresa S.

description: The people serving tacos should not be handling the food with their bare hands . For instance , handling all the fillings that go into tacos and burritos should not be will bare hands !!! Use gloves! And the the people taking your order are rude. .
author: Jennie M.

description:
"the whole wide universes's bestest burrito-est"-- nate silver. 

i think la taqueria is what results when a statistician is put in charge for determining the best burrito.

i came with cautious optimism having been the unrelenting victim of the hypiness of other "bestest _____ restaurant eva!" claims made in SF (Frenda's Brench Soul Food, Ike's, Nick's Crappy Tacos, to name a few). But i decided to go for this since a) i live down the street from this place and b) burrito-dom hits close to home-- being a burritonista most of my life.

immediately, I was disappointed when i didnt see al pastor as an option. thats right a "taqueria" with NO AL PASTOR. just so you heard that right.. NO AL PASTOR.

ok. 

so as i was waiting in line, i witnessed the burrito-making process. one guy unaffectionately throws down a flour tortilla, with a rectangular slice of cheese perfectly in the center. *steam* *steam* -- hands it off to the next guy who places the watery beans and remaining fixins and wraps it up for the consuming public. 

the burrito itself was pretty underwhelming. it tasted like something meant for mass consumption-- not terrible, but also not good. there was an excessive amount of sour cream and guac in it which made the burrito weird creamy texture. i would put it in the category of chipotle-esque burritos. in other words, if there is something better nearby, its worth the extra walk to have that.

And thats the thing. There are 10 taquerias within a 3 block radius that are quite a bit better. Taqueria Vallarta, Farrolito, even the establishment right next-door Elsy's (el salva but chya ill take their papusa's intravenously if i could).

BOTTOM LINE: this is just another overhyped, underdelivering SF food establishment with burritos that have been statistically proven to have all the requisite features of the most bestest burrito in the whole wide universe. (sarcasm)
author: Sumeet S.

description:
Awesome, the best in town !
Since i am in SF i criticize Mexican food that i find pretty bad almost everywhere i go. But this place makes the difference ! Cheap and good !! I'll be back !
author: Marion P.

description: The tacos are just amazing . Tried the pork tacos and chicken tacos . Pork wins over chicken . The manager recommended Chorizo which was also very good . Add a mango Fresca and you're all set . Finding a table to sit can be challenge but with patience nothing is impossible
author: Vin M.

description: Try a burrito or taco with pork. Simply the best meat in SF.
author: Chris G.

description: Everyone raves about the Carne Asada burrito, and it is good, but the carnitas quesadilla is the best thing on the menu followed closely by the carnitas taco. It was crazy busy when we were there today and apparently has been that way for a couple weeks since it was on a TV show on the food network.
author: Chris H.

description:
Vegetarian taco with guac- WORTH IT. That cheese is DELICIOUS.

Carnitas taco- not worth it. Not bad by any means, but not that special- I'd go with the carne asada next time.

The green sauce on the tables???? HEAVEN.

You could just order one taco and be stuffed. But 2 is perfect, especially if you're on a diet and don't want a burrito( but seriously all you want is a f-ing burrito but you cannot be trusted to not eat the entire super burrito in one sitting and then hate yourself for the rest of the night/next day)- if you eat 2 its like... non-burrito heaven.
author: Emily D.

description: I finally tried the carne asada burrito because someone told me it was world class. So tasty!
author: Victoria L.

description: El Faro is better than this place. that is all.
author: Q W.

description:
I live in Honolulu so good tacos are few and far between.  Like pretty much the expanse of the Pacific Ocean between the island and the mainland. 

Three tacos (2 carne asada, 1 pollo).  Each $3.25.  1 bottle of Pacifico.  Very simple and well done.  I finally got to taste the carne asada skirt steak with the right marinade that I was used to when I was living on the outskirts of Alhambra/El Sereno/Huntington Park.  

I didn't like the beans in the tacos.  They kind of got in the way.  You can get "sin frijoles" for $1.20 more.  Yes, more.  I suppose they give you more meat.  Otherwise, I don't get it.  The tortillas were top quality and able to hold the ingredients adequately.  The salsa was good but it was the kind with the bigger diced tomatoes and onions like you see in the pictures.  I would rather have the minced roasted salsa but that's just a preference.  Also, I like my taco shop to have the pickled carrots, onions and radishes for me to top the tacos off.       

The pollo was pretty good too but nothing special.  The shredded chicken meat was good but can be found in burritos even in Honolulu.  In fact the guy that runs La Tacqueria de Ramiro in downtown Honolulu is part of the family that runs Gordo in S.F (and Berkeley) and does a great job with the pollo burritos.  Can't say the same about the carne.  

It's all about the carne though.  Four stars for the carne asada tacos.  Not quite 5 stars because of the beans and lack of options for salsa.
author: Will L.

description: Bland overpriced slush. No rice no black beans, but plenty of hipsters.
author: Eclectic E.

description: Just had the super burrito and super taco. Literally, beyond a shadow of a doubt the best I've ever had! Prices are great for the quality, taste and presentation. Meat is juicy and tastes fresh. Everything else was so perfectly balanced. Not too heavy while still filling. This place made me happy!!! I wish I lived here.
author: Adam D.

description: I got a carne asada burrito for a flight back home.  I ate the burrito completely cold and it was still amazing.  That is saying something.
author: Tatsu O.

description: Awesome carne asada and carnitas burritos! First bite is glorious! I  had low expectations, but it didn't disappoint. Burrito without rice,yeah! Will definitely come back.
author: Lollo H.

description: Their business hours are not that convenient, compared to those of any of the other great taquerias in the Mission District and surrounding areas--they close too early. Their prices are a little too high, considering their menu is just taqueria menu and nothing more than that. However, their dishes generally have a cleaner, more authentic and typical Mexican flavor than that of pretty much any other taqueria I've tried in San Francisco. Their food is fresh. They don't allow vagrants and crazies, which is an unusual big plus for a taqueria in the Mission. But their location is not very centric--they're way far south, near Cesar Chavez, rather than near 16th St, Soma, or Duboce--and their seating space is too limited for their rather large clientele size.
author: Raymond F.

description: Went here after reading that it was the best burrito in the US. It did NOT live up to the hype. The burrito was just okay, hardly any meat. You have to pay extra for sour cream and guacamole. My friend got the tacos and they were soaking wet and fell apart. Green salsa is pretty good, I guess. Farolito down the street is way better; they got robbed.
author: Audrey I.

description: Had Lunch here and the tacos were amazing. I'll have to come back again soon and try the burritos.
author: Ron P.

description: We used to rave about this place, but no more.  I had my usual two tacos: chorizo and carne asada.  The meat had no flavor as the tacos were full of dry and tasteless brown beans topped with the most pasty looking and bland pico de gallo I've ever swallowed.  My friend had a burrito that put him back over $12.  For an 'ok' burrito?  Really?  They charged for the chips and salsa (bland pico de gallo), which in most taquerias is free and delicious.  This was not good at all.  There was half an inch or more of liquid sitting in the bottom of the chip tray.  And the chips were stale.  How can you get stale chips in a taqueria?   We won't be going back.  The Taqueria Cancun down the street is good.  Head there!
author: Janet D.

description:
The food here is really good but be careful if you're a vegetarian!!!

- The food handlers constantly touch meat and then touch the beans/salsa on your veggie burrito with the same hands without even wiping them.
- They use the same spoon to pickup beans that they use to pickup some kind of meat.
- I've seen them spread avocado on a burrito but the spoon touches the meat and then they place it back in the bowl with avocado.

I love the food there, it tastes great but I rarely go there.  I would honestly go there 3-4 times a week if they had better food handling techniques.  But if they are do that kind of stuff in front of me, it scares me to think what they would do behind the scenes.

If you're a meat eater, don't worry about the above and I don't think anything they do is malicious, clearly the people making the food don't realize that a lot of vegetarians don't want the food handlers hands or the utensils touching meat and then their food.
author: Deke R.

description: I have been eating here for years and HANDS down, they have the best taco's, burritos,and quesadillas! All I have to say is FLAVOR! It's on point! The meat is delicious and the salsa's are the best. Esp the hot green one. I travel the distance for these tacos! They are expensive but who cares with flavor like that!
author: Michele M.

description: I have to say that La Taqueria has one of the BEST tacos/burritos in San Francisco if you know exactly how and what to order. It's cash only (annoyingly), a tad on the expensive side, and expect a 30-50min wait at all times (especially in the hours around lunch and dinner) from the time you get in line to when you get your food. But back to the food: Firstly, this is one of the only burritos you'll find around that doesn't include rice! That's right, it's pure meaty deliciousness wrapped snugly in a warm tortilla. Secondly, get the carnitas. Third, get it grilled. That's all I'm saying!
author: Vivien O.

description: Damn good asada burritos. Steak is super tender, and tons of sour cream and all the good stuff is extra good. Recommend!
author: Greg P.

description: The food here is exceptionally good. The meats are juicy and tender. The trimmings are abundant and fresh. The service is fast and courteous
author: Wolfgang F.

description: Simply the best out west! This place has always been my go to spot in the mission. Sometimes the lines are long but for good reason.
author: Derick G.

description: Yum yum yum. A SF institution, this will probably have a long line at most times of the day. Pro tip: order your burrito "dorado"--grilled brown and crispy after wrapped. To die for.
author: roger t.

description:
I chose to try this place because it was mentioned in every travel book that I read and the Yelp reviews were all great. I must say that they were all right on. 

This place is delicious and pretty reasonable. Adding double meat to your tacos yields some of the biggest tacos that I've seen. There are some interesting meat choices too. 

I ordered one chicken and one carne asada taco both with double meat. The chicken was good, but the carne asada was unbelievable. The two double meat tacos (more like 4 tacos) and a beer were about $13. 

If you want some delicious mission style tacos or burritos definitely hit this place!
author: Brett P.

description: With all the flat screen and hashtag crap this place has on its wall you would think they would developed a better way to communicate when your order is ready.
author: Mister T.

description:
We didn't really get to enjoy this place like I had hoped we would. On an extra busy and packed day we ended up eating three meals (one breakfast and two lunches) right in a row. It was not ideal. (it was fun but not ideal.) And, unfortunately for La Taqueria, this famous little taco joint was last on the list. Translation: we were full!

But I did decide to get three tacos and an horchata. I did everything I could to order in spanish and did a half way decent job. I chose chorizo, carnitas y lengua. The order was up quick and it was enormous! How could three tacos be so big?! They pack these tacos full of good stuff. A single taco is a reasonable meal. And here we had three for our full stomaches. 

Each bite was painful and so good. The explosive taste was wonderful. Even though I sort of misordered which toppings we wanted (Spanish is not my first language!) they were still tasty. The carnitas were especially tender and flavorful. The lengua was also so good. Chorizo was my least favorite and I could pass on that next time. Horchata was good but it isn't homemade. I wasn't super into it or anything. 

Next time I'll practice more spanish beforehand so I order properly.
author: Tai F.

description: It was delicious but overpriced imo and I prefer my burritos with rice--they're just too floppy without it.
author: Jess C.

description: I come out here as often as I can, and although it can be slightly pricey, worth EVERY SINGLE penny, best burritos and tacos I've ever had!
author: Tommy P.

description: Great burrito. Great salsa. Decent service. The hype is justified. Gordo burrito, for instance, tries to be what La Taq is, but can't quite hit the mark.
author: Grey Z.

description:
I really didn't want to like this place. I love rice. I love Mexican rice even more. They don't have it. BUT, the carne asada and carnitas burritos are just SO GOOD. The meat is marinated in heaven, I think. Seriously, DELISH.

But, what's up with like $10 burritos in the Mission? Ugh, minus one star.
author: Francesca F.

description: Funky place with lines out the door and cash only but the best burritos & tacos ever. Even with long lines it moves fast. Fresh ingredients and so tasty. A must do place in the Mission
author: Jim H.

description:
CARNE ASADA BURRITO GET BACK IN MY MOUTH.

The definition of satisfying. I haven't tried anything else on their menu, but the tacos look fantastic. It's pricey, but in my opinion Mexican food is like spelunking--soggy and not fun and unsatisfying most of the time until you hit gold. And then it's all worth it.
author: Cathy H.

description: Best chorizo burrito in the mission. Little bit more expensive, little bit better quality, and a little bit (but still huge) smaller portion size than el farolito.
author: Drew M.

description: California super burritos have rice. Actual burritos don't. Actual burritos have impeccably stewed pinto beans, the most flavorful carne esada, perfectly ripe, macerated pico de gallo and salsa verde to die for. There's nothing else needed. Take your rice, lettuce and cheddar monstrosities and leave me to my bliss. If it needs sour cream, it isn't worth eating. Mi sequndo hogar. Mi ultima comida. All goodness. Viva La Taqueria!
author: Caitlin K.

description: I went to La Taqueria for the first time with my family from out of state after I told them that it was voted best burrito in America so my expectations were really high. There was only a short wait and the employees were very nice but the burrito wasn't my favorite. I think the biggest issue I had with it was that there wasn't any rice and there were a lot of sauces so the burrito was very wet. If I was expecting a wet burrito I might have liked it a little bit more but I defiantly couldn't have eaten that burrito on the run, it would have dripped everywhere. My family liked the meat and the guacamole was really good, but it wasn't a burrito that I was that impressed by.
author: Selena R.

description: Came here ready to try the "Best Burrito in the World"...this was definitely far from it. The line was extremely long but I was patient in hoping the outcome would make up for it. Ordered a Dorado Carnitas Super Burrito with everything on it. When I got the burrito it was not dorado and also very small for a "Super" Burrito, it was mostly beans and the condiments, not much meat at all. When I finished the burrito I was not full or close to it, unlike when leaving normal burrito places in the mission I am barely able to finish them. I would rather go to several other places in the mission then have to deal with the lines here and average Mexican food. I recommend going a couple blocks up to Taqueria Cancun or El Foralito for a more satisfying authentic Mexican food experience.
author: Josue V.

description:
People are really not overselling the carne asada.  It's delightful. Their beans are creamy but not at all mushy, and even smothered in those babies and covered in sauce the carne asada is in no way lacking the all important crispy bits.  Mmmmm, crispy bits.  Is there anything more important in any asada-d meat than the crispy bits?  The correct answer is no. 

Bottom line: CRISPY BITS.
author: Kellie T.

description: This place ain't even that great, San Jose has better tacos and burritos, be sure to bring cash. 35 for a burrito, quesadilla, and a taco :| unsatisfied
author: Anthony N.

description:
I talk shit about Northern California Mexican food all the time.  It sucks and I always avoid it when I'm up there.  Seriously I would rather eat at Taco Bell than get a burrito in the bay.
But a trustworthy friend took me here and got me a carnitas taco.  This place is the only Mexican food I'll eat in the bay.
author: Michele S.

description:
The carnitas burrito (crispy, with cheese, guac and sour cream) blows my mind every time. Just the right proportions, the right size - bearing in mind I eat every meal like it's my last - and every single bite is the new most delicious thing I've ever eaten. Drunk, sober, whatever state of mind I'm in, I can always go for La Taqueria.

My mom had a revelation here. No joke. She hadn't eaten Mexican food since she was pregnant with me (that's TWENTY TWO YEARS without Mexican food, the tragedy) but I dragged her here anyways. One burrito and she was hooked. I went back to school and she started sending me photos of her there. By herself. Eating burritos. 

Pro tip #1: If your stomach is a black hole like mine, top off your burrito with a slice of banana cream pie from Mission Pie, which is like two doors down. You will not regret it. Actually you might, but it's totally worth it.

Pro tip #2: Not a whole lot of seating (and a whole lot of patrons). I personally enjoy taking my burrito-shaped nectar of the gods to nearby Dolores Park so I can camp out and enjoy some people-watching as I gorge.

Pro tip #3: You have to request cheese, guac, and sour cream if you want it on your burrito, which you do. They're like 50 cents extra.

Pro tip #4: Cash only. Bring the benjamins.
author: Alec S.

description: There's a reason why La Tacqureia is in just about everybody's top three.  There are plenty of fancy new taquerias, but this place is a true institution--generations of SFers have grown up on their tacos.  While burritos are a daily staple in The Bay, as the name implies, this place is really about the tacos (at least for me).  I prefer tacos at their simplest--meat, beans, and fresh pico de gallo on two steamed corn tortillas--and the quality of La Tarqueria's ingredients really come through in that form.  The carne asada and the carnitas are excellent, the former with just the right amount of char grilling, the latter crispy outside, moist and chewy inside, salty all over.  The real sleeper is the quesadilla--flour tortilla fried on one side with melted queso on the other, filled with crispy carnitas and couple of shots of green hot sauce--which is life changing.  Lines tend to move quickly, so don't fear, though finding a seat can be tricky depending on the time of day.  No hype, it's the real deal.
author: Ronald C.

description: I had the super steak tacos dorados, they were cool. The place is a little over priced. Super tacos are $6 and change and super burritos $10? I've never paid so much for tacos!!The ambience is loud and it's a little challenge to find seating. Seems like they need to open up a bigger establishment. Cash only. Not sure I'll be back given that there's more pros than cons.
author: Ali N.

description:
One word: delicious! 
Carnitas and tongue tacos are amazing! Burritos dont have rice (which I like!) and they also fry them a little on the outside-soooo good!

Strawberry drink is the bomb!
Have to go back to try more stuff soon!
author: Mila Y.

description: Best consistently fresh and delicious  carnitas corn taco in the city.  Order with everything and you won't be disappointed.  Been coming here for over ten years.  Tried to convince owner to franchise, but that would probably kill it.  Enjoy it while still in the family!!!
author: Philip B.

description: Very nice customer service, a clean and interesting atmosphere, and a pretty good burrito. It wasn't amazing, or close to the best burrito I've ever had, but certainly very good. Hence the 4 stars instead of 5.
author: Vanessa M.

description: The tacos here are absolutely delicious and the sauce they place on the tacos is uncomparable. Not too big a fan of the whole meat being in the taco but it's still good. The only complaint I have is their burritos aren't as good as their tacos and the line is alway so damn long. But definitely a must try of San Francisco.
author: Anonymous ?.

description: Super disappointed! Sloppy handling of food. I can't  believe they're the nations best burrito. Food doesn't even taste that good but there's a long lines
author: Noel O.

description: Got out of dance class and wanted to try a taqueria we hadn't been to before. The thing that comes to mind is...it's all white people, is this place any good? Haha, well, it is pretty good. The carnitas in my burrito was super flavorful, though I wish they had some special hot sauce of sorts to make it more special.
author: Rowena L.

description: Super burrito de Carne Asada and Super taco de Lengua were relatively lite for Mexican food. Cash only. Salsa verde can be considered very spicy.
author: Sergio R.

description: I went here because a silly friend said he heard it was "the best tacos in the world according to someone or something.  Just returning from out of state to my beloved SCO, what do I know right..  Well, once again the transplant white people get it all wrong again.  The are dozens of mexican places in the mission that have much better food for less than half the price.  This is for burritos and tacos both.  Like another yelper said,  if all you see are white people in anything other than an American restaurant whatever that is, RUN. Also,  if you grew up in our beloved city and never heard of a restaurant that's supposed to be the best in the world, its not.  You would've known about it.  This is trendy crap for trendy people.  Walk down the block, you won't be disappointed.
author: Nick P.

description: Great food! Take a super burrito (with extra sour cream, avocado and cheese) and add a Strawberry water, this is delicious!
author: Adriano M.

description:
I blame Taco Bell for the hype of the chalupa. On a trip to NYC, I was introduced to the San Loco taco (which made me immediately dismiss all notions of yo quiero taco bell). And then I moved to NYC and totally missed all the Mexican food in Cali. I visited SF last week and had a crispy taco at La Taqueria. One bite of that taco made the trip all worth it. If you think the queso loco taco at San Loco is bliss, sorry you don't know what bliss is. I even made that mistake. And now I know. The glory of the crispy taco at La Taqueria in the Mission in San Francisco.

Of course I went for a chorizo crispy taco while Jess M played it healthy and got the chicken taco. La Taqueria does not skimp on the meat here. My taco was bursting with crispy edged diced chorizo. The fatty juices were running and I sopped up every piece of chorizo that fell out of my taco and into my basket. The saltiness of the sausage was balanced with chopped tomatoes and my crispy taco was blanketed with a flour tortilla. The flour tortilla held it all together. I washed it all down with a melon agua fresca. Refreshing and delicious, one bite and one sip at La Taqueria will leave you wanting more of everything. Jess M held me back. We had more food stops along the way.

I've had the burrito here before but crispy tacos are really the way to go. If you want a traditional plate of rice, beans, and a main dish, you can have that as well but isn't it more fun to eat little things wrapped in foil or edible wrappers? All of the agua frescas here are divine. In the summer, go for the watermelon. If horchata is what you crave, they have that as well.

La Taqueria is a no fail bargain meal. The food is fresh and the offerings are endless.
author: Rachel A.

description:
So far, this is my favorite burrito spot in the city. I first tried it this week, meeting a friend on a weekday for lunch. It's clearly popular - the place was packed, with a deep line of people ordering. 

The menu offers a solid range of options, and despite the lunchtime crowds, the staff are quick to get orders processed and food on plates. The only downside is I live in the Richmond, work in SoMa, and don't get into the Mission often enough. 

Keep in mind that it's cash-only, so hit up the ATMs across the street before getting in line.
author: Tom C.

description:
High prices - low flavor.  Meh.

I wish this place was better.  We could really use a mexican restaurant where they don't skip on the details... such as:  multiple salsas made daily from scratch,  homemade tortilla chips, aguas frescas made with insight, comfortable seating.

They nickel & dime you so the taco (basic $3.75) becomes $5.50 when you add avacado/chese/salsa.  Then they charge you for store bought chips.

I look at their awards and I don't see anything in the last 5 years.   What was once a fantastic place has become the land of the lazy resting on their laurels.
author: mario w.

description: For all the praise, I thought it was a bit overrated. Don't get me wrong, the carnitas burrito was tasty, but some of the more low key places in the Mission give you more flavor and portions for your money. The vibe was low key and hipster, if that's your thing.
author: Olivia S.

description: Cash only!!! We came to this place because it was highly recommended and got super tacos (chorizo and pollo). We were excited because there was not much of a line and got our food quickly. But then, our meat was not seasoned well (the chorizo was not even spicy and the pollo had no seasoning that we could tell). The super taco was a overloaded. All in all, the tacos weren't bad, but we were very disappointed because of all the high praise. I've had better tacos in the same area.
author: Lauren S.

description: Overrated burrito! Long line, no seating area. The super burrito was small! Chips were hard.
author: Sandy C.

description: Had to try it to see what all the hype was about... the food is good, but not 100% sure that the wait is worth it. It has also become such a touristy place that I think it might have lost the original charm.  I would .... go find another place in the same area.
author: Frank C.

description: The food is decent. I am just visiting but we heard so many great things about the restaurant we figured we had to try it. First off it's cash only (not a big deal b/c there is an ATM inside, but really who carries cash anymore). The menu was kind of hard to understand I ordered a regular taco with beef and my boyfriend ordered a super taco with carnitas and we also got chips n salsa. It was like $14 which we didn't care about but either we got two regular tacos or two super cause they were the same size. Really just a taco nothing extraordinary! Also the chips come in a paper boat with salsa all poured on top, again not a huge deal but it makes the chips soggy since they are underneath the salsa. This place to me is not worth the hype!
author: Jazzy W.

description: Ordered a super burrito but my burrito only had steak and pico de gallo. Was charged extra to fix and add what was suppose to be in a super burrito. So in total I paid $15 for a super burrito, and the meat tasted like it had been sitting on the grill for a while.
author: Bonnie S.

description: The best chicken burrito and beef tacos I have tasted anywhere, ever.  Highly recommended!!!
author: Jim B.

description: Yummy tacos as big as my head. Daughter says burritos are the best. Friendly folks, quick and easy service. Bring cash. No cc's!
author: Renee F.

description: As a Mexican, this place did not impress me at all....the salsa was blah, I paid an additional 1.?? for avocado in my tacos and burrito and got it in one taco!! I ordered to go so eating it while angry didn't help much....over rated and overpriced! Try Garaje on 3rd street, the Cadillac taco kills!!!!! :)
author: Me D.

description: Nothing special here.. I got the chicken super burrito . the chicken breast was dry, the pico was decent but for almost 10 dollars I expected a decent size burrito. This one reminded me of taco bell (  I would've enjoyed taco bell more). I won't be coming back.
author: Heather S.

description:
Dangit, La Taqueria.  "I wish I could quit you."  I'd probably have a down payment on a house...

The prices are criminal, true.  Then again, so are the ginormous portions, so we'll just call it even (that one crispy "everything" taco you'll enjoy is the size of three at neighboring competitors who simply don't stack up in the taste department).

So don't hate, folks. No one offers better Mexican fare in the entire city, and we all know it.  Accept the cost and proceed to the counter with your college fund.
author: Brendan S.

description: I have to admit the Tacos here are plenty good.  I stopped by there for the first time in maybe 3 or 4 years and it still has a constant line out the door.  That pretty much says it all.  Good food at Great prices.  Not much on ambiance but the service is fast and friendly.
author: Lisa M.

description: The best carne asada tacos with everything and burritos in SF long lines every time though!
author: Mel R.

description: The sign says "The best tacos and burritos in the whole world." That's a big statement to live up to and difficult to verify but I will confirm that they are among the best, if not the best, damn tacos in Northern Cali. I ordered the carne asada tacos and they hit the spot like no other. And that green sauce on the side... delicious. It's actually pretty nuts that El Farolito is right down the street because that place is amazing as well so it's a difficult pick between the two but La Tacqueria surpassed expectations for sure. And if you're from Southern Cali where great taco shops are the norm, this will definitely be your go-to spot when you're in SF.
author: Gordon Z.

description: Everyone that goes here already knows it's great but here goes anyway... We had the Vege Taco and the Dorado-style taco. Fresh and full of flavour with great salsa and beans bringing out the best of the flavors. 11am on a Thursday and the queue was already out the door. Says it all.
author: Chris H.

description: We came to this place waiting to be impressed. The price was good but I have tasted better burritos. I don't know what the hype is all about. They certainly don't have the best burritos in the world, which they cla to be.
author: Annie D.

description: ew & yuck. amazingly disappointing super vegetarian burrito. obviously cheapest ingredients and very slimy/ sloppy. they don't recycle, if they do it's a well-kept secret. an otherwise efficient operation though not worth a return visit
author: Loren B.

description: This place was delicious. Amazing burritos with tender, perfectly cooked carne Asada. Quick and  efficient with the line and crowd. Huge tacos. We loved everything about this place.
author: Madison A.

description: My family and I love La Taqueria so much, especially the carnitas burrito. They do not fill up their burritos with beans and rice so it is by far one of the lightest and juiciest you will ever eat. This place has been voted the best in so many magazines during the last 30 years, and I am not surprised to see this restaurant receiving all these awards. My only constant complaint are that the agua frescas taste always somewhat watered down, and it is cash only, so bring cash or you will need to run to the first ATM nearby.
author: Rodney T.

description:
The Arachera tacos (Steak Tacos) are simply amazing.  The meat is tender, juicy and has all the right seasonings.  They remind me of my child days as we barbecued Carne Asada tacos on the Parilla.  I normally order the steak taco with no beans.  It comes with two tortillas, pico de gallo and you can add some guacamole.  I then follow this up with a fresh strawberry drink.  

These tacos will not disappoint.
author: S C.

description:
I have not stopped thinking about the double taco - la carnita AND carne asada since I tried this place 2 weeks ago. Make sure to get everything on it, all the add-ons with guac, sour cream, the works. 

Looking forward to going back!  Next time I will make sure to just get one taco fully loaded. 

Another delicious, great find.
author: Melody T.

description:
Never again for a lame, small, burrito. I never have exaggerated on reviews, this place was 100% caucasian customers. Overpriced. A super burrito the size of a taco bell "burrito supreme" and a bottled water $10.74???
Never again.
author: Andrew Z.

description: Should be an SF landmark, if not one already.  crispy tacos are the best, burritos very good as well. simply the best taqueria in the mission, which is saying a lot. never met anyone who didn't like the food here.  very crowded all the time, so expect a bit of a wait and shared table seating, so you can make friends too.  on weekends, they have mariachi singers who randomly show up and belt out classics, don't forget to tip them.  in short, la taqueria is the mission.
author: Roy N.

description: Great tacos and service! I ordered two tacos for dinner and saved one for my trip back home. Unfortunately, I dropped one while running to catch the train but I hope a hungry hobo made good use of it. RIP taco...
author: Leslie C.

description: Food is so good! We ate beef burrito and chicken taco, both are so good! We should ordered the super one!
author: Chelsea W.

description: I went here after the earth day festival. Good service, welcoming environment, and TASTY burritos! It was a great experience.
author: Steph L.

description:
I went here on the recommendation of a coworker, even though I usually go to El Farolito. He seemed incredibly enthusiastic about the fact that they don't use rice in their burritos. Now, everyone knows that rice is just a cheap filler material that's high in carbs and calories, but I always figured that it was just a part of life. Sure, you could be the guy who asks for your burrito with no rice, but I'm more of the go-with-the-flow type. Like, the guy at the burrito shop (who makes burritos all day. every day. burrito burrito burrito) probably knows a bit more about burritos than I do. So, until I heard about this place, I didn't even know that the riceless burrito exists. I had to try it out.

It wasn't too long until I had a burrito craving, and then it was time to check this place out. The line wasn't nearly as long as El Farolito - only about two or three people long. I actually got my food surprisingly quickly. And it was a bit on the expensive side ($8-something for what amounted to a super burrito). They even put it in a paper bag when I asked for it "to go" (more on that later).

So, burrito bag in hand, I set off for my three-block journey home. When I was about a block away, the bag gave out, dumping my burrito on the street. Fortunately, the protective foil remained intact, so I figured that the 2 second rule applied (probably not a good idea in The Mission). Although I have to deduct a star or so for the poor bag construction (not really).

As for the food, it was pretty much a standard burrito, sans rice. Nothing really special or magical. I prefer the carne asada elsewhere - this tasted sort of like hamburger. I might eat here again, but there are about ten taquerias on the same block, so I'm inclined to try those out first.

Also, I'm a bit disappointed that very few of the taquerias give out free chips any more, although the chips were always pretty low quality anyways.
author: Dana L.

description:
Not much more I can say about this place that hasn't already been said... they make the best carne asada I've had without a doubt. 
Having said that, it's a pain to go here. It's loud, there's mariachis playing for tips over the crowd noise, and the line extends out of the door. Once you wait in line for 30 minutes or more, seating is hard to come by. Many people eat standing directly outside of the door. This is all due to the fact that they were recently recognized nationally as the "best burrito in America." As far as the burrito, it was awesome. At $9, it's was a little smaller than I'm accustomed to, but that's because they don't put rice in their burritos. I had a carnitas taco as well, which was amazing. 
Obviously this place is very, very, good. For people that dislike crowds and "hype," I'd recommend going down the street. I withstood the crowds and the noise because  I wanted be able to say that I ate here finally. Eat here once, experience the epicness, and then decide for yourself if it's worth going back. If not, there are plenty of other spots close by, that are almost as good, and definitely less of a headache. 

Verdict: Best Mexican food around, although not the place to go if you want to sit down, enjoy your meal, or converse with your company. Docked one star for the craziness and because they don't accept debit or credit. Cash only.
author: Javier M.

description: Mr. WC went there after the dinosaur show with his posse and a Jurassic appetite. " Food was fresh, filling, hearty, and melt in your mouth, and the service was awesome. There's a reason for the long lines and great reviews. Better than anything in Napa". Enough said...
author: Kelly M.

description: Basic ingredients and fresh quality makes an awesome burrito. No fancy experimenting here, but you're guaranteed an excellent solid burrito. And the agua fresca is nice and  pulpy here compared to other places that serve the fruit completely blended. Definitely lives up to the hype.
author: Shamy J.

description: I love this place!  Can't get enough- I know it's been written up about a ton but I just wanted to give my 2 cents worth.  Love the staff - been coming her for years and the food is to die for!  The BEST tacos (dorado style) and burritos ever - I take all visitors here and it's the first place they want to hit up when in town.  I could eat here every day!  I hope all this crazy stuff going on with rents in the city doesn't send this incredible restaurant away -
author: Sandy M.

description: So after being an El Farolito regular since birth, I decided to give the "best burrito in the world" a shot. I don't know who gets to make those titles, but the deserve to be shot in the face. The burrito at BEST, was just ok. Not filling, taste was ok, but worst of all the burrito was TINY. I wolfed it down in 3 bites. In comparison, it can take me a day to finish a burrito from El Farolito, El Faro, hell, even overrated Papalote can fill me up more than this place. If you're looking for an overrated, small, expensive ($10?!) then come on by. But other than that, don't waste your time, try another spot for sure.
author: Warren L.

description: Hands down, best carne asada EVER! Burritos are packed with flavor, you can tell all fresh ingredients are used. The strawberry Aqua fresca is the best I've had too! Quick, friendly service!
author: Shannon K.

description: This is not the best burrito in America. Perfect acceptable, but not the best-- I doubt it's even in the best burrito in the city, certainly not the Bay Area and definitely not in California. I did think their meat was quite good.
author: Courtney M.

description: The line is long but sooo worth the wait. I had the pork burrito and it was okay but what sold me were the chips and salsa! The chips and salsa only cost $1.30 and the fresh salsa was amazing!
author: Laura L.

description:
Ladies and Gentlemen, I have officially found the best Tacos in the Mission. 

How did it take me so long to come here? I got a veggie taco and a carnitas and both  were so good I think I forgot to breathe. 

They wrap them up so they are easier to eat and all the good stuff doesn't come out the other end. I was a little turned off when I had to pay a little more than I was used to for tacos in the Mission but then when I got my order I was delighted to see that they were much bigger and fully packed. Worth every penny. And you could probably be full with just one. 

It's called La Taqueria for a reason; their tacos are the best.
author: Katie D.

description: The tacos and burritos from La Taqueria are the best. There's no rice in the burritos here. Just the good stuff. The carnitas burrito is ridiculously good and the tacos are huge. Get everything extra crispy. Worth the money and the wait.
author: Caroline N.

description: Most authentic Mexican burrito i've had. You can watch them grill the steaks and dice it up. Toppings are amazing and it's always packed. Be careful so much juice and flavor fitting every last morsel can get messy.
author: Jack B.

description:
Mission Burritos are essential. After all, the burrito was popularized in this neighborhood after Central California farm workers invented them. Yes people, are you as shocked as I that the baby Jesus never had him no burritos?

La Taqueria is one of the top 10 stops for a Mission Burrito and they also have some pretty mean tacos and get yourself a side o' beans you won't regret it. 

The food comes out hot and fresh here and the people are nice and it has an "institutiional" feel (in a good way). 

I think the standout is the green salsa which you can buy in a to-go soda cup if you so desire. 

Warning do not drink half of that green salsa cup or your ass will burn ma'friend (and this coming from a guy with an iron stomach and an adamantium-plated sphincter). 

I liked my Carnitas way better than my Carne Asada but I try and eat mostly vegetarian these days so it was pretty painful to come here and see all that fresh, hot, savory meat being chopped up in front of my face. DAMN YOU, CHINA STUDY!

I'm not really capable of deciding which Mission Burrito I liked the best...I like them all..
author: Ryan S.

description: I had two carnitas burritos in two days, dorado style, and they were both far above the usual taqueria fare. The chips are good, and the pico de gallo is good, but when you order chips and salsa, they have an annoying habit of bringing out a basket of chips with a bunch of salsa dumped on top. The chips instantly become soggy, foreclosing any chance at a five-star review. However, this place is worth a visit (and worth a sometimes long wait) anytime you're in San Francisco.
author: Scott B.

description: I mean - it's great. A transformative burrito experience. The line can be long at dinner time but it moves pretty fast and it's worth it.
author: Jason C.

description: Hands down the best carne asada tacos I've ever had. I'd drive all the way from Stockton for 4 tacos they're that good. Just walking through the door the smell of fresh carne asada in the air brings me back 30 years to the first time when I was 8. I order my tacos with their spicy salsa verde and enjoy every bite. They have a bottle of that same spicy salsa verde on the table. Every bite requires more salsa verde and makes you want to eat more especially with a ice cold Modelo. For anyone that's been by this place and never gone in, try it one time. You'll be hooked and you won't regret it. VAMOS LA TAQUERIA¡¡¡
author: P N.

description: I wasn't a burrito person until La Taqueria. I have eaten three of their burritos in the past week, and I still could eat another one. Their carne asada burritos, which have no rice, are juicy and flavorful. I love their spicy green sauce. I have only tried the carne asada with avocado. It is more on the expensive end for a burrito, but I think it's worth it.
author: Lin H.

description:
What I ordered:
1 carne asada taco (with cheese, guacamole, and sour cream)
1 carnitas taco (" ")

What can I say that hasn't already been said by other posters? The meat is savory with every bite, the beans are hearty,  and the other additives complement each other well, balancing spicy and refreshing. The portions are adequate, the prices are reasonable, and the food is served in good time, even on packed days. 

Minor gripes:
I would say that there seems to be lack of a condiment stand (limes, radishes, jalapenos, different variations of salsa, etc.). If there is one, I apologize in advance; I'm very absent-minded from time to time.
They also don't have enchiladas or chimichangas on the menu; I don't think this is an unreasonable expectation as many other Mexican restaurants of similar caliber serve these and other entrees.


Overall, La Taqueria is fantastic, yet simple.
author: Khoa N.

description: I love love love their tongue taco and would fly out from NYC just to have their tongue taco. Garnished with onions, their tongue is tender rich explosion in your mouth. I get guac as extra topping because that's what I like to get, but I highly recommend the tongue over Carne taco.
author: Haruka H.

description: Over-hyped and underwhelming.  My carnitas burrito tasted nothing like pork, and it came with a large piece of tendony chewy meat - terribly gross.  Even the chips and salsa were disappointing:  the chips were thick and hard, and the salsa was bland.  And who serves salsa already on top of the chips???  Who wants soggy chips???
author: T M.

description: Probably the most delicious tacos I've ever had, upsettingly better than any I had when I lived in Texas. A little expensive if you add on the extras (cheese, avacado, sour cream) and cash only, but so worth it.
author: Maria G.

description: This place is so mind blowing I have to eat here at least once a week. What I order is not found on the menu as my spouse - a lifetime fan who grew up in the Mission - orders what I like in Spanish.
