All I can say I this place has me hooked and if it ever disappeared I swear I'd die. I love you La Taqueria!!!
author: Carmen H.

description: Made the effort to go here on the recommendations and was a little underwhelmed  The steak burrito was great but not out of this world.  Maybe a chose incorrectly or was over hyped.  Saying that the steak was perfect and moist and cooked to perfection.
author: Graeme U.

description:
5 stars for the delicious quesadilla. Its very good. Oh, and their tacos are huge and good too.

1 star for the burrito. I seriously dont understand this burrito, but ok.

Basic burrito comes with just meat and beans. Then you add on all the extras (sour cream, salsa, quac. No rice..) and it ends up being a $10 super burrito.. I dont get whats the big deal about this place. When you can get something much bigger and better a block away! For $7 with chips and salsa! 

We paid $10 for each burrito then they want to charge us extra for chips. Um, no.

5 stars for their refreshing beverages. 

average, 2/3 stars!
author: Boops D.

description: Best Burritos & Tacos in AMERICA!! It's no wonder La Taqueria has been winning awards year after year. They are a PREMIUM Taqueria and the Quality is Grade A Their Super Burrito is on another level. Their Tacos are ORGASMIC and leave you feeling a sense of Satisfaction & Serenity . Don't forget to order your Super  Burrito "DORADO" style. The Price is more than fair when considering your paying for Quality over Quantity. If you haven't been here yet, I encourage you to go visit the #1 Taqueria in San Francisco. The lines are long but move very fast, long lines define great business, service & of course great food. If anyone wants to have the Best Burritos & Tacos in America, visit "La Taqueria" the Mecca of all Tacos and Burritos.
author: George R.

description:
What's up with me hitting up "ehhh" places???

I read many reviews about this place for their carnitas taco and when I had it, I was not impressed at all. I ordered the tacos to go. Came home to give it a try only to learn that the carnitas were not that tasty and wet/soggy from all the juices. Definitely expensive for what I experienced.

Doesn't look like I'll be coming back here...
author: Kaycie Y.

description:
Some people move to San Francisco for a new job. Some move here to live among people who perfectly align with their worldview. Me? I moved here for love. The love of a good burrito.

Back in the winter of 2005 I had an offer to transfer to San Francisco for work. I took a weekend to come out here and check it out to decide if this was a place I could really live. After spending the weekend walking around the city and taking in the sights, sounds and new odors, I had a few hours to kill before my flight back to the middle of the country. On the recommendation of a total stranger I grabbed a burrito from La Taqueria and headed over to Dolores Park. After one bite I knew I was home.
author: Mark A.

description:
Summary: Great, slightly more expensive, tacos.

Tried a few tacos, which were great. They were on the pricier side relative to other taquerias ($3.75 each), but the portion of meat inside was definitely greater than most of the other surrounding places.

Interior was clean and functional.

Would come back again.
author: Gary Y.

description: It's the best thing ever. Sucks the lines are so long now. I first went here in 2006 and it blew my mind. It continues to do so. Funny story (MAYBE): they recently changed the indoor signage to TV screens and when I asked for chips, salsa & queso, they claimed they don't do that and they never did. Uh, what? Yeah, yuh did. I used to get it once a week. Doesn't matter because it's the best thing ever and I'll keep going back. I'll keep taking all the used-to-live-here folks that still visit and that's the only place they want to go.
author: Robert S.

description: I went with my son and we both had two soft tacos-two beef for him, a chicken and pork for me. While the tacos themselves weren't expensive, by the time we added avocado and sour cream, the total for four tacos and two drinks was $23. Now, that being said, the tacos were absolutely delicious and the service was fast and efficient. I loved the food--it is just important to be aware the the price can rise quickly with add-ons.
author: Marceline W.

description: I have tried a lot of Mexican places in the city and this place is definitely one of the top 3 so far, if not #1! I tried their chicken taco the first time I came here. I was pretty amazed how tasty it was, and thought it was the best taco I've ever had! This time I had carne asada Buritto and carnitas taco. They were both so so tasty!! The Buritto was probably even better than taco. I will definitely come back here again and again!
author: Cartman P.

description:
Vegetarian Tacos A++++. 
No rice. Just perfect beans, salsa, avocado. Simply the best. 
I crave them so much since moving and I always go to Good Luck Dim Sum and La Taqueria when I am back in town!
author: tallie t.

description:
There's a reason why my dad and I refer to this place as "best tacos". The carne asada is seasoned to perfection. If you're getting tacos I suggest getting the "crispy" tortillas. It's not a hard shell, but a white corn tortilla placed on the grill with cheese and then a soft white corn tortilla place over it. Always add cheese to your taco, and don't forget the guac! 

The burritos are really good too. Essentially the same as the taco but encased in a flour tortilla. However, I prefer the tacos 10/10 times. 

Their green sauce on the tables is really good too. A bit spicy, but it adds a lot to the eating experience.
author: Ryan N.

description:
We dropped by here on Saturday to grab a couple of burritos to go.  There was a line, but it moved quickly.
The burritos were excellent.  I asked for spicy sauce and was surprised that it was really hot.   Next time, I'll ask for a mild sauce!
author: Philip C.

description:
what i ordered... super burrito with carne asada

"IRS" should look at this place first before they hunt 'em tea party folks. The place only accept cash and it was overflowing with hype induced customers.... and they ain't brown colored or have an idea what horchata is.

I admit that year's ago when this place was just a regular taqueria with regular customers their carne asada was the best and priced right. now, they just churn out as much meat as they could out of that grill to satisfy the hoard of customers and stick it to them.

super burrito was ok..... so small compared to a regular mission taqueria, meat was fresh but tasteless and all the filling's were of minimal amount.

ambiance... bad (dirty, for the cost of the food, they should at least have someone cleaning up the tables)
service... bad (rushed and arrogant)
cost... $ (expensive)
author: Gors P.

description: Ordered a vegetarian burrito. Not only were there minimal beans inside and no salsa (despite the guy at the counter asking whether I wanted spicy or mild salsa) but I also found a large piece of meat about a quarter of the way into it. Really disappointing after hearing almost exclusively positive things about this place. With so many other choices within a small area, I would not recommend this place.
author: Vanessa W.

description: Pretty good. Burritos are kinda on the small side to be honest. Farolitos still holds the crown for best burrito in the mission in my opinion.
author: Mario W.

description: when you get your tacos, ask for crispy :)
author: Sherry L.

description: I know this place is supposed to be famous for its meat burritos, but its vegetarian burritos are lacking. Actually one of the worst burritos I've had in San Francisco, and I've had a lot. The sliced cheese was barely melted inside the burrito, and the ratio of rice and beans to guac, sour cream, cheese, and lettuce was way off. I'll stick to El Farolito and Pancho Villa for my burritos, but that's just me as a vegetarian!
author: Jordan M.

description:
Best Mexican in the city hands down! The flavors POW the amount daaamn! and the price is affordable as hell!

Carne Asada tacos with the soft and crispy shell is the way to go.

The other best thing about them is that they don't put rice in their burritos! shut the front door! mmmm all meat and beans without the filler... damn right! I do Carne Asada for this one also and add avocado for that California touch ;-)
author: Ilya Movshovich M.

description: Best tacos around worth the money and the drive. I come from the east bay just to eat here on the pricey side but you are in the city. Non the less probably the best tacos in the world like their logo says.
author: Joel L.

description: Ever since this place got rated for supposedly one of the best burritos in the country, quality and size went  WAY down. Had a supposed "super" chicken the other day. Too much sour cream, very bland, didn't like the salsa. And over 11.00 bucks. I'd recommend La Corneta, Gordo, El Faro, among some much better taco joints and way cheaper.
author: Kay C.

description: The carnitas tacos were well worth the 30 minute wait! Make sure to bring cash with you as its cash only. We will be back!
author: A J.

description:
beans! ICK!

I rarely go out to the mission or this side of town on a friday night, and boy did it feel weird, people were walking and the night life was up and about. parking is a bit difficult but there are parking in the dark neighborhoods, just be safe!

the place was fairly packed, and little did i know that they dont serve rice in the burritos! weird. if you dont want the beans it costs more! even more strange.

so we tried the beans, and I got the beef, bf got the pork, and we got a strawberry and melon fresca drink. yum

the burrito was a good size, not humongous but not tiny. very filling. I didn't mind the beans too much, it was good, made the burrito saucy which was good. bf's pork was okay, a bit strange but still good. the melon drink was yummy, but the strawberry was a bit too thick and sweet.

pretty expensive though....spent like 60$ or more for 4 people...we WERE starving though...but pretty expensive..chips and salsa were not free. but clean though
author: Christine M.

description:
When I walked in on a Wednesday around 7, it was total chaos... Giant line around the restaurant, no place to sit, kids and cooks yelling... This is not a place to go if you want a quiet, chill dinner. But if you want to give the best burrito in the Bay Area a try and don't mind a little wait, I recommend you brave the mission for a taste of their famous carnitas.

About the food: Since I'm allergic to peppers I had to play it safe and ask them to hold the Pico de Gallo. Instead I opted to make my burrito a "super," which is the addition of cheese, guac, and sour cream. The first bite was heavenly. A gooey delicious mess in a perfect tortilla, with the best carnitas I've ever eaten. 

The mango agua fresco was a little sweet for my taste. Just get a beer and indulge yourself, try not to get hit by a Google bus on your way out. 

WARNINGS: If you can find parking nearby, don't leave anything in your car because the streets are paved with glass 'round these parts. And watch your back walking those streets home... If a thug doesn't rob you blind, a hipster on foot may crash into you while staring at their iPhone!
author: Michelle L.

description: Love this place. I got two tacos -- one beef and one pork. Both were "cheesy crunchy" (hard taco inside a soft taco lined with cheese). The beef was good but the pork was definitely the stand out. Beware of the hot sauce -- it's spicy! The only issue is seating. Definitely survival of the fittest going on here. There is a decent amount of seating but it's close together and the place is already packed. Still five stars because the food is that good. Super simple super good.
author: Grace G.

description: I feel like i had an off experience at la taqueria. I loved how they melted a piece of cheese into the tortilla, but i did miss the rice in the burrito, typically my favorite part. However, i did like the flavor of the carne asada. I felt like if there was rice, then the burrito wouldn't be so drippy. I could basically drink the burrito, from all the bean juices. I ended up needing a bowl to finish the burrito. Not cool. But still a burrito that tasted amazing.
author: Joanna C.

description: This place is super packed for a reason. I had a hard taco de carnitas with the soft tortilla on the outside and it was BOMB! The burrito was good very flavorful. The burritos aren't too big but they are tasty and make sure you get the tortilla grilled a bit more because it gets kinda soggy. Can't wait to go back again
author: Mel G.

description: Terrible health rating.  I choked down some food because I was with people but I won't go back.  It's the only place I've seen with a health evaluation in the 70s.  Yuck!!!!
author: Amy M.

description:
The best burrito place in the bay area by far, this place is truly amazing.

I have had plenty of burritos in my lifetime, this place by far tops them all. I had the carne asada burrito and it was amazing, very fresh ingredients,  you could smell and taste all the distinctive components. I've tried el forolito thats also on mission, but this place by far stomps el forolito. You could not go wrong with this place, amazing food, everything looked clean and fresh. The complimentary chips and salsa was very very good, freshly made tortilla chips and the salsa was very flavorful.

Try the carne asada burrito, you cant go wrong with it, i guarantee it. The tacos looked very good too and i'll be sure to try them next time I hit SF.

Pros: excellent burritos, very fresh and tasty. great prices, good burrito options.

Cons: parking could be challenging on mission, try to park ahead of the place. seating is kind of awkward, no chairs just benches, refer to photos to get an idea. The burriots are a bit small, but the quality is the best.
author: Mahmoud E.

description:
Alright all of you San Franciscans looking for your mexi-fix...Let me put an end to the age old question, "Who has the best tacos in the mission?" This place is my favorite taco joint in the mission bar none. 

I expected to find this place OKAY at best. On the contrary, the carnitas tacos were knock your socks off good. Be sure to get them EXTRA CRISPY (for those who have had it before, this is a lot like 'Nick's Way' from Nick's Crispy where they use two shells separated by a layer of cheese and the inner shell is deep fried to add a crispy crunch). The carnitas are a no brainer win in my book (and I'm usually a carne asada girl when it comes to my burritos) but the carne asada has a good smokey flavor to it and is still delicious.

Basically, if you think you have tried all there is worth trying in the Mission but you haven't been here....go. Its a bit on the more expensive side, but hey this is San Francisco. Worth the showcase on the SF 7x7 list, and definitely on my top list as well... May have a generic name, but not a forgettable generic taqueria.


PS Try the Agua Frescas, you will not be disappointed! The perfect sweet to compliment the savory....
author: Samantha R.

description: This is my FAVORITE taqueria in town! I craved this frequently during both my pregnancies. I am Mexican, and it is as close as it gets to taste like home. I love the salsa and the carnitas are very well prepared. I just wish they delivered! We would eat from here more often if they did!
author: Alejandra C.

description: fast moving if there's a line don't worry, you will be eating some of the freshest and best tasting taqueria food in SF. Recommendations include everything on the menu!
author: James P.

description:
I was so disappointed by La Taqueria's burrito. For starters, they don't even have a super burrito on the menu. Nothing stood out from the carne asada burrito I had. The only above par ingredient was the carne asada itself, but nothing else  impressed me. The rice, beans, and salsa were average / a little bit dull in flavor and failed to compliment each other well.  I think this place can fall under the more "authentic" Mexican joints in the Mission because the menu is straight to the point and simplistic. If you are looking for something mouth watering and bursting with flavor - head down the street a couple blocks to El Farolito. 

Note: do not order the chicken. It is watery and bland. 

I would come back to try their tacos.
author: Brian L.

description: Great place for inexpensive Mexican food the lines can be long but they move really fast
author: John C.

description:
Definitely doesn't deserve the title of being the best. I'd say the food tastes above average at best. The price per portion is terrible, I've never ate a super burrito and not felt full until now. This place is expensive too BTW.

Also, the parking sucks, a lot of metered parking and it's hard to find any at all.
author: Killua Z.

description: I haven't yelped in forever, not sure what compelled me to for this place other than disappointment. This is the most expensive and underwhelming burrito I have had in....a really really long time. I had the carnitas super burrito. Size wise was petite as far as a California burrito goes but that's ok because if it tastes amazing then size doesn't matter. But it didn't. It really was kinda fast foodish. I looked around at the clientele and was like ahhhhh ok - no Mexican people actually eat here and my guess is these are all tech transplants. Which I guess by their east coast Mexican standards this place is probably good. Mission used to be THE PLACE for Mexican food but now, honestly, I think you're better off heading south to San Mateo or further. Their chips were good, the restaurant was clean, their tv menu was convenient for sure. But I go to a taqueria for food and I tell you this sure was a let down.
author: Katie P.

description:
Though I've lived just a stone's throw away from this much-lauded taqueria for a year and half, I haven't paid them a visit... Maybe because I'm also near Mexicatessen, La Palma, which has stolen my heart. 

Anyway, La Taqueria certainly lived up to the hype. My partner in crime and I decided to create our own flight of tacos, so we ordered the carnitas, beef tongue, carne asada, pollo, and veggie. All the meaty ones where amazing - though the bean and cheese vegetarian option was a tad bland. And who knew tongue was so tasty? The carne asada, however, was my favorite. It's smokey, tender, delicious. 

Word to the wise: their green hot sauce is, like, five-alarm hot. If you're sensitive, you might not want to try it. For those like me who like to walk on the edge of first-degree tongue burns on a regular basis, it's dreamy.
author: Christina S.

description:
So what did I do after twenty six hours of flying from Australia (hooray for stuck doors and missed connections!)? Got me some tongue, that's what!  

Had a cow tongue burrito with guac and cheese, oh yeah - I definitely got some tongue loving. The tongue was tender (hey - aren't they all?) and the burrito filled with just enough fillings so it didn't explode whilst eating. 

Top it off with a cantaloupe (rockmelon for all you NSW and QLD based Australians) agua fresca and the result was a very satisfied moi after a well travelled tongue lashing.

I'd do it again.
author: Ben L.

description:
Good, but not up to the hype. Since my breakup with El Farolito over their declining quality, I've been looking for the best place in the Mission. This ain't it. Cancun remains a strong contender.

Food: 4 stars. Fresh-tasting guacamole and really good salsa verde. Both the steak and the chicken are moist and flavorful. They distribute the ingredients well, making every bite perfect. Still, other places have tastier ingredients (Cancun) or better salsa selections (Pancho Villa, La Cumbre).

Value: 2 stars. The burritos are a little more expensive than at other Mission joints, and significantly smaller. I love that they don't load them up with rice (I'm looking at you, El Farolito), but a $10 burrito better by God fill me up.

Ambiance: 2 stars. Too crowded, with nowhere comfortable to stand while waiting for a take-out order. Bad feng-shui between the line and the door. But I did hear a mariachi band here last night! So that was cool.
author: Mike B.

description: The tacos here is where its at...the soft crispy thing is what sets it apart..the carne asada was very well made and flavored...buuuut if you dont want a headache from a horribly structured order/pickup process dont even attempt during high peak hours which may be most of the time...people vulture for a table even if they are by themselves with a burrito...and you have to walk through the line in order to pick up your food...its crazy...its like people literally lose their minds trying to get to there damn tacos..so surprised people are not getting beat up/shot here weekly...the food is good but not worth me trying to do that again...just some insight ive been here a handful of times and its like this everytime...but do you booboo
author: Leonard C.

description: The crispy taco here is pretty yum. I got the carintas tacos and thoroughly enjoyed it. I also got a carne asada quesadilla, which was really good too, but a bit pricey for my taste. While the size of the quesadilla was pretty big, it wasn't worth $7+ to me after adding on avocado. Their strawberry agua fresca was also very refreshing. I'd go back if in the area.
author: Becky C.

description:
My friend took me here saying that he was told it was the best Mexican food in the Mission. Which I would assume is quite an achievement since there is so much Mexican in the Mission Area of San Francisco.

Thus, he chose this for his birthday lunch.

5 stars to this place because it tasted similar to the Mexican food I ate growing up (I'm adopted into a Mexican family). Also the service being a busy place was good (staff even made suggestions), and a nice open atmosphere.

What won me over how crisp the tortillas were! I got a quesadilla which had the right amount of ingredients in it, the right amount and blend of cheese, and the meat was juicy and tender. 

My friend consumed his burrito rather quickly because he said it was absolutely delicious, and we shared an order of chips and salsa. Which surprisingly I ate since I don't eat any other salsa besides my Aunt Maria's homemade. Yummy!
author: Lara E.

description:
This is my favorite taqueria in the mission. Portions are relatively small, ingredients limited and salsa is green or nonexistent, but somehow this adds up to burritos that make my mouth water just thinking about them. 

Carne asada is the best option here, and make sure to add cheese. Amazing salsa is on most tables and will make you weep for the swill you have to use elsewhere. Veggie burritos are good, but I left my heart with the carne asada. 

Only downside is they closer up relatively early so you will experience heartbreak one night and have to resign yourself to the crowds at el farolito.
author: Scott T.

description:
This is one of my all time favorite taqueria's. I love the way the burritos are made with NO  rice and it develops a nice juicy taste. 

The house hot sauce is great. One of my favorite attributes of the restaurant for sure. The only thing I don't like is how it's gotten soooo pricey since my first time going 13 years ago. 

I am also not a big fan of the non native hipsters that crowd this location every single day. (Find another taqueria boys SF HAS A WHOLE BUNCH OF MEXICAN FOOD). I came here trying to get a burrito the other day. Jesus Christ, I had never seen a line so long.

Food is great!!! The wait....  Makes it not worth it. 

You gotta find a new system La Taqueria, either open up a new restaurant or find a new system to accommodate all your customers. There is no way I should have to wait over an hour for some take out. The service is my only complaint.

FOOD IS GREAT
author: Tough C.

description:
Yum Yum!

I finally made it over here after telling myself for many moons that I need to head over there.

This place reminds me of some places in Mexico in terms of serving fresh food, prepared simply and cooked well.  The menu is simple - tacos, burritos and quesadillas with a choice of meat.  That's it.  

I ordered one carnitas taco with avocado and one pollo taco.  Both came with pinto beans, fresh salsa, onions and cilantro.  My friend and I split some chips and salsa.  Spicy salsa and plenty of napkins are available at each table - you'll need both.  The tacos, on their own, were fine - fresh, tasty and full of flavor, but the addition of that salsa just pushed it to another level.  Yum!   The chips were thick and crispy.  The fresh salsa that came with the chips was a bit on the bland side for my taste, but a few dribbles of the hot salsa made everything just right.  I washed all of this down with sips of their Jamaica agua fresca.   The only downside was that the tacos were a tad watery.

The staff does a great job of making sure that tables are cleaned and turned over quickly and making sure that everyone's order is taken quickly.  The seating area can get filled up quickly.  We were there at 7 pm on a Sunday night and the place was packed.  People didn't seem to linger much so the wait for a seat was pretty short.

Definitely check this pace out, if you are in the neighborhood or not.  Yup, it's worth making a trip for their carnitas.
author: Melissa L.

description: Most of the places around here are equally good to me. I've been here quite a few times and love the burritos.  Definitely recommend trying it out.
author: Nirea S.

description:
Best mexican food in SF. They are fast and friendly and the food is authentic.  The pork is well seasoned and marinated.  The pico de gallo which comes free with any meal is fresh and spicy.  I suggest pork or cabeza.  Yum.  


 The only reason I don't give five stars is that they had a negative inspection from the department of health.  I have never gotten sick and I have eaten here so many times, but apparently they weren't storing food at the appropriate temperatures.  (ie raw pork and beef at room temperature next to the grill instead of fridge and frozen meat being thawed improperly).  When I visited, I did not see the food out near the grill as the inspection said it had been, so I believe they have fixed these issues as required.
author: D M.

description: La Taqueria (LT) is the beneficiary of a study that caused people to scurry into  the Mission location to buy their mediocre burritos (MBs). I bought two 9/12. Instead of meaty mighty meaty, they were beanie, beanie. I asked for black beans instead of pinto beans, and I was told that that was not an option. Additionally, the salsa and chips were no match for one restaurant also located in the Mission, and black beans is an option available at many Mission Mexican restaurants. LT's was not fire grilled, instead it was wet as it appeared to be boiled.
author: larry h.

description:
You know a place is good when its 74deg in SF in early Feb and the place is packed with no AC. And they got they're system down. A waitress goes down the line and takes your order and writes it all down so you only have to give the slip to the Super Cheery cashier.

We tried:

Vegi Soft Taco
Pork Soft Taco
Beef Tongue Soft Taco

($3.50 ea + $ for extra toppings)

It came out expensive, only becuase I said yes to "everything on the tacos" not knowing that would include ALL the extra toppings (sour cream, avocado, etc). But it was VERY good and I love big-stuffed tacos, so I didn't mind the extra cost. 

I really liked that they adjust the salsa and toppings to fit each type of taco. 

CASH ONLY! ( they conveniently have a ATM machine inside)
author: Radha X.

description:
I've been on a taco binge over the last month and I was due for a trip to San Francisco, so I said, "Why not?" try La Taqueria.

I decided to have two tacos: a chicken taco and a carne asada taco.  I also added a small jugo (or agua) de piña.  

Each taco came with beans in it, which I thought was unusual, but tasted great.  They were topped-off with pico de gallo.  I ordered these two tacos with cheese.  The two tacos and the small drink came out to just over $11.  

I don't really like spicy (HOT) food, but I decided to try the green salsa at the table.  At first, it felt really hot, but I kept adding a bit to each bite of my tacos and it seemed to do the trick for me.  I enjoyed it.

The place was crowded when I walked in, at 1pm, but a waitress/worker took my order while waiting in line.  I then paid and I received my food within 5 minutes. 

The restaurant has about 10 tables.  A few are picnic style so you can immediately meet new people while eating.  Really cool. 

That was my first visit.

I had a craving for tacos the next day and decided to go back.  This time, I ordered a carnitas (pork) taco and another carne asada taco, this time without cheese.  I used even more of the spicy green salsa!  Awesome. I almost wanted my own bottle to take home.

The carnitas tacos reminded me of the lechon asado (roast pork) I eat every time I visit my family in Puerto Rico.  Pork is our staple.

If I am ever back in San Francisco, I am definitely going back to La Taqueria for some more grub!!!
author: Brian B.

description:
I don't know if I'll ever order anything aside from the tacos dorados. A side of chips and salsa, maybe. The crispy outer shell really sets this taco apart and makes me want to never order a Double Decker taco ever again. The grilled meat is fresh and aplenty. For first-timers, I highly recommend the carne asada and carnitas. Do add avocado. Two tacos will be plenty, even for the ravenous sort.

After adding avocado and cheese, two tacos will set you back $10, but I guarantee it will be more satisfying than 5 Cool Ranch tacos or other lesser substitute. If I had to choose once place to get my Mexican fix in SF, it would be a close call between here and its close neighbor, El Farolito. But with the golden glories fresh in my mind, I think the victory goes to La Taq.
author: Daniel N.

description:
THE BEST CARNITAS BURRITO IN THE WORLD.

Plus the guy who works the front is hilarious. Worth the wait, every time.
author: Kate W.

description: Solid taqueria. Fresh Fresh salsa and solid carne asada.
author: A L.

description:
Greatest quesadilla ever?  

Went to La Taqueria after hearing it was the place to satisfy all your Mexican food desires.  I wasn't extremely hungry so I went for the quesadilla.  It was amazing.  I'll definitely be going back.
author: Matt H.

description: Visiting from Boston - friends recommended.  Carnitas burrito el Dorado style.  Does not disappoint.
author: Joe T.

description: Someone I met in Monterey recommended this place, so we went there on 9th September.  The flavour was OK, but it was wet and the portion was very small.  I really don't like soggy Burritos.  They won't give you chips and there was no rice.  It was not a good value for money.  I think we would stick with Pancho Villa.
author: Chris K.

description:
Really tasty home-style Mex food.  The guac and salsa are incredibly fresh -- we have no idea how they can make such huge quantities of the stuff at the rate that folks are eating it! 

My veg partner in crime suggested his burrito wasn't as amazing - he said there was nothing really in it in terms of a main substance (usually grilled veggies or tofu or something), so probably not best burrito in town for a vegetarian.  But my carne asada was delicious and I enjoyed every bite - especially with the amazing hot sauce I added to every bite!

The place is no frills, you order up front, and service is fast.  The meal was also plenty cheap.  Definitely worth our going out of the way for!
author: Joan H.

description:
I wasn't that impressed my first time here a few months ago. Then again I was getting over a horrible cold and couldn't smell or taste anything. Deciding to give this place another try I stopped in for a veggie taco and was blown away.

The ingredients were so fresh especially the avocado. And I love how they double layer their soft tacos.
author: Priscilla M.

description: Insane line but moved pretty fast. Ordered the carnitas burrito but unfortunately got chicken. That being said, the burrito was much lighter than other burritos (no rice as filler), the avocado tasted fresh as did the tortilla. I'd love to try the burrito grilled and saw some tacos dorado walk out the door that looked drool worthy. Definitely worth checking out again.
author: A M.

description: I've traveled over an hour by bus and BART to get the carne asada burrito. Twice.
author: Barry B.

description: For the hype and relative quality of taquerias in the area, this place was a pretty big letdown. The tacos were subpar and the wait was super long even late on a weekday. Would recommend 3-4 places in the area over this that are cheaper and better.
author: Kyle K.

description: The best burrito I've ever eaten, and it's not even close. Make sure to order it "dorado" style if you want it to be extra good.  The place is really crowded, but the line moves fast. It sometimes is hard to grab a seat though because it's so popular.
author: Jesse W.

description: delicious burritos.
author: Sasha B.

description:
Que occurió, la taqueria?

This used to be a pretty good taqueria- in the past they would give you nice thick slices of beef in the arne asada burrito, and the avocado was likewise thick and sliced and juicy. 

I went the other day and got a carne asada burrito- what a turn for the worse!  The burrito was tiny and prices went way up.  Instead of thick slices of steak it was your mediocre carne asada.  No more thick slices of avocado either.  Just your average guacamole, no better than what you'd find at your typical grocery store.  The burrito was so soggy the liquid has soaked through the tortilla and then soaked the bag.  What a mess.  

And to top it all off with some irony, they've now installed tv monitors where you can view their reviews on screen while you wait in a ridiculously long line of white people.  Save yourself a couple dollars, walk a few blocks, and get yourself some worthwhile food.
author: Lia S.

description: Not blown away. I'm not sure why everyone likes this place so much. Smallish, sloppy, not very flavorful burritos.
author: Patrick S.

description: I have to say, the burritos here are really really good. I look forward to trying tacos too.
author: Will D.

description: Love this place!!! The food is amazing and for the amount of people that they get, they make your food so fast. This is the only place I am ok waiting in line for to get their food. My hands down favorite is their super burrito, it's the perfect amount of size and taste! Anytime someone is asking for a place to eat in San Francisco I always tell them to come here.
author: Maryann B.

description: Get the lengua and cabeza with cheese, guac and pico!
author: Renel S.

description: The food is shitty. So shitty, it will make you feel shitty. I was very saddened to eat here and be so disappointed. Why do you call yourself THE taqueria if you're so lame?!!!! Life is just not fair.
author: Gladys M.

description: Just had a chicken taco from La Taqueria- the best I've ever had!   I will go out of my way for one- I tend to have that urge at least once a week!
author: Eric R.

description: Mexican food, when done right, is my favorite food. Needless to say, I'm very particular about everything from the taste, technique and presentation of the dish I'm eating. Nothing spoils a good burrito when it's not layered properly eg too much rice or not enough guacamole or meat. After eating at my fair share of taquerias, I can honestly say La taqueria has to take the cake. There flavors are spot on, well balanced with the perfect amount of flavor and juiciness. The tacos in particular are a slam dunk. The only downside to eating here is the realization that you've just hit a plateau on how good Mexican food can taste.
author: Eric B.

description: Small in many ways, packed like China shop. Don't get the pork. This place game me diabetes.
author: The U.

description:
I came to this place mid-afternoon, and the place was still packed. It's a little difficult to find seats, so you should be willing to share the long benches with others who come to dine. The line is quite long, but it's always moving - and let me tell you! It's WORTH the wait.
 
I got my steak burrito with cheese, guac, sour cream and you can bet it's a party in your mouth! At first I wondered why rice wasn't part of the burrito, now I know. It's not necessary. The steak was not tough at all, the burrito itself was juicy and the flavors were just superb - definitely THE best burritos I have EVER had!
author: Angela L.

description:
A certain yelper indulged my cravings for a certain taco on a certain list that I'm absolutely certain I'll finish within the next 6 months if I keep going at it with lightning speed. 

Karen Y. is a delight to be with.  She is also lucky to live in the Mish.  Not only is it a certified foodie neighborhood, it's where the cheap eats are too!

Although one might be aghast in handing over $3.50 for a small carnitas taco with only beans and salsa, I couldn't have my taco without guac.  It's another dollar or so extra, but what the heck. It came with such a friendly smile that welcomed me as if I've been there a hundred times over, I didn't mind the extra charges at all.  

Oh yes. The list I'm obsessed about. 7 x 7 Magazine's Big Eats SF list. 

#3 carnitas taco at La Taqueria

I savored my taco slowly. (I was really trying to keep it from dripping all over myself)  I let the juicy shredded pork roll over my tongue.  It was wrapped in a warm tortilla with fresh salsa, hearty beans and creamy guac, plus a dash of green salsa, my taco experience here was complete.  

Of course, Karen and I came hungry.  I went back in line (which have grown exponentially in the first 15 mins we were there) to get our chips and salsa.  Normally, the chips and salsa cost about $1.60, but the generous man behind the counter only charged me $1.  Wow.  

We were enjoying our thick, crispy chips doused in tasty salsa, when Mr. friendly cashier handed us a freebie.  A crispy taco filled with chorizo, guac and cheese.  Ole!  such greasy goodness.  Muchas gracias Miguel.  You totally made our day. 

You think I'd be back?  

Most certainly!
author: Janice C.

description:
Today was a triple 5 star dining day. La Taqueria is the crown jewel of the taqueria scene in the MIssion. The carnitas taco on that perfectly crisped shell, with melted white cheese and smooth fresh guac is why we are touted as having America's best Mex. Love!
Beware, it's packed.
author: Andrew K.

description: In 1974, at age 25, I was working for the Southern Pacific Railroad in San Francisco.  A friend suggested we eat at La Taqueria.  I really liked it then, but I didn't realize at the time how unique and special it was.  A few years later, I moved to the east bay where I still live.  There are no restaurants in the east bay that I know of that serve tacos and burritos like they are at La Taqueria.  So I now commute to the city on Sunday mornings at 11 am, when they open the doors, to get my weekly "taco or burrito FIX" (the wait line is shorter then).  The bridge fare alone is $5, not to mention the cost in gas and time (two hours, round-trip).  It seems I just can't live without them.  But be forewarned!  I think their food is possibly addictive.  A lot has changed since 1974; the railroad no longer exists in San Francisco.  There's a ball park where the railroad used to be; pesky ball park!  But the (food) hits just keep on coming at La Taqueria.  I especially like how they don't fill the burritos predominantly with rice and beans.  Instead, they are very generous with their tasty GRILLED meats and delicious salsas (ok, a few beans).  Leave the rice to the purvue of the Chinese (and other Mexican) restaurants!  I'm clearly a "meat" kind of guy!  I hope they never change their food and never close their restaurant.  I'm 67 years old now and I fully intend to eat here until I can't get here any more....hopefully another 40 years.  With BART nearby, that should be "no problemo!"  Hasta la Vista, Baby!
author: Bruce D.

description:
Told you guys I was coming back here soon. haha Met up with Janice C. for lunch today and it was a wonderful experience! We beat the crowd by getting there around noon...we ordered quickly, paid, and found a table. Of course we both ordered the carnitas taco (off the SF Big Eats list).

carnitas taco ($3.50) - OMG! This was delicious...the pork meat was so juicy and flavorful! Unlike the lengua taco I had last time, this one also contained beans and salsa so it was kinda like a mini burrito without the rice. Knowing me, it got kinda messy but nothing a fork couldn't fix. After eating here again, $3.50 really isn't bad for a taco of that proportion. Once again, the green salsa made everything taste better!

We made a new friend named Jose or Miguel? lol He hooked it up with $1 chips (very crunchy and of course I doused it in green salsa too) and a free sampling of what seemed like a crispy quesadilla with cheese, guac, and either ground beef or chorizo. It was greasy and dripped with oil but so yummy and full of spices! The company, food, and service makes for a 5 star review!
author: Karen Y.

description: What more can is say than over 1800+ reviews. Awesome burrito! However, it gets busy so seating accommodations are next to none. Get it to go! CASH ONLY.
author: Justin F.

description:
best, most balanced burrito in town.  if you like rice, black beans, lettuce, blah, blah... go elsewhere.  This is simplicity and can't be improved on.

Carnitas with cheese and avocado.  ask for it 'seco' (dry) if you don't want to make a mess.  Eat in house and add lots of green sauce from the bottle on the table as you go.

Tacos rock too.  Try 'Dorado' for a crispier crunch!
author: Josh K.

description: Love the tacos did a hard shell with soft wrapped.  Get the works cheese, guac, etc.  my favorite was the carnitas.  A bit pricey for tacos but u are in the city.  Worth it
author: Alex A.

description: This is part of my Childhood - growing up in SF Comfort Food.... Simply the Best & my Most Favorite Mexican Restaurant. My fav: Flour Quesadilla w/ Carne Asada & Lengua or Tacos w/ everything!!! This is also my most recommended Mexican Joint!!! Love You Mike - Miguel: Owner
author: April M.

description: There are a lot of burrito joints in the mission. LA Taqueria's motto is "The best tacos and burritos in the workd"...a little presumptuous perhaps...but close to the truth!  For me at least. Love it!
author: Jamie M.

description:
This place is a solid taqueria. I had the tacos that are crispy on the inside and soft on the outside kind of like a gordita crunch from taco bell. The taco was delisch. The carne asada was good, not great, and the carnitas i had were sub par. I like my carnitas more crunch and i would like to say the majority of carnitas lovers like them crispy also. Overall I would give this place a 3.5, would go back if i was in the area.  

**Cash Only! Big no no also.
author: Shivdeep S.

description: Easily the best burrito you can get in Norcal, legitimate contender to be the best burrito you can get on the west coast. They have a location in Alameda as well that's just as good. The tortilla is soft, proportions are spot on, their carnitas are hands-down the best I've ever had. Whenever my family or I go here, we bring a cup of the green salsa home with us as well because it's so good. Gotta go if you're looking for Mexican food in SF.
author: Micah S.

description: We tried the Carnitas Burrito. It was very tasty. Portion size was nice for 9 dollars. I wish there was just a little more of everything basically, especially meat. They call this the super burrito which could be a little deceiving. Guacamole and meet were fresh and delicious. I will say that if I didn't have the green salsa on my table in handy squirt bootle to deliver to each bite I would have probably given it a three. Tortilla was especially nice. We will return.
author: Joe M.

description: If you are in the mission area, do your hunger a favor and eat something that is to-die-for. Probably the best burrito you will EVER taste. Enough said. Wait is pretty long, but you can stare at their decor in the meantime/ check facebook on your phone. TOTALLY RECOMMEND!!!
author: Ellie A.

description: I just tried this place recently, upon my roommate's raving about it and I must say it was delicious! I had their carne asada super burrito. I'm not giving it five stars for a couple of reasons. Namely, the burrito was missing what I consider an essential ingredient, up there with the meat and beans - rice. It had no rice! No rice in a burrito? What?? The burrito is also small, especially when compared to others. It pales i comparison to its close neighbor, El Farolito's super burrito. Nonetheless, it's quite tasty, quality of the food is great and the chili verde sauce is sooooo good! Yep, the line stinks. Very true. But they move it along efficiently.
author: J A.

description: First stop when arriving in SF.  Very good burrito, hit the spot for the Cali style burrito I've been wanting.  It was very fresh, big, and tasty.
author: Greg O.

description: Now this is hot! If I  could live in the mission, I'll live close by my 2nd home in the city. Salsa bars, long lines, for fresh, quality , authentic food. I have to say in all my years of visiting mexican restaurant, I have never seen security in a establishment and directing the line.
author: Tianna W.

description:
We took a BART Taqueria trip yesterday to the Mission to get some tacos and burrito fix for the weekend. Our first time to La Taqueria. It was busy but not overcrowded and we ordered after a 5 minute wait in line. The place was clean, colorful and staffed by friendly cooks and staff.
The food... Pretty damn good Carnitas. I am an expert on Carnitas. I worship at the altar of Carnitas. I eat salad with Carnitas on top. My Carnitas burrito was nice, flavorful and just enough lard to give it flavor but not too much to stop your heart. Homer Simpson would approve.
The wifey had the vege taco and a carnitas taco and loved both of them.
We're going to work our way down Mission and eat at all the Taquerias one at a time.Yay!
author: William K.

description: This is my favorite place for Tacos in the mission.  The carne asasa tacos with cheese topped and verde sauce are so good, I sometimes find my self day dreaming about my future encounter with them.  Super tasty and tenderly marinated beef, beans, and their fresh salsa helps perfectly balance these tasty tacos.  Highly recommended!
author: Josh A.

description:
Thats right dammit.... Two Stars! Count em.. count em good hard and long. I have my reasons. Mainly Being the price. It is a wallet crippler. getting 15 dollars worth of food in San Diego would be 30 or nearly 40 dollars at this place. We didn't even realise it at first. all we ordered was 2 tacos and two burritos. Thats it. Nothing special. But DAMN!  The place is merciless. The older lady working the register gave us back the wrong amount of change too like it was operating as some kind of shady Chinatown eatery. When we confronted her about it it took her 15 minutes of what i could only assume was trying to figure out how to work a calculator because she gave up trying to use the beads on her rosary as an abbacus. why did it take so long? was she hoping we would just leave so she could pocket our money? it's not like it was coin change either. it was solid cash! 

The food itself wasn't bad. I have actually never had food like this. The chorizo wasn't chorizo at all. All they did was take carne asada (steak to you SF rice eaters) and put it in chorizo seasoning. The joint wasn't even pork! I don't know if they ran out and were to skirt to tell me or that's just how they do it this far north.. The taco was the most interesting... They deep fry the first tortilla and then put a normal one over it.  I had never had anything like it before. It wasn't bad. The seasoning on the meat was bland.. just salt and pepper it tasted like.. I mean damn..... . add some Adobo or somethin!
It wasn't bad food. The service just sucked. On top of that The prices are outrageous.. maybe if it was next to the Jr. College sized middle school in the Marina, or somewhere out in North Beach.. Or even possibly located in the fairy building.. But not in the Heart of the mission.. Even for SF prices (which is a load), this was too much. I wouldn't be able to do it again.. 

On the plus there are no rice in the burritos. but they are bland. 2 stars..  
If the prices were lowered.. I'd give it 3.. If the food tasted mexican I'd give it 4.. If the service was good who knows.. The best thing about it is They make palatable food that gets you full.
author: Vinny T.

description: I've been to La Taqueria a few times since hearing about them after their win for best burrito on FiveThirtyEight. I was worried the hype would oversell the burrito. It did not. These burritos are fantastic, one of my absolute favorites. The carnitas and chicken are delicious and juicy, and the ingredients are fresh. There's a great distribution of flavor in every bite. Make sure you order your burrito DORADO; the crispy, golden tortilla makes all the difference.
author: Cade W.

description:
3 stars because their burritos are super weak... $6.75 for beans, meat, pico & flour tortilla rolled up?? Really!! Everything else is extra because they don't have a super burrito.  $1.20 for avocado, .50cents for cheese, $1.20 for sour cream.  Paid $10 for the skinny thing!! Ridicules.  
Now the tacos on the other hand are delish buy still over priced as well.  Would only come back for the tacos.
author: Drea B.

description: Came here to eat after work and I decided to try this place.  They had a band playing inside.  I ordered the chicken taco.  They came out really fast.  I had ordered 2 tacos because all the other taquerias that I have been to gave me really tiny ones.  This place gives you a pretty good amount of taco.  So 2 is enough if you are a lady.  It was very tasty and fresh and the price point was not bad at all.  Under $10 if I remember correctly.  Made a pretty lean mean because all it had was grilled chicken, salsa.  I put that green sauce they had by the table and it tasted even better.  Gotta try this place out one time if you are in the area.  I hope you don't drive in this area because parking is not so good.  But it is in the city, what else is new right?
author: Alice T.

description:
1. Bring cash
2. Order your burrito 'crispy'  which is briefly tossed on the grill.
3. Mix carne asada and the pollo (blanco), skip the sour cream & cheese.
4. Grab a stool outside 
5. Enjoy.

FANTASTIC place... been a fan for years.  But I don't eat here or any Latin food too regularly because if I did, it'd defeat putting 40 miles a week on my sneakers.  

Good treat.  Just don't get too addicted...
author: Athena S.

description:
I LOVE LA TAQUERIA!!!!!!! My best friend brought me there, she is related to the owner.. and i am not giving them 5 stars bc i know them, but bc food is amazing!!!!!!!!! yes some people will consider it pricey BUT.. hey! its worth it and you pay for good quality food, if you want cheap stuff and processed food go to another place!!!! their tacos and burritos are HUGE! i have been there twice bc i am from LA, but every time i go and visit my bff we go there! 

Last week i was craving some tacos from La Taqueria, they are THAT GOOD!
author: Mila J.

description: I don't understand what the hype is about ! I ordered a chicken burrito and undercooked & really fatty my husband on the other hand ordered a taco and they do not have the best burritos but they do have some great tacos !
author: Cindy M.

description:
my lord!  a little piece of so cal delivered to me on a plate here in sf!

I had the carnitas tacos.  order them crispy.  they fry the inner tortilla and leave the outer tortilla soft.  they put some stewed pintos in the bottom, and the carnitas are SO juicy and flavorful!  Their salsa options are killer.  well blended type of stuff with lots of fresh flavors and the proper amount of spice....not that chunky, flavorless pico de gallo crap most northern californians have just accepted as 'salsa'.

also the chips and guac were really good too.  the guac was delish, and the chips were quality.  and it was only $3 or something ridiculously cheap like that!

i cannot wait to come back!  

TOTALLY recommended!!!
author: Christian C.

description: My wife and I had burritos and tacos. Superb. Meat was fresh, tender, and juicy. We recommend the strawberry, pineapple, and mango fruit drinks. It has a clean and cheerful ambience, and good location on Mission between 24th and 25th. Awards and recognitions are proudly displayed above the kitchen. The cashier/manager went out of his way to be friendly to us as first timers. Could not have had a better experience. We're definitely coming back!!
author: Wendell Y.

description: I heard this was the place to go in the Mission District and they were right!  The burritos were great and the atmosphere was great too.  You should definitely check this place out when visiting the Mission District in San Fran!
author: Jason V.

description: I came here and definitely expected 4-5 stars. I got a carne asada burrito - to my surprise they have no rice here. I'm a big fan of rice so that knocked off a star. I also come to find out there's no cheese. I got pico de gallo in my burrito and they didn't even try to filter out the juice before putting it in. my burrito was a little drippy, salsa being alright on the side if you can drain out the rest. the carne asada was pretty tasty no complaints on the meat. guacamole was almost tasteless- needed salt & lime. decent all together but no 5 stars if you ask me,  i wished it to be better.
author: Kelsey D.

description:
Absolutely my favorite $6 tacos!!!!

Ask for one shell to be crispy and the other one to be soft.

Yeah I said it $6!!! After you add the sour cream and guacamole ya get a taste of heaven in one hand. The green sauce at the tables should be sold to the public that stuff is da bomb!!!

When ever I want my fix I head right to this place.
author: Peter B.

description:
For most people, its either La Taqueria or Tacqueria Cancun.  They live and die by their choice, lose friends and maybe family over it. I may be exaggerating, but this place is goood.

Great, fresh ingredients, of course. I measure a burrito by whether or not i can move and function after I eat it. With La Taq, I can. I like the fact that the reg burrito does not include beans to weigh you down. Also, the green salsa is a must. Hard to describe a burrito, so I'll save you some time and just tell you to go there and taste for yourself.
author: Jeremy K.

description: Solid and really great tacos for a very reasonable price.  I make it a point to eat here when I'm in the Mission.  Been here four times and delighted every time.  There's a reason why the Chronicle and Michael Bauer like this spot.
author: Patrick B.

description: The holy grail of all Mexican food in the world.  I would like to call this place Heaven someday...
author: Courtney S.

description:
I'm addicted to this place and this is why I'm probably packin' on the pounds. I've been loyal to a few other taquerias in the hood, but this blows them all out of the water. 
I usually go for their tacos but their burritos are equally yum. Warning: they do not contain rice or other fillers. It's straight up beans, meat, salsa and some guacamole if you pay extra.
Their carnitas is mouth watering and for all you vegetarian hippie freaks, they have delicious options for you as well (so claims my boyfriend).
author: Kitty K.

description: YUMMY!!!! I wouldnt say its the best but it was pretty good! I wasnt overstuffed! Definitely ask for it fried on the grill! I will try this again! The wait was a little long but thats only because of the recent review of this place.  ! I ordered a carne asada super burrito! The steak issssss the bomb! Hot sauce good! overall lunch experience was great! Congrats on your success LA Taqueria!!
author: Kyle W.

description:
The secret to savoring the delicious life, as a graduate student on a tight budget, is Scoutmob.

With such an offer in hand, I went to La Taqueria on a (or "in the") mission to sample a carne asada taco. Unfortunately that didn't happen, as the person at the register, as well as his minions behind the counter flat out refused to accept the offer.

That's not a way to conduct business.

So I never got my taco and politely walked out of La Taqueria.

Key points:
1. They refused to fulfill a non-expired offer, saying that the offer expired "yesterday" even though the printed e-mail I handed them stated an expiration date of the current.
2. They refused to acknowledge that there was no Blackberry app, and asked for an iPhone or Android. I told them that's quite discriminatory.
3. I mentioned that the other 20% of smartphone users out there use Blackberry and I was met with a look of bewilderment. Has he never been arould a Blackberry user? (And what about the other non-smartphone users? I have friends who carry around conventional phones since they do not feel the need to be electronically leashed to their e-mail at all times away from a computer.)

I wrote out an e-mail to Scoutmob the same day I wrote out this review. Lets see who gets back to me first.

Below is the e-mail I tried to redeem:

"From: deals@scoutmob.com
Sent: Thu 9/01/11 8:03 AM
SCOUTMOB BRINGS YOU:

100% Off at La Taqueria. Expires on 09/15/2011. Code: 9d47. Valid for 1 carne asada taco. 1 per customer. Can't combine offers."
author: Cuong T.

description: touristy spot, good tacos. overall yummy spot. very crowded on weekends and lunchtime so be prepared to wait.
author: Jasmin J.

description:
I heard about this place while watching the Cooking Channel and then a friend of mine mentioned that it's the best burrito place in the city so I came to this place when I was in the area. 

This place was packed with almost all of the seats taken.  I had the chicken burrito which was really well seasoned and moist but the downside to it is that since the chicken is sitting in a watery sauce, the burrito becomes soggy.  By the end of it, the sauce leaked through a fold in the foil and all over my hands and tray.  The burrito was worth the mess though.  My friend had the beef one which wasn't a mess and it made me a bit envious of how he could eat it to neatly.  
People are in and out of this place so while it's busy, a seats become available pretty quickly. 

Great burrito place - I believe in the hype.
author: Tanya N.

description: This kind of hole in the wall place is where the charm of mission lies. The burrito feels authentic and satisfying. Line is long but wait is short so definitely stop by this joint if you are in the neighborhood.
author: George L.

description: Best Mexican food outside of So Cal that you can find! Menu is limited but the food is great. You are also going to pay more and get a smaller portion but its worth it.
author: M K.

description: Charbroiled carne asada, fresh tortillas, homemade salsa and beans and then top it off with fresh guacamole!!! Absolutely the best I've had in the Bay Area!! Take it from someone born and raised in SoCal!!!
author: ADOLFO R.

description:
Your search is over. Tell the others not to bother. This is the best value taco experience you will find.

Don't be put off by the line or the noise or the hustle and bustle around tables. Don't over think it - order some simple food, pay them a fair tip and when the food arrives you will be transported.

To Taco Heaven.
author: Rob K.

description:
We were in the Mission for the SF Food Festival and decided to hop into La Taqueria after seeing the lines out the door and the accolades on the wall. 

I'm from MPK, a city right next to East Los Angeles, so I know my Mexican food and quite frankly I must say that if this is the best, then Bay Area Mexican food does not compare to socal. 

First of all the tacos are expensive! $3.50 for 1 taco? You have to be kidding me? Sure it's much bigger than a typical taco but for that price you should be getting a few. 

Second, what's up with beans in the tacos? This is not a burrito! 

The side of aguagade (guacamole) was $1.20 and it was small as well. 

We ordered the carnitas and asada taco and both were decent but nothing to write home about. The service was efficient though, the line was out the door but it kept moving and our food came pretty quickly. 

I would definitely want to try some other taquerias in the Mission before writing off Mexican food in the Bay Area but La Taqueria did not knock our socks off. 

-the individual taco was 
A couple of cons:
author: Betty C.

description:
Crispy Tacos people CRISPY TACOS!
Order one chorizo and the other your choice - add avocado, grab a seat anywhere and enjoy. This is as good as it gets :)
author: Penelope B.

description: Ok, I'm from southern New Mexico, and I've lived in Texas for several years. I tell you this for background as I've had lots of burritos, Tex-Mex and real Mexican food, and I'm a big fan of Chipotle. This place is hands down the best burrito, period. Restaurant is always busy, so just come prepared to wait and be ready to jump on open seats. Excellent food, burritos are less expensive than chipotle, but just as big and better good quality. Cash only, but they have an ATM with a $2 fee. Great for families as well. There is a reason the line wraps around the interior of building and sometimes out the door.
author: JB A.

description:
Best taco I've ever had? Well, I still think the best fish taco I've ever had was in Venice, but for carnitas, this place has immediately shot up to the top.

The juicy melt-in-your-mouth meat topped with fresh salsa alone is amazing, and with guac & sour cream, it is basically a wake up call for your taste buds to ponder why you ever thought street trucks or god-forbid, taco bell, was at all sufficient. One [gigantic] taco for ~$5.69 filled me up nicely.

Plus, the cashier/owner/guy is adorable & endearing. I'd return just because I experienced great service. After mock-rudely greeting me with a "what are YOU doing here!?", he cut a rose for me from a bowl next to him in response to my "whaddayamean why are you mean to me i don't even know you!?". And when he found out that it was my first time around there, he gave me a stawberry agua fresca on the house - delicious already, even more so because it was free. 

Definitely a must-try!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
The Best!!! Viva La Taqueria!!! This place is the Salma Hayek of taquerias and all others are Ugly Betty in comparison.
Over the last 25+ years I have been to almost every Mexican place in the Mission and many more throughout the Bay Area and none compares to this place.
There is no better tasting burrito in the world than the Carne Asada with avocado and cheese that I have been ordering here since 1985. The only thing that prevents me from eating here everyday is that they are a bit pricey and I now live on the Peninsula. But once or twice a month I get that craving for the most satisfying, the tastiest, the most delicious and distinctive burrito known to mankind. Viva La Taqueria again!!!
author: Johnny C.

description:
yeah they're good but not the best. 

1. service is terrible, matter of a fact horrible. real rude!!!
2. real shitty wrapped burrito's and the portion wasn't worth the price 
3. they can't even ask if you want it for her or to go
4. If you buy drinks they don't give it to you with your order they just leave it on the counter for you to find with the rest of everyone's drinks.

for a taqueria that's been on good eats, this place is whacckkkkkk!!
author: Lilian S.

description:
I'm visiting from the east coast, and this was hands down THE best burrito I've ever had.

The meat was so savory and juicy and the tomatoes added in so much flavor. I hate when burritos have too much starch in them, but the rice & beans in this burrito was just right and allowed the flavors of the meat & veggies take charge. OH and the cilantro. I looooove me some cilantro, and La Taqueria isn't afraid to use it.

My friend from NYC is coming tomorrow, and this is the first place I'm taking her to. She's going to go wild.
author: London G.

description:
There are so many taco places in the area.  It's like the peep shows in times squares during the 80s.  I was looking forward to getting an amazing taco since I saw many reviews about it and it's busy as fuck.  So I told myself. Yo, I'll hit this spot.  

I was so excited. It was packed and they had a relatively organized system of expediting the food to the customers that ate in and took out.  The kitchen is an open kitchen and facing the dining area. So I watched as I waited for my anticipated carnitas tacos.  Homeboys, are scooping food with there hands without gloves making the taco.  It was almost barbaric.  Alright so I thought, whatev's. This shit is going to taste fantastic.  Cross my fingers and hope to chance I won't get sick.  I got home and started eating my taco.  I was terribly disappointed.  NO FLAVOR!  I was so surprised.  I couldn't believe it.  It was the blandest taco I've ever eaten in my life!  The carnitas was overcooked to the point you thought it was crispy but it was that it was tough to chew.  I hit this place two more times after that. I got the same deal.  Man, what a let down.  Not to mention it's expensive as fuck.  I don't understand why it's so busy.  

The taco truck down my block back at home is off the chain. Anyhow, I don't recommend.
author: A K.

description: After a hard year of burrito comparisons, my roommate and I think we have concluded that La Taquería is the best burrito in SF.  The carne asada and pollo are both fantastic - juicy and full of flavor.  I recommend ordering a super burrito with refried beans.  The chips are also amazingly wonderful.
author: Rachel A.

description:
First time going to La Taqueria today.  I work in the Mission so taquerias are a big part of my selection when it comes to lunch.  I've been to a few around my office but had always been told I MUST try La Taqueria.

Well, I finally did.  And if you've made it this far you probably know where this is about to go.

Service: 1/5
I walked in and the place was busy.  It was disorganized in that I didn't know where to go to get in line.  Some people were placing orders with the cooks, some were placing orders at the register.  Some were picking up orders and some were just walking up to get some forks and straws.  Very disorganized.  Once I got to a place where someone would take my order they were unpleasant to talk to.  I will credit them for the swiftness of delivering my order but that should have been an indication of how the food was going to turn out which leads me to:

Food: 3/5
The fact that it took less than 2 minutes to make my Super Carne Asada Burrito should have been a red flag.  This wasn't speedy service, it was sloppy service.  Each bite was either a mouth full of steak and sour cream or a bite of tortilla and guacamole.  It was as if the cook just slapped the food on each half of the burrito and rolled it up faster than he called my number in Spanish and then in English because I wasn't paying attention.  This doesn't even take into account that half of the burrito had cold ingredients which is just unpleasant.  Also, the whole time I was eating the burrito a pool of grease was building below in my tray..yuck.  I will say though that had the burrito been more carefully prepared it had the potential to taste much better.  One final thing, they DON'T serve bottled coke.  And you call yourself a Taqueria?!

Price: 2/5
$11.  That's what I paid for my burrito and a small soda.  $11 would have been acceptable had they included a bottled coke (not a 12 oz. cup).  $11 would also have been acceptable had they included some chips with my order.  But no, neither of these things were the case.

I may give La Taqueria another shot some day because after 700+ reviews at the time of writing this one they've managed to maintain a 4 star average.  But I can be honest and say that it may take some time to try this place again after spending 2 years eating better burritos at different taquerias in the mission for lower prices.
author: James G.

description:
So simple, yet so good.  We've lived in the City and peninsula for over 5 decades and have tried just about every burrito spot .  But i have to say, this place has the most savory meats for their food.   People line up and wait for their food patiently here.   You look at the line and you know you are in the right place with locals, business people, and all races represented.  The prices are average, but for the quality and service, hard to beat.  And like other's have said, the food is just good and juicy!   btw, my favorite, carnitas!

I was reminded of this place when we needed a fast meal to take with us on the road to Tahoe.  We were about to head to "taco truck", but remembered this place.   Glad we did.
author: Gerry T.

description:
Best burrito on Mission Street. They aren't huge, but they are perfect. 

The beef is so well seasoned and cooked. Never tough or chewy or bland. They don't put rice in the burritos, so that flavors come across that much stronger. I get it with everything except sour cream. You can eat the whole burrito, and thanks to the no rice inside, you feel full without feeling bloated. 

And for as busy as they get, they have their system down and you still get your order in quick and the food ready fast. 

The only downside is that they only take cash.
author: Kristin N.

description: Carne asada taco w/ avocado. Do it.
author: Judith M.

description:
Great service and the best tacos (especially the pork) and burritos I've had. Since it was our first time we were given free fruit drink samples and a free taco.  

The restaurant is busy, but very organized so things move quickly and easily.  When my wife and I left we chatted with the guy working the register and he gave my wife a rose.  Highly recommend La Taqueria.
author: August W.

description: This place is heaven. HEAVEN. Can't go wrong with a carnitas super taco. The one drawback is that it's always packed, but they keep the line moving pretty quickly, and I can't exactly fault them for having a successful business.
author: Valerie C.

description:
Best taco I've ever had, was at La Taqueria.  I'm not one of those extreme taco lovers, but the Carnitas Tacos here are DELICIOUS.

Nothing fancy here--soft tortilla, shredded pork, fresh salsa, cheese, sour cream...but so good. 

It's a very simple, small shop.  You order, then seat yourself on tables with benches.  Consistent crowd, but service is fast.

It's a little on the pricier side, compared to other shops (and there are many, many of them in the neighborhood).  My husband believes there are better shops that are cheaper.  But I disagree.
author: Joanne N.

description:
We stopped by La Taqueria to fulfill #3 of The Big Eat SF with the carnitas taco.

The taco was pretty bland and run of the mill.  I usually like really simple tacos (this one had pork, pinto beans, and salsa), but the meat wasn't flavorful enough to hold its own.

It left me wanting to douse it with some hot sauce, but there wasn't any around.  There are bottles of green sauce at each table, but it's more savory than spicy.

I feel bad that my impression of this restaurant comes down to the one taco I had, but it is one that they are supposed to be known for.  No go for me!
author: Mee-Sun Y.

description: $7.00 for a small burrito and no chips!!! The chicken burrito was good but not seven dollars good.
author: Joy A.

description: Taco Dorado: heavenly goodness! A crunchy taco wrapped in a soft tortilla shell... Absolutely delicious and my favorite thing on the menu. I recommend it with their guacamole - TO DIEEE FORRRR. I took my cousin here while she was visiting from New Jersey and she was seriously considering moving out here, just for this food. ;) Tip: La Taqueria is cash only, so come prepared!
author: Christina D.

description: Crispy Steak tacos are really good.
author: Farbod F.

description:
This is the best place for tacos in the Mission (which means the best in the city), hands down.

They are expensive, yes. But, like other reviewers have said, you get what you pay for (in size AND quality). The chicken super tacos are where it's at! It's just the kind of basic, down-home, DELICIOUS Mexican food you'd expect to find in the Mission.

One disclaimer: burritos are not their strong suit. I've definitely had better. So, when you go (not if), stick to the tacos. They are UN. REAL.
author: Nora T.

description: El Farolito has my vote on the Al Pastor but the Carne Asada at La Taqueria has my heart. Just, phenomenal grilled steak and the marinade is perfect. Ask for your taco "el dorado style" for a crunchy taco wrapped in a soft shell.
author: Monica L.

description: Not nearly as good and twice the price as Tacqueria Can-Cun. Skip it and go to Can-Cun
author: Pat W.

description:
Authentic and delicious Mexican food. I bookmarked this place after seeing it on a TV show ages ago and finally made it here. I got the pork burrito. Oh my god. It was incredible. Can't wait to go back.

Service was friendly and fast.
author: Ruchi M.

description: If you like big burrito, this is not it.  Meat is tasty though, but nutting  spectacular.
author: KK S.

description: Stumbled on this little place on date night and was not disappointed. I highly recommend the chicken quesadilla. The tortilla is nice and crispy and the chicken falls apart in your mouth.
author: Cory E.

description:
We went here before but didn't review it so we tried it again.  Only thing we got was a lengua taco for $3.50.

It took forever for them to call our number.  It was small but had lots of chopped up beef tongue, onions & cilantro.  Not much flavor so the green salsa in the bottle on the table really helped.

Just ok for me.
author: Ann L.

description: I think this was probably the best burrito I've ever had (although I am used to London burritos).  I went for the carnitas option.  The meat was very tasty, the other fillings with just the right balance, and the tortilla was moist and light.  The beef they were preparing looked amazing, as did all the tacos that were being served up.  There was a bit of a queue when I got in, but the service is really fast, so I wasn't waiting for long.
author: Andrew M.

description: I hate giving poor reviews, but I was surprised today. I ordered the regular burrito with chips and I have to say it did not live up to the hype. Food is like any other Mexican restaurant. May the search continue.
author: Michael J.

description:
It is only fitting that this is my first review being this is possibly my favorite place to eat.

Hands down the best taco's and burrito's anywhere.  We have have own and this is MINE!  My dad took me here when I was young and I have not stopped coming back.

All the meats are great but I only eat the Carne Asada and if on a good day you come when you get the meat right after the they chop it right in front of you are a "Winner".  They use a higher quality of beef here than any other taco/burrito joint in the city.

They hot sauce and salsa are how can I describe it "Like Krak"  Cant get enough.

Its amazing that a place like this is surviving with out having rice, chili verde and for a long time sour cream which I think is a sin to add on because it hides the flavors of the meat, but after the yuppies starting making this place so popular that is the one thing the owner gave into and I don't blame them.

The only CON that I have the the price.  Reg taco runs about $3.50 (far from the $1.75 years and years ago? once you add the everything on it its jumps to $6 bucks.

Regardless of the price I'd still keep on coming back........
author: King L.

description: Not that this place needs another yelp review but...Carnitas burrito slays!
author: Fred S.

description:
How have I not written a review for La Taq already?  Well, this is hands down the best burrito in SF and all of the bay area.  For those of you who are haters because they don't have rice, you don't know what a good burrito tastes like!

Their carnitas burrito with avacado and hot sauce is the bomb.  Chicken is great too!  I'm salivating....it must be lunch time!
author: Dana D.

description:
I recently visited San Francisco for the first time and found out about this place from a friend who accompanied me on the trip.  Hands down, the best tacos I've ever had and I'm from Texas so I know what good tacos taste like! :) 

I had the carnitas & carne asada tacos when I was there and they were delicious! I believe the tacos only came with beans & salsa, but it's definitely worth the extra money to add cheese & sour cream. Speaking of the salsa, it was fantastic! Pretty much just a pico de gallo type salsa, but it had great flavor & was only slightly spicy. If you're like me and enjoy spicy, on every table there's a bottle of salsa verde to liven things up!

All in all, this place was scrumptious! I was only in San Fran for 5 days and ended up eating lunch at La Taqueria twice...haha best tacos EVER!!
author: Meredith J.

description:
This place is excellent.
Anyone giving a bad review must be from the Mid-West!

It doesn't get better than this.
The crunchy taco wrapped in a non-fried tortilla is brilliant. 
Amazing Carnitas and Pollo tacos, as well as veggie
Great Aqua Fresca with real fruit (not that crappy concentrate stuff from inferior taquerias)

I miss this place so much when I travel....or go on a health kick
author: Sam I.

description:
The sis and I went here on a boring night for some good mexican grub. 
Two basic veggie tacos(beans, rice or cheese, salsa), with additional avocado, plus 2 beers was 16 bucks! yowza~ 

Sitting outside at the tiled bar lets you look at the working kitchen while eating. It's wonderfully entertaining.
author: Em L.

description: I am the HAPPIEST PERSON EVER today!!!  Just picked up my nephew from DFW airport and guess what he had in his backpack when he stepped off the plane?  Two carne asada burritos for me and two for my daughter.  The deal is when our family visits us they cannot step off the plane without burritos from La Taqueria.  I don't normally tell my age but I will let you know...OMG...I have been going to this place for probably 40 years!  La Taqueria is truly a landmark in the Mission and a happy place for my family and I.  THANK YOU LA TAQUERIA FOR 40 YEARS OF YUMMINESS!!  There is NO other place like you when it comes to burritos and tacos.  YOU ARE DA'BEST!!
author: Nhp C.

description: Arguably the best taqueria in SF. Get the tacos, not the burritos. I recommend the carnitas, lengua, and carne asada, in that order. And no matter what you get, get it dorado style. Never forget dorado style. You will thank me later.
author: Winston L.

description: Came here after hearing about it from friends and definitely lived up to it's name. Had the Beef Burritto (super) and it was really good! Service was quick and the restaurant was pretty full.
author: Keiya S.
