description: Wayyyyyyyyyyyy overpriced. Ridiculously overpriced. food was good but two burritos and two tacos shouldn't be $29 no matter WHERE you go! will not be coming back (unless they lower the prices)
author: Damon W.

description:
Hands down, the.best.carne.asada.taco. I have ever had.  As a decades long connoisseur of the best taquerias in San Francisco, nothing holds a candle to La Taqueria.  They are not cheap though.  By the time you get your double-hulled, one crispy grilled, one soft corn tortillas loaded with carne asada, beans, guacamole, crema, pico de gallo, and their delicious green salsa, you are looking at nearly a $7 taco.  However, for $14 you can send your tastebuds to their happy place for the duration of your dining experience.  Then, you can dream about how delicious they are when you move to a new city.   It's truly one of the things I will miss about San Francisco.

CASH ONLY.
author: Julie T.

description:
Perhaps one of the better, most authentic burritos i've had.

No rice, just meat, beans, salsa, avocado, and cheese. And watching the man behind the counter stuff all this into the tortilla is impressive (the burrito stays together nicely). The meat is tender, the salsa perfectly spicy... I had the Lengua and it was perfect. The Carnitas were delicious too. Keep in mind you don't get chips or salsa with your burrito, but why distract from the goodness of it?
author: Vittorio L.

description:
There's burrito's in Heaven!  La Taqueria is consistently serving up authentic, fresh mexican burritos, tacos, quesadillas. I've been eating at La Taqueria for over 30 years.  It's just a great today as it was 30 yrs ago.  Everytime i'm in town, its a drop-in.
Experience the freshness and the authentic taste of a great burrito, taco or quesadillas prepared right in front of you. Consistently rated numbero 1 by Zagget.
Get your burrito-taco grove on, you won't regret it!
author: A G.

description: I'm a total fan!!  It's crowded at all hours, but the line moves fast and the tables turnover pretty quickly.  Two chicken tacos (tender, tasty chicken, mmm!), chips and salsa (crispy chips with ultra fresh salsa, loooove) and a strawberry fresca (refreshing, slurped it all up, healthy, tangy, tasty, looooove).  I would come back in heartbeat - no wonder this place is in all the books, magazines, guides and Food Channel TV shows.  Loooooove.
author: Maile N.

description:
This place has been on our list for the longest time, and boy was it worth the wait! We loved this place. I ordered the Carnitas and Choriso Burrito while the girlfriend ordered the Carnitas and Carne Asada Burrito. Let me just say this: These guys know their way around meat! The Carnitas was so juicy and full of flavor that it practically exploded in your mouth. I recommend it to anyone who is a serious pork fan. I figured that if they could do Canirtas well they could do the Chorizo well too and I was not wrong. Everything here I'm sure is fantastic and I cannot wait to try it.

The price was definitely a bit steep for a taqueria, but I'll be damn, I was pretty impressed!
author: Michael N.

description:
I was dropping off a family member at the SF airport and had to make the trek to this legendary taqueria.

I asked the woman taking my order for the 'winning burrito.' She asked a few final style questions, to which I responded--however you recommend. For those unfamiliar with the winning burrito, it was the super burrito with carnitas with crispy outside.

I was NOT disappointed. The pork was juicy and tender, and the vegetables were fresh and brought a perfect balance to the meat. I typically order my burrito without onions, but in this case I did not want to deviate from the original. The onions were almost unnoticeable (in a good way) and simply added a bit of spice to the savory flavors. The tortilla was given a quick crisp on the fryer, which gave a wonderful texture I rarely experience with from a burrito. Overall, A+

I can see what the hype was about. Of course, it is only a burrito. It's not going to change your life. But if you want a spectacular burrito experience and are near the SF area, I encourage you to give La Taqueria a try. Enjoy!
author: Chris M.

description: I just moved into the area and heard about the good reviews so I had to check it out myself. I love the place because they don't use cheap fillers like rice in their burritos. There's no doubt that I will take my friends here for great Mexican food. PS get there early because there are long lines!!
author: Katie B.

description: Get the carne asada tacos with sour cream and avocado, and chips & salsa. Thank me later.
author: Tara M.

description: Get the chorizo tacos! Yum! Also get your burrito "dorado"- makes the bite a little crunchy. Love!
author: Wendy L.

description:
Heat tortilla, put meat, beans, pico de gallo, avocado, and sour cream, serve. Once you take off those extras that kill the taco, you come to learn that the asada has no flavor to hold its own, the carnitas is actually good, and yet the possibility of enjoying a good taco on its own is destroyed by all of these extras.

Chips were good and much better than other taquerias in the Mission District.  Asked for the spiciest hot sauce they had and it was actually a mild sauce. Horchata was on the watery side.
author: F.D. R.

description:
Places like Pancho Villa and La Corneta may have better burritos, nachos, etc., but La Taqueria serves the best taco in San Francisco.

When you order your taco, you *must* specify that you're ordering a "taco dorado" (golden taco).  This means that they'll fry up one corn tortilla, melt some cheese on it, and then layer it into another soft corn tortilla.  So, your taco shell is a three-part masterpiece, made up of: (1) an inner layer that is crispy/oily/chip-like; (2)  a middle layer that is melty and cheesy; and (3) an outer layer that is soft and mealy like a traditional corn tortilla.  It's the perfect receptacle for your taco fillings.

I don't like beans in my tacos, nor do I like sour cream.  These are both standard fillings in La Taqueria's tacos.  I usually do two tacos-- always one with carnitas, the other with chicken or carne asada.  

The guacamole is really good, as is their red salsa, so I usually ask for both in my tacos.  I generally find the salsa to be a bit under-salted, but the meat is usually nice and seasoned so it balances the flavors.  Their salsa verde, which is available in squeeze bottles at each table, is a bit bland.  

The chips aren't very fresh, and too thick for my liking, but they're nice to graze on between each taco.  There's also a good selection of Mexican beers.  

This place is usually a madhouse at lunch, so keep your eyes peeled for seating.  I would sometimes walk to Precita Park to eat in peace, but you're not being to be able to preserve the integrity of the freshly-fried taco shell if you have your tacos wrapped up in foil and take them to go.  Bear the crowd and down your tacos immediately after your number is called.
author: Jonathan R.

description:
Last place to eat in SF? 
Ah, I don't think so...

The food
Average
Quick 
Unique circus music
Expensive... $3.50 for a taco?
Really?
I got the carnitas burrito ($6.50)
A try before you die? Not really...

Carnitas burrito was okay. =\ Nothing spectacular. My friend ordered the carnitas taco and said the same. The chips were a bit hard. Wished the Horchata was more fresca!

I've been trying to do all these 100 places to eat in SF before you die! But it was funny that my friend and I came here before we even knew it was on the list!! We just randomly walked into this place after El Rio on our way to the BART station! haha I really don't consider this place in the category of "Try Before You Die." There are probably a lot of better places to try than this one.

100 The Big Eat SF: 100 Things to Try Before You Die
http://www.7x7.com/content/eat-drink/big-eat-sf-100-things-try-you-die?page=1
- La Taqueria: Carnitas Taco ($3.50)
author: CeCe C.

description:
Nom Nom.

Was there about six weeks ago, visiting from out of town, sister recommend...and absolutely loved La Taqueria.  Will be back.

Fantastic food, fantastic staff.  Seriously good salsa, more than one fine variant to select from.  And an appropriate selection of beer.

(My wife has been training me to say "thank you" recently.  And La Taqueria staff assisted in that nobel, painful effort.   THHHHHHANK----YOOOOUUUUUU!)
author: Stu T.

description:
One of the best places in SF to get some delicious tacos. Expensive, but less tacos here will fill you up quickly. I come here pretty much every weekend and I can tell you that the meat is ALWAYS fresh. The place is small so seating can be a bit of  a hassle during rush hour peaks but it is so worth it. 

LOVE LOVE LOVE
author: Guadalupe M.

description:
Long line and a wait. Doesn't move as fast as El Farolito's

Tried the Super Burrito w/beef lengua (tongue) dorado (tortilla fried).

It was delicious, and frying the tortilla certainly makes a difference. In contrast to El Farolito though the Super Burrito wasn't as "stuffed" (I had it withotu rice at El Farolito too).

If I had to pick one, I would go with El Farolito. Now if only El Farolito offered a "dorado" option too.
author: S J.

description:
Disappointed and never going back. 

My family and I have been coming here since I was a kid.  That's over 20 years of business.  I went over there today to grab my favorite burrito with everything on it.  We ordered three burritos and two strawberry drinks.  $34+!!!!  I had to double check the price and the register girl confirmed.  OK.. fine.  The prices are getting dumb but we still like the burritos.  So, we drive home slightly disgruntled only to find the skinniest most anemic burritos I've ever seen.  For $34 we got wussy burritos.   

Do not go if you are ACTUALLY hungry.  The burritos have gone down in quality and quantity.  Yes, the place was filled...but  with those entitled transplants from other places in the country who are looking to 'experience' the mission and probably driving up the price.  Hardly any latino patrons.  The food is expensive and there are plenty of other great burrito joints in the mission who are still true to their roots and not gouging customers. 

We're never going back again.
author: Marie L.

description:
My wife asked me the other day, if you had only one last meal, what would it be? I told her it would be a Burrito de Carne Asada with everything on it from La Taqueria.
If Jesus could sneak down for a day, he would stop by at La Taqueria...Yes, that's how great the food is here. Everything taste original. You could visit a hundred Burrito places all over the world and they would all have a distinct likeness to each other. Not here. The food here taste like no other place you've ever visited. The moment you bite into any meal, you immediately appreciate the unique flavor from decades of perfecting the taste in every bite. Am I bias? Absolutely! I LOVE burritos and as a native San Franciscan, I've eaten at every Burrito place at one time or another, and I now only eat at La Taqueria when I want to feel like I'm enjoying a meal in heaven.
author: Alex T.

description:
I love La Taqueria! I've only had their carne asada tacos - crispy with avocado..but they are SOOOO GOOD! I haven't tried anything else but really if these were all they made I'm sure they'd still have a great following of customers. And their green hot sauce is delicious!

They only get 4 stars though because they are so expensive! Going to La Taqueria is something I treat myself too every once in awhile. I couldn't afford going there too often. But I do love those tacos..definitely going to have to make a trip soon :)

The horchata is also very good! But I LOVE their agua fresca = fresh strawberries!! 

Great place, I just wish they were a little bit cheaper. I def had to make sure to add it to my friend's Foodie Adventures list though ;)
http://www.skinnyscoop.com/list/claudia/best-eats-in-bay-area
author: Jackie S.

description:
Pricey yes, but look around you!  The mission district is filled with burrito places that are much cheaper and they even serve rice in their burrito's.  But the clientel are not gringos and chinos looking for the "belly bomb."  This place is filled with the locals who appreciate quality in their food and meat.
I was impressed with the simplicity of taste in the Cabeza taco with only salsa and celantro.  It was pure and simple and no other convolution of filler or excess.

La Taqueria, es muy sabrosa!
author: Curtis L.

description:
Some good friends of mine that live close to La Taqueria, introduced me to this place of deliciousness. Their tacos are uh-mazing to say the least. I've been here two times now and both times I have left a happy happy customer. I believe both times I ordered one chicken taco and one veggie, both with guacamole Their salsa is super delicious, so if you get your food to-go, remember to throw some on before you head out.

The only downfall of eating in is that it gets super crowded around feeding time, so it might be best to get it to go and enjoy it at home. Their chips and salsa are delicious too if you're considering a little something extra on the side. Overall, La Taqueria is easy on the wallet and simply delicious.
author: Emily S.

description:
I find myself in the Mission regularly and saw that this place made a top 5 list for best burritos in the country. The #1 spot went to a joint outside of the Southwest so I guess I should have been suspicious.

I got the super carne asada burrito. It was pretty good. Generous amount of lime and sour cream, which is probably why it's raved about (not that hard to figure out, folks).

It was, however, much smaller than any other burrito you can find on Mission Street, not to mention more expensive (after tax, nearly $10) and not worth the premium.

Worst bit: it doesn't come with chips! What?!?
author: Pierre B.

description: I gave this place 5 stars for the simple fact that their tacos are definitely top notch to any taco joint in SF. It's a bit pricier, but the quality of meats and preparation they have make this place worth it. If you like your taco with a bit of crunch...get it "Dorados" style... Oh my, seriously the business! I usually get two and that's just enough. This place can get packed so make sure your ready to either grab a seat before you order or have no problem eating while standing.
author: B. B.

description: The carnitas burrito is amazing. There's the perfect amount of kick. The ingredients taste so fresh. I tried my friend's carne asada and the meat had a delicious grilled flavor, but I still think I made the better choice. There isn't rice in the burrito which makes it a more manageable size. I took off a star because there's no salsa bar and they don't give chips. I should take off another star because they charge over a dollar extra if you don't want beans  (because they add extra meat) but it is on the sign. Read carefully.
author: Mary H.

description:
Heaven on earth. Need I say more? 

From one Mexican to the world. Legit.
author: Edith G.

description:
This is as good as it gets.  In the area of 25th and Mission.  A must stop for any taco lover.  If you ask for your taco to be made El Dorado the inner shell will be made crispy!  Highly recommend the chorizo and carne asada tacos.  Carne asada was easily the best taco I have ever had.  Also previewed the chicken burrito. Nice big strips of fresh white meat chicken. Looks like it was carved right off the bird! Worth the money, (obviously some places in the Mission are cheaper).

Great salsa verde. Very spicy so go easy.

Bring CASH credit is not accepted.  The food is goo so naturally it is very busy. The lines can be long but they move fast!  Every once in a while some live music will roll in for a quick song or two and some tips.
author: Tony N.

description:
I was in SF for a trip and went to this small taco joint to get our fix and I was wow'ed.

Yes - it is so simple, but the idea of taking two corn tortillas fuzed together with melted cheese was genius! One of the tortillas was soft and the other was slightly fried to give it a crunchy texture. It won't crumble on you of course because of the melted cheese!

Choose whatever fillings tickle your fancy. They are all good. I had a chicken, carnitas, and pulled pork. ALL GOOD!!!!

I have been looking for a place around DC that makes something like this and have FAILED - the closest thing is the Gordita Crunch taco from taco bell :( sad sad day.

If you are in SF - give this place a try!
author: Charles K.

description:
Sadly la taqueria has gone downhill. This place used to be amazing. Talked it up to my kids and went in - I was reminiscing about the magical crispy crunch of the tortillas fried with generous fat content, the magical balance of a great slab of quac and salsa fresca atop the rice-less main ingredients in the body of the taco, the wondrous perfection in this version of mexican comfort food... but it was gone. Limp tortillas, the vegetable matter lacking its peppy freshness, greasy instead of deliciously oiled, a blandness overall. 

Coming back here was like losing a good friend.
author: Mike K.

description: Best Mexican food in the bay; in my opinion. Every time I'm in San Francisco I make sure to make my way over there. Good food and chill atmosphere.
author: Kristina P.

description: What's that berkeley burrito place that's open till 2 am? La burrita! This is its father. I had the carne asada burrito and while good it wasn't as mind blowing as I expected it to be. It seems that la burrita had copied their model so it tasted old and nothing new. The place is crowded though but I easily found a place to sit. I wouldn't recommend going at the time that I went: 8 pm due to the dinner crowd but feel free to go anytime before!
author: Minks M.

description:
Actually: 3.5 stars
Came here for lunch after visiting De Young Museum.

Ordered:
1) Carne Asada Burrito
2) Carne Asada Taco

The carne asada burrito was good b/c I added extra avacodo in it; otherwise it would've just been steak, very wet salsa, and beans. The burrito wrap was extra good b/c it was really soft.

The Carne Asada taco was decent. A lot of salsa.

Nothing THAT special in my opinion. It was pretty pricey too for mexican food. I guess their beef quality is better than El Farolito, but I would still go to El Farolito b/c i think El Farolito tastes better and it is cheaper and bigger portion (which means you can share)!
author: Jen H.

description:
I LOOOOVE this place. My friends and I met up really early just to eat here before the morning rush. The building was open, but no customers were allowed inside unfortunately because they were still cleaning. They saw us, but I wish they would let us sit down. 
Anyways, one of the workers (and possibly the owner?) greeted us really friendly and let us inside and took our order. He was SUPER friendly and funny and made the experience of being there a great one. We were also given free chips and salsa and he gave us free mints! And lastly, the food there was amazing. Best burritos and tacos in the entire city.
author: Marjorie M.

description: Line can be brutal, but I guess that's the price to pay for a great burrito.  Sometimes you just need a burrito, and if you do, this is the place to go.
author: Christopher M.

description: Solid, quick, delicious. There's a reason that people rave about this spot. I go for the carne asada.
author: Ameer N.

description: This place is awesome!!! The food is crack and there is not an empty seat in the house! There is also live music! Come in and be a local
author: Yaya L.

description:
I heard a lot about Mission burritos and was pleasantly pleased!
I had the shredded beef burrito and my friend had a vegetarian burrito.
The place was really crowded so that was a good sign.
The owner who took the money was really sweet and friendly and the food was reasonably prices and really tasty. Would definitely visit this place again!
author: Lynn B.

description: Great tasty tacos but bummed out about poor customer service!! Employees taking orders and at the cash register were horrible on TWO separate occasions!! Owner needs to reconsider training these employees!! Rude beyond belief!! I am from the Mission and while I no longer live in the Mission I am surprised and disappointed to find some horrible grumpy cats working there!!! No thank you, no smiles, no clarification no nada!! Okay then!! Pricey however the Tacos rock but some of the employees not so much...
author: Connie R.

description: This will not be the salty fast food burrito you may or may not be craving. See 'Chipotle'. La Taqueria graciously served me a golden burrito with the freshest ingredients I've ever tasted inside a tortilla. Try the carne asada and an authentic Mexican soda alongside. However, I won't give out a fifth star until I've sampled more of San Francisco's indelible Mexican cuisine.
author: Alex R.

description: Their reputation for the best burritos proceeds them! Great food! I recommend the beef burrito!
author: Hannah M.

description:
I didn't know that you have to add things separately and ended up with a carne asada burrito with just beans and meat. Do you have to pay extra for rice?? 

I want to come back for a carnitas taco.
author: Amy D.

description:
$6 dollars for a taco!!? are you freakin out of your mind!!

Well i must be, because it was worth it! Also there was no way I wasn't going to try it since it's on the 7x7!! However, the 7x7 tells you to get the carnitas taco, but thankfully my friend also recommended the carne asada one. I definitely think the carne asada one tastes much better since the meat is more seasoned and flavorful, but do whatcha gotta do!

TIP: DONT FORGET TO USE THEIR GREEN SAUCE! IT'S A MUST!!!
author: Kristen C.

description: This is carne asada the way god intended it - actual thick, juicy steak cut into strips. Just get the super carne quesadilla. Fresh guacamole and a fried, crunchy tortilla. So bomb.
author: Kristen F.

description:
Hands down, the worst restaurant in San Francisco for a vegetarian. Also the worst place to eat if you have a weak stomach and are prone to food poisoning. I used to love the veggie burrito because they don't use rice however I kept getting sick the next day, I am guessing it is either because they use so much grease on the grill or because behind the tall counter the kitchen is really filthy. Its probably both.

I ordered a veggie taco today and it cost $4.50 (the same as the veggie burrito? WTF) for one taco with only beans, cheese and avocado! Insane, why didn't I just go somewhere else. Then I got my veggie taco and it had a huge chunk of what looked like dried steak sitting on top of it. Before I took it off the counter, I asked if this was the correct order. The cook said yes, I lifted the nasty looking shred of nasty, dried meat and looked at him as if to say, "really?" It was so obvious it was not anywhere near becoming a veggie taco, he had to have noticed the chunk on top! ! He gave me silent attitude and a nasty look, the lady behind the register was offering me a new taco with attitude (but not my money back). Honestly, I would rather not get sick today, thanks for the offer though. One more place I will never visit again, which is really too bad since I live so close.

Eat with caution, food poisoning is just not worth it. SF Health score 87/100, not great!
author: Shannon Z.

description: Went today the line was out the door. Someone sId they won an award and were in the paper. Ill credit this to the feeding frenzy. I ordered a burrito w cheese and refried beans. No cheese and regular pinto beans. You know i was home when i opened it. I was pissed. Other than that it was ok
author: dave d.

description: I find it very hard to trust anyone that doesn't think this is the best taqueria in San Francisco. Yelp is generally a sight for people to give their opinions. Well, I won't give you my opinion here, just facts. La Taqueria is the best taqueria in San Francisco, possibly anywhere. I have been going here for eight years now and the quality and consistency are incredible. The ingredients are fresh, the meat is of a much higher quality than the competition, and the service is excellent. When I hear someone say that they like Pancho Villa or La Combre better, I immediately discredit anything else that comes out of their mouths. This place is a  winner and I hope it stays for many more years.
author: Ryan B.

description:
I have been coming here for 10 years and have had 3 things all equally outstanding. 

Carne Asada Burrito with Hot Sauce and Avocado (Best burrito I have ever had anywhere!)

Carnitas Taco with Hot Sauce - amazingly tender with outstanding flavor

Chips and Salsa - Always simple and fresh. 

I would pay double the prices for the food here, it's that good. I have been to other mexican places in the mission but they always disappoint compared to la taqueria.
author: Blake E.

description:
Oh my God best tacos everrrrr. They are pricey because they are huge. Two large flour tortillas with meat and salsa inside, mmm. I don't like my tacos with beans, but they usually include it. Anyways, the meat is JUICY TO THE CORE. Oh my God. Best taco I've ever had, even better than the ones I rave about at my favorite taco place in Santa Cruz. I usually hate carnitas, but this place's carnitas taste like sex in my mouth. Warm, juicy, wet, yummy, delicious, gimme more and gimme it fast sex.

The burritos, on the other hand, weren't that great, but were still good compared to other places. The tortilla on the burrito didn't taste very cooked (it was like they took it out of the package without toasting it even a little), and the carne asada, although juicy, wasn't my kind of thing. I like carne asada to taste like steak pieces, kind of like Chipotle style, not chewy, almost grounded pieces of meat. Not bad, but I'd get another meat instead next time. Their burritos are also particularly small.

Agua frescas are also awesome. I wouldn't recommend getting chips and salsa - chips were too hard and crispy for me, and the salsa isn't amazing (ours got too wet, so the tortilla chips underneath got soggy). Anyways, next time I'm going to get all the tacos with evvvvvvverything on them! TO DIE FOR TACOS. Maybe I'll give the burrito another chance, too, just for kicks.

This place has been famous like since I was born, and there's probably a good reason for that. I've been here when I was a child and since my adulthood revisit, I would say its legacy is still legit. Known for having no rice in their burritos (and I don't believe they offer it as an option!) - yay fewer carbs!
author: Amy Y.

description: My go to place for yummy tacos in SF!  LOVE the carnitas taco and the carne asada is great too!  The tacos can seem a little pricey, but they are big and usually two is enough to keep me satisfied (as long as I order a cup of horchata as well!).  The meat is so flavorful and the eating area isn't as dingy or dirty as some of the other taco places around here...  I'm a fan!
author: Jeff C.

description: In my search for great chips and salsa, La Taqueria left me disappointed. It's not salsa, its Pico and the chips are run of the mill. The chicken burrito has no seasoning and is very bland and they get you for $9. I'd rather go to Chipotle.
author: Ryan M.

description:
I've been back from San Francisco for a week now and almost nightly I dream of the carne asada burrito from La Taqueria.

Perfectly cooked and seasoned beef with freshly made salsa. And beans, let me tell you about the beans. 

I absolutely despise beans, but at $1.20 to get the burrito without beans I sucked it up and got the beans. They were lifechanging. Seriously, not overcooked and mushy, complimented the other ingredients to perfection.

Only downside,they don't make their burritos with rice which would have been great. 

If I could I would get on the plane back to San Francisco just to eat at La Taqueria.
author: Rochelle L.

description:
The best carnitas taco, carnitas burrito and strawberry fresca, I have ever had. They don't stuff their burritos with rice. Matter of fact, there is no rice at all. Just lots of delicious meat, salsa and beans.

And you can get the tacos or burritos crispy!
author: Christopher B.

description: Delicious delicious delicious! I have been going to this restaurant since I was a little girl and it is one of the best taco places in town. I recommend getting tacos dorados and an agua de fresa. The tacos dorados are crunchy and juicy. Although you have to pay extra for salsa, sour cream and guacamole it's all worth every penny. Remember it's a cash only place so you don't pay the $5.00 fee at their ATM. The only thing I would change about this place is the small cramped up benches and tables they have. I wish they could expand so everyone can sit comfortably.
author: Khatia R.

description:
So to be fair. I only stopped in here for a burrito because I was lazy and didn't want to walk the extra block beyond my house to go to Taqueria CanCun. 

I thought. Wow this place is always busy. Why not?

Now I know. First off the person who took the order looked like she could hardly be bothered. 2nd she lists off a list of burrito choices as if those are actually choices and not extras. 

Come to find out. Those are extras inflating the already more expensive than Taqueria CanCun burrito prices to new heights.

I opt out of the extras and still pay $16 for two burritos. 

Now I'm at home and the burritos are far smaller than Taqueria CanCun's. Mine is very bland despite ordering it with hot sauce. And wait, where's the fraking rice? The burrito barely holds together because it is underfilled and rolled incorrectly.

Now back to the price. $16 and change for very little food.

Last time I was at Taqueria CanCun I paid $12 and change. I also got a burrito with the choices I want (not extras, and rice), chips with salsa and guacamole, and really great taste.

To anyone claiming this is the best burrito in town, or to be a burrito aficionado, well there's no debating taste, however I invite you to take a stroll further down Mission, past Cesar Chavez, and just beyond Fair. There you may have to change your opinion.
author: Hayden R.

description:
I have been hesitant to write a review for La Taqueria because who can write of perfection.  When I think of eating a carnitas burrito here I think of the best sex of my life on the smoothest sheets in some tropical paradise devoid of mosquitoes and humidity.  When I unwrap that silver foil bundle I think of mooning Ronald Reagan, George Bush (both iterations), and Glenn Beck all at the same time and getting away with it.  When I take that first bite and my teeth penetrate the golden brown of the tortilla I think of walking through the pearly gates and being told, "Hey kid, you did good."  

The most mystifying part of this experience is that I don't know how they do it.  All the ingredients are the same as any other burrito place, but yet no burrito has ever produce such felicity in my mouth.

I'd also recommend getting a carne asada taco with everything on it and on crispy shell on the inside.  It's like a 7 dollar taco, but it will be the best taco you've ever had.  And yet that is still not as good as their carnitas burrito.
author: Jeremy G.

description: Was in town for a conference and someone that I was with suggested this place.  I noticed the wall having multiple awards including Zagnet.  The menu is very basic and has a variety of different meats.  I got one Chicken and one beef taco with nachos.  It was one of the best taco's that I ever had.  The salsa used on the nachos was very tasty and chunky.  If I ever make it out to San Francisco, this will definitely be a place I will visit again.
author: Alan G.

description: I had a burrito, it was good but smaller than I expected. I was still hungry after finishing it. A lot of the toppings cost extra, and there was no salsa bar. I enjoyed my meal, but definitely prefer other burritos in the area.
author: David B.

description: This is some of the best Mexican food I have ever had. It was so delicious and the price was amazing. The staff is so friendly. I will definitely be coming back on a regular basis. I got a quesadilla and it was so good!
author: Jasmin R.

description:
Instead of complaining about the long lines and overpriced food, why not give this guy a standing ovation for making a taco joint a tourist spot.  This place makes me love food, and I say to the SUPER G dude who runs this place-good for you for raising the prices if you've worked your butt off for so long and people still line up for your taco regardless of the price. I will still, I cannot resist. Three carnitas tacos, crunchy-soft (a soft shell on the outside and a crunchy on the inside YUM), with guac of course, and an agua fresca. I wish I was born earlier to eat at this place when it was more local and less touristy, but then again I am not a local, I am in the touristy group if anything. But I know a good taco from a bad one. I know juicy carnitas from dry. 

And if you ever watch the dude who makes those tacos... your mind cannot think about making them as fast as he makes them, on the real.
author: Matt M.

description: It's still one of the best taquerias in the MIssion. La Taqueria continues to lead the pack in making quality mexican food! I always order the carne asada because it is always consistently so good. I brought 2 newbies here and they were highly impresserd and said it was one of the best burritos they've ever had. Overall no matter what my heart will always be with La Taqueria seeing that I grew up eating here as a kid!!! Nom nom nom nom...
author: Richard G.

description: Omg, I love this place. They're known for their tacos, which are amazing, but I'm a burrito guy. They always hit the spot in just the right place. I also usually get an order of delicious seared serrano peppers doused in lemon juice. So, so good. Highly recommend going here.
author: Alexander C.

description:
My mom has been going here for at least 30 years, so its a family favorite. Maybe the prices have changed but I'd say it's still definitely worth it. 

The carnitas are delicious! Load up on the green sauce.

Also have a strawberry drink.!
author: Tina G.

description: Hand's down the best tacos ever! I've been going here since I was a little kid, only thing that sucks is the long line (but well worth it). Be sure to have some cash on you before you go as this place does not accept any credit card.Customer for life!
author: Eric R.

description: Not sure what the hype is. I've tried two other taquerias in Mission (el farolito and taqueria cancun) and both had better tacos and burritos than this joint...maybe it is because they did not toast my burrito and lacked the gooey cheese my farolito burrito had but I was left unimpressed.
author: Trish M.

description:
A friend from school, named Harriet, (yes, Harriet... isn't that funny?) grew up in SF and she told me this place has the best mexican food in the city.... I kinda have to believe her...

As far as fast food mex food is concerned, this place IS the best. Had a carnitas taco and carne and they were both marvelous... nice texture to the tacos, they don't fall apart, top notch ingredients... Go, if you've never been.

Only gripe - tacos are $3.50 each.... then they ask you (innoucuosly?) "do you want cheese, guacamole, and sour cream...?" I respond (offhandedly) "sure!" "OK, that'll be $12.60." Huh, what...? My extra ingredients were nearly as much as my damn taco! Yeah, whatever.
author: Tom M.

description:
Simple menu with delicious food, fast and great service.

Tacos are large and filling,  quesadillas are crisp and tasty,  grilled chiles make everything better, and the agua de pina is the best I've tried by far.
author: Vanessa V.

description: If it came to it, this would be my choice for my last meal. It doesn't get better than this. Get a carne asada burrito, ask for it "El Dorado" style, get the fresa drink, and then wish your stomach was the size of a cow's so you could just spend the rest of your life grazing at this place
author: Greg M.

description:
When I was a kid my uncle, a sacred drummer, would take my cousins and myself to Park Potrero del Sol and amaze others with his syncopated beats on the conga.  I remember someone whispering into my eight year old ear," He is really really good!"
After our cultural music lesson he would take us all to La Taqueria.

This was my first experience with a taco that wasn't from Taco Bell or wasn't  a store bought shell filled with packet seasoned ground beef, when my grandmother took a night off from her wifely duties. As a kid I was a little disappointed, but later came to appreciate a taco built with a fresh corn shell tortilla and packed with onions cilantro and a choice of meats.

When I became a musician, in my own right, I took my bass player here.  He bit into his taco, looked at me, and nodded.

As an adult this is not my ATF Taqueria in the City  and that's just because I have tried so many, but it is the place that I will take hungry band mates for a quick bite.

And it's where the locals go.
author: Joshua C.

description:
Absolutely excellent!! I've had my share of tacos (believe me I have :D) but the carne asada tacos at La Taqueria are just fantastic. The food here is authentic and the chefs are super cool. Everything is made fresh and the meats are seasoned just right. Be prepared to wait in a line during lunch but it's so worth it and the prices are reasonable as well. 
Can't wait to hit it up again :)
author: Shawn S.

description: So good. Hard to find seating most of the time, so go with friends and have one scope out a place to sit. Their strawberry fresca... Mmm mmm good.
author: Rachel C.

description: Definitely my favorite taqueria in the Mission. They have the best tacos! Carnitas is very popular. You should get chips and guacamole. They have beer here. It's cash only, and a little more pricey than most of the local spots. But they do have the best tacos!!! Salsa verde out on the tables -I wish I could have that in stock at my house 24/7.
author: Michelle W.

description:
I got a super veggie, no sour cream and was a little disappointed with no lettuce, no choice of bean type (pinto (not my fav)), kinda on the small side, although that should be a bonus because most are way too big. The price was very reasonable, under $6 before tax. The place was insanely busy at 6PM on a Tuesday but they were obviously working really hard to keep up and the wait was reasonable. I prefer the taquerias where you follow the preparer down the line and they ask you about options. 

I didn't know about the grilled option, and guessing it's prolly good but expensive. The best smoky browned tortilla burrito in town is Dos Pinos (Two Pineapples) on the north side of Potrero but it's silly expensive and slow. Yeah, I know, nobody is perfect...

I heard someone say they don't have El Pastor :-(

I don't know how I failed to notice this place before. I did like the brisk bustling atmosphere. Maybe the carne asada is great? but the veggie was fresh enough and not very exciting.

For comparison, I tried Little Chihuahua in Noe Valley the other day and the beans and rice burrito was literally just beans and rice. It was inexpensive but super boring. Papalote at 24th & Valencia is super delicious but slow and silly expensive.
author: Paul F.

description: I've had better burritos at SFO. This was a basic burrito and I hate myself for spending that money on it.
author: Caitlin M.

description:
The best taqueria in SF.  I won't eat or pay for any other burrito in the city.  Crispy burrito with carnitas is so good.  
I love this place.
author: D B.

description: Lots of hype about this place. I mean if you're in Mission, you can randomly throw a rock anywhere, and whatever it lands on, you'd have a pretty good chance of landing on a Mexican place that has good food. So when you go one of the top places in the area, you'd expect a lot. Unfortunately, La Taqueria is pretty much the same as anywhere. I had the super burrito with carne asada and everything. It cost $10. It wasn't that great tasting, because it was pretty wet and soggy. There was more juice than meat. And the tiny tissues doesn't do a good job of absorbing anything. The place was packed on a friday night. The seating layout is grab whatever is open, although the seats outside are always guaranteed to be empty. Service was somewhat quick and they were nice. You order at the cashier, cash only.
author: Phan H.

description:
Like many others, I wanted to see what all of the hub-bub was about at the "nation's best Mexican food" place. The line was huuuuge, which I took as a good sign. It moved pretty quickly, despite the length. 

I ordered a carne asada burrito with everything to go. I watched other people receive there food while I waited, and the burritos looked very tasty. Mine, when I received it, not so much...

It was tiny! Way smaller than everybody else. And it was $10! Not worth the money at all. I don't know if this was a fluke or what (maybe because I ordered to go?), but I did not get my money's worth.   

I will probably give this place another chance eventually, but for now I will stick with El Farolito.
author: Will C.

description:
The first time I came here, I came with a co-worker who used to work in the city. I am back a few months later, and I took my fiance to try as one of the only restaurants that you CANNOT be in Mission and not try.

I grew up in a Mexican family, and I can tell you that I have flashbacks to my childhood when I bite into one of those tacos.
author: jennifer b.

description: Late night super tacos gave me food poisoning. DON'T GO LATER IN THE DAY!!!!
author: JD L.

description: These little tacos are so filling!  Amazing place, wonderful and friendly service!
author: matt n.

description:
5 stars...need I say more.  Here it is (depending on your mood):
-Carnitas taco spicy
-Carne Asada burrito add everything
-skip the chips
-Horchata

Life changer, guaranteed :)
author: Joe S.

description:
Came here for dinner on a Tuesday night.  There were a couple of parking spaces near by.

I got the  cabeza with cream and avocado no cheese burrito . Meat was very tender and excellent with the hot sauce at the table. 

Then I ordered the chicken taco which comes with a soft and crunch shell. Chicken was ok bur after using the sauce from the table it was good.

The chips an salsa were excellent very fresh!!

I would come here again to try the cabeza and carne asada tacos.
author: DOM d.

description: The best taqueria EVER. I mostly get carnitas burrito with beans, pick de gallo, and sour cream. When I'm in the mood for a taco, the carne asada taco "durado" (crispy) is nothing short of perfection. Not sure if their meat is organic but I don't ever have an upset stomach from anything I eat there as opposed to other taquerias I've been too. Lastly, DO NOT forget to drench your burritos and tacos in the salsa verde. I've honestly never had better.
author: Jazmina F.

description: My friend is the son of the owner of this place and when he said his restaurant is considered the best taqueria in town, i thought in my mind its probs just exaggeration. When i got there, i was instantly surprised with how crowded it was. When i tried the food, i understood why. I got a beef taco with added avocado and sour cream and boy was it the best taco ive ever had. I also had the chicken and avocado flour quesadilla and i didnt like it too much. But nonetheless the taco was still AMAZING.
author: Jenny N.

description:
This place is the next level of burrito joint. It already has a reputation so was predictably packed at lunchtime, yet they worked through the line blazingly fast. Assembly line process to pay, assembly line process to prepare. Food just comes fast. 

This was our first time there, so we got the carne asade and carnitas super burritos to get a good feel for the place. They were a bit smaller than I expected from the reviews, but still a good size. The carne asada was super tender and the carnitas were juicy and perfecly cooked. The ingredients were mixed very well so every bite got a bit of everything. Juicy burritos so prepare to embrace the mess. One of the best burritos ive had and the efficient service sealed the deal.
author: Trevor S.

description:
It pains me to do this... I have been here 5 to 6 times in my life.  I wish I could visit more, but it is just far from where I live.  I use to love love love the chorizo burrito.  How can you not love the chorizo burrito?

I was just there a week ago at 3 pm and got the burrito... it was awful!  It wasn't the same intense flavor of the salty, spicy and oily chorizo!

The chorizo was dry.  I am so disappointed.  The tacos weren't great either.  This sucks big time!  I can't believe I'll have to settle for Gordos... boo.
author: Frank M.

description:
I was on a mission to eat at as many places on 7x7 in one day and came here post-breakfast snack at Tartine. It was packed, around noon, obviously pointing out how popular this place is for lunch. Many of the customers were Mexican, again making one believe the tacos have got to be good! 

I ordered a few carnitas tacos (as recommended by 7x7) and it was tasty! I was def not disappointed. I will need to get use to eating corn tortillas as opposed to flour tortillas (more authentic).
author: Angie Q.

description: Good taste burrito just a little pricey & burritos are not that big would recommend this place
author: Cyn R.

description:
I love tacos! I can't get enough of them! The crisp texture and delicious meat filling make an amazing combo..


Now there are many options in San Francisco when choosing a restaurant to get your taco fix: Nick's Crispy Tacos, Tropisueno, El Farolito, the list can go on and on. The only place I now go to is La Taqueria; they make the most amazing tacos.

The best way to order them:

- Ask for two carne asada tacos
- Order them crispy (this makes a huge difference)
- Order it with cheese, salsa, and extra hot sauce
- Order a beer

Consume your beer as you wait for your number to be called. 

Pick up your order and try not to eat so quickly. The combination of thei special green hot sauce, smoky flavor of  carne asada, fresh salsa, and the cheese between the two tortillas make these tacos so delicious, it's actually making my mouth water right now. 

If you ever plan on visiting San Francisco, you must visit this place! Very easy to get to if you are coming from Downtown Union Square; just take Bart to 24th st and it's a five minute walk from the stop! Otherewise, if you live in SF, be warned, this place becomes habit-forming!
author: Joel V.

description:
They have some of the greatest tacos in the city.

But not your average Mexican food prices. Tacos start at $3.50 but that only gives you the meat, salsa and corn tortilla. Cheese, guac and sour cream are all extra so really, a taco is $5+. But that's okay - they're gigantic and truly delicious. 2 tacos do the trick for me.

Try the carnitas and carne asada for sure. The chicken is meh...just that annoying shredded chicken you love to hate. 

They also serve beer...though I've seen people sneak their own in so I guess that works too.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
The Carne Asada beef is juicy 9/10 times. Sometimes it is meh.

If you get the tacos, be sure to order the deep fried shell which they combine with the soft corn tortilla.

Chips are nice and crispy. 

Strawberry fresca has bits of strawberry and is refreshing.



This is the only Mexican joint I know of that closes at 9pm. :(
author: Evan W.

description: Amazing!!! I had the best chicken taco and strawberry fresco. I'm dying to know what they marinade/cook their chicken in. Somebody find out and let me know. Need to try to replicate it here in Atlanta with my family's meals.
author: Julia J.

description: If you ask me about my childhood, I will tell you I grew up going to the library and taking weekly trips into the Mission with my family. One of our stops (if we were lucky) was to La Taqueria. Back then, I would get carne asada tacos because that's all I could eat. Now, I've moved on to the chorizo burrito. I'm very picky about my chorizo, but La Taqueria uses some top notch chorizo that's flavorful but not too greasy! Pair that with some horchata (also some of the best horchata I've had) and I'm pretty much the happiest camper ever. I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE this place!
author: Lucina P.

description:
Taco, taco, taco. Did I say taco? Taco.

That's all you need here. I've tried the lengua, cabeza, and vegetarian (regular without meat) tacos and that's the only thing I recommend.

They also serve burritos but you can get that elsewhere for much better, it's just mediocre here.

Make sure when you order, get the crispy taco. They fry one corn tortilla and then wrap another unfried corn tortilla outside.

After you've tacoed out, head next door at Dianda's for dessert.
author: Allen C.

description: I can't believe I had never tried La Taqueria until recently. Now every time my fiancé and I head to the city, we have to stop here and then right over to Mission Pie afterwards. The super carne asada burrito is ah-mazing, and that's an understatement. I don't know how they do it, but each time we come here, it's consistently delicious. The meat is cooked perfectly and full of flavor. The burrito itself is loaded with the right amount of beans, cheese, rice, guacamole, sour cream- the works! Each bite taste like heaven and if you haven't already been here, you must give it a try. Be warned, CASH ONLY!
author: Victoria N.

description:
Still one of my favorite places in The City!
Tacos so good they practically bring tears to my eyes.
I had to write an update because I put up another pic of those absolutely fantastic tacos!!!
author: Barry A.

description:
4 stars for the burrito, not the best in town but the carnitas are darn good.

5 stars for the dorado taco.  Always dorado!
author: Nick W.

description: Hidden charges for avocado, for sour cream, for veggies... for everything you'd expect to come in a super burrito. Basic burrito price is for beans and meat only.
author: Orin Z.

description: Carnita tacos dorados.....AWESOME!!!!!  One of the best tacos I have ever had in my life.  Filled with tons of fresh goodness, and the owner working the register is a hoot.  Worth a trip to the Mission.
author: Gamaliel E.

description:
Being a tacqueria on mission street means the bar is pretty high, and these guys don't deliver. 

1) No rice. It's not even an option on the menu. 
2) Extra charge for "no beans," and they fill in the empty space with salsa. 
3) Base burrito is pricey at $6.50

Basically, I paid $9 for a very mediocre burrito that was about one third meat, two thirds salsa, and had a smidgen of cheese. With La Corneta just a few blocks down, that's pretty inexcusable.
author: David S.

description: I was referred to this place undoubtedly the worst burrito I've ever eaten they don't serve rice this super is not a super burrito its a mini burrito, I asked for refried beans I got pinto beans the only thing makes it different from a regular burrito is a couple ingredients but the size is not feeling, my mom got the super chirizo casadia very greasy not health conscious at all, worst thing about this place is they don't take credit  cash inly, the worst $20 spent on 2 food items ever, this food isn't even worth the garbage can its going down the garbage compactor,
author: James F.

description:
It is impossible to read any kind of newspaper review/magazine article about burritos in the bay area and not see this place. Just look at their wall, it's covered with Zagat Rateds, Best Places to Eat, Top 10s--and I agree with all of them. It's funny, everybody always raves about the burritos in San Diego and Southern California, but when I was there for four years, I couldn't stop missing THIS place.

I've yet to find a simple Carne Asada burrito that's as good as this place, anywhere in California. I just don't think it's possible. If you like, simple high quality ingredients in your burrito, you MUST try this place. The steak the use is freshly grilled, perfectly seasoned, and high quality meat.

I always stick with the Carne Asada burrito, extra avocado, extra sour cream, just the way my friend introduced it to me many years ago. Just thinking about it makes me drool, just like the countless number of days I used to cut school to come here to satisfy my cravings.

And don't you dare forget the hot sauce. Whatever they put in that green sauce, I have no idea, but I just to steal me a bottle of that and put it on everything!!!

Just, YUM, please go try it if you're ever in the area.
author: Trevor L.

description: Burritos are good (dorado style) and so are the chips and salsa.. But this place is too hyped up! They charge you extra for just about everything that you want to put in your burrito and it's cash only!!
author: Mertani G.

description:
I come from New York to eat here. Enough said. It's amazing. 
Everything it should be. Its a must. And make sure to order with Guac. yum.
author: Martina R.

description:
Esssf Mexican food purists, fellow so-cal brethren and even my girlfriend have denounced Gordos, regulating it to adjectives such as lackadaisical and passable.  Instead, they declare either La Taqueria or El Faro as their own individual sanctum of burrito eclaircissement.  

Forever memorialized , Caesar Chavez, by the State of California, I finished an mid a.m. lifting sess and upon walking out, was hit with the most incredible cosmic rays of 2011.  It was glorious, blinding, and I felt moisture begin to accumulate under my pits.  I surmised Helios had ceased the mourning of Phaeton and has once again taken the helm of his chariot.  In gratitude for Helios bringing out the sun, I would have a cheat day and eat whatever and started looking at my phonebook to see who would join me on this joyous quest.  Alas, nobody gets Caesar Chavez off, so like a loner, howbeit a very happy loner,  I punched thehyperdrive for La Taq's coordinates and was off.  Parking was pretty easy, however, this was a working day and well past noon so take that advice with a grain of salt.  I worked around aimlessly trying to find it, backtracking and zooming in on my iphone gps and nearly walked by it.  I don't know how I did as it does say La Taqueria in very bold letters and was packed, even at 1:30.  Taking off my shades and waiting in line, I got trucked by a big boned woman, resulting in me dropping my shades.  She looked back and nodded apologetically, however, that nod would not magically piece back my sunglasses if they were to break; luckily, they did not.  A worker in line took my order.  I ordered a one carnita taco and one carne asada taco with sour cream and guacamole.  They garbled it back at me, however, did not know whether she got the correct item or not.  When I got to the register, the man told me $17.  I gave him a quick wtf look and told him I only ordered two tacos.  He laughed heartily, scolded the woman who took my order in a humorous fashion and adjusted the price accordingly.  2 tacos = $11.  Geezus christ.  Mexican food is supposed to be cheap...good god.  However, he looked like he was a salacious fellow in his prime as he was quick of tongue.  I can definitely appreciate that characteristic.

They whipped up my order very quick.  Taking the food to my seat to snap a pic to make A.Hahn jellie, I was taken back.  These were not regular street tacos you get for a buck.  These were huge, about 3 street tacos in one.  It was overflowing with beans and meat with sour cream defying gravity and perched on top.  The carne asada taco was okay.  The meat wasn't that flavorful despite being plentiful.  The spicy sauce was perfect.  It provided an instant kick, however, faded once the tongue developed an immunity to it.  The carnita taco was a lot better; the pork was crispy and had that snap, however did not amaze me.  Don't get me wrong.  It was good but only on par with the carnitas at regular taco trucks.  Taco trucks do not usually put sour cream and guac so you can appreciate the meat.  La Taq puts a load of condiments so its hard to singularly appreciate the meat as there are so many meldings of flavour.  I felt the food was overpriced for what is essentially supposed to be cheap chow.  Maybe they are taking advantage of their fame?  I would recommend this place however want to debunk the whole myth of this being the holy mecca of mexican food people want you to believe.  I do regret not getting their homemade strawberry fresca tho.  Next stop, El Faro.
author: Brian V.

description:
I am not sure why this place is rated so highly.  I have eaten here three times, but each time has been a disappointment.  I like tacos better than burritos, generally, but here they serve the large tacos with a bad balance of meat to salsa/onions/cilantro (too much meat!).  I recommend that you stick with the burritos.  However, even here, the burritos are not good (I like my burritos plain - meat, rice, beans, and salsa).  This is mainly because of the meat.  I have tried the pollo, the carnitas, and the carne asade, but none tasted good, and I recommend that you, gentle reader, stay away from the tasteless boiled chicken.  If you feel the need to disguise the taste of the meat with sour cream, cheese, and avocado, be my guest.

Horchata was pretty standard.  No free chips.
author: Go S.

description:
There's no Mexicans in Hawaii, let alone Mexican food, so it felt like my life completely changed when I moved here. All of a sudden, I have Mexican friends and the tortilla is *this* close to replacing rice as my staple starch. My mom even said, "Do you still know what Pho is?" Hahaha.

My Mexican friend brought me to La Taqueria, which he (and his aunt) claim serves the most authentic, most delicious Mexican food in all of SF. Who am I to second guess him, right? I'd definitely be offended if someone doubted my Vietnamese culinary knowledge. Anyway, I got a taco and he got a quesadilla, both with carne asada and everything. It hit the spot on a cold, rainy, Saturday afternoon and was simply delicioso. I don't know what's in the carne asada here (crack?), but it was so flavorful, tender, and nicely browned. Washed it down with a pineapple smoothie (so good!) and I couldn't ask for anything else.

Well, except two more tacos. Haha. My friend said I could only handle one, so I only got one--but next time I'm getting at least two AND a burrito. He may know Mexican food, but he obviously doesn't know my stomach capacity. I need to eat, I'm growing (horizontally)!
author: Liz T.

description: Fantastic! I got the super burrito, and it was absolutely top notch. Long line, but well worth the wait.
author: Rajesh S.

description:
Yes, this is it.  "La Taqueria" - the name says it all.  There is no other - this is THE place for tacos.  I have heard that this is the best taco. Period.  The best taco ever made happens right there at La Taqueria everyday.  Visit if you can!

I love these tacos for a few reasons:

1) TWO corn shell tortillas with melted cheese in between them. TO DIE FOR!
2) they are wrapped up in paper perfect for handling
3) the meat is exceptionally delicious - any.
4) guac & sour cream...ahhh!
5) red & green sauce squirt bottles at your table

Yes, you will have to wait in line.  Yes, you have to pay for every little extra.  But for my money and time it is worth it 100% of the time.  

If there is a cathedral of tacos - a holy grail of tacos - the papacy of tacos - it is La Taqueria.
author: scott a.

description:
almost 5 stars, but need to try other items on their menu first before i give them the 5th star.  their Burrito is soft and flavorful compared to others i've had.  it's filling but not too filling that you're bloated. i could finish their whole Super Burrito in one sitting.  usually can only go as far as 1/2 to 2/3 of a Super Burrito from other places.  must be due to the lack of rice.

it's good and don't let the line fool you, it does move fast.

would recommend they move the order/cashier stand towards the back though instead of having people line up, order/pay and then back around to pick-up the orders.  creates as huge traffic (people) jam.

or maybe just have people order through the window facing the street, that will make the people traffic flow more smoothly.
author: TIGGER P.

description:
BEST. CARNITAS. TACOS. EVER.

This is about as good as it gets for tacos. Juicy carnitas topped with salsa. Simple and to the point awesome! I always wanted to ask if they sell their carnitas on its own because it's THAT good and I always wanted to leave with more than my tummy could handle.

At $3.5 per taco, you actually get a lot of food, they don't skimp on the meat on their tacos. 2 of those meaty tacos can really fill you up. And I absolutely love their green tomatillo hot sauce. It gives the meat that extra kick and your palettes literally go from happy to being in heaven!

I've been coming to this place for a while now, and the quality of the tacos has always been great. This is definitely a solid place for great Mexican food when you really crave it! I would recommend this place to everyone who loves Mexican food.
author: Joyce C.

description: Took my son here for his 30th birthday. He wanted AUTHENTIC Mexican food. Food good, but guacamole could be tastier.
author: Maida S.

description:
The burritos are ok, but rather flat. I've been eating a lot of El Metate (welcome to flavor country!) and the difference is quite striking. La Taqueria burritos have a lot more moisture, no rice, and soft boiled chicken (flavor-neutral). Metate has flavorful rice and offers grilled chicken, their burritos are relatively dry.

I know, I know, you can't please all of the people all of the time.
author: Jeremy S.

description: We got the el dorado style beef burrito and it was amazing. The wait for the food was 20+ minutes after ordering, but pretty worth it. Would go back to try the tacos that other people seem to be raving about.
author: Karen C.

description:
Carnitas tacos seem a bit overrated considering all the attention from various food bloggers and the 7x7 list. Sure, they were okay (3 stars), but really nothing absolutely special. 

Oh and minus 2 stars because I found hair in my food (gross!), thus the 1 star rating.
author: Willk W.

description: So, this place is pretty good..but. I really loved it when the Warriors fans ran the place. So I used to live about 2 blocks away, and came here pretty regularly in the 70's and 80"s. There was a couple who ran the place that were really great, and they were huge Warriors fans. One time the woman made me wait to order because Purvis was at the line for some clinching foul shots. Totally endearing to me. They opened a place in Rincon when that was renovated that was good too. Then one day a banner appeared that said "original owners are back". WTF, you let someone make the place really good then pull the wool out from under them! At least the "original owners" kept the staff. I think the guy grilling has been there as long as I have been going there. We both are a lot grayer, and Purvis is probably hoisting those rainbows at the senior center. So, I don't like this place mostly because of that, but food wise, the tacos are good, but the burritos totally miss the mark of what an SF burrito should be. I guess being old school, and well, fuckin' old (obviously since I was coming here in the 70's). I just want some rice in my burrito.
author: James T.

description:
I have been coming here for yearssss...and 20 years later, they still have THE BEST burritos/tacos, hands down. 

Can you say juicy?!?!
author: Jackilyn B.

description: Everything is fresh and delicious.  Portions are generous and the food  just packed with flavor.  Their carne asada burrito is my favorite, but there really isn't a bad dish here.  I'm not Mexican, but this is probably my favorite place to eat Mexican food.
author: Jayce O.

description:
I was in the Mission for the weekend and I stopped by La Taqueria with my friend for a quick and cheap bite to eat.  Good decision, chica!  Best lengua taco I've ever had.  Get two, douse it all with their spicy salsa verde, add an horchata and you are good to go!

The boss at the counter gives out free hugs too!
author: Marissa G.

description:
Worst taco I've ever had in my life, definitely the worst in the Mission, IMO -- and expensive!

Carnitas and beans tasted like canned dog food. Salsa had nothing to it, no flavor. Tortillas were fried in lard prior to serving.

Never again.
author: Zara E.

description:
The good - beef tongue tacos

The bad - more expensive than you would expect for a tacos

The verdict - Ordered 1 beef/steak (carne asada) and 1 beef tongue (lingua) taco with guac and sour cream.  The beef was decent.  The flavor was tasty and wasn't too chewy.  The beef tongue was definitely what took the prize.  Tons of flavor and the meat was so tender and soft.  I will definitely skip the beef next time.  The green salsa on the tables provided just enough spice on the tacos.  But at the price of $3.50 for a standard taco and guac/sour cream/cheese all required additional cash.  I can say I will probably not visit this place too often.  My 2 tacos came in at over $10.  Not worth it.  Go to El Farolito if you want a good and reasonably priced Mexican food.
author: Allen T.

description: Tried this place today after being so confused about which place to eat in the mission. There are just so many places to choose from. Every time I pass by here there are a lot of people and I saw many good reviews on Yelp. But I also judged that this place is not as good as it seems. My judgement was on spot. I was mainly craving for beef so I got the carne asada thinking that it would have rice in it. Wrong! How can a burrito have no rice in it. Very disappointed. Aside from having no rice in it, sour cream and cheese was extra. I thought the burrito wasn't that special. And also I agree with the other person who said that the burrito was dripping -it was a little difficult and messy to eat. The green chili sauce on the tables tasted good though. Other than that I will pass on this place. Overrated and expensive.
author: Carmen L.

description: I don't always eat Mexican, but when I do I prefer LA Taqueria. Actually I will only eat La Taqueria. Their carne asada is my favorite. I get it with everything. It costs $9 something but I've also paid as much as $12. I didn't ask since I didn't know. They don't give out salsa and there is no salsa bar. I always ask for salsa but lots of times they don't understand me. I'm moving out of the area soon so I'm probably going to eat 1 or 2 more burritos before I'm out if here. There is almost always a line. They close whenever they want, not at the listed times. I've walked by many times at night after work and they're already closed at 7 or 8. Maybe they close when they run out of meat?
author: x x.

description:
This is a very lively and interesting looking place. However, the downside of it being lively is the lines that come with it. I arrived here having to wait in line for about 5-10 minutes to have my order taken, regardless of the workers moving as fast as they could.
NOTE: Take your order home, visit this place early, or hope someone leaves because you will have trouble finding a seat.

I order two Carnita tacos, and luckily I didn't have to wait long for them to make it. It looked really good, and smelled great. As I sat down and took a bite of my taco I didn't quite get the great taste I thought I would have. Don't judge a a taco by it's toppings I guess?.. Pun intended if you catch it. There was this green sauce, and it gave a spice to the taco though, and that definitely gave it the flavor boost it needed.

The size cannot compare to other tacos I've had in the past, but in terms of flavor it cannot live up to the tacos I've tasted. Unless they will have that green spicy sauce all the time to boost the flavor, I would not consider coming back to this place. The taco is good and the sauce makes it better, but I've DEFINITELY tasted better tacos than this.
author: Richard C.

description:
Overall stars: I actually have to give them 4.5 stars....keep reading, I'll explain!

Food: Fresh, flavorful and good quality. The tortillas are heated upon order, the cheese is so yummy, the salsa and guac are heavenly and everything else is the real deal. I don't know if I really know what real Mexican food is like but I really felt like I was eating food with mama's love! I had the burrito with the works, AMAZING! My husband had the carne asada quesadilla....ohh WOW! The cheese goodness was heavenly...only complaint was that they they fried the outside of the quesadilla with too much oil; totally unnecessary.

Price: Okay, so here is where I have to ding them by a half star! A burrito comes with just the basics.....tortilla, meat and beans....no cheese, no guac, no sour cream, no salsa....all of that is EXTRA! WHAT?!?! A basic burrito is $6.50, but after the fixings, it's about $9.75+. I guess when you know people will come here b/c of it's great reputation, it doesn't matter what they charge for!

Location: So it's located in the Mission district. I've only lived in SF for about 3 days and it's really not the nicest part of town. On the flip side, there are some great produce shops around La Taqueria that you can go to for cheap fruits and vegetables!

Overall: Totally going back again!!!!! LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place!
author: LAIKA K.

description:
What happened?

The Mission is known for great eateries, especially Latin eateries. With all the variety that the Mission has to offer, I just wasn't impressed with La Taqueria.

For starters, there are no black bean options. For the Mission, I'm surprised the healthier fare is missing. I like black beans. It's yummy & fills me up without making me sleepy. Pinto and refried beans make me sleepy and bloated... that, among other things.  

Second, there are no al pastor or shrimp options. What if I'm really hungry and my appetite calls for shrimp AND carne asada in my burrito? What if I want al pastor in my tacos rather then carnitas? I guess I will never know, at least not from this place. Don't get me wrong, the burrito was good. However, it was disappointingly thin & crammed w/ so much sour cream that it overpowered everything else. What happened to the meat? 

Third, I paid for chips and salsa. Usually chips and salsa are complimentary, in this case it wasn't. I was hoping it would at least taste good. Instead, the salsa watered down the chips. Because they didn't give the option of putting the salsa to the side, the chips lost their crispy crunch. 
 
Fourth, affordability is lacking. It cost us about $25 for a regular-sized burrito, 2 tacos, chips, and a drink. I don't mind paying that price if it was any good. 

Bottom line: I may be griping, but there are better taquerias out there in the Mission, ones that offer a better bang for your buck. 

Besides, I'm female and I like my options. When it all boils down to it, that is what La Taqueria is lacking.  

Tips: 
*Taqueria Cancun & Taqueria Guadalajara are always a fave of mine.         
*If you are following the 7x7, King Bakery and their delicious coconut buns are located right across the street.
author: Joy A.

description:
see, i like these place, but what I dislike is the state of the tomatoes they make their salsa with.

They just not ready to be eaten.
author: Davis E.

description: Best food in the world. There a reason why they were named the best burrito in AMERICA!! anytime I'm in the mission i always stop by here even if I'm not hungry. Huge portions, freshly made guac, not skimpy on the sour cream at all. VERY VERY well priced. Then again it is Mexican food which is cheap but nothing is cheap in San Francisco.
author: Michael C.

description: I love this place so much. The carne asada burrito is Outta this world if your from SF and never tried this place go right away
author: Malic Z.

description: So good and so fast! Best quick Mexican food I have had in a long time. Line was out the door but we got through the line and received our food in under 15 min.  Anything quesadilla will make you very happy.
author: Luke G.

description:
This place has a very cool looking entrance. When I got here there was so many people it was hard to move around. Waited in line for about 6 minutes. They worked fast. Everything looked so good from what people were eating. I came with some friends to get some tacos. Right after I ordered, luckily someone left and we got seats. The customers here are pretty nice.

I ordered 4 Tacos. 2 carne asada and 2 carnita tacos. I like how they were wrapped. Looked really good and smelled even better. Don't know what the green sauce on the table was but I used it right away. It made it even better. 

If this place was closer to where I live I would be coming very often. You can't hate this place unless you don't know food.
author: Hui L.

description: I always get the same thing:  two vegetarian tacos with guacamole and a sandia agua fresca.  It never disappoints!  It can be a little hairy at times wondering if I'll find a place to sit down because it's so popular, but by the time I get my food, a place will magically open up.  I love how the tacos have cheese between the two tortillas, and it's slightly crispy.  Yum yum!
author: Tess G.

description: Easily the best burritos I have ever had. I have been here at least ten times, and they have yet to dissapoint. Premium quality and authenticity beat out the small (compared to other taquerias) portions, and the loud and cheerful environment only adds to the experience.
author: Eyal L.

description:
If I could pick my last meal and it happened to be lunch, I'd be eating at La Taqueria.

1 Tongue Taco, extra spicy with everything
1 carne asada/chorizo burrito, fried with everything 
1 strawberry fresca
author: R C.

description:
My friend took me to La Taqueria when I visited SF a few months ago--best Mexican food I've had outside of Mexico! 

Of course, I'm from the eastcoast, so I wouldn't have much to compare it to within the US, but it definitely beats the Mexican places over here. Still, was delicious! and right in the middle of the Mission District. Cheap, delicious eats--can't beat that.
author: Ellie W.

description: Awesome. Meant to leave half of the burrito for later, ate the whole thing because it was wonderful.
author: Grace A.

description: After you opt for all the requisite toppings (avocado, cheese, sour cream), a $3 taco easily becomes a $6 one. But, one portion is usually enough, and a watermelon juice to go along makes it just about right. Clean, open air atmosphere with bench seats for dining in but still more of a grab-n-go spot in between meals. Quick service and cash only.
author: Jenn W.

description:
As the #3 item on the 2010 Big Eat List, I expected the best taco I've ever tasted. It was in the Mission, afterall. But it wasn't the high expectation that led to this 1 star rating. It was the very, very bland food. The pork in the infamous carnitas taco was dry and tasteless. Even the salsa was bland. The tomatoes were near colorless and lacking of freshness. I added guac to the taco and it was not only ridiculous how much they charged but how little they gave. 

I'm not sure if it was an off day. Either way, there's no way I'm coming back.
author: Tina T.

description:
I'd always heard really great things about this place, so one day during my lunch hour I ran to catch the bus at 16th and took it down to 24th.

The place was pretty crowded which always makes me a bit leery because I feel that the Mexican food places people pounce on and rave about are often overrated.

I got myself some soft tacos of carnitas. My usual order at any Mexican place. My tacos were sooo good. The salsa was spicy (for once!) and their tortillas are clearly handmade corn tortillas. 

IMO, any place that has freshly made thick corn tortillas is a go to place.
author: Vanessa F.

description:
The only reason i am writing a review (the last time i checked there were only 100 or so, but now there are 551) is in case friends want a good referral to the best taco ANYWHERE.... 

$5 each - order it with everything + crispy. Yum. gotta try it to understand.
author: Adam X.

description:
Nuh-uh.  Why this place is so expensive is beyond me.  I ordered 3 tacos the last time I was there (and by last, I mean--I'm never going again): Carnitas, Lengua, and Grilled Chicken.  

All were rather forgettable.

Sure, they stuff the tacos to capacity, so I guess that's where your extra dollar is doing, but the salsa, while visibly present in the pictures, left no impression whatsoever upon my taste buds.  In fact, I had to remind myself to mention that the salsa was even there to begin with.  

The carnitas were mushy and flavorless.  The best carnitas I've ever had have always had that nice mix of saltiness, juiciness, and crispiness on the outer layer.  They shouldn't even use that name for what they serve here, as it'll just confuse people.  This was not carnitas.

The lengua and grilled chicken were average at best. And I'm being really kind.

Look no further than Taqueria Vallarta, where you will get a REAL taco for just over a dollar. Sure, they're smaller, but one taco at Vallarta packs more flavor than all 3 tacos from La Taqueria combined!
author: Michael J.

description:
it's quite good but I'm not stuck on it!  flavor is good but nothing too special... it's clean it's a little pricey go eat at dona mago on 16th for authentic flavor... and much sweeter service from the staff... not the stiff lipped register persons here... no thanks.
but the food is fine
author: Adam O.

description: Amazing. Very close, if not the best taco I've ever had. Owner was awesome. Great suggestions. Get it hard shell inside with cheese.
author: Jordan I.

description: Best chicken tacos in the city. They are so juicy and they pair so well with the green salsa on the table.
author: Amin S.

description: Best burrito I ever had. Got a chicken super burrito and I said the magic words to have the whole thing fried, which transformed it into a wrap of ecstasy. They don't use rice, which I was skeptical about at first, but that left more room for meat. Amazing meat, at that. It was some of the best chicken I've ever had, either in or out of a burrito.
author: Ben R.

description: Is really good tacos, I'm Mexican, but is really bad service and is to small, everybody looking for chair and the owner don't do nothing for fix it. I'm so sorry, was my last time I when there, I don't like be in middle of many people. Is very uncomfortable eat like it.
author: Fabian P.

description: Amazing tacos!!! You have to get them crispy and with everything: salsa, guacamole, cheese, I mean the works. My son loves their burritos as well. A+++
author: Leslie J.

description: Seriously, how awesome is this place? I'm always down for finding new taco places whenever I'm traveling, and I stumbled upon this gem by word of mouth. I ordered a chicken taco, and holy hell, I wish my stomach would have expanded so I could have eaten way more.
