The chicken was seasoned just right with the perfect about of tomato salsa that wasn't too spicy. I rave about this place to everyone, especially when I find out people are going to SF. Don't pass this place up. SO GOOD!
author: Emily D.

description: Ordered two tacos.  They gave me two quesadillas.  Refused to take them back or switch out for what I ordered. Strange.... Just ate the quesadillas, which were pretty bad.  Wish I got the tacos I ordered.
author: Scott H.

description:
I love tacos, so I had to come to La Taqueria and try their carnitas taco (I'm also a slave to the 7x7 list). I guess I shouldn't be surprised that the Mission would have such delicious tacos.

A tip for n00bs like me: you order at the register, claim your table, then wait for your number to be called.

In addition to a carnitas taco, I ordered a carne asada taco. No cheese or guac, which I'm really regretting now, but I'm not sure where they would have put it, since the tacos were overflowing with meaty, pico-y goodness. Two was definitely enough for dinner.

And the mysterious green sauce is so good. No wonder all the bottles were more than half empty.
author: Sarah Z.

description:
"If I was on death row, La Taqueria would be my last meal." This is how I describe my passion for this food to friends who have not been enlightened. 

I'm a San Francisco native and I've been eating here for over 10 years. I've tried all the popular taquerias in the city: La Corneta, Pancho Villa, El Farolito, El Toro, El Metate, Gordo's (I was boyhood friends with the owner's son). And I can say, hands down, that La Taqueria has these places covered. Even today, I try to go back to these places occasionally to remind myself just how good La Taqueria is.

This is the place that I am always excited to take visiting friends - and then I enjoy reveling in their high praise.

So what makes this place so good?

1) NO RICE: This is the only place that seems to understand the superfluousness of rice in a burrito. Rice is simply filler that crowds out the more tasty, expensive ingredients.
2) Tender Meats: All the meats are grilled fresh. My favorites are the carnitas and carne asada. Very juicy. Cooked perfectly.
3) Salsa Verde: The squeeze bottles allow you to heat up every bite.
4) Fresh Guacamole: Their guacamole is in fact only avocado, salt, and lime juice. Simplicity is the ultimate in sophistication.

Note: I've been told the horchatas are great but I can't speak from experience. They just aren't my thing.

The most common objection to this place (and you can verify this by perusing the sub-par yelp reviews)  is the price - a burrito w/ everything and a large fountain drink will run you $11. For some reason, some people are offended by the prospect of paying a price premium for Mexican food.  But in this country, we are not communists. If an entrepreneur produces a superior product, he deserves to be compensated. These naysayers obviously hate freedom and want the communists to win.
author: Chris F.

description: My last review 2 years ago wasn't fair. I tried this place again recently and got their speciality instead, which is the carnitas taco. It is pricey but its very tasty.
author: Eric S.

description: La Taqueria is my favorite taqueria in SF. I grew up in SF eating at many different taquerias and I still gotta hand it to this place. They have the freshest burritos one could ask for. No wonder the place is always packed
author: Marcelo P.

description:
La Taqueria is hands-down the best authentic Mexican joint in San Francisco (and is among the best I've eaten anywhere).  

There's nothing even remotely upscale about this taqueria, its interior, or indeed, its location (all of which are or appear to be rather questionable).  But the quality of the food they produce is unequaled anywhere within easy driving distance.  At La Taqueria, you won't find a dizzying array of options on the menu (posted on the wall above and behind the cash register).  They focus instead strictly on the basics: burritos, tacos, quesadillas; chicken, pork, etc.  They don't even offer guacamole, but rather straight-up avocado, which is always perfectly ripe.  There's pico de gallo, and a hotter salsa to choose from, and that pretty much covers it.  

The beauty of La Taqueria's food is not to be found in the novel or complex arrangement of ingredients, but rather in their flawless preparation of simple, fresh ingredients -- which, when combined to form a burrito, taco or quesadilla, result in the most satisfyingly tasty Mexican meal you'll find in San Francisco.  

As noted, La Taqueria is in a rather shady part of the Mission, so it's best to visit during daylight hours, or as part of a group of friends (and this is definitely not a good place to flash a wallet stuffed with cash, etc.).  And because the dining room is small and always packed, you may want to order your food for take-out, and then bring it home to feast on.
author: S. K.

description: The BEST Mex in ALL THE LAND. Generous portions, cooked with attention to detail. And I didn't even sample the secret menu. NEXT TIME!
author: Wrath N.

description:
This might be it. This might be my favorite taco spot in the mission. 
There - I said it. 
The guacamole is fresh and yummy. The cartitas is super tasty.

The owner cannot be described in a yelp review. 
Go Here! Eat!
author: Unkl- T.

description: You need to be up for a boisterous atmosphere, confusing lines (ask a local) and shared tables but it's worth their one-of-a-kind grilled (dore) burrito.  As others have noted, this option is NOT on the menu so be sure to specially request it.   Menu is relatively simple so you can be ready to order when it's your turn.  Have someone save a table while you pay (they turn over pretty fast), then they'll call your number for pick up.  Even on a crowded Wednesday night, our order was ready in less than 15 minutes.  Take out is another option but there's nothing like eating a grilled burrito fresh.  I'd stay away from the speciality sodas (we tried mango and tamarindo which were thick and syrupy) but that's just my taste.  There is just one size of burrito (basic - beans, meat and salsa but very generous) and you can expand it by adding avocado and cheese.  Incredible and tasty value for the money.
author: Liz S.

description: Great tacos for a steal! I came from New York for the weekend and journeyed to the Mission to eat these delicious masterpieces. I reco getting the juice drinks as they are quite fresh - not artificial tasting at all.
author: Mary G.

description: This place is good, don't get me wrong. The tacos are delicious and large with seemingly good quality meat. Unfortunately, they're also a decent amount more expensive than some other Mission taco spots, the restaurant can get packed, and the line loads from the back of the restaurant for some reason.
author: Russ L.

description:
Given that this place already has 250+ reviews, it's a given that I'm not gonna cover any new ground here, so I'll keep it short and simple (like Fady).

1: The food is good. Carnitas deliciosos.

2: The crispy tacos are like those double decker tacos you saw at Taco Bell some years back, but they aren't disgusting. In fact, when stuffed with the above they are ridiculously good.

3: This place is kind of nickle and dimey. The tacos are $3.50 to begin with, but they charge you an extra .50 cents to $1.00 if you want cheese, avocado and sour cream. You now have a $5 taco ...
author: Wes T.

description:
Still freakin' delicious. But everytime I come here, I see people eating burritos!!! It's ALLL about the "tacos dorados" - I mean, when something isn't on the menu, doesn't that signal to you in flashin' lights that it's going to be fantabulous?

Maybe they aren't Yelpers, educated in the way of tacos dorado.  *sigh* and on I go to educate the world about the greatness of Yelp.
author: Alita M.

description: Not my thing, small place, with limited number of tables. The burrito with carne asada was alright. Not too filling, definitely under a pound, where other places check in at over 1 1/3 lb. The cook makes tacos with his bare hands, manly, but I would prefer him wear gloves. I was expecting a lot more, based on all the reviews, but nothing special here.
author: Try E.

description: If you are coming here for a burrito, you are mistaken . The tacos dorados here are life , a little pricey and crowded but these babies are worth it all
author: Andrea V.

description:
Average.  Definitely not worth the hype.  There are so many better taquerias in SF.

I would've actually given them 3 stars... but they charged me extra to hold the beans.  What a travesty.

Do yourself a favor and head over to Farolito, Cancun, or Guadalajara.
author: Jaymar C.

description: It was frighteningly busy but they churned customers out like no other. Also, they don't really tell you how to order or where to stand but somehow everyone figures it out. The manager also was nice enough to give me a free drink. So A+ for customer service! The tacos are a generous portion and delicious! I love crispy tortillas so I was sold. I saw them make some quesadillas that I will definitely be trying next time. It looked delicious! All in all, wasn't sure what to expect going in but it was a good meal.
author: Linda Z.

description: I had a Carnitas taco and a Beef Head (aka cheek) taco and they were both fantastic. The Beef Head was my favourite, as I really like cheek. I think I'll be a bit more adventurous next time and try the tongue.
author: Kelso H.

description:
I was told to try La taqueria for the best burrito in all of san francisco. 

1) For $6.50 I was expecting something a tad bigger. 
2) The Carne Asada was excellent and tasted exactly the same as Gourmet taco shop in Sonoma (my hometown favorite). There I could have double the portion and added rice, beans, guacamole, and salsa for $5.75
3) The horchata was excellent, but expensive as well.
4) Look elsewhere besides all the touristy ratings for a great taqueria
author: James F.

description: Probably one of the best burritos I've had here in the city they may look small but they sure are filling. Only thing is I thought they where a tad expensive but overall it was great. The tacos are also pretty big and delicious. Definitely coming back here again
author: Eric S.

description: I passed twenty-two Mexican restaurants on my way to La Taqueria. I was a little unsure on my way there, but my friend insisted it was that good. Twenty minutes later, I knew he was right. The service was quick, the the prices were (fairly) cheap, and the food was delicious. La Taqueria, I'll be back.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Living in Pittsburgh has generally been a culinary downgrade from Chicago, our previous city of residence (sorry, but it's true).  Nowhere is this more evident than in the arena of Mexican food.  Since according to Wikipedia, only 2% of Pittsburgh's population identifies as Hispanic/Latino, there simply is not an audience for authentic, inexpensive, amazing Latin American cuisine.  Chain Mexican, yes.  Tiny taqueria on every corner?  No.  Major bummer.

So - when we went out to California recently, it was a no-brainer that tacos needed to be acquired.  Immediately, if not sooner.  My boyfriend's aunt saved the day by bringing us to La Taqueria.  Cue the heavenly choir.  Just what the doctor ordered.

I got a carne asada taco, and a carnitas taco - the latter of which was especially amazing.  I gave my boyfriend a bite and he almost didn't want to hand it back to me!  Glorious with cheese and creamy pinto beans.  Great hot sauce too.

And don't forget the horchata.   Such a treat.

I feel like I can't accurately judge this place - I'd been craving this food for so long, it's hard to be objective - but the tacos hit the spot and I would make a return visit anytime I'm in San Francisco!
author: Meredith A.

description:
Ive been coming to this taqueria wit my family for over 16 years 
It has the BEST tacos,and fresh strawberry water. I would love to live in this city to be able to eat here more often.
author: Xamara P.

description: Now this is what I'm taking about. Pure unadulterated burrito that are fat, loaded, and delicious
author: Sigorney S.

description: Favorite taqueria in SF. Recommend getting a carne asada burrito with queso. And then drizzle every bite with a bit of their spicy green salsa. Helps greatly with hangovers :)
author: Ankur V.

description: Not usually a fan of Mexican food but this place is pretty awesome
author: Roland T.

description:
I too had heard good things about this place from a local and had some high expectations, JOSH.

My friend had several tacos and I thought I'd just get a carne asada burrito with some extras.  My total came just under $10.  The burrito was very fresh, but wasn't very large at all (I even ate more food at home afterwards) nor particularly tasty/special.  For $6 I would've given four stars, but it really wasn't worth it.  My friend's order was around $12, and he agreed it wasn't really quite up to snuff either.

El Farolito is definitely the better way to go if you want the most bang for your buck. But hey, maybe the tacos there will wow me next time I give the place a try.
author: Norman P.

description:
When did they start charging $10 for a burrito (with guac, cheese, etc, super burrito)?  $6.50 now for a plain (small) burrito.  That's probably why it was nearly empty when I went (they used to have a line all the way to the back at all times).

I'm not gonna lie, it's damn tasty, at least the carne asada and carnitas are, but $3.50 more than Taqueria Cancun?  No Thanks-o.

I probably won't be walking the extra 7 blocks to come back here any time soon.
author: Greg J.

description: meh. i've had better. across the street. and up the block. And everywhere because it's the MISSION!
author: Dimple B.

description: This place never fails me! If you are looking for yummy tacos and great quick service then this is the place. It is always packed yet the service is swift. The eating place is clean. I have never been to their restrooms so I can't comment on their condition. The only thing I have tried out of their menu are tacos but they also have burritos and quesadillas. The pricing is bit above avarege for tacos but you will get your money's worth. They are well-stuffed and you can add different toppings. A great place to check out if you are around the area!
author: Betty R.

description:
No rice. They have no rice.
No salsa bar. One salsa option only.
You have to buy chips!?!?
Weird.
author: Stumbalina b.

description: This place fell a little flat.  I got one carnitas taco and one carne asada (wihch I usually prefer anyway).  I have to say, it was nothing special.  The tacos were both huge and a good value, but nothing all that outstanding.  I agree with reviews that I read - it felt a little touristy with all the accolades on the wall, and the mariachi band that came through was more an annoyance than something to enjoy - the space is too small and the band too loud.  It was a good, hearty meal, but I can think of a few other places that would have been better to include on the 7x7 list.  The most interesting part of the meal was the melon agua fresca
author: Lilly N.

description:
Really, REALLY good carne asada tacos , but I think an even better carne asada burrito. Quite pricey when you add in the guacamole, sour cream, cheese, etc., but good nonetheless.

Anxious to try some of the other tacquerias right by there, because I have a sneaking suspicion they may be equal in taste but a little less expensive (whatever happened to $2 tacos??)
author: K. D.

description:
Great tacos!  I used to order their burritos all the time (price is up to almost 8 dollars per burrito) and more if you order extras like avocado or cheese.  I've been going here for over a  decade now and the food is almost the same-- maybe portions have shrunk and prices have inflated faster than most other commodities. The burritos are average size- smaller than you would expect for the cost. Tasty but very basic unless you order extras and you should. Cheese, avocado, sour cream, etc. The special thing about these burritos is that there is no rice in it. The most  basic burrito will come with beans and salsa with a meat of your choice. The stewed beans have a very rich bean flavor which adds to the texture as well as to the flavor.  

Tacos are about 3.75 and they are fabulous for a light lunch and two for a light dinner. Their nachos usually come with a ton of guacamole and it's a nice cheap side dish. 

The freshness of the ingredients makes everything taste great and even when there's a line, it goes pretty fast since the staff are used to working fast to accomodate to the crowds.  Drinks are great too, try the watermelon drink. It gets pretty loud in there especially when it's a full house during peak hours. 

Getting  to go is your best bet during peak hours to avoid the crowds and excessive noise and the food tastes just as good after the commute.
author: Lorissa W.

description:
The ritzy burrito joint I take visiting friends to, to impress them with clean surroundings, cushy outdoor seating, and decent Mexican food.   If on my own I will usually go elsewhere for my burrito fix.   

And I say their burritos are only decent because to make them fabulous I would have to add guacamole (extra charge), sour cream (extra charge), a side of chips/salsa (extra charge) along with a strawberry agua fresca (2x the price of everywhere else).  And by then my cheap eats has suddenly gotten a little too pricey and I've gotten a little too cranky to enjoy my food.
author: Joanne G.

description: Literally hands down, the best taco I have ever eaten in my 24 years of existence. When I go to San Francisco it will take all of my will power to keep me from returning. The carnitas fully loaded taco was absolutely delicious. The carnitas was juicy and crispy and the two toritllas is brilliant. I also had the lengua burrito but since I was so full from my two tacos, I ate it the next day and it was still amazing. This place is off the richter.
author: Michael J.

description:
OMFG.

The best taco ever. Ever.

You have to go and try it. I promise you'll love it. But if you don't, you're weird.
author: Francisco T.

description: Hands down best tacos I've ever had. They're also so friendly and accommodating, making the whole experience above par. Anyone visiting San Francisco must stop here. Nothing else compares!
author: Maddie A.

description: They've made the best burrito for decades. Simples and little frills, but if you want a great burrito and agua fresca, or cold Modelo, this is the place to go.
author: Tyler H.

description:
I've eaten here many times back when I lived in noe valley, so for old times sake I took myself here while visiting the city a couple weekends ago. I guess they raised the price of a taco to $3.50 (I think it was $2.50 not THAT long ago), which is definitely pricey. A taco here, tho is pretty big and I can barely finish 2 in one sitting. i always get the carnitas, which was not as great this time as i remember, which was nicely singed on the ends, and also not as overpowered by the beans.

I think there's better food for less in the neighborhood at this point, like le cancun.
author: Henry Y.

description: BEST. TACOS. EVER. I've been to Mexico over twenty times. Yes, these aren't 100% authentic. But every Mexican I've sent to La Taqueria has come away a believer. Bring cash, they don't accept cards. Plenty of it, for a quick taco place you'll spend some loot witht he extras. But DAYUM!!!! What an investment!
author: Jesus R.

description:
La Taqueria you son of a dish!  You've given Farolito's a run for my money! However you require like twice as much of it to get my food, so -1 star.  Your crispy tacos are crazy delicious. Carnitas supertacos loaded with half a carnitas burrito on the side and a large Fresa or Horchata to wash it all down is the way to go!  The green sauce is less then perfect but more than adequate. This will definitely enter my rotation, but due to the price being higher than farolitos, it will be less frequent than it should be.  Point in favor -- the food did inspire me to create a mini sculpture. Check out "Ode to La Taqueria" in the photos for this place.

Be warned, this place doesn't nickel and dime you, it quarter and dollars you.
author: Tyler W.

description:
I have been coming here since3 I was very young (7-8 years old). My mom grew up in SF so we always went to places all over the city.  Just in case you didn't know, they guy making your tacos has been there for about 34 years!!

Best carnitas burrito EVER.  No fillers of rice and lettuce and the like.  You get meat, beans, salsa. Yes, the prices have certainly increased over the years but I love those burritos and everyone I have ever taken here feels the same.

Don't miss the fresh juices.  My personal favorite is Strawberry (Fresa).
author: Jessica E.

description:
Best carne asada tacos in SF.  I liked the chips & guacamole too :)

'nuff said.
author: Grace C.

description:
I've never been one to buy into restaurants where everyone believes they serve the best type of food. I've heard time and time again that La Taqueria has the best Tacos in San Francisco, but honestly that's up for debate. 

From the three times I've been here I was more amazed at the cost of a taco than it's taste. I ordered 3 tacos and was slapped with a bill of $12, very pricey tacos. I've also ordered a burrito once, disappointed by the lack of rice. No doubt the food here is good to eat, but nothing spectacular. I feel that more lesser known restaurants in the mission make a better taco and definitely better burritos than this place. 

I believe you pay this staggering amount of money just to be able to say "I went to the Taqueria, which serves the best tacos in SF". On the contrary, to me there's nothing fancy about these tacos, aside from the poverty you'll experience if you truly believe these are the best (and you likely never tried any other Taqueria). Everyone has their tastes, I'll take my money to La Altena or El Taco Loco not too far from here and be just as satisfied with eating more tacos that I'll be able to afford.
author: Jesus A.

description: I have always been a big fan of this place.  In fact, its always been the best taqueria I have ever eaten at.  Today, not so good.  Maybe just an off day but nothing tasted the same.  The carnitas were dry and tasteless, the beans just ok and the great green hot sauce was even off.  I won't give up on this place just yet.  One more try.  The weird thing is when I walked in there was hardly a line.  This place always has a line.  Has ownership changed?
author: Maria S.

description:
The Basics: Yes, this place is good but it's not amazing.  During peak hours, it gets packed and it's pretty hard to maneuver yourself with food and drinks in your hand. 

The Hype: I guess because it's been heavily reviewed and it's become some tourist attraction, there definitely is a lot of tourist there.  I was there one night and saw a few tourists with their Zagat Guide in hand. 

I'm always a little suspect when the majority of the crowd is non-Mexican or not of Latino decent.  It's like me walking into a Chinese restaurant and there aren't any Chinese people eating.  It makes me wanna go "hmmm..." 

There are plenty of taco trucks, roach coaches and other taquerias that can compare and if not better.  In the East Bay, they are hidden everywhere, no need for me to trek to the Mission for some tacos!
author: Meshell C.

description: I was touring around San francisco  And after a week of eating seafood burgers n pizza. My husband and I were craving Mexican food from Los Angeles. I was feeling food sick but this spot literally hit the spot !! It was so good! Just like home! we ordered burritos and tacos de carne asada
author: Kris M.

description:
I love this place after the 1st time I was introduced to La Taqueria!!

I don't like soft tacos...but when a friend told me you can get the inner shell crunchy w/ cheese...I was drooling.

-Get it w/ everything - beans, guacamole, salsa, sour cream & medium hot sauce. 
-Be sure to say crunchy to get the inner shell crispy w/ cheese.

$6 each...a tad pricy, but worth it.

4 Stars - Because of price.

La Taqueria [click below - pictures]
http://www.xanga.com/icantsee/676917969/la-taqueria.html
author: Kenny C.

description: Hmmm, well it was recommended by a local of the mission district. Thought the price for a taco was a little pricey and then to boot cheese, sour cream, and guacamole is an additional $1.20 each. ...say what?!?! You have got to be kidding me! Ordered 3 tacos and a soda and grand total.....drum roll please. ... $23.21 umm yeah no thanks!! Tacos were very packed with delicious stuff, but definitely not the BEST taco I have ever had.
author: Charmaine T.

description:
OMG, the BEST Tacos dorados (crispy, but not like taco bell, it's fried on the grill)!  The carnitas and carne asada cannot be beat and I've been going there for years!  I won't stop!
the Aqua frescas are amazing too!!
author: J L.

description: Meat had tendons which were hard . The parking was a nightmare. Next time ill stick to pancho villa in san mateo. Food is excellent there promise !!!!!!
author: Jolens V.

description: No wonder it was rated as #2 in the country by USA today!  Fabulous tacos and drinks!!  The owner is very special too and the customer service is wonderful!
author: Carol G.

description: I gotta say this was probably the best taco I've ever eaten.  I'm used to LA tacos which are awesome and usually only a dollar, but for 3.75, these tacos were worth every penny.  The carnitas was perfectly juicy, seasoned, and fatty.  Tasty pinto beans inside.  Topped with their chopped salsa fresca kinda thing and mashed avocado.  I opted for adding cheese which wasn't really necessary because there is so much flavor and substance goin on.  I had 2 but one would have filled me up for a light lunch.
author: brian g.

description:
Now THIS is what I am talking about. The burrito sitch got so bad in the Inner Sunset I vowed to move closer to the Mission as a remedy, and damn it, I am a man of my word (but if my girlfriend asks you it's because I REALLY wanted to move in with her, got it?). Upon my first visit to La Taq I knew that I had finally arrived.

I thought it a bit ballsy that they took the name "La Taqueria", but I'll be damned if they don't back up their bluster. The carnitas rests comfortably in the upper echelon of deep-fried pork products; it lives up to the hype and then some. On a side note, I love living in a world with pork hype.

Theirs is a rice-free burrito-- I first found this slightly disorienting having grown up on NorCal burritos, but have quickly come to realize that this is the way it is meant to be. All killer, no filler: beans, meat, salsa, tortiller. Four steps to perfection. You can add sour cream and/or guac if you'd like to up the mush factor.

Though they always seem to have plenty of that delicious carnitas, La Taqueria is fresh out of fucking around.
author: Trav W.

description:
I dream about the carne asada burritos here.  Just the right amount of meat and its tender and juicy -mixed in with salsa and fresh cilantro and some beans.  They don't add rice to the burrito which is fine by me - there's more to eat. 
This is a must-stop whenever my brother comes to town to have really good Mexican food. He lives in S.C and unfortunately doesn't get much good mexican food there.
author: David Z.

description:
Amazingly good tacos. I always want to get two when i come but am full after the first one. Definitely recommended. I get the veggie tacos and it still very good. You dont need meat to have a good time here. 

The salsa that comes with the chips is to die for too. SO fresh.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
All I have to say is carnitas taco. Kind of fatty but it practically melts in your mouth. Barely have to chew it at all. The taco shell was soft and delicious. Salsa, beans, and cilantro really made it tasty. With the hot sauce it's even better. I think this is the best carnitas taco I've had so far. 

I also ordered the cow head taco but it wasn't nearly as good. Didn't come with the salsa or anything. 

The place was pretty packed when we went inside. We were lucky to grab a table. 

Prices are a bit high for tacos in my opinion. The burrito price is alright. It came with a lot of meat instead of a lot of rice and beans. 

I'd come here again. A warm carnitas taco would always hit the spot.
author: robin w.

description:
Best burritos belongs to El Farrolito.  Best tacos belongs to La Taq.  

The tacos are NOT cheap if you want them fully loaded.  They come out to about 4.50 per taco....which is damn near a burrito's price.  

With that said, it's worth it.  The carne asada is super juicy and flavorful.  The tacos are huge.  My go-to meat has been the cabeza...great flavor and melts in your mouth.
author: Per C.

description: The super tacos are delicious! Very well seasoned and generous portions. The line was long, but the food was served really quick. 5 super tacos, 2 regular tacos and two super burritos = $66.  A bit pricey but we will be coming back.
author: S R.

description:
After our little adventure at Rosamunde, we decided to walk down the street and hit up La Taqueria.

I was so full from the sausages earlier, and we had a plan on eating at Mission Pies next door, so I only went in to get one taco. I figure if you can make a taco taste good, then I will be a fan.

Well, I became a fan upon the first bite. I ordered the carnitas taco with cheese and guac. So simple yet delicious. The pork was cooked so well--juicy, soft, and flavorful. I don't know what sauce I used (salsa verde probably) but that added to the taco. I will definitely want to come back here and try a super burrito like the fatty that I am (even though coming here to eat AFTER I had an initial dinner does constitute a "fatty" comment) 

Taco was 3.50 and they only accept cash. not the cheapest, but it was delicious nonetheless.
author: Victoria B.

description:
By the time I visited La Taqueria, I had been to several neighbourhoods in San Francisco already.  This was the last day on my trip.  I had seen Haight-Ashbury, Castro, Financial District, Chinatown, Sunset, Richmond District.  But once I stepped foot into the Mission, saw the people hanging around the streets and felt the energy there, I thought to myself, this is my kind of neighbourhood.

I was told to definitely eat at one of the taquerias in San Francisco before I leave the city, and La Taqueria was one of the recommended places.  It was early yet in the evening but the restaurant was already packed and the line not short.  Up on the menu the offerings of burritos and tacos were all fairly familiar, except for one: lengua.  Or tongue.  As soon as I saw that I knew I wanted to try the lengua burrito.  I also ordered some chips and salsa, and to wash it all down, a mango drink.  

While I was waiting in line, the Mariachi duo that was playing outside decided to go inside the restaurant to play.  Fun times, and at least several people tipped them after they were done with their song.  The pretty lady immediately in front of me in line finally got to the cash register to order.  The man at the cash register must have been either the owner or at least the manager.  He was very nice to the lady and tried to flirt with her, but I think she just tried to be polite.  Once it was my turn to order, he didn't speak more than five words to me.  I guess I just wasn't pretty enough!  But that's ok, brother, I would do the same thing.  Hah!

The lengua burrito was delicious.  It was served with onions and cilantro.  Normally I don't like onions, but in this case it worked.  The chips and salsa was also better than I've had at most other restaurants, and the mango drink was definitely a nice touch.  On my next visit it would be difficult to choose between La Taqueria and trying another taqueria in the Mission!
author: Radford T.

description:
Cash only. My favorite burritos in the city. If I had one complaint, it would be that they don't put rice in their burritos, which you need at least a little bit of to hold everything together. I have seriously considered bringing in rice from another Mexican restaurant to add to the burrito.


The atmosphere is much better at La Taqueria than at El Farolitio's (although El Far is much cheaper with bigger portions), and the quality of the meat is the best. Best carne asada i've had in the city for sure. It's 6.50 for a burrito with no sour cream, cheese, or guacamole. Altogether, it costs $2.25 to add all those. So if you just get a basic burrito, its just meat, beans, and salsa.
author: J R.

description:
What?  $35 dollars for 4 tacos and 2 beers in a can?  Now normally I would have given this Mission Street taco joint a 4 star review for the really good carnitas tacos.  But, be very careful when you order, because when you see a taco for 3.75 on the menu you think it comes loaded.  And when they ask you if you want everything on it, it turns in to a $7 taco.  They even charge you $1 to $1.50 to remove the beans!  They charge you to remove something from a taco...  

If I ever go again it will only be because friends are already there.
author: Tyler J.

description:
I finally learned the secret to La Taqueria -- adding cheese to the tacos. When you order cheese on your taco they grill the inner corn tortilla until the cheese melts. The tortilla gets a bit crispy from the grill which only adds to the deliciousness. I usually ask for sour cream and hot sauce too.

La Taqueria doesn't hide the fact that they consider themselves to be the Cadillac of taquerias. The prices are significantly higher than other places but the quality of their ingredients is also higher. You'd be hard pressed to find more tender carne asada or juicier carnitas anywhere else. Although their tacos aren't authentic, they're tough to beat. They also have some of the best agua fresca in the Mission. Highly recommended.
author: Aaron V.

description: Nothing would keep me from eating here and enjoying the food. Not even their health inspection rating of 72. Mostly because of the care and handling of food without gloves, which is fine with me. Best carnitas tacos ever.
author: Kevin D.

description:
What a great spot to gather with friends for Cinco de Mayo.  We sat at the window to watch the staff chop up sizzling chunks of fresh steak. 

$10 gets you two shredded chicken tacos with guacamole.  Pay with a benjamin and you'll have just enough money jingling in your pocket to fear for your life on the walk home.
author: Janney B.

description: Best taco In my life!!!!! As a vegetarian I have a hard time finding such amazing and delicious tacos!!!!! If you don't go there tomorrow I am going to SCREAM!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Hailey G.

description: The best tongue tacos I have ever had. My wife had the carne asada and she also says that they were the best. Everything was fresh and the long line went by really fast. The staff was super friendly and the guy at the register, I think he is the owner, gave us a free order of quesadillas.
author: Ramin P.

description:
La Taqueria claims to be one of the first places to bring authentic Mexican burritos and tacos to America. Whether or not they were the first doesn't make much a difference because it's the quality not this history that makes them one of (if not the) best taquerias in San Francisco. Unfortunately they're only open to 9pm so dropping by after a night at the bar isn't possible. Set up here is typical, you order your food and drink (they have fruit drinks, beer, and sodas), pay, grab a seat, and wait for your number to be called. The menu is simple, tacos ($3.50) and burritos ($6.50) made with your choice of meat, beans, and other toppings (like onions and cilantro, salsa, or guacamole). Unfortunately they don't have black beans if that's your bean of choice. Unlike nearly every other taqueria they don't have rice here as they believe it detracts too much from the meat. I would tend to agree with them after having been to El Farolito and had a burrito where a number of bites were just tortilla and rice. Meats here include steak, sausage, chicken, pork, beef head, and beef tongue. I tried the steak and the pork, both were amazingly juicy and flavorful, the best I've ever had. The tortillas (for the tacos) were on the thinner side so the tacos came covered with a second tortilla which ended up being a good idea because the inside one for some reason was a bit greasy but they were still two of the best tacos ever.
 
FYI: La Taqueria was recently featured on a limited series on the Food Network hosted by Alton Brown as being one of the top 10 comfort food destinations in America.
author: Matt E.

description: The meat in their burritos is just so good!  Top marks for excellent ingredients.
author: Tasha D.

description:
Wow folks i guess you love this place and ya'll could pretty much keep it.  

Not my "stilo" (style). Besides the fact it's stupid expensive, and hella hype wrapped in foil calling it self the best carnitas burrito, the food here lacks flavor.  Just cause salsa juice oozes out and drips everywhere does not mean the stuff taste good.  I am not the "authenticity" officer but I sure as hell wouldn't make this my taco or burrito spot.  If your into Champagne Prices and Budweiser quality then knock yourself out boo.  It's all yours, as for me I'm on to the next one............
author: Eryka V.

description: The tacos were delicious.  I liked the hard shell wrapped with a soft tortilla even though I wasn't expecting it.
author: Gabriela H.

description: Really good. I made the mistake of getting a regular burrito once though and even if you're not very hungry, it's worth it to get a super burrito and just save some for later or whatever. Get the burrito cooked "dorado" (sp?) it just means they cook it longer to make it a golden brown tortilla that's nice and crispy. It will take your burrito to the next level. The only reason I'm giving it four stars is I'm usually soggy at the end and also based on the hype, I was literally expecting the best burrito of my life.
author: Steph B.

description: My friend and I ordered carne asada tacos, a tongue taco, a chorizo taco and two beers. Good tacos and a cold dos Equis really make me happy. The tacos here are very large and very good. Lines can get long and seats get occupied quickly, but it's worth it! Can't wait to come back
author: Sheeva G.

description: i ordered a chicken taco and a carne asada taco, ermegwed! they were freaking massive and had so many toppings ,so messy but delicious.the agues fresco were really good too i got the pineapple one.the salsa was good too i eat spicy with everything so i was happy with how spicy the salsa was.
author: kat v.

description:
So I'm Latin and I can tell you that you will rarely find a Latin person eating in here. I barely mention "La Taqueria" to my dad and all I get is a dismissive tisk, and my tia says "it's good but it's so spensivvveee" . La taqueria is ridiculously priced and it hurts. 

But if you're ever dragged in you need to be prepared to know how to order. "Taco dorado de carne asada con queso". Just stop after you say those words and you will leave with money in your pocket and enough food in your belly to take away your hunger. Lather it with some green sauce and that'll add a few more calories to further satisfy you. Next stop dianda's next door or king's bakery across the street to finish filling up. 

And that is how it's done homies, coming from a girl who grew up in the mission and now lives in the suburbs.
author: Valerie A.

description:
These are by far the best tacos I have ever had in my history of eating Mexican food. The food here is unbelievably cheap and incredibly delicious. I was nearly full after eating only 1 taco but of course happy to eat a second. 

Te best part is that when you get a $3.50 taco, you get something that would cost at least $5 anywhere else. They don't skimp on the meat and they put beans and salsa in it which only adds to the delicious mess that will surely be all over your hands. Nevertheless it is an experience one can not help but to enjoy with every bite!
author: Lara N.

description: WHOA! the Burritos here are NUTS! I love that they don't have rice in the burrito as a filler, it allows for the flavors of the beans and the avocado, etc. to shine through. Also, the vegetarian burrito is only 3.75, which is an incredible price for a dinner! My co-diners report that the carne asada was "tender, juicy, smokey." Thank you La Taqueria for keeping it real! OH, and also try the topo chico mineral water, a true authentic delight!
author: Emily P.

description:
There's not a whole lot to say aide from "I haven't had better burritos in San Francisco."
And I've been looking...

First, everything is fresh and made in front of you. Their turnaround is so great that nothing stands open in the air. In fact, there's always a line, though they are so efficient that I've never waited more than 5 minutes. 

Second, it's the only place I know that doesn't stuff the burrito with rice. No fluff, just the good ingredients. 

Third, while it's quite the bare bones place, the clientele is really diverse and always friendly. In addition to the small table (for 2 or 4) there are a couple long, community tables and which folks always share. Makes the experience so much more interesting. 

And last, it's right in the middle of the mission, just a block off the 24th Street BART station, and a block from the hip valencia corridor.
author: O Z.

description: Maybe I should have gotten the tacos since that seems to be what everyone is raving about at La Taqueria. Came here on a Wednesday night and the place was packed. I ordered a carne asada burrito. The flavor of the meat is good, is juicy, and not too greasy. However, no rice which I do like in my burritos. All there is inside is meat, salsa (pico de gallo), and beans (pinto, no black). Overall, the burrito is smaller than any other burrito I've had in the Mission. $6.75 without additional add-ons like guac, sour cream, and cheese. Oh, also there is no salsa bar which I love at other taquerias!  It was satisfying but a little pricey. Next time I'll try the tacos.
author: Dora L.

description: Hands down the best freagin tacos! Just the thought has me savoring. My fave has to be the chorizo tacos and of course its a must everything on them. These tacos are twice the size of your average taco fyi you'll need a fork to start off.
author: Paulette B.

description:
Amazing! Great service and delicious tacos. 

I went for the first time after work last night, and the older guy working the register asked me if it was my first time there. When I said yes, he asked me, "What's you favorite fruit?" (and listed a few) I replied, "mango!" and he came back a few seconds later and handed me a drink. I sipped it down and it was the most refreshing thing I've ever tasted! It was a mango agua fresca and he gave it to me on the house. Awesome.

I got 2 carnitas tacos. Had one for dinner and saved the second for lunch the next day (still good!) The salsa is a little spicy and tangy and I loved the pinto beans they put on it.

Definitely going to be a regular here :)
author: Meg L.

description:
LOVE!!!! I'm heading into town in a couple days and I'm seeing amongst the family hoopla if I can fit a trip to La Taqueria into my schedule. This would definitely be my last meal on earth. The green salsa alone is enough to crawl home for. 

I miss you La Taqueria... see you soon!
author: Monique O.

description:
Best damn tacos in the whole damn world. 

I'm a huge fan of the chorizo tacos, but carne asada is excellent too. It doesn't matter what u get as long as it's a taco covered in their hot sauce!
author: Brittany D.

description: Big fan of the tacos, especially the carnitas! I'm originally Texas so I don't get the burrito battle but enjoy the tacos, even if they are double the price and half the size :)
author: Vicki R.

description: "The best tacos and burritos in the world." My favorite is the steak taco with the works or a super steak burrito mmmm yum!! :)
author: Lexi C.

description:
Eh, not amazed, not desperately disappointed.  I know this is a Mission institution, but after years of taco trucks in Fruitvale, eating here feels like eating a burger at McDonald's and then going to Burger Bar and paying way too much for something not so different.  
They don't have al pastor, which was very disppointing to me.  So, I went with chorizo and carnitas tacos, which were good, and big, but nothing amazing.  It was also hard to get our hands on some of the salsas that are only available at a few tables.
I'll stick to Fruitvale trucks.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Best-burritos-ever. Seriously. I CRAVE their carne asada. Weekly. No joke. I order mine with cheese and guacamole, I skip the sour cream,  you definitely get what you pay for. 

It's usually a bit crowded, so you have to stake out a seat before you get your food. 

I would also recommend their aqua frescas. Yummy.
author: Lisa F.

description:
I LOVE this place!! The tacos are delicious!! Especially when you get them crispy.....amazing!! And the green salsa they have on the tables definitely tops it off....Also, their fresa drink - soooOOoOOooOo good!!! It is made with real strawberries! 

Only thing is I wish this place was cheaper! But I guess it's better that it is a bit costly for some tacos so then I'm not eating there every day - because I would.
author: Renee F.

description: World's best tacos and burritos hands down! My family has been going to La Taqueria for 4 generations now, and the quality has not changed. The juiciest carne asada on the planet, paired with the freshest salsa and beans. Getting your tacos dorado style is must. They don't over complicate things by adding rice or other fillers, just pure and simple ingredients.
author: Ciana D.

description:
This is my most favorite burrito place EVER!

Located on Mission near 26th, this place is not in the best part of the city (although not the worst either). I do feel uncomfortable walking in this area alone or with another girl in the evening, because many guys will yell things!

La Taqueria (yes, the name is definitely not original) is busy at almost any time of the day although you can usually find a place to sit. After standing in the line and giving your order to a lady that will write it down on a piece of paper, you sit and wait for the person at the counter to call out your order (sometimes in Spanish and sometimes in English).

They have a few small wooden tables with benches and a few long wooden tables with benches (which are sometimes difficult to share). There is a jukebox on the far wall that plays Spanish music. There is also a neon sign that says "La Taqueria" in green the red writing. There are always people that look like they are Mexican here, which means that it must be good, right?

The watermelon agua fresca is AMAZING, you have to order this! The chips with avocado (not guacamole) and pico de gallo are really really good. My favorite thing here are the burritos, they literally feel like they melt in  your mouth and with the delicious green salsa, in the tubes that are on each table, they have mastered the PERFECT burrito! I think the key to their burritos is the tortilla, which taste more fresh than anywhere else I have been. They do not have rice here, but who needs those unnecessary carbs anyway?

I usually order a burrito with beans, cheese and guacamole and every time manage to finish the whole thing, even though I am full after about half!

The tacos here are really good, the chicken is really juicy and fresh and the carne asada is very good as well. Pretty much anything you order, you will be happy with! 

The only downsides about this place are that 1) they do not take credit cards (cash only), but there is a Washington Mutual right across the street and 2) the location is a hard to get to if you are not already in the mission and sometimes parking can be difficult, but other than those two things, this place is awesome, I do not know anyone that has not loved this place!!!!!!!!!!!! (they also have another location in San Jose on South First Street, but their hours are really bad)
author: Elaine S.

description:
OMG .. the tacos in this joint are the BOMB .. worth the trip and the $$$ and the aggravation to find parking for their tacos!!!

You have to get pretty much EVERYTHING in order to feel and taste the full effect of their delicious tacos!  OMG .. you can't just have one!
author: A Marie D.

description: This place is my absolute favorite place to go when I want the best food it is seriously hands down the best Mexican food in town tacos and burritos Agua fresas the bomb dot com. The owner is always a joy to meet when ever we have people come from outta town this is the 1st place they go and they enjoy it !!!!! Enjoy it you'll fall in love
author: Andrea M.

description: The best I have ever had and its a quite bart ride for me.  I went on a spree and tried a burrito and taco and had troubles finishing them both, but AHHHH gotta love it.  The manager was out and about interacting with guests which was cool.  Just remember it is cash only so bring maybe like $25-$30 if you want a beer with it.
author: Justin I.

description: Tacos are good but expensive.  They are big and filling though,  I was literally dying after 3.  The lengua taco was delicious, one of the best I've had.   Carnitas and cabeza were pretty good too.  I recommend showing up early -- at 11:45am it's not crowded yet and was nice and calm in there.   Aside from the jacked-up prices, the only other thing is that I wish they had a spicier  salsa to use (maybe they do, I didn't ask!).   No frills and good tacos.   I'll be back for an early lunch with friends soon.
author: N. C.

description: Enjoyed the atmosphere.  Thought the chicken burrito was OK.  Definitely a good size portion for the price
author: Austin G.

description: The crispy carnitas tacos were definitely fun to try.  But I'm not gonna lie... I love my al pastor tacos with onion, cilantro, limes and hot sauce the best! Like in Mehico... Once you taste that, can't go back.
author: Yoko H.

description:
Way, Way too expensive.

I just got back from a trip to the mission for lunch today and I was reminded of how pricey La Taqueria is. I got two tacos with cheese and guacamole and no drink and the total came out to $11.50. That's crazy money for two tacos. For that type of money I could go get two super burritos from El Farlito down the block.

All complaining aside, these are some of the best and biggest tacos I have ever had. The meat is tender, the guac is tasty and the tortillas are fresh. I love how the inside tortilla is nice and crispy while the outside one is nice and soft. Also the aqua fresca is tasty but can get a little too pulpy.
author: Jeff P.

description: Best burrito I've ever had. I think about it on a daily basis. The carne asada dorado style (i.e., slightly crisped outer layer) is the way to go. The tacos are also excellent.
author: Alykhan K.

description:
Realllly don't give the hype about this place. Met a big group here last night (had to stuff fourteen people onto one big table, but that's not really their fault) for tacos and several people were raving about how this was the best taqueria in the city. 

I don't even think it's the best taqueria on the block. I got two tacos with avocado and an agua fresca. First off, 14 bucks is entirely too much for two tacos and a drink, even if the tacos were fairly large. The tacos are on big flour tortillas which are very doughy, loaded up with salsa and beans and some not especially juicy or flavorful meat. The avocado was tasty, but it couldn't redeem the overall mediocrity of the tacos. Maybe their burritos are better? Go to taqueria vallerte and get a taco that's what a taco's supposed to be: tiny tortillas filled with onions and cilantro and a bit of salsa and some juicy, flavorful meat.

TL;DR
Overpriced, unimpressive. Go elsewhere.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
Carne asada burrito with everything and extra salsa is how you should do it in this joint.  And if you can find a seat, splatter on each bite their salsa verde in from their squeezable bottle and then wash it down with a swig of melon...yummy!  Their carne asada has that grilled taste which I enjoy and as you get closer to finishing your burrito, the juices start to get on your fingers from the fresh salsa inside.  If I lived closer, this place would be frequented weekly by yours truly and hopefully run into more local celebrities.  (I once went in and sat on the bench next to Benjamin Bratt and his lil' family.  I was in awe but couldn't share it with anyone in my party cuz they didn't know who he was....are you kidding?  They didn't watch Blood In Blood Out???)

The people taking orders are always nice.  The downfall are really just the prices, but it's sooo worth it!  Oh, and parking is street parking - you know how that is in the city.
author: beverly r.

description: Well, the carne asada taco, with extra avocado! is so good with the salsa. Maybe it's because I don't often eat this, but it's so fresh, clean and simple. Worth it.
author: Eva G.

description:
Food took a long time , which is ok if its good. Quality of product  was good. Taste was good. Price: f-ing outrageous. Charged for everything meat and beans. Add some rice to your burrito, back off on the sour cream. My burrito was like soup.
I must admit the tacos are spot on though!
author: Fat ass g.

description:
Came here with the recommend by 7x7.  Compared with my favorite taco places, this ranks about average.  For $3.50 per taco, I was at first taken aback, but then seeing the sheer size of these, I calmed a bit down (then somewhat regretted ordering 3).  All 3 had generous servings of meat, salsa, and beans, which was great.  The carne asada was pretty standard with nothing special to write home about.  The carnitas was really the selling point.  PACKED full of tender, flavorful pork, this bested the carne asada.  The lengua met my pretty high standards where it was anything but chewy, with tender cubes packed full of flavor.  

Overall, I'd probably stick with my El Taco de Oro in Alviso due to a much better price with similar, if not better taste.
author: Jeff N.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Been coming here since I was a kid. Father use to work here and my uncle is currently working there. This place is like childhood memory. $7 tacos is worth it!!! must order this, carne asade con todo y dorado, trust me, you'll fall in love and never look at a taco the same again.
author: Amy R.

description: La Taqueria has the greatest burritos and tacos in the city. Nay, in the world. The only downside is that they're not open late. But otherwise they're perfect. If it were legal, I'd marry this place. And they'd cater the wedding. And every meal for the rest of eternity. I will do anything for a La Taqueria carnitas burrito. ANYTHING. Such as, but not limited to: walking there and buying one, taking one from a baby, picking one out of the trash, punching someone who just ate there in the stomach 'til they regurgitate it into my mouth like a baby bird. Stop reading and just go there. Oh, and don't forget to put on extra salsa.
author: Andrew C.

description:
4 Stars for the Beef Tongue Taco -- tasty
2 Stars for the Carne Asada Burrito -- wet and soggy by the time I ate it
0 Stars for being overpriced (for being in the mission and not the marina!!)
 
I could have gotten better tasting burrito at El Farallito for half the price.  I swayed from my usual spot yesterday and was regretful.  

meh is right......
author: Anna C.

description:
Man, I've been hitting up a lot of "meh" places recently.

My boyfriend bragged about this place having the best carnitas tacos he's ever had in the city. We trekked out here to bring a friend from out of town. I expected cheap and delicious because we were in the deep heart of the Mission, and I've spent many a night around those parts getting $5 burritos that were bigger than my arm. 

We got 3 carnitas tacos (at $3.50 each) and a beer. Total price? $20. What?? They must have added it up wrong. Oh....my boyfriend ordered guacamole on the tacos......okay. Not sure how the price was bumped up so much (i'm guessing $1 per taco). But it wasn't like we got a big side order of guac. It was just a small dollop on top of each taco. 

Carnitas were fine. A little on the dry side, but okay.

However..the tacos didn't even come with some chips on the side. Almost every Mexican place I've been to gives at least a handful of chips with your burrito or tacos so you can scoop up all the good stuff that falls off. But nope, no extra chips whatsoever. My boyfriend's friend ordered a burrito that amounted to $10.

....Really? I'm over this place. It was good food, but you can find the same quality for much cheaper in the Mission.
author: Hannah L.

description:
Been coming here since my teeth came in. My family loves the carnitas burritos, salsa verde, and agua fresca in either pineapple or strawberry. The carnitas here is out of this world - a mix of crisp and tender with lots of juices and always piping hot. 

The place is almost always crowded, but the food is so good you can be butt to butt with total strangers and not mind it at all. Parking can be difficult as well, so usually we just take the BART to 24th & Mission and walk the few blocks over. 

And this is right next to Dianda's bakery where you can stop for dessert! We always make it a family ritual to eat carnitas burritos at La Taqueria and then take home some almond biscotti from Dianda's.
author: Elaine W.

description:
Greatest fucking tacos ever. You have not lived until you've eaten their Lengua taco with cheese and avocado doused in their heavenly hot sauce. 

So good, and so delicious. There is nothing better. I would choose a meal at La Taqueria over any restaurant in the city.
author: Allen T.

description:
I've had tons of people tell me this is the best Mexican food in the city. I just don't get it. It's expensive, they charge for almost any additional topping (really? $.50 for cheese?), there's not much selection, the meat is hella salty, and the burritos are smaller than you'd expect. Yes, the carnitas taco was probably the best thing I had here, but everything else was disappointing. The agua fresca tasted artificial, like they threw in chunks of strawberries, and then just dumped in some strawberry syrup for taste. 

I'm gonna have to burn through quite a few other mexican joints before I try this place again.
author: Saunders C.

description:
Been eating here since the 90s ... never thought to write a review but after recent visit a table of us were commenting how incredible it was the place had maintained such excellence for so long.

Best tacos bar none.

I've occasionally ordered a burrito, which is good, but there is no comparison to the tacos and the amazing corn/meat/avocado flavor ratio.  Add the home made verde sauce and POW.  Nirvana.  And excellent agua frescas.    

Only negative to mention is these tacos are getting a little pricey.  But still worth every cent.  And they are not open very late, even on weekends.
author: Herr D.

description:
I love La Taqueria. I hear the lines get really long, but my friend and I went at 5:30pm so there were no lines. We ordered 1 pollo (chicken) taco and 2 carnitas (pork) tacos with a mango agua fresca. 

My friend taught me to order them "El Dorado" style and also with cheese and guacamole. The El Dorado style had a hard shell taco wrapped in a soft corn taco. I loved how they really melted the cheese down and filled these tacos with heapfuls of delicious, tender meat, beans, salsa and guacamole. Melting the cheese makes a HUGE difference (versus just sprinkling some cheese on top). These tacos blew me away. The hard taco shell was so crispy and I loved having that extra crunch. I ate the carnitas taco first, which is also on the 7X7  100 Things to Eat Before You Die list. It's definitely something on the list worth eating. The carnitas taco was so flavorful and tender. I didn't think the chicken would be as good, but it also did not disappoint and was just as flavorful and tender. If I had to choose between the two, I'd probably choose the carnitas taco, but let's be real-I'm just going to order one of both every time I go to La Taqueria. 

Don't forget to partake in the agua fresca. I seriously wanted to try every single flavor. We settled on mango and it was like drinking a fresh mango. It was so refreshing that I couldn't resist and had to try the tangerine flavor (one of the seasonal flavors). Tangerine was good, but I wanted it to be a little bit more sour (it was really sweet) so I'd recommend the mango over tangerine.

See photos on my blog: http://rbjello.wordpress.com/2012/02/07/tuesday-mission-food-crawl/
author: Jackie T.

description: 3.5 stars. I had the carne asada burrito. THE meat...oh the meat was so delicious. So fresh and tender but no rice?! NO RICE?! I wasn't very happy about that. It was a little bit pricey and parking is awful. Overall OKAY experience.
author: Anita B.

description: My awesome "foodie" friend drug this suburban girl over to SF to try this place.  He swore up and down that it was the best around.  He did not lie.  I had a chicken "dorado" taco and I thought I was going to die and go to taco heaven!  DELISH.  La Taqueria is a GREAT reason to get out of the 'burbs!
author: JS M.

description:
This is not your standard Mission Taqueria. Yes, it's pricey, but IMHO, it's so worth it! My fave taqueria hands down since 1998. This place has not changed one bit in 12 years; maybe longer?! I get a carne asada taco and a chicken taco, both with cheese that is fried in between the tortillas, and I am stuffed! The food is so fresh, cooked to order, perfectly marinated, and delicious. There's usually a line, but it moves very fast. I must have been here 100+ times and can order in my sleep: carne asada taco, sin frijoles con queso y pollo taco sin fijoles con queso, gracias! I can't say enough good things about this place!!!

Oh, on a side note: it cost extra to get NO beans in their burritos b/c they put extra meat in. It's the same price for a taco without beans. Also their corn quesadillas are like a dollar b/c they are tiny; the flour ones are meal size and come with the works which is why they cost  more.
author: dan s.

description:
After a failed attempt to try nearby Papalote, I figured I'd try this place for my first Mexican food in SF. 
I ordered a carne asada and chorizo tacos and a horchata.

I found the carne asada to be very very tasty and I liked it quite a lot, the chorizo was good but not quite as much as the first one. The horchata was awesome, some of the best I've had.

Yes, I can see this place is a little pricier than some of the other taquerias in the area but I enjoyed it.
author: Jeff G.

description: This place is very good and it shows by the amount of people that show up to eat here.  Located in the Mission, La Taqueria serves up quick and tasty Mexican fare - tacos, burritos, etc.  However, they might have the best tacos in San Francisco.  You can order a variety of meats to go inside your taco.  To be different, I decided to go with one beef tongue taco and one beef head taco, both crispy style.  The outer shell is soft and the inner shell is slightly crispy (but not a hard shell like on most standard "tacos").  The meat was tender and savory.  Toppings such as guac and sour cream are extra.  Ingredients are fresh and orders are made quick.  Seating can be hard to come by and there are several large communal tables along with beautiful artwork along one side of the restaurant.  One important note if you decide to visit this restaurant is they accept cash only.  A great option if you're looking for something quick and casual.
author: Daniel B.

description: First time here. It was very,very packed so you may have to wait around for a spot to open up to sit if your not ordering out. The food was definitely worth everything though. I had never had fried tacos before but this was a very great start!
author: Maria S.

description:
All i have to say is "taco-licious" that is what la taqueria is. I have no idea how beans, cheese and guacamole taste so good, but they do, and it's like crack. 

I came here as a compromise. "I'll try a new taqueria if you dont make me eat more chinese food for lunch" anyway, I came in thinking I would get a burrito, but was told upfront that I could order tacos or go next door and get a pupusa, but no burritos. people these days! (but I guess it was for my own good) So I ordered some veggie tacos and have been dreaming about them ever since. The boyfriend claims its the fresh corn tortillas that make them so awesome, but I think it's the gooey cheese.

Whatever it is that makes the tacos here so magical, you would be silly to walk by with another taqueria as your destination. So hitch up your horses and sit yourself down for some sinfully good tacos.

also, no to be missed, some deliciously sweet horchata.
author: Allyson S.

description: Carnitas Taco Dorado. I might just have to go again today and get one! We were following the 7x7 best eats of SF list and came across this! WOW. This was the best eat of the day. Go get yourself some tacos from this place.......
author: Jill T.

description:
Awesome!
Just moved here from Arizona, and have been looking for a replacement for my comfort food. Found it! The flavor of both the Carnitas and Carne Asada was outstanding, and the beans were unreal. Absolutely terrific tacos!
author: Pat P.

description:
The food was good, I order the "Dorado" one crispy fried tortilla sandwiched by another soft corn tortilla with all the fixings. It was tasty but the meat was rather salty for my tastebuds. I prefer Pancho Villa over this. The strawberry agua fresca here was delish, full of whole strawberry chunks yummo  :]

P.S. Make a stop by Anthony's Cookies...get two of everything like a fatty
author: Tess R.

description: Great hard Tacos & Burritos, with everything on them (beans & meat, cheese & avocado extra, but worth it). Carne Asada was great & the Carnitas was even better.
author: Michael D.

description:
La Taqueria is delicious. The quality of the ingredients is superb, and definitely above the level of most mexican food places in the mission. The meat, especially the carne asada, is amazing and served in generous quantities in both tacos and burritos. I've always found rice to make burritos excessively starchy, and I'm glad they don't include it.

However, 10 dollars for a burrito with all the extras is just theft, especially since unlike most burritos, you will definitely finish this one in a single sitting. The tacos are overpriced too, considering you can get amazing taco truck tacos for a buck fifty just a few blocks away. I feel like they've been so hyped up that they can get away with charging crazy money, and for this reason I am docking a star.
author: Martin W.

description:
This place has amazing reviews for a reason- very delish!! I had the crispy veggie tacos (spicy with guac and Cheddar) and they were amazing - just as good as Nick's, if not better! Only negative is they charge you extra for everything (Guac, Cheese, Sour Cream,etc) so it can get a little pricey - I think my order cost around $10-12.

Another negative for vegetarians is that they are not too careful about keeping the meat separate from the beans (they are right next to each other)... you'll know what i mean when you go there!
author: Harvinder K.

description: While in the Bay Area for a long weekend, I had to try La Taqueria. The line was about 20 people long, but it only took about 10 mins to order, then about another 10 to get the burrito. I got carne asada with guacamole and cheese. I ate it while riding to the airport, so not the best way to savor a meal. That said, I though it was good but not spectacular. The meat was definitely good, but the  burrito seemed to lack an extra kick in flavor - maybe another time I'll try it with a spicier salsa...
author: Carlos J.

description: Ground beef in the crispy tacos, not shredded. Bland rice, bland beans...
author: Robert S.

description: Amazing food! Awesome pork tacos, and super-dooper burritos. So why not give more than three stars, I hear you ask? Well, lets see. The last three times I've been in there the hat-guy on the register has tried to rip me off. The first time I thought was a genuine mistake during a busy lunch hour. The second time I became convinced he was trying to smooth-talk me while pocketing a few bucks, but I still couldn't look past the delicious guacamole. The third time he hit on my girlfriend as the smokescreen then tried to shortchange her 10 bucks between distracting arm gestures and flirtations. Just as well she called him on it. There's a nice bouquet of roses next to the register that they are sure to give to the pretty ladies when they call them on such shoddy transactions. Be aware of the hat-guy. He'll hit you for six when all you want is one of the areas best Mexican dishes.
author: Mike K.

description: The best taqueria around. Tacos quesadillas and aguas frescas are always tasty and fresh! The carnitas 9 out of ten times are juicy and flavorful. Once in awhile are too salty for me. Corn tortillas always cooked just right. The chicken for the tacos is 90% of the time moist. Once in a great while may find a dry piece or 2 in the taco. Lots of guacamole. Generous portions. Not the cheapest around but definitely the tastiest!
author: Armando H.

description:
The cabeza de vaca (cow head) is to die for.   The cow head is cooked for several hours until the meat just falls off.  The meat just melts in your mouth, but is probably high in Cholesterol.  Just another thing for the nanny city of San Francisco to ban, la cabeza de vaca.  I have had la cabeza in other parts of the city, but this is the best.  Not for everybody, but be adventurous and try it.

The fresh fruit drinks (pina - pineapple or mango) are a refreshing break from the boring sodas.
author: Coyote B.

description: seriously the best tacos ever.  Make sure to order it with crispy and soft shell.
author: Megan C.

description:
Let's get down to the nitty gritty: yes, there are millions of Mexican restaurants on Mission alone, and most of them seem to serve the same stuff under different names.

Well, La Taqueria just stood out from the rest! From their healthy portions to how many tortillas they give with their meals, I think La Taqueria is one-of-a-kind. I've eaten at so many Mexican restaurants that they all seem to have blended together, but why is it that this place is the one I remember? Must have been the Super Burrito...
author: Geric O.

description:
I'm finally expanding my repertoire of Mexican places in the Mission.  I don't know the best or the worst yet, but I do know the good.  We came for burritos around 1pm on a Wednesday and there was about a ten minute wait to order and find a seat (obviously a local favorite).  

The menu is minimal, which is great if you're in the mood for a good, basic burrito or taco.  All four of us ordered carnitas burritos with cheese and avocado.  I must say, it's a pretty legit burrito.  Others have mentioned the lack of rice, which I'm embarrassed to say didn't jump out at me, but reminiscing about that burrito, I realize it was so good because it was chock full of carnitas, and not clouded with "filler".  They also did a great job of distributing the extras throughout the entire burrito.  

Very filling, very fresh, very tasty.  A warm tortilla, some green sauce from the table, and a well stuffed burrito = a good lunch that may leave you almost too full for dinner.  

The only slight disappointment was the chips and salsa.  The chips clearly weren't made fresh there, so they tasted like they were out of a bag.  That's fine, but they weren't the best bagged chips i'd ever eaten.  Stick to the burritos and tacos when you come here.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: La Taqueria's burrito is, in my honest opinion, the best burrito I've ever had.  I ordered the carnitas burrito with cheese, sour cream, guacamole, pinto beans, and pico de gallo (their pico isn't spicy, so need to worry if you're not into spice).  Every bite was as flavorful as the previous one, with a perfect blend of ingredients throughout the entire burrito.  La Taqueria doesn't use rice in their burritos, and some people might find that sacrilegious, but who cares if every second of consuming the burrito is filled with the desire not to actually finish it.  Not because it isn't good, mind you... but because finishing it would mean that there is no more burrito left to eat.  The meat was juicy, the avocado fresh, the pinto beans crisp... I almost can't put into words how incredible the combination of all of these things results in the most amazing burrito I've ever had.  You'll simply have to try it for yourself to see what I mean.
author: Erik W.

description:
Yum Yum.

I got the chicken burrito . Man is the chicken good here. It's very tender and so good - like it's been soaking in some magic juice for weeks. And the burrito is filled with the chicken - no skimping here. The rest of the burrito was juicy deliciousness.

I also got chips for extra $$. The salsa wasn't spicy at all and pretty sure the chips are from aren't freshly made/fried.

But the burrito is killer.
author: Chili B.

description: La Taqueria can't be beat! I went there the first time many years ago after I saw an article in Sunset magazine that they were voted the best tacos in the country and  I love a good Taqueria. The tacos were amazing but I prefer burritos so now it's a carne asada burrito with no beans. There is usually a line but it's well worth the wait!!! when the owner is there you may be given one of the dozen roses he keeps at the register :)
author: Cindi R.

description: This place is very yummy! I had a veggie burrito (just a tiny bit spicy) and a horchata. Food came out fast and the service is also very efficient. Came in here for a lunch on a weekday and it was a little busy, but we were still able to grab a seat. Would definitely come back.
author: Irene L.

description:
The Mission has some of the best Mexican food, and La Taqueria is one of the best places in the Mission for some good eats. I came her for some food before we went to a Giants game, the place was full,but the line was short and we were able to order our food right away. I got two carne asada tacos with everything, sour cream, guacamole, cheese, and covered them with the salsa. Their tacos are pretty big, I had two of them and that filled me up pretty good.

 I always crave this place, so when ever i'm in San Francisco I have to stop and get some, definitely a place to come a try if you want good Mexican food in San Fran.
author: Tony R.

description:
My reviews have been getting epically long, so lets keep this one to the essentials - order something with carnitas.

I think god's gift to man was pork. Pigs are my favorite animal, and my favorite animal to eat (hmmm Wilber clearly didn't have a big effect on my life). And, in my eyes, there are few things that can compete with the greasy, crispy, salty goodness of carnitas.

La Taqueria knows how to make carnitas - so much so that the recipe I use when I make them at home is actually their recipe. It was published in some Bon Appetit, or Sunset, years ago, and and I stole it and started pretending that I was just born with the gift of making perfect carnitas. There, I admit it. I stole the recipe. Happy?

I had the carnitas taco, which was as magically delicious as I would expect. The green sauce on the table (tomatillo sauce?) really added something special to my taco experience. My only issues were 1) that there were too many beans (I just find beans unnecessary, but that's just my personal taste), and 2) hot damn! $6.50 for a small taco!? Most expensive taco I've ever eaten.

Next time: carnitas burrito. Bring it.
author: Kelsey E.

description: I have tried tacos when I was in high school, but didn't like it that much. However, I changed my thought after tasting the Cartinas taco which my friend ordered for me for lunch. It's good.JUICY! lots of meat. I like it and I will go in store next time when I want to have taco.
author: Yingmei C.

description:
OOOOOweee!! 

Do you want cheap belly bombs?!  Go to La Taqueria.  The chicken burrito was savory, the tacos make your mouth water (even after your full), and the homemade chips and salsa are divine.  

Totally chill atmosphere.
author: Kristen H.

description: Best burrito I've had in recent memory.  This place destroyed El Farolito in the Pepsi challenge.
author: Darin E.

description: Best quesadilla ever!!! Highly recommend this place, you must try the quesadilla. The staff and owner are really nice too, definitely worth coming to
author: jolene b.

description: We got the carnitas super burrito and the carne asada super burrito. The burritos were good,but they were not as orgasmic as a lot of the reviews claim they are.
author: T B.

description: We ordered the carne asada burrito with everything extra in it. Pretty damn perfect burrito in the heart of the Mission district. Tasty, just the right amount of heat (there's green sauce available at the tables to spice it up more) and very well balanced given the various amount of stuff we asked for them to cram in it. My friend and I went splitties and were quite satisfied with this afternoon snack.
author: Lizz K.

description:
This place gets 5 stars for the Carne Asada burrito with guacamole and a side of their hot salsa, as well as for its ambiance.  

Being a San Diego native, I have come to love and enjoy the excellent Mexican food we have just across the border there.    I had lived in L.A. for 1.5 years and never found a place that had Mexican food as good as San Diego.   I tried a couple of Mexican places in SanFrancisco, and was disappointed.   But, halleluja......great Mexican food does exist outside of Tijuana and San Diego, and it exists right here at La Taqueria.
author: Marc P.

description:
I love this place.  I have been over 100+ times.  I used to work right next to this place.  Sometimes it hurts my stomach but it is so delicious I always go there anyways.  Bathroom is not the greatest.  

I love the chairs here.  Really good green hot sauce on the tables.  Excellent quesadillas, excellent everything.  Nice staff. Cool atmosphere.   Delicious.  Fast and friendly service.
author: Cynthia B.

description:
The food is good, but the prices are high and the servings are small for you what you get. They nickel and dime you for everything; my friend got avocado and sour cream on his taco and it was about the same price as my undersized (by American and neighborhood standards) burrito.

I was disappointed that they didn't have al pastor. That's my favorite Mexican meat.

On the plus side, I like that they don't give you rice on the burritos, but their burritos are half the size of anywhere else in the mission and that's not just the rice volume!! You need two to fill you up, and I'm only 150 lbs . . .

Food: 5 - tastes great. less filling (literally)
Value: 2 - they're lucky it tastes so good
author: Andrew C.

description:
