Although I haven't been here this year (only because I am too far away)..this taqueria has been an all time favorite.  Carne Asada burrito is very good...order a fruit water drink...recommend strawberry!
Man, if only you could find Mexican food this good on the East Coast...So far outside of CA and TX...I haven't.
author: Kelly K.

description:
Well it did live up to the hype, I can honestly say. This is the kind of place I can't wait to bring people from my home town to, the kind of folks who call El Pollo Loco food. Prepare to be set straight.

Make sure you order the tacos El Dorado (for the crispy inside and soft shell outside). It's the only way!

Glad they have seats outside for my doggie to eat taco crumbs.

I want to go back and see if it will 5-star. The chicken and carnitas was great but the steak was over-charred. I will probably take my sister-in-law the next time, someone needs to show her SF can rock the Mexican food.
author: Nikki M.

description: One of the best Mexican restaurants around.  Authentic taste and feel.  Get the carne asada burrito, you wont be disappointed.  Only negative is cash-only, but well worth an extra stop at the bank.
author: Bud L.

description:
IF I HAD MONEY, I WOULD BRING THIS FRANCHISE TO WASHINGTON DC RIGHT NOW!!!

DC, as much as people say about how diverse the city is greatly LACKS some authentic quick-bite mexican foods. I'm from Boston and always missed having Anna's Taqueria when craving for some cheap tacos/burritos. You can only do Chipotle so many times.... seriously.

The line is long but staff is very efficient so you won't stand in line for long. The price is very reasonable for the quality of foods. Stupid Chipotle (still good but...) costs you $7 + drinks. This place is so much better and cost just as much as Chipotle. Nothing against CMG but.... u can't beat local joints.

There are many small Mexican joints in Mission St. alone, but I think this place should be very high on your list if you plan to make a trip to this great little cheap foods haven called Mission District.
author: Josh S.

description: I enjoyed the food and the house sauce. This place is just extremely overrated, in my opinion. The long lines add to the impression that this must be the best Mexican food in the Mission District, when really it is pretty mediocre--by Mission standards--and more expensive than most other taquerias. If you can get in quickly the food is good, but not worth the wait or the money--walk two blocks and get better food more quickly for less money.
author: Nathan W.

description: carne asada burrito regular, extra meat is the best carne asada burrito i've had in california.     it is a zoo inside at all times so exercise patience.
author: Wakako U.

description: This place was really pretty darned good! For $3.75 you get a ginormous taco, and for just a buck or so more, ask for "everything and crispy" which gives you the works plus a melted crispy cheese taco INSIDE your soft taco shell, is your mouth watering yet? I had the pollo and the carnitas. Both were excellent! Green sauce on the tables for a slight bit of heat, too. I'd go back, but next time one taco is more than enough, esp if you're having chips, salsa and guac to start out. The tacos are twice the size of any other taco / burrito shop. Definitely worth it.
author: SFCAFOX S.

description:
Great al pastor tacos- tender and flavorful meat in a soft, warm corn tortilla. Great flavor.

Slightly more pricey than other places in the area but very good.

I wanted to try more but didn't have the belly room :o(

Can't wait to go back and try more!
author: Mister Chub S.

description: Got the carnitas burrito. Decent but not the best I've ever had. The carnitas was salty, and not crispy enough. The salsa, though a bit watery, was chunky, which I liked. I hear the tacos are what you should get here.
author: Ivana N.

description: Best tacos, absolutely. Best burrito.... nah. Still, tried to get one last night because their sourcing of meat is better than any of the other places... and the line was nuts. Like I've never seen it. Forty people lined up on the sidewalk. Please tell me this line is not the future norm, that Nate Silver didn't ruin La Taqueria for the locals. Because their tacos really are the best.
author: Simcha K.

description:
I had a need to eat tacos in Mission while visiting SF. Friends and fellow yelpers agreed, La Taqueria is one of the better places to go. The tacos were delicious (I had one carnitas taco and one carne asada) -- juicy, with verde salsa, beans, pico de gallo and meat. The melon fresca was like drinking a melon -- it seemed really natural.

The owner/manager creeped me out, though. As I came up to the counter, he ignored me in favor of flirting with three English girls who were just about to leave. I guess he was just making sure they had enjoyed their experience.

When it was time for me to pay, things got really confused. I gave the dude a $20, and I got $8.25 back. it seemed like too little to me (2x$3.50 + $2.75 = $9.75). I was looking at my money, and he put a heavy hand on my shoulder. "Everything OK?" he said. "I gave you a $20!", I said. He pointed to the cash register, which was showing $11.25. "So where's my three dollars, then?" I said. "That's the total", he said.

I figured with tax, it would be possible to approach that sum (I'm not familiar with CA sales tax), and I was too confused and hung over to realize that I shouldn't be getting .25 in change for a total also ending in .25. I figured it was gonna be OK, and I even tipped them a dollar.

I sat there eating, feeling sort of jipped, but the tacos more than made up for the sour feeling.

I'd come back, but be ready to do some quick math. Cash-only places leave a lot of room for creative bookkeeping.
author: Per N.

description:
#3 on 100 Things to Eat Before I Die in SF: Carnitas taco

Um, Chava's down the street does a WAY better job on their carnitas.  La Taqueria, eh.  I really wasn't impressed.  Nor were my companions.  Although, I will say that their avocado was beyond the freshest of fresh and was just so delicious.

The place was uber-packed at the start of our lunch, but as we dined on, the crowd petered out.  I can tell you this: I will not be standing in line for anything on this menu ever again, nor pushing through skinny USF kids just itching to be on the "in" vibe of purportedly the best tacos on Earth to find a seat.
author: Tamar D.

description: La Taqueria is the platonic ideal of Mission Burritos. There's a reason their business name is so generic.
author: Erich V.

description: If I could give this place 100 stars I would!! Words can not describe how much I LOVE this place!!! I started coming to La Taqueria when I was about 5 w/ my parents but to the one in San Jose. I swear everyone that worked there knew us! Don Miguel is such a sweet heart!! Ever since the San Jose restaurant closed I don't come as often but when I do they NEVER disappoint. My whole family continues to come eat here and I've even recruited my boyfriend and he loves it as well.  Their tacos de carne asada n flour quesadillas are BOMB!! I have dreams about their green tomatillo salsa!! My mouth is watering as I type!! La taqueria is THE BEST Taqueria I have ever been too!!
author: GandR A.

description:
my boss brought me to eat here and it was pretty freaking bomb

i love burritos so i always get the carne asada burrito. 

its full of FLAVOR, SO MUCH THAT IT CAN DRIP FROM THE BURRITO.

the  horchata is bomb too, definitely a must try
author: Jaime D.

description:
taco perfection!  my favorite is the carnitas tacos dorados with beans, pico, onions, cilantro, and guac!   for a nice filling snack order 1, if you want to go for it, get 2.  

the quesadillas are just as awesome.  small is the perfect portion or get the larger size to share.

this place is addicting!
author: maggie m.

description:
This is the best taco place in San Francisco, NY & LA.  I've been to many and this is it.

You'll know why when you get your food.

Go.
author: Dante S.

description:
Ok, I came here on a weeknight b/c I've been wanting to try this place for a while. Luckily, the Bart trains were delayed and everyone had to get off the trains b/c of some issue they were having. My bf and I walked to the restaurant and ordered 2 tacos each. We each had the lengua (beef tongue) and carne asada. We added the additional sour cream & guac on it. I don't think we even ordered a soda. So, why the heck did our 4 tacos come out to $24 bucks? 

Since I hadn't treated in a while, I decided before we got there that I was going to treat this time. I expecting maybe a $10 meal, but I was sooo wrong! Lol! $24 is not a lot for a meal, but it sure is alot for tacos! I am used to the $1- $2 taco prices... Anyway.... the tacos were definitely really big and pretty filling. The two tacos we each had was enough to satisfy our hunger. I love their lengua tacos! It was so delicious, yet so pricey... =(
author: Bernice C.

description:
Wow, how haven't I written a review for La Taq yet??

Best burrito in San Francisco.  Always a line, but it moves really fast.  I love watching the guy chopping the huge mound of asada :)

I just wish they stayed open later.  9:00 on a Friday?  Come on guys!
author: Corey C.

description: I've been cmg here for 20yrs best mex food I have ever had hands down!!!!!
author: Pat B.

description: Food was good, service was bad. Hey look, I know you guys were on the Food Network and all, but c'mon, can i get some service?! See this is how it happened, I waited in line behind an older "hispanic fellow" we shall call him and he was being chummy with the staff. Carrying on conversation for about 8.5 minutes. Maybe it was hot, maybe I was hungry, but I was agitated. THEN I was told it was cash only. So i had to wander to the back of the restaurant and use a sketchy ATM that charged me an extra $2.75! I might go back....but probably not.
author: Daija P.

description: This is hands down my favorite Mexican place in the city. Their carnitas burrito is wonderful, tacos are lovely, and everything is fresh and yummy. Their agua frescas are great too, I love the strawberry one. Definitely worth checking out!!
author: Katherine L.

description: Great burritos!! I am a serious burrito enthusiast, and I have to say this burrito is awesome. Also the prices on the menu are totally wrong which is funny
author: Josh A.

description:
The sign inside La Taqueria says: "The best tacos and burritos in the world". Bold statement. But true.  I have been to LA, Chicago, and San Diego. These cities are all heavy hitters when it comes to mexican food. From the taco trucks, to hole in the wall taquerias, to 5 star gourmet dining, all these cities have it. But when I want to get the best burrito or taco, the first thing that comes to my mind is La Taqueria.

 La Taq is the Michael Jordan of inexpensive (kind of), casual, mexican food. The cuts of meat are amazing, the cheese, guac, beans, etc are all made and prepared with the highest integrity.  
I love the pollo taco (not asado) with cheese and guacamole, EXTRA CRISPY (where they fry the tortillas). I have been coming here since 2000 and I send everybody here. This is on my go to list for showing people around in the city. I have had La Taq cravings and my devotion is so gnarly that I will request a La Taq run whenever I am away from the city for extended periods of time. This is the first thing I do when I come back. No question about it. 

They also make fantastic aguas frescas. I highly recomend the pineapple-strawberry combo. The menu is very simple: you have a choice of tacos, burritos, and or quesadillas. The selection of meats are carnitas (killer!), carne asada, pollo, lengua, and cabeza. This is seriously the best taco and burrito  I have ever had in my life. Go there.
author: Nick H.

description:
food: 5/5
service: 5/5 cashier only
cleanliness decor: 4/5 typical taco place

Came here on a week night with a friend. We ordered two burritos, around $7 each including tax. We sat in and ate. The burritos are pretty big and make a decent dinner. The carne asada burrito was good and the meat was very fresh. The carnitas burrito was equally good. The burritos have alot of juice from the meat; the meat sits in containers of brine liquid so it depends how well it's strained when they put it in the burrito. Towards the end of my meal the tortilla got kinda soggy but it was still tasty. I would definitely come here again for the authentic food and fresh ingredients.
author: Cecile S.

description:
Was in the mood for something fast, inexpensive, filling, and delicious last nite.  We found La Taqueria in the Mission (Carnitas Taco) in the 7x7 Big Eat SF list.  So we took the BART to 24th street and the restaurant is less than a block away, very convenient.

Both S.B. and I were starving our pants off, so we ordered:

1. 1 x carnitas taco - good, but the meat was kinda dry, tough and chewy, though all of the fixins were on point.
2. 1 x carne asada taco - this was very delicious, the meat was tender and had great charbroiled beef flavor, again, fixins were great (corn tortilla, guacamole and pico de gallo)
3. Chips and salsa - fairly large portion for about a buck and a half, a bunch of thick corn chips piled high with pico de gallo, only problem here is that the chips get water logged after a while.
4. 1 x carnitas burrito - see review for carnitas taco.
5. 1 x veggie burrito - cheese, beans, guacamole, and pico.  Very tasty, but also watery.
6. Large mandarina agua fresca - this was ok, it tasted more like fruit punch (bright orange and sugary) than fruit juice, but you could see bits of tangerine pulp, so I guess there is some real fruit mixed in.

We ate absolutely EVERYTHING and were uncomfortably stuffed to the gills for it.

Random observations
1. They charge $1.20 extra for guacamole, so if you are a guac lover like I am, just order it on the side of your chips and salsa, then use it freely on your tacos and burritos, otherwise they charge you $1.20 per item you want it added to.
2. When picking up your order, be prepared to figure things out yourself because they will just call your number and that's it - no one has any time or bandwidth to answer questions.

I definitely think we'll make it a habit to dine at La Taqueria often...It's a good hearty meal at a good price.
author: Burrito M.

description: Had a regular Carne Asada burrito here.  Good stuff, nicely marinated meat, fresh salsa, very good burrito.
author: Mr. B.

description: My favorite taqueria. I'm partial to carnitas or carne asada tacos. The food and taste was fresh and yummy.  I'd give it 5 stars if it wasn't so expensive to get a fully loaded taco. Parking is tough.
author: Jennifer B.

description: my favorite burrito place.... La Taqueria made it on the list of 100 Top restaurants in the US alongside French Laundry and Per Sec in New York... I was like.."really" ... a hole in the wall Taqueria with Michelin rated restaurants and so of course I must try... I love their burritos because they have no rice... yep... no rice... ah, i like rice but burritos are so filling, I normally feel like a burrito after consuming one, but not from La Taqueria. We have tried the chorizo, pollo, carnitas, carne asada and I must say, they are all delicious b/c the meat is so tasty. Some may say its pricey for burritos b/c they charge you for every adds, but that is OK, I rather have tasty burrito then a fat burritos that is tasteless.
author: Jay S.

description:
La Taqueria offers tasty tacos with quality ingredients. Yes the tacos are on the more expensive side, but what's an extra $1.00 to you Mr. Yuppie? Maybe 1/100th of those out-of-style aviators you own? These tacos really shine because of their skin and ingredients. The skin is thick but not starchy. Unlike inferior places where the skin is just a medium to hold the ingredients to gether, the skin here really contributes significantly in terms fo taste. The meat and salsa here are equally great. I usually get half-steak half-lengau to create a nice combination of flavor, texture, and fattiness. The meats here are well seasoned and are not overdone like the other places.

Best of all La Taqueria wraps your taco in a clever way such that you can eat it like a burrito, keeping your hands on the wrapper instead of the actual taco skin. They certainly took a cue in packaging from the iPhone!
author: Andrew H.

description:
I laughed when they claimed they have the best burrito in the world. I laughed like HAHAHA because that is some pretty big shoes to fill.  I really shouldn't have snickered because their pork tacos had me in joyful tears.  I came back again for the burrito and scarfed it down without batting an eyelash.  I brought a friend here and he said, "Wow I never had burritos with no rice?" I puzzled over that... I was so busy eating I didn't even realize the lack of carbs.  It is that good! I have to say the pork is fantastic, but the chicken is lacking in flavor.  I never order chicken here.

Oh and I absolutely love the strawberry fresca because I love picking out the strawberry pieces. I always get that drink.  The customer service was great and one Sunday they were passing out roses to all the ladies. :) I don't know about the best tacos and burritos in the world, but it certainly rocked my world!
author: Amy L.

description:
My go-to Mexican in SF.  I have been going there for almost 13 years and the same guy has been chopping the meat there (the owner, of course) the whole time. He rocks. It is the kind of place that, if there's a line (usually is, but it goes fast), I bowl over the neighborhood old lady to line up. I start salivating while parking. 

 A little more expensive than some places but the ingredients are superb quality. I like the pork tacos w/ sour cream and guacamole, spicy. Go there- you will love it! Good for kiddos too.
author: SB C.

description:
I can't say enough how much I love this place. 

My go tos:

2 carnitas tacos, everything, extra crispy, extra spicy
or
1 carnitas burrito, everything, crispy, extra spicy.

Seriously. Best tacos ever. Best fried burrito ever.
author: Kevin L.

description: Best taco in SF. Love it. Amazing. Huge line (it moves fast). Get it to go and take a walk over to Delores for a great picnic. Corn quesadillas are a bomb and the way to go. Go super with everything (recommend chorizo) and get the Horchata to cool the spice.
author: Sandra S.

description: This has become my favorite taco spot in San Francisco. I think what does it for me is the fresh salsa that they use on everything from the tacos to the chips. It's so incredibly fresh that after every bite of a chip with salsa and guacamole I can only say, "Wow, this is so fresh!!!" And you cannot beat the price here either. I've never had a bad experience at La Taqueria and will keep coming here until the cows come up.
author: Philip M.

description:
Garbage food garbage service overpriced tat. The clientele consists of Mission yuppies and white bred idiots from the East Bay,most of the real Mission residents avoid this place at all costs. You want real mexican food in large portions cooked properly and at great prices go next door to Elsey's. 
The best thing that could happen would be for this place to be closed down ITS WHITE BRED HELL.....
author: John R.

description:
If I was on that Food Network show "The Best Thing I Ever Ate" and they had an episode on burritos, I would definitely talk about this place.  Since I'll never be able to be on a show like that, I'll just make this my "The Best Thing I Ever Ate - Burritos," Yelp edition.

I have tried many taquerias on the Mission but this one keeps me coming back for more.  When I think of a burrito, I think of a La Taqueria burrito.  

The restaurant is clean and has a good amount of seating for people to enjoy their food.  Behind the counter is a wall of reviews and awards which provide justification that this place is yummilicious.  The staff is friendly and keeps the line moving at a steady pace.  Behind the counter you can see the mound of marinated carne asada just waiting to be cooked to satisfy the hungry customers.  As I wait for my food and a piece hits the grill, I just look at it and say "oh yes, you will be mine..."

My order here never changes.  I am addicted to their carne asada burrito.  I know everyone says "What?!? They charge you extra if you want guacamole, cheese, sour cream, etc.???"  Yeah, it sucks but honestly it's still worth it, LOL, and I always add these extras to complete my burrrito.  Their carne asada is perfectly marinated, tender, and juicy.  Their green chili sauce that can be found at every table is a must as it complements the already flavorful burrito.  To wash down each bite, I always get one of their aguas frescas.  All of them are good and satisfy your thirst.  After I finish my meal, I leave a happy and full customer.

Gracias La Taqueria, muy delicioso!
author: Suzi K.

description: Average taqueria joint located in the Mission.  I ordered a carne asada burrito with guacamole and sour cream prior to a visit to Mr. Pollo.  While it was definitely nice to be able to view the kitchen at work, it didn't change the plain fact that the sizzling pieces of beef still did not pack much flavor.  As many people have mentioned, the price of the food here is borderline unconscionable.  Given the proliferation of food trucks in San Francisco, it would be difficult for me to recommend La Taqueria for anything more than a desperation Mexican food run.  Gallardos and a host of other taquerias are in the vicinity and would probably be worth the trek.
author: Yelper N.

description:
This is by far the best mexican place I have ever been to.

I'm not really a carnitas kinda guy but the carne asada burrito here is amazing. The burritos here have no rice - its just beans salsa and PERFECTLY COOKED carne asada. Try taking a couple minutes and eating it there with some green sauce. The same goes for the tacos which are immense and 2 tacos here are very easily the equivalent amount of food as a burrito.

It has a very hole-in-the-wall vibe and is not super expensive which is what I like. Transportation-wise, it is one block down from the Mission and 24th BART station so it is pretty easy to get here from just about anywhere.
author: RAHUL D.

description: It's as good as everything you've heard--it lives up to its reputation. The best carnitas and carne asada I've ever had and definitely the best Agua frescas. Amazing place and deserves all its awards.
author: Won't B.

description:
Hunger strikes again. 

I have a feeling if one of the managers I work with stumbles upon this posting, he'll have a hernia. Jen W. & Rick I. and I came here before a Giants game. We were famished. The parking gods were with us, so we got a spot right in the front of the restaurant. 

We ordered tacos and burritos with chips and salsa. The first taco was amazing. The second taco after being less than starved was only mediocre. The meat is tender and juicy but lacks intense flavor. Though the tacos have a crispy AND soft shell which makes them pretty tasty. Rick got the burrito and he enjoyed it. 

Why only 3 stars? Slightly overpriced... and looks like it draws the yuppie crowd more than the authentic crowd that a place like this should.

My search continues for the best Mexican restaurant...
author: Lisa L.

description: So if SJ has La Vic's and their orange sauce, then SF has La Taqueria and their green sauce. I am sure it is just a salsa verde but it is necessary condiment to making the food here taste even better. Got the carnita and chorizo tacos and ask thm to make it crunchy. It was so delicious and I am not even a real big fan of Mexican food. I preferred the chroizo, the kick from the meat and salsa was a party in my mouth. There was beans which i usually don't like but it help balance some of the heat. Great way to start the night.
author: Eve C.

description: Pretty good food. Kind of ridiculous to have to pay extra for no beans though.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I am so grateful that I work right next door to this fine establishment.  It has served as the spot (sorry Mission Pie) for all of my fellow interns and I to bond, consume ridiculously good and authentic burritos, and practice  our espanol.  Granted, I never get spoken to in English at this joint (which I love, thank you brown skin), and was at first suspicious of them not carrying black beans, and therefore settling for pinto beans, but the vegetarian concoctions (i.e., burritos) I order always end up being devoured in five minutes.  Yup, they are that good!

Muchas gracias for your existence la taqueria!  Simple name, simple food and easy on your pocket. :)
author: Megha S.

description:
2 burritos, 2 tacos, 1 drink =  around $30.  I really want to like La Taqueria since the quality of the food is pretty good (once I got over the sticker shock on how much we spend on Mexican food in the Mission).  Their burrito and taco consist of meat (of your choice), bean, and some salsa.  Everything else (guacamole, sour cream, etc) is extra which means you can end up with a $10 burrito very quick.  On top of that, the size of the burrito is pretty skimpy too.  The tacos, however, are pretty big and filled with meat and salsa.  The meats we tried (carne asada, cabeza, carnita, and chorizo) are very inconsistent.  Some meats are tasty, some are bland, while chorizo is overly salty and greasy.  As a matter of fact, I think the grease was dripping out of all our tacos and burritos.  

Considering the fact that there are so many restaurants within walking distance that offer food of similar quality for either bigger in size/quantity or cheaper in price, I don't see any reason to come back and pay $10 for a small burrito in the Mission.  To me, this almost felt like eating at Panda Express but paying PF Chang price.
author: Jack L.

description:
How this place has less stars than El Farolito, I do not know. Don't get me wrong, I love El Farolito, it's my 2nd or 3rd Mex option in SF, but La Taqueria's tacos and overall quality of food is on a whole other level. Perhaps the prices are what have created this difference in stars, as La Taq is very expensive compared to other Taquerias...but let me tell you, this is not only as good as it gets, it's "I don't think it can get any better"
Yes, it is that good. I'm craving the tacos and burritos just thinking about it. It haunts me to know that 3,000 miles separate me from this establishment. If you haven't been, get the steak tacos with everything. You can ask for the tacos to be "dorado", or crispy, which is a nice way to mix it up. The avocado mix and salsa along with the good quality of the steak and the cheese is what makes it all work. You can add sour cream or hot sauce, but if you want to savor the taco, stick with the avo, cheese and salsa.  Burritos are great too, I love them here. I've had friends that have said they love the burritos, and others who have said they are not used to having a burrito without rice (they serve burritos without rice). So just a heads up. This place is a must if you've never tried it.
author: Mariano A.

description:
My family has been going there for more than 30 years and it's because of the good flavor and quality.  

Yes, prices have crept up - don't expect to go and eat there on the cheap. Don't believe the one $ yelp rating :-) At least not if you expect to make a full meal out of it.
author: Habibi S.

description:
CARNITAS TACOS!!!!!!

Sooooooo good! Salsa is excellent, I get them hot and in the original style with meat, salsa, beans, in corn tortillas (you can add sour cream, guac, cheese, and crispy shells if you like). La Taq is cheap and delicious!!!
author: Kadie B.

description: This place is popular in guidebooks and some locals, but, in my opinion, it's nothing too special. I sampled their carne tacos and they were reasonably priced (came out to about $8 for two tacos). The meat and filling was good but nothing to write home about. In conclusion, a decent place if you're in the area, but not the best Mexican food in town.
author: Giulio R.

description: Umm. Pork taco no beans but with avocado n cheese. Chips n salsa and a fresa please! Thank you! it's what i always order.
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description: It's fast and cheap but not doesn't stack up to the rest of the burritos I have had. I came here once with a friend of mine to have lunch, it's one of her favorite spots but when I gave it a shot it sort of missed. Carne asada isn't really my cup of tea [ I know, every time I say that my friends want to beat me with their abuelita's broom "A burrito without meat is a burrito without a soul!!" Still, I quite enjoy my vegetarian burros). It was a pretty damn bland burrito unfortunately. not much sour cream or guac in mine, mostly melted cheese and lettuce but it did that thing where the cheese is so hot it cooks the lettuce so it doesn't feel fresh, maybe i'm being too picky though. I mean this is my buddies spot so I guess some people like it and some don't.
author: Dan B.

description:
My cousin brought takeout from here and it was generally terrible. They messed up the order, but the main problem is that it just didn't taste good. We had a combo of tacos, burritos and quesadillas and they were all bad. I'm guessing the food is better in-house, but word to the wise, do not get anything to go. 

The one good thing was the spicy green salsa.
author: S S.

description: Damn tacos are the best ever! The meat is perfectly seasoned, steak, grilled chicken, pork, whatever you choose, delicious! The way the layer both tortillas together, with whole pinto beans, salsa, my mouth is watering just thinking about it.....must try place!
author: Gwen K.

description:
You just can't come in here without getting in a long ass line, and after you've had their carnitas burrito and/ or taco you won't be surprised. They don't use rice, they just get down to business when it come to their burritos/ tacos: salsa, cheese, avocado, and the most tasty carnitas EVER. They also toast their taco's so you get that nice crispy texture, OMG I'm drooling on my keyboard just thinking about it. 

They also have a good variety of Aguas Frescas and of course Horchata to wash that bomb ass food down. 

I say head out to La Tacqueria even if you have to wait in line, absolutely worth it! 

PS. CASH ONLY = )
author: Irene N.

description: Best burrito in town, hands down. I hate that I have to avoid it for a while after all the good press they got last year. It's just mobbed.
author: Jeffrey T.

description:
La taqueria is one of my favorite burrito places in the bay-area.  I'm very picky when it comes to a great burrito, but not having rice on the burritos really brings out the flavor of the meat and the sauces.   Nice people running the place, great atmosphere, and clean establishment.  

Even though is a nice trek from where I live and work, I take any opportunity to take friends and coworkers to this location. It's just that good.  I recommend the Carne Asada burrito with Extra Guacamole and sour cream, or the tacos de cabeza, Very very good.
author: Marcelo B.

description: Best carnitas burritos in San Francisco. Eat there every time we visit the bay area. Great chips and salsa as well.
author: Nelson R.

description:
Quick, authentic and delicious.
If you order a taco ask for it crispy!
I love the tongue but everything is amazing.
Guacamole is too expensive but not a deal breaker.
author: A S.

description:
100% lives up to the hype. The carnitas are the way to go. Burrito has soft, delish tortilla too -- just get the regular, no need to muck it up with sour cream, etc. 

I have actually found myself counting the minutes until this place opens so I could have some pork goodness.
author: Jessica C.

description: A friend and co-worker took me to this place and I had the Burrito and it was pretty good.  My friend suggested we split a meat stuff quesadilla.  Sounded like a good idea and boy was it.  That was the best single mexican food item I have ever eaten.  Wonderful, just wonderful.  I have take my wife now a few times and she just loves this place.  5 Stars all the way
author: Sarah N.

description: Their quesadilla are the bomb diggity. You might be in danger of suffering a heart attack 30 minutes later but it's the best hang over food I know. I'm deducting one star because I'm not totally sold on their tacos.
author: Yana K.

description: The best carnitas tacos I've ever had. period. My favorite mexican taqueria north of the border :)
author: Daniel M.

description:
Literally just got back from this place after enjoying a pork burrito.  It was my second time there and there's no way I'm forgetting this place.  SO GOOD! Make sure you get some hot sauce in your burrito for that extra tatste.  The beef burritos are just as tasty.

A burrito (which, by the way, will fill you up) and a drink will cost you less than $10, so it's definitely worth it.
author: Michael S.

description:
la taqueria has copies of over 20 magazines who sing their praises on one wall. the opposite wall has a mural depicting ancient ancestral lands.

menu: tacos (3.50) burritos(6.50) aqua fresca(2.25, 2.75)

sampling
carne asada burrito(6.50) on the small size with only beans, juicy salsa and tender carne asada.

frijoles refritos:
-pay at register and wait for call when food is ready
-no chips, no salsa bar, lots of naplins
-not filling.
-long lines at lunch.
author: Victor G.

description: Doesn't live up to the hype. After waiting in a very long line and staking out a table, I hoped for an amazing burrito. The "el dorado style" was nice, but the "super" is not big. The burrito felt especially expensive for the size. No rice is an interesting choice, but without free chips, I left hungry. Also, there is no guacamole here, just plain avocado, and of course there is no salsa bar since there are no free chips. Check out La Cumbre instead.
author: Michael L.

description: OK, so it's expensive for a taqueria ($3.75 for a taco without any extras) -- it's worth it!!!  The chicken is the best I've come across, all white, tender and moist.  The soft shells are perfectly cooked, everything is top notch.  We went there last weekend and the gregarious guy at the checkout gave our little girl a rose!  And it wasn't creepy btw, just awesome.
author: Steve S.

description:
Dear La Taqueria, your taco put Nick's to shame. I mean it, you do the same thing but better. I wish I could keep you all to myself and stuff my face with your tacos while everyone is at "Taco Tuesday." 

Ever since I moved up to the bay area, I've loved La Taqueria for it's burritos... little did I know the best lay ahead. These tacos are delicious and the green sauce they have on the table is AMAZING. 

I love La Taqueria (and then when you're done you can go across the street and get a slice of pie!)
author: Abbey S.

description:
For years all I got here were their absolutely fab tacos (super carnitas with dual crispy/soft tortillas, natch!). Then, about two years ago, I decided to try their burritos.

Wow.

Just as out-of-this world but in the oh-so-much-more convenient burrito form factor. Just make sure to ask for your burrito "crispy" for that extra bit of delicious texture to the tortilla and even more gooey goodness inside.

Now, I get the tacos if I'm sticking around to dine in. Even I'm on the run, it's burritos every time.

Normally I would give them 4 stars since it's so damned expensive for taqueria but the ingredients are top-notch and there's no rice "filler" so it's totally worth it.

-Shugs
author: Seth S.

description:
I can't believe I haven't written a review for this place. I've been a satisfied customer since 1979, which is the year of my birth. I would like to note that the weaved leather chairs have been here since forever. 

I recently took my son here since we were in the hood. He's all, "These are like mini burritos!" Right you are, son. Referring to the tacos, of course. He's used to the taco truck variety; the sand dollar sized ones with chopped meat, onions, cilantro, and salsa. We love those as well, but sometimes you have to fulfill your fully-loaded taco craving. La Taqueria is the perfect place to do it. I'm happy that my grandmother moved away from this part of the Mission because bums and hookers used to loiter about her front stoop, but I really miss having this place within walking distance.

They are so efficient, too. Even when the line isn't crazy, they have a waitress taking your order in line. And they call out your order number in Spanish and English.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
Ridiculously priced and not so delicious, at least the burrito wasn't as good as it could've been.  First, let's discuss costs - a burrito is $6.50 (don't quote me on that) and it only comes with meat, beans, and salsa!  WTF?! A burrito is supposed to come with so much more.  You have to pay 50c more (for each item) if you want cheese, sour cream, or guacamole, which I of course added all three items.   So the burrito itself came to $8 or $9, which is outrageous and unreasonable for a burrito in the mission at a classless dining establishment.

I also had the opportunity to knock another item off the 7x7 SF's Big Eat List, which was #3, the carnitas taco.  It was great, at least the bite of it I tried.  I thought it was much tastier and less expensive than the burrito.  I definitely think La Taqueria specializes in tacos, not burritos...what's coming out of your speedo?! Hahaha!
author: Jenny W.

description: Best tacos I've ever had EVER!. Its a shame they closed the one in san jose. I actually rarely went because the location there was inconvient. Downtown parking is not the best. Their chorizo taco was soo good its dangerous. I'll have to make a trip to SF one of these days to grab a bite.
author: Evangelina B.

description: The crunchy tacos are bomb, almost as good as mine, haha, like no other taco's around, crunchy taco inside a flour tortilla, stuffed to the brim with your choice of meat.  The chicken, and pork is my favorite. Other than it being a little pricey, no complaints on this spot. Always stop here when in the neighborhood.
author: Charlie H.

description: I always make excuses for a bad experience... maybe it was the cooks on that particular day and time, or maybe it was what I ordered.... They have a wall of awards.... But they did not meet up to them.  Their taco's were salty and not very flavorful at all. And expensive even! For a good taco I wouldn't mind paying $4 but I didn't enjoy it... those were $7 i'll never get again with the taco and drink I had lol.... I wouldn't go there again, there are much too many mexican places in the mission to love.... Awards? Yeah right! Don't believe the hype!
author: Adriana T.

description: The very best ever carne asada tacos! They melt in your mouth. The chicken were good as well as were the chips with fresh salsa.  But get carne asada!! I'm coming back tomorrow :-)
author: Anna W.

description: Great portions for the carne asada old school feel with tunes from Mexico blaring.
author: Chris D.

description: It's a cute restaurant with a lot of relatively clean inside seating, and kind of a lunchline style of ordering your food. Got the carnitas taco (7x7 list), and it was tasty. We must have not known how to order though, caus I looked around and saw that other people's tacos came with cooler things on them, like cheese. I also liked how it came shaped more like a standing-up-triangle-roll so that it wasn't as messy to eat.
author: Melody L.

description:
one of the places listed on the 100 places to eat in SF. 

the list says to eat the carnitas tacos which i heard were really good but I decided I wanted to try something else. I tried the chicken burrito which tasted similar to other places I have had but the SALSA WAS GOOD! I'm a big fan of salsa and this place has great salsa!
author: Michelle W.

description:
I was back in the city a week ago, and whenever I'm back in the city there is just one place I HAVE to go to....Taqueria baby. These are the best tacos I have ever had. One taco in the afternoon is all you need as these things are big and pack a wallop. Make sure you hunker down with the verde salsa too, and don't forget to smother your taco with it. 

Mark my words: Best Taco EVER.
author: Matt M.

description: I've been a fan of their chicken tacos since forever! They're just that good! I def recommend this place if you haven't been!
author: Fallon P.

description: Super tacos de carnitas!!! This place.is really good just a.little price.
author: Silvia R.

description: What other burrito places aspire to be. There's nothing like one of their monster burritos after a long hike through San Francisco's parks. It's a long bus ride down Mission street, but it's worth it. Get a glass bottle of Coke for the perfect combination.
author: Robert V.

description:
UPDATE: 30 mins after original review

Meh, I spoke too, soon. I give them a good review, and they totally jack my order. Then the lady who was already cranky, got even crankier when I called to tell her she made a mistake. 

Pffft! It's the Mission. There's tons of taquerias and they're ALL cheap. No need to come back here again.

Minus two stars. 


----------------------------------------------------------------------------

El Cheapo's Dream Come True...

The food is good. The prices are excellent.

-Mrs. El Cheapo.
author: Ladi Da A.

description:
At first glance, this place seems to really cater to the meat eaters. The steak and carnitas look and smell great and you can watch the cooks dicing it up right behind the counter.

However, for a vegan like myself, La Taqueria is attractive as well.  Their veggie burrito is simple---just beans, salsa and cheese for $3.50.  Avocado is $1.20. While ordering, I asked the cashier to leave off the cheese and when she asked if I wanted avocado, I said, sure, I'll have avocado instead of cheese. She won major points with me for actually replacing the cheese with avocado price-wise--that is, dropping 50 cents off the price for no cheese, so I only paid $4.20 total.  Yes, I'm also cheap, and it really rubs me the wrong way when I have to pay for stuff like cheese and sour cream that I don't eat just because I want something vegan (I'm looking at you, Taqueria Can Cun).

I also like that La Taqueria doesn't put rice in their burritos. Though this seems to define the "Mission burrito" it always seemed like an aberration to me. With just beans, fresh salsa, and added avocado (spiced up with the salsa verde from the squeeze bottle), this good-sized burrito was tasty and plenty filling. Maybe not as flavorful as other places, but it was affordable, fresh-tasting, and the service was fine. All in all, unless I'm in the mood for the novelty of Papalotes, I'll bring my next burrito craving here.
author: Tamara F.

description: Tacos: Taqueria vs. Farolito.... Taqueria is a little more filling - it's got sour cream and beans as well. Actually, I prefer the taste of Farolito, it's more meat/savory and spicy.
author: Julia K.

description: Hands down one of my favorite taquerias! My boyfriend and I take a trip all the way down to SF when we are craving super fresh and super yummy mexican food..Writing this review is making me crave it. Ahh! We order the same thing every single time we come here and we've never been disappointed. I get a carne asada taco.. bomb.com I tell ya! The way they cook their meat is on point. I love that there's a crunch factor in their shells. The boyfriend always gets his usual carne asada quesidilla. It's pretty big and super fulfilling! I looove their fresh salsa. Contains lots of super fresh tomatoes! Definitely worth the 40 minute drive down to this place! Not to mention Anthony's Cookies is right around the corner from this place.. haha. If you're in the area, give this place a shot!
author: Krystle Ann C.

description:
Here I am at last to speak up about this place! See, I was brought up in SF, going to this place. It was my dad's mose favourite burrito...why? Because as he used to say "We are Mexicans, and Mexcians don't put beans in a burrito, and this place knows that!" 

We would stand in line for an hour, sit on those ghastly chairs and love every second of it. It was a HUGE treat for us since we were very poor. 

I went back this past month as I do every year as a tribute to my father. Just like when I was I kid, the place tasted like the food of the gods....

The only downside is that for the serving size, you have to have the apetite of a bird, or the money of a god to be able to fill up there.

On that same note: It is a CASH ONLY business...so bring 20 a person if you are not anorexic.
author: Sugar V.

description: My go-to place when I need a burrito fix. It's usually packed anytime I come here, but it's to be expected when their ingredients are so yummy. You can't go wrong with anything there, but I love their burritos the best.  The regular size is plenty for me, but my husband can down the super burrito plus a taco. What keeps me coming back for more is the green sauce they have in bottles on the table.  Not sure what's in it, but it adds just the perfect amount of kick to my burrito.  It's cash only so you might want to stop at an ATM before coming here.
author: Julie P.

description:
I really want to LOVE this place, because the food is spectacular.  But I can't give more than 2.5 stars (rounding up today).  The reason why?

I was SCARED to order, the people there are kinda rude. Taco nazi's! 

Then I was afraid to ask for more salsa, and I was right.  The lady at the counter BARKED at me when she said "there's already salsa in your taco!"

B*tch, I drink salsa, so gimme some more.  I was even ready to pay for more salsa.  

I left feeling defeated, but full and satisfied.
author: Bhumika K.

description: I eat chicken burritos, and La Taqueria has the best chicken burrito.  Prices, due to the gentrification on Valencia St, seem to have been steadily rising, but damn are their chicken burritos good.   They also have bomb salsa that you can stock up on, and beer, and a few good window seats. . . or you could take your chicken burrito to the park.
author: Christopher F.

description:
Now this place is TASTY!

I love crunchy and their Carne Asada Tacos are delicious and crunchy!
Gotta love that...

The meat is surprisingly tasty and marinated well.  I am glad they have guacamole in their tacos too...

Don't get the burrito, just get 2 tacos... worth its weight is carne!
author: Limzer L.

description:
La Taqueria is not your average Mission taqueria. 

First, both the tacos and burritos come with minimal ingredients. If you want anything more than beans, meat, and salsa, you'll be charged for it. I've seen conflicting prices on Yelp, but currently (I ate there tonight), sour cream is .50, cheese is .50, and avocado is $1. Chips and salsa are $1.20.

Secondly, the bill is more expensive at La Taqueria than other taquerias nearby. Since the burritos start at $6.50 and tacos start at $3.50, it's not exactly cheap. A dinner for two (burrito, two tacos, chips & salsa, horchata, and soda) was $27.

Third, the quality at La Taqueria is well above average. I'm an emphatic supporter of El Farolito, but I actually think the carne asada at La Taqueria tastes better. It seems they don't put a lot of stuff in the burritos because they take pride in every ingredient. A predominantly meat burrito at other places would probably be horrible, but it's not here. 

Fourth, there's no rice. I love rice in burritos, although I know some people don't. I solve this by ordering tacos instead.

And finally, the place has loyal fans and numerous accolades. It's almost always busy. Getting a table, giving your order, and paying can range from simple to hectic. Patience is important here.

My recommendation:
Carnitas & Carne Asada tacos dorado style, + cheese, + avocado.

I have to admit that the tacos are similar to Nick's Crispy Tacos, which sells cheaper food. I can't decide which I like more, although I think La Taqueria has a slight edge. The flavors are more complex and authentic.
author: Amanda C.

description: BEST burrito in San Francisco!! I take that back!!BEST IN THE Bay Area!! Been comming here for almost 25 years!! It sucks!!Kidding!! Steak burrito with no beans and Guacamole is ALL it needs!! Simply put, there is a Party going on in my mouth EVERYTIME I take a bite!! Not a tastier,tender,Kick-ass burrito in town!!Chips and Salsa I can pass on,and you to probably should!!Still not holding it against them!!THIS PLACE ROCKS!!
author: Craig T.

description: What else is there left to say about this place?! I mean, just look at all the reviews this place has and its average rating!! I am definitely a fan!!! I come to this place maybe twice a month.. Their carne asada is the BOMB!!! And their burritos are not too big and not too small. All of their ingredients are fresh and never dull!! I bit pricey, but as they say, "you get what you pay for". I have to warn you though, if you plan to come and eat here; they only take cash so make sure you bring DEE-NEH-ROW (Money).  However, they do have an ATM in side for your convenience. A typical carne asada burrito with everything, chips, salsa and a large drink will run you about $13 with tax...  Trust me; your taste buds will thank you!!
author: Cesar N.

description:
I've been going to this place since I was in the 5th grade. (that's a long time).  The receipe has not changed and it's still the best. Whenever family comes to visit this is the first stop. 

Everything is homemade, amazing salsa verde on the table, carnitas and carne asada are my two favorites. You can request crispy tacos as well and get all the extras. 

It's not your cheapest taco but the quality is worth the extra bucks.
author: Chris W.

description:
Fat Day. Stop number 2.

After devouring a beer sausage, my friend and I made our way over to get ourselves the carnitas taco. We were both feeling pretty darn guilty by now because we were also planning on getting donuts after. I can just hear it now - people are screaming - OMG! WTF?! Well, I have nothing to say for myself, I really don't. 

The tacos are around $3.50+tax. That's pretty steep for one taco, but I guess I can see why. The carnitas taco I got was pretty stuffed with meat, salsa, and I forget, but it was realllly good. I don't know if it was $4 good, but I'd maybe opt for a burrito next time. 

Another confession - I was watching other people eat their burritos and I really wanted one, but of course, I didn't. They didn't look overwhelming stuffed, but it also didn't look skimpy, so maybe that's a better choice?

I digress, the taco was really juicy and flavorful. Mmm...I am kind of craving another one and I just ate lunch, but I guess that didn't really stop me yesterday. Thank goodness I don't live near these places or it would be all bad news bears.
author: Dolores L.

description: They really do have an amazing burrito.  I always get the beef super burrito, spicy.  It would be nice if the line was shorter.
author: Eric V.

description: Mmm my bf and I read some awesome reviews about this place and decided to try it. He got the steak burrito and super taco. I only had the super taco. The super taco were good (it could more flavorful) but they weren't worth $5.95 in my opinion. It's kind of overpriced. I've tried a little of his burrito and it was good too! We got to try the different meat as well. Love the service!
author: Karen T.

description:
Hello crispy shell taco with soft flour bed wrapped around you so snugly. Now don't get me wrong, these tacos are actually quite tasty and I would love to have another one. However I think they cost about $7 each, which could buy you a full meal with a drink in itself when it comes to Mexican food.

The taco was extremely well done with the perfect balance of crispiness and softness. Filled to the brim with meat and overflowing with sour cream and guacamole. Delicious and quite filling, but I would still need to take down two for it to be a meal and I actually eat rather little.

All in all I would come back but only if my wallet was feeling up to it. It is a bit pricey for what you get, taco-wise.
author: Winè C.

description:
I've been going here since I can remember, I'm 26 now, and their quality has never, ever gone down. The guy who has been assembling the tacos there for the past, what? Thirty years? He's still there and he's got. it. down! The prices fluctuate with the economy, sure, but it's still a good deal on delicious, quality, food.

A big plus for me, and I know this is a major source of contention in the burrito eating community: NO POINTLESS FILLER RICE IN THE BURRITOS! Thank you, La Taqueria! You may get crap from pro-ricers but I for one appreciate your vision of a rice-free taqueria.

Everything on the menu is scrumptious. Try it all but especially the carne asada burrito w/ cheese and avocado and a large fresa (strawberry) agua fresca.
author: Sophia D.

description: Best steak burrito I've ever had.  The meat was so tender and flavorful that I wish I could be there right now.  It was super-busy so getting a seat was competitive, but it was well worth it.
author: Jane A.

description:
If you have read my other reviews in regards to Mexican food, this place is my favtorite spot for a good taco! 

If you happen to be in the Mission district and feel like a good taco for lunch you have to stop by here. I will say that the super taco's are a little pricey, but you'll find that it was well worth the $7. I know.... pretty expensive for a taco, but the super has a soft corn tortilla shell, which is then accented with a crunchy taco shell within it. Then the meat of your choice is stuffed in between and topped off with sour cream, fresh salsa, and guacamole! MAN..... im drooling just thinking about it! 

Words cant describe! go check them out and have a super taco!
Oh and one thing that does kinda suck is that they dont take credit cards. Who carries cash these days?
author: thomas l.

description:
Best carne asada burrito I've had in my life.  Stupidly tender, packed with fresh ingredients, marinated beyond belief, with incredible crisp farmers market flavor veggies..

Go.. that is all.
author: Ethan L.

description:
I only posted 1 start because of my first experience with upset stomach and severe diarrhea after eating the delicious carnitas burrito with guacamole. Don't know if it was the pork or the guacamole. I've been here many times before and never had a digestive issue. I just want to post this to make sure everyone is safe and they're not getting to lax (no pun...). 

I would love to be able to go back without any worries.
author: Andrew L.

description: Authentic flavorful meat, I had 2 tongue crunchy tacos with only cilantro and onions and the green sauce and it was LOVE in my mouth!!! Simply the best I have ever had! The amount of guacamole and meat they put on your taco is large so I think one or two tacos will be plenty. The first time I ordered 3 tacos thinking they were small and I was overly full. I went on a sat and sun around lunch time and place was crowded but not packed. Price per taco is like $3.75 or so but trust me its well worth every bite, its not ur typical taco truck food so you cant even compare. I love La Taqueria!
author: Selene P.

description:
Really, 3.5 stars.

I'd been wanting to come here for ages, and while it's good, it wasn't amazing - especially since it was kind of expensive. I got two carne asada tacos "grande" (because I wanted salsa, guac & sour cream), and they were, like, $6 something each! I was feeling the need to try something fruity so I had the cantaloupe agua fresco, and my entire bill was almost $15. 

I was a bit stunned, as a group of girls and I had actually all eaten at Limon Rotisserie - family style - a month or so ago, and when we all split the bill, we each paid $17, and that included sangria (awesome sangria, at that)! So while I hate to sound cheap, let's face it - we're in a recession, and this 9370.07 Dow could be an artificial rise, so we're all watching our pocket books.

Point is, for 2 tacos and an artificially flavored sugary/fruity drink, I think $15 is a bit ridiculous. Food was good, but a bit over-priced. Next time I'll probably go to El Farolito, Taqueria Cancun, or try out Papalote.

p.s. I'm not totally averse to spending $, but prefer to save it for the finer things in life - the things that truly merit it (e.g. wine-tasting, for one). I'm a cost-conscious management consultant, so what do you expect? :)  I'm not cheap, just particular. ;)
author: Sally M.

description: What a disappointment. 14 bucks for a large mango fresca drink and a carnitas burrito with cheese avocados sour cream and no beans. They charged an extra 1.20 for no beans. So I expected every bite of my carnitas burrito to be filled with hot tasty carnitas. Nope not only was the meat lacking it was cold to the taste. Once I had that first bite I should have brought it back and demanded a refund. Place is overrated. And they have the nerve to have a tip jar.
author: Aj S.

description: Could be meater. Love the fact that the refried beans aren't mush, but that extra charge for no beans is weird. The best place to get a burrito so far though
author: Cynthia L.

description:
2 stars only for being edible and decent tasting. Burrito was very watery, and had little flavor. And I tried almost everyone's food (had brought some cousins from out of town here), and all of it was watery with not much flavor or spice. This is one of the most overrated spots in the city. I would never come back here with so many better options around.

Ok, some extra points for the exterior being kind of unique, with the two ovals and the sign. And decent service.. But at the end of the day, bland food.
author: Steve R.

description: I am sad to say the food quality has gone down. I am born and raised from the Mission and this was my beloved spot. I recommended it to everyone and as an adult would make special trips to here. I recently came here in December and brought my friends from Southern California to show them how a taco is really done and was clearly disappointed. It had lost its familiar taste and became a taco I could have gotten anywhere.  I do hope they return to their roots and become the great taqueria they once were. Oh and yes the service is terrible but it always has been. I put up with it since the food was great but now that it isn't, I'm not so sure
author: Courtney B.

description: Visiting San Fran from L.A. I thought we knew Mexican until I hit up La Taqueria on Mission. I had the asada burrito, side of chips & guac, wife had a chicken taco. Open kitchen you could see the meat on the grill....then chopped up hot and most importantly NOT FATTY at all. I've had some crap in L.A. that's chewy and hard to digest. The meat at La Taqueria was nothing like it. The chicken especially was flavorful.  The ambiance was very laid back and casual....heck, it's a Taqueria and because of this alone I had some doubts. The recommendation was a hit. One the best mexican I have ever had and I have had a ton being from LA.
author: Aldo B.

description:
I grew up going to the La Taqueria in DT San Jose. My family and I would order the quesadilla, Agua Fresca and a few carne asada burritos. I'd play La Bamba on the jukebox and would be the happiest little girl ever! 

The La Taq in San Jose closed about a year ago and I was devastaed. A friend told me about an amazing mexican restaurant in the Mission and brought me one lazy saturday. To my amazement it was the same La Taq i knew and Loved!! 

Get the crispy carne asada tacos with guac sourcream and chesse!! Best mexican food you'll ever have!
author: Meg C.

description:
We entered after a failed attempt to get food at the San Francisco Street Food Fesitval. People are lined up for Latin American food, so we figured, this is the Mission. We can go to a real restaurant instead of eating something cooked in a booth. 

Walking down Mission on the way to El Farolito, we came across this place. I decided that it'll be cool to try something different. Originally, I was going to order a burrito, but looking around me it seemed tacos were the thing here.

We ordered 2 chicken tacos with guacamole and salsa, carnitas quesadilla, and two coronas. The final bill came out to 28 dollars, which caused me pause.

Food was decent. Fresh, but not terribly flavorful. The service was fast and painless.  However, there was nothing remarkable that would justify the price. 

It may be worth it to try the carne asada tacos to see what people are talking about. However, given El Farolitos is just a block away, and in general there are no shortages of places to get excellent Mexican food in the Mission, you have to look up at the awards on the wall and realize that the price is often influenced by those pieces of paper.
author: Boris C.

description:
What can you buy with $6?

1. Two mini meals at Mcdonalds = two burgers, two small fries, and two drinks
2. Two Vietnamese sandwiches from Lee's or Saigon Sandwiches
3. Two Mexican hot dogs (hot dogs wrapped in bacon topped with onions)
4. A bowl of Pho from PPQ
5. ONE, I repeat, ONE TACO from La Taqueria. Yes, I said ONE.

Yes, it was a good, maybe even very good, carnitas taco. But a taco that only comes with meat, beans (ew), and salsa, is not good enough for me. So:
 
   $3.50 For a meat, bean, and salsa taco 
   $1.20 For guacamole
   $0.50 For sour cream
   $0.50 For cheese
+ Tax
----------------------------------------------------
$6.18 For ONE taco

This is unfortunate because their carnitas was tasty, lightly crispy; their guac was rich and yummy; their spicy salsa had a bit of a kick; and it all came together for an expensive, tasty taco. I'd say these tacos are about the same size as Nick's tacos at Nick's Crispy Taco's (which are $1 on Tuesdays!!! Makes these even less appealing...), so they're on the bigger side. I'd eat two for a meal, which means $12 for two tacos, when I can pay half that for a burrito with everything on it at nearly any other taqueria in the Mission.

P.S. Their burritos work much the same. $6.50 for a burrito with meat, beans, and salsa. Everything else is extra $$.
author: Christine L.

description: I don't get why others go nuts for this place.  I tried the carnitas super burrito, and it was very bland and mushy.  I'm a big burrito fan, but was disappointed by this spot.
author: Josh Q.

description:
Four stars for this delicious taqueria in the Mission. One thing to note: it's cash only, so make sure to have some handy - though there is an ATM in the back.

Honestly, I've only had the Carnitas taco so far, but I can't wait to come back to try some of their other offerings. The meat is so tender and yummy that I kind of just want a bowl of it. The pico de gallo on top is really fresh and a perfect blend of the ingredients. I just loved these tacos. I saw some people ordering what I think is a "super taco" - where they fry a tortilla on the flat top with some cheese, and wrap it in a soft tortilla and throw some sour cream/guac on it (like a double decker!).

Their horchata is also really good here too. It's not that watered down crap that you can find at most other places. Instead it's really sweet, and full of yummy almond/cinnamon goodness. 

You can tell that the place is full of regulars, and the people that work there are really nice.
author: Amanda D.

description: They say they have the best burritos in America! Not true. It's a big hype. I tried better but they are still pretty good. Very great tasting meat and all the ingredients.
author: Eric S.

description: Overrated & over priced.  Ordering "No beans" in your burrito will cost you $1.50.  Can you believe that?  There are way too many delicious mexican restaurants in the Mission to waste your time eating at La Taqueria.  I'm sure they were excellent a few years ago before they received all of the praise and awards.  Service was also poor.
author: Jenice M.

description: Best burrito in San Francisco, bar none. The carne asada is to die for, you get a true grilled taste. Love the fact that rice is nowhere to be seen here, I just don't like rice in my burritos, it makes for a dry burrito. La Taqueria's burrito is the juiciest burrito I've had. Go read my el Farolito review, I get more in depth why I prefer la Taqueria over el Farolito. Both establishments have their pluses and minuses...but my review here is on pure flavor, and la Taqueria wins this one. El Farolito gets an eight, La Taqueria gets a ten. Oh, and the green salsa here is da bomb. Wished I knew what the salsa at el Farolito tastes like, unfortunately, I wasn't given any there, lol.
author: Hector Z.

description:
Look, any place that has the cajones to call itself "La" Taqueria, i.e. "THE" Taqueria, has got something to prove.

I have been eating at this place since I was ten (I'm 44 now) and can say that this is the CLEANEST flavored place in SF's fabled Mexican food kingdom.  (I'm not saying clean as in soap and water, but in terms of taste, sabor!!!)

Note:  Most of you newbies would never know this, but the crew that works behind the counter never EVER changes.  They know their stuff.
Very familiar faces.

Don't, I repeat DON'T leave w/out getting one of the fruit drinks.

Oh, and I usually do the tacos.  Just a little more autentico para mi.

Lastly, those who are seeking arroz, go elsewhere.  No fillers here baby.
author: Sam P.

description: Awesome tacos, the tongue ones are the best (minus the beans) and they have beer to go with them!
author: Anna N.

description:
eh.  nothing really noteworthy to right about.

my fav burrito places are still chipotle, tropisueno
author: Cathy U.

description:
Absolutely delicious! Carne Asada taco loaded is my favorite. One does a small appetite/tummy good...wish I could fit two in!! 
My one and only complaint (if you even want to call it that) is the cost. Cheap if you get you item plain but who's gonna do that?! The more you add onto it the $$ it gets so beware & bring xtra cash.  It's WORTH it to ME!
author: Marlo R.

description: Fried rice   and noodle   soups  and   pho
author: Rodricus P.

description: who said this is the best burrito in the US? well, gotta say I strongly disagree with that assessment.
author: Hanya G.

description: I went to redeem the free carne asada taco tonight courtesy of the Scoutmob app. I was in and out of the restaurant in less than 5 minutes! The tortilla was superb. The carne asada was alright, a little on the dry side. The tomatoes were really good as well. Not bad for a tree taco from an authentic Mexican place.
author: Dominic T.

description: This place is pretty good.  I got the steak crispy taco..comes in a crispy tortilla then wrapped in a soft.  Lots of meat lightly seasoned with yummy pico de gallo.  Cheese, sourcream and avocado are extra.  Very busy but that  must mean a good thing.  Only negative thing, no free chips or salsa ;I(
author: Kimberly C.

description: I'm a 59 year old mexican american.  La Taqueria has the BEST carne asada tacos that I have ever tasted in my entire life. This includes all the homemade tacos I have had from all of my relatives.  My favorite tacos are the soft carne asada with cheese, whole beans and pico de gallo. I pour on the green tomatilla sauce and enjoy. Truly worth the wait and travel time
author: Thomas P.

description:
See, I came here based on all the fantastic reviews on Yelp. Goes to show that it really is a hit and miss some times!

The burrito wasn't horrible? But I've definitely had better (and I'm from Canada!). It was small, plain, and just not oozing with stuff. In my mind, burritos should just be bursting with Mexican flavour! 

It did not. 

I told them I wanted cheese and avocado. They skipped on both. It was sparse, empty, and lacking excitement. That is all.
author: Emily C.

description:
Came here for the carnitas tacos. Some of the best carnitas that I've had in the city. They are perfect and juicy and generally full of awesome. They are huge, though.  They are full of meat and beans, so one of them can fill you up.  They're also pretty expensive.  It's $3.50 for the basic taco (no cheese or anything).  Oh well.  

Had the tacos both times I've visited.  Will go for the burritos next.
author: Alea G.

description:
Busted hand edition review time.

Had way better carnitas.  Runny, not much flavor.
Pollo ok.
Chips hard as rocks.  On the plus side they can smother them in salsa & flavorless avocado & they never get mushy.
Tacos with beans?  Not my style.
Tamarindo middling, drinkable.  Horchata same. 

I was totally not in the mood for Mexican food but I know what I like.   Bleh.
author: Sarah S.

description:
The best chicken taco!  The flavor is delicious and the hot sauce is spicy, the way I like it.  I will try the pork taco next time, because of the rave review. The aqua fresca is very refreshing, goes perfect with our meal.  We brought our out of town guests, they never had soft/hard shell tacos before.  They came back to visit because they couldn't get it anywhere else.

The gentleman working t the cashier was extremely friendly.  It was cash only and I was short on cash. He was kind enough to put our order through even though I wanted to cut down my order.  He didn't have to do that, since they have an ATM machine in the establishment if I remember correctly.  Needless to say, I went back again and brought more cash.
author: T K.

description:
There are a bunch of tacquerias nearby, but this place is packed full of people.  We went on a Saturday afternoon, and there was still a lot of people waiting in line -- and for good reason.  All in all, this place has great tacos, tasty beef/pork/chicken, and fast service.

I'll definitely be back for the burritos.
author: Julie C.

description:
You'll pay a bit more compared to El Farolito down the block but its well worth it.  I love pork especially carnitas but when I'm here I always get the carne asada because its grilled over an open flame.  The majority of taquerias cook it on a flat top which lacks any smokiness. 

The carne asada is juicy and tender.  The only beverage of choice when I'm here is water because I want to enjoy the full flavor of their burrito.

Best time to go is around lunch when they're taking the carne asada off the grill.  I'm sure they'll do more business if they stayed open late.
author: Sun T.

description:
6 years ago I was living in the East Bay.  A friend took me to La Taq and after biting into the first of many Carnitas burritos, I knew I had to move to the City, if for no other reason than to be closer to La Taq. 

I'm not going to add anything that hasn't already been said.  But my order of choice: 2 carne asada tacos, extra crispy, corn quesadilla, and a pineapple aqua fresca or Pacifico.  

Perfection.
author: Courtney N.

description: Nothing fancy, but the burritos are delicious (great Carnitas, and I'm picky!), the prices are reasonable and the service was great (don't know if the man cashiering was the owner, but he was very friendly and really made us feel welcome). We noticed that everyone seemed to have the chips & salsa & pico, so we ordered some and it was delicious. The indoor seating was completely full, but luckily it was a nice day and the outdoor seating was fine. Would definitely come here again.
author: Carol G.

description:
I'm a firm believer in the no-rice burrito. Rice is just extra carbs and filler and takes away space for more meat! If you haven't been here, this is the place that Nick from Nick's Crispy Taco's got the idea for his entire menu word for almost word. There would be no Nick's if it wasn't for this place. The prices are about the same so if your looking for a more authentic Mission experience this would be the spot.

p.s. I love Nick's so this isn't a bash against that establishment.
author: Jason C.

description:
Pretty good taqueria, but not the best.  La Corneta and Pacho Villa are both better.  The burrito is good, but there's no rice available, which is crap.  It's relatively cheap and really greasy, which is good.  But there just aren't enough options on the menu to really justify going here with so many other good taquerias in the Mission.

Also, minus one star for cash only.  Get into the 21st century.
author: Chad H.

description: well well well... the tacos here are GREAT! had me some asada tacos, and damn were they good. the owner recommended i get them crunchy (outer tortilla fried) for some extra bite. My GF got a quesadilla and an agua fresca de piña. I must say that everything we had was really good. The owner was very funny and lively. He asked had we been there before when we told him we hadn't he comped us all kinds of stuff for us to try HUGE plus!! needless to say i will most def going in on my next frisco visit. A little pricey but worth it
author: D I.

description:
I really like La Taqueria.  I like that they look at rice and scoff.  It's just gonna slow you down anyway, right?  Rice is what turns a single burrito into two meals, or one meal that you need to take a nap to recover from.  So sometimes when you're on the go and don't wanted to be loaded down, you need a burrito without rice.  And La Taqueria is literally THE Taqueria to make it for you.

The meat is fantastic, there's great outside seating if you can get it, and they have all the kinda freaky authentic taqueria items (lengua, etc) that I am too gringo to try on the menu.

The fact that getting extras (guac, sour cream ,etc) on your burrito really adds up quickly, so that the cost of your once-cheap riceless burrito is now comparable to a rice-filled, two-meal burrito at any other taqueria, is the only reason they don't have 5 stars in my book.
author: Kevin H.

description:
I have a confession:  When I first moved to SF in 2008, I did not know what a taco was.  Not a "real" taco, anyway.  I thought a taco was those hard shelled, yellow things you got at Taco Bell, stuffed with some artificially seasoned ground meat (god, I hope it was meat, anyway) and some lettuce and cheese.  None to appetizing, to say the least.  And even when Chipotle came around and introduced me to burritos, I still didn't know what Mexican food really was.  All I knew was Tex-Mex (a la Chevy's).  Sad?  Yes.  

I've come a long way since then.  I've eaten my way through several taquerias, and while I'm not quite an old hand at it yet, I'm still well versed enough to know when I find a good thing.  And I HAVE found a good thing.

La Taqueria has, hands down, the best carnitas I've EVER had.  I got the carnitas taco (per the 7x7 List during a List crawl with Alea G., S.K., and some of our friends), but I'm pretty darn sure that carnitas ANYTHING (aka, burrito) at La Taqueria would be awesome.  

The tacos are pretty big, so a taco might actually be more than enough for you.  They're not cheap, and you have to pay extra for additional toppings like cheese, but when it's the BEST carnitas in the city, I don't mind so much.  

Now I wonder, is it possible just to get a plate of carnitas and just down that all on its own . . . ?  :D
author: Jeanne Y.

description:
This place gets a lot of attention given all the awards that they've won that hang on the wall behind the counter. But in reality, I don't see it being that far from other burrito places. 

Moreover, the price is a bit high for a burrito, and you have to pay extra for practically everything! I would come here if I were desperate for a burrito, but I think there are more places where you get your money's worth of food. 

La Taqueria is always packed though and it is a bit tough to find a spot.
author: stacy c.

description:
What more can be said? I have been coming to La T. for 30+years. The quality never wavers. Staff is superb and caring. Owner is great. Customers are great also. This place was named best Tacos in all of America in a poll done by Sunset Magazine. Spot on the best tacos and burritos. Not as big as the run of the mill rice bloated atom bombs available on every corner. THIS is quality mexican STREET food in a spotless restaurant. La Taq. ROCKS!!!

P.S. Mr. X's review below states that the food here is "full of rice and beans" Hey Mr. X, are you sure you even ate at this place? Perhaps you were at a different place. La Taqueria does not and NEVER HAS used RICE in their food. The owner told me many years ago that he considers rice a useless filler. The prices are a bit higher than some places especially the bland burrito joints that proliferate. SO WHAT. You pay for quality. Maybe you should check out Taco Bell if you only want quantity at a cheap price. I know Taco Bell has 99 cent tacos and burritos. You could get 5 or 10 and have a party and certainly not go hungry. Mr. X, whatever your opinion you are obviously in a tiny minority of people that do not like La Taqueria. Either way they have been thriving for decades and will continue to without any of our reviews. Ciao Compadre.
author: El R.

description:
Happiness, thy (presumptuous!) name is La Taqueria.

Tied for SF's best taqueria (in my mind) with El Farolito. My friends and I came here for the first time two weeks ago, and I've since been back at LEAST 435924 other occasions. The staff is incredibly friendly, and the man working the register (owner?) not only handed roses to my roommate and the little girl in line ahead of us, but he gave all FOUR of us fruit drinks on the house.

If you haven't experienced a La Taqueria fruit drink, you're sincerely missing out. Perhaps most accurately described as an explosion of WIN in your mouth, the Mango had me at first sip (and I'm that loser who usually just sticks with water at restaurants). Nevermore!

Also, the veggie burrito is almost heavenly, and SO satisfyingly filling - well worth the price. As a vegetarian, I can't comment on the meat dishes, but I was assured by a friend that the carne asada tacos are To. Die. For. The place has been extremely busy every time I've been here (and given the number of taquerias in the Mission, I think that's pretty telling), so be prepared for a line and limited seating room. Happy eating!
author: Sam S.

description:
The tacos are authentic and quite excellent and are of the taco-truck variety.  We ordered the pollo, carne asada, carnitas, and chorizo with chorizo being our favorite.  We didn't have the stomach to try the cabeza or  tongue but there's always a next time.  The chips and salsa were so-so with the biggest complaint being they throw the wet salsa on top which leaves the bottom half the chips soggy by the time we got down to them.  The quesadilla was yummy on account of the butterlicious nature so no complaints there.

Service was fast and efficient and we also had some overly-sweet horchata.  Overall, it was a nice place that surprisingly closed early (10PM on Friday night) even though I would sure love to swing by for a late night snack.
author: Roger W.

description: I ordered the carne asada taco with cheese, as recommended by 7x7. It was absolutely delicious. Tasty meat, fresh salsa, two tortillas, and surprise beans. It's the best taco I've had from a taqueria in the Mission. A little expensive, but just like a fish taco from Nick's, it's worth the price.
author: Rahil P.
