Although I'll take what I make at home any day, the tacos at La Taqueria are decent for state side. I get either a straight carnitas taco (which I only add a little salt and lime) or carne asada. The tortillas are acceptable and the meat is fairly prepared. In Mexico City this place would last one month, but we are only lucky that we can get a C- taco here.
author: Hank S.

description:
Good, but pricey and ultimately not uniquely good enough to warrant it.

Yes, they have good burritos. I have yet to try the tacos and plan to make an effort to, but ultimately I'm looking at burritos here. In that respect they come up lacking a bit. A standard super burrito runs $8.00: $6 for the burrito and then 50 cents each for cheese and sour cream and another dollar for avocado. While normally this should work in my favor since I dislike sour cream and always order my supers without it I still end up paying more than I would at most of the other taquerias in town.

As for the burrito itself the tortilla is steamed which, well, sure it's a bit of a preference, but I think the majority of us aficionados will tend to say that grilled is better. Also the burrito comes without rice which made it seem a tad skimpy. The carnitas was slightly crispy, fatty, and delicious. Chips, standard with just about every burrito I've ever bought from a taqueria, are also extra for $1.30.

Ultimately the burritos are really good. The problem is that they're more expensive and tad smaller than the competition. I can get a burrito that's just as good, if not a tad better, at Taqueria Can-Cun or Taqueria el Buen Sabor for less. Sorry, but a super burrito and a large horchata shouldn't be running me over $10.

So, go if you must, but know that there are equivalent or better and less expensive places located very close by.
author: Mark S.

description:
This time I feel like I did it right by ordering a couple of tacos that everyone seems to recommend at La Taqueria.  I enjoyed my two chicken tacos that I had for lunch the other day.  The ingredients tasted fresh, and I liked the crispy shell touch.  Where I ran into issues again was the lack of mixing of ingredients but with a taco at least you can easily mix yourself.  The price was also high, close to $15 for two tacos with all the fixings and a horchata drink.  La Taqueria charges you extra for everything: sour cream, cheese, avocado, etc.  I prefer to be able to grab two chicken tacos for $7-$9 total, which is possible at many of the other places in the Mission.

I'll continue to go back to this place just for the horchata, since I haven't had a better horchata in the city than La Taqueria, and if you order that with one chicken taco without the fixings, maybe one can keep the price to about $5-$6.
author: Josh K.

description:
Expensive.  And if you have to use their ATM machine the fee is $2.25.  That's worse than Vegas (almost).

The Tacos were pretty good.  I got the chips and guacamole.  I swear the guac was pre manufactured and is the type  that normally shoots out of a gun at Taco Bell.

I am alergic to milk and told them no cheese.  Well I love when I get sabotaged into eating cheese by having them hide some in their for me.  They must have accidentally dropped some in there and thought it would be a bonus but not for me.
author: Shawn L.

description:
I'm born and raised in San Francisco and been to most of the more popular burrito shops in town. By far, this is as good as it gets. The food is great, and the aqua frescas are the best in town. My personal favorite meat is the carnitas...and the hot sauce that is provided at every table is off the hook! It's spicy without being blow the roof off your mouth hot. It's a nice balance of flavor and heat.

You can only get three things here: Tacos, Burritos or Quesadillas...if you're looking for something else, you're out of luck.
author: Aaron S.

description: Ok, the price is a little much but when you bite down on the carne asada or carnitas tacos you will forget about it.  I have been coming here since i was a kid, i love this place! i now live in los angeles and you would think i could find a great taco here but when you have had a taco from La Taqueria, nothing else compares!  YOU MUST HAVE A STRAWBERRY DRINK! I have had agua frescas but never like the one here! every time i fly into san francisco to visit, this is my first stop even before i go home to visit my parents!
author: Michael S.

description:
The reason these carne asada tacos are so good is this: 

The carne asada has the perfect amount of saltiness and limeness and is grilled right there all the time.
They have the shortest menu ever. 
They are constantly making tacos so the ingredients aren't ever just sitting around waiting.
They use perfectly soft corn tortillas and double them up.
The pico de gallo is so simple - like something you make at home if you don't try to get fancy - just tomatoes, onions, cilantro, lime and I'm guessing jalapeno.
The beans are also simple. No crazy cowboy beans, just normal pinto beans and just the right amount.
I don't think they even use cumin, which is just fine with me. If they do, it's the right way to use it.
I like that the cheese (if you ask for it) isn't on the top. It's melted in between the tortillas and the meat, quesadilla-izing it.
If you order guacamole, you get a little cup of avocado - nothing else but the best California avocados and maybe a little salt. 
The flavors all seem to balance perfectly. 
I noticed someone said you shouldn't pay 3.50 for a taco (or more, if you get the wildly expensive 50 cent cheese - kidding). Well, these aren't taco bell tacos. No tacos compare. Sorry, I'd pay more. The quality demands it. And not to mention, two tacos and a cerveza is about 10 bucks, which is pretty good considering these are possibly the best tacos in the country.
author: Henry M.

description:
I have been coming to La Taqueria for well over 30 years and I love it. This is one of my favorite places for tacos and burritos. The carne asada, carnitas, lengua and chicken are all so good.  My favorite are the tacos dorados with avocado and cheese. Yes, they can be a bit pricey but I've never had a bad meal in all the years I've been coming here. The quality of the meats is high. The burritos are yummy too. I'm happy they don't use rice, since it's just a filler.  The green salsa is so good though you should test it out because sometimes it's hotter than other times.

I've brought tons of people to this place over the years and almost everyone agrees that this place is awesome. The strawberry agua fresca is delicious. I hate ordering this drink anywhere else because I'm always disappointed.  I wish they had more locations. I was bummed when I heard they had closed down the one in San Jose.
author: Myra D.

description: Great food, but pretty pricey compared to other taquerias. The burritos are small compared to others around but the quality of food is beyond any other. Just thinking about it right now makes my mouth water. Their cantaloupe fruit drink is awesome too!
author: Patrick L.

description:
For whatever reason, when you say "Taqueria" in San Francisco, any burrito / taco foodie knows which of the many, many, many Taquerias that cover Valencia and Mission streets that you are referring to. Why? Because La Taqueria is simply better that the rest. 

The ingredients are super fresh. The folks at La Taqueria were using fresh and organic ingredients before Whole Foods became all the rage. I typically don't crave meat, but I am always enticed by La Taqueria's carne asada. The burrtos and tacos are all top notch. And you can't leave without trying the fresh salsa or guacomole. It's the real deal. 

None of the dishes have rice (who needs the bland taste an extra calories anyways?)

A din din at La Taqueria, followed by a slice of Mission Pie (which is 1/2 block away) is my favorite date night!
author: Colleen S.

description:
This is the place other taquerias strive to be. 

The carne asada tacos with cheese and guacamole are by far the best things around.  Two tortillas-one crispy and one not surround the best flavored beef you'll ever have in a taco.  The beans are something new to me, but mucho tasty.  The salsa verde on each table is spicy and delicious!

I've ordered a burrito or two and they were good, but order the carne asada tacos.  The chips and guacamole are excellent too.

Service is fast and friendly.  Prices are high, but I gladly pay them each time I go.  Two loaded tacos (enough for one meal) and a drink are roughly $10-$11.

I've introduced a ton of people to this place and every single person has become a fan!
author: Curtis C.

description: Honestly, if you're looking for a great (albeit unhealthy) Mexican food dinner, this is the best place I've found so far in the Bay Area. Their burritos are excellent. Their chicken was cooked to perfection and their quesadillas are grilled perfectly. Highly recommended!
author: Davis J.

description:
I struggled with this rating. I almost gave them five stars but didn't for a few reasons. First let me say that the food is excellent. The Carne Asada's are huge and delicious. I always order them San Diego style without the beans. (they don't put rice in them either...thank God.) When you order them without beans they put extra meat in and charge you a bit more. The service is excellent too. Often times I will walk in there and find a line of ten or more people. Somehow the food is always ready in 5 to 10 minutes. Here's why 4 instead of 5 stars. Why can't anyone make SAN DIEGO style taco shop food in this area? (see Rojelio's Taco Shop near SDSU or ((still good but not as good)) one of the many Roberto's Taco Shops in SD). Every time I ask someone around here they give me some new place that makes it in the same style...Rice and Beans in a burrito...NO!...putting avocados on and calling it guacamole is like putting a tomato on and calling it spaghetti sauce...where's the green hot sauce?...rolled taco's?...please grill the quesadilla...on and on...
  Someday someone will figure it out and kick ass in this city with this type of biz. But that is more about my tastes then it is about this excellent restaurant. Please message me if you think you know a place that meets my needs. :)

La Taqueria is very good at what they do and are cool people. Excellent food. Go there.
author: Edward N.

description:
This was the best food (and best prices) on our taco crawl.  I had a veggie taco, which was delicious.  I didn't think I really liked mexican food (it's horrible on the east coast), but now I'm a believer.

The owner was operating the register, and is a character -- he definitely gave the place some great character.

Minus one star because of ridiculous crowdedness, and a confusing/totally inefficient ordering/pickup system..
author: DH H.

description:
you're searching mexican food or taquerias right now so do yourself a favor...
GO NOW!  this is the holy grail of taquerias.  Tacos, Burritos, or Quesadillas...Carne, Pollo, Carnitas, or Orchata...it doesn't matter.  Everything is PERFECT every time.  The place is wall to wall off the hook pretty much open to close every day, but they are very efficient at keeping the line moving and the food coming out in a reasonable time frame.  -1/2  star for the HELL that is trying to park on Mission Street, and -1/2 star for cash only.
author: jim a.

description:
I've had much better burritos... like WAY better burritos.... why is there no rice? No veggies? No say as to what really goes in your food... 

BIG PASS.
author: Tiffany T.

description: I live in the Midwest now but I was introduced to La Taqueria in 1979 or so. I have been no where that can match up with the burritos and tacos that they offer. I was there in April of 2011 and it was great. It is a short walk from Bart so I always tell my Midwestern friends to take Bart to Mission and walk down to La Taqueria!
author: Bob D.

description: Hands down the best carne asade in town. It is juicy and melts in the mouth. If you go, order the taco durado with carne asada with onions and cilantro.
author: Helen L.

description: I have always rated tacos on a 10 point scale (1-10). This place requires that an additional 5 points be added. Best tacos I've had by far. Amazing, amazing 15 point tacos. Line can seem long and daunting - fear not, it moves quickly. Plus food tastes better when you're hungry. Seriously, enjoy.
author: Zoey S.

description: Their super chicken burrito is one of the best that I've ever had.  All of the flavors are absolutely delicious.
author: Juan R.

description: This is such an awesome place. Everything is made to order once you place the order. I recommend adding the extra sour cream and fresh avacados to the burritos that you order. The salsa is just right and fresh. The burritos are nice and definitely more than filling (if you can actually finish them). The choices are everything from beef to chicken to shredded pork to tongue, ect.. It is definitely a place you wanna try in the Mission district while in San Francisco. Parking is not fun in this area, just be prepared to walk some.
author: Pierce B.

description: Loved the burrito and the tacos!  It far exceeded my expectations.  I can't wait to visit again!
author: Scott A.

description:
It is fascinating how a taco can be transformed by one simple change: by exchanging one of the soft shells for a hard one, the new crunchy element really makes their tacos sing. 

I guess any other taqueria can easily do this if requested, but here, it is a regular.

I also go for the $3.50 veggie burrito. The frecas. What a bargain.
author: w l.

description: La Taqueria is very good and highly recommended. The reason this restaurant is so expensive is because the quality of the product is so high. If you want the true experience get some tacos (3.5+ each) and one of those tasty drinks (strawberry, orchata, melon). If your looking for a cheaper option get a burrito which is much more reasonably priced and just as good. If you elect to eat at the long wooden-communal tables there is a good chance you will be entertained by a wandering Mariachi band. Every time I come back to SF I make sure to visit for succulent Carnitas, tasty Carne Asada and warm ambiance.
author: Samuel P.

description:
I like french kissing the tacos here.  

Except I'm talking about their bomb ass beef tongue tacos here.  ;D

Extremely tender, moist, full of flavor and probably the best choice of meat to pick from.

Yes, I'm still talking about tacos... the Mexican food.

I usually also go for the pork, but it has been lacking in flavor.  It just seemd boiled and shredded.  I don't know why, but they charge you extra for omitting the beans.  And the guac is worth paying extra for.  Just make up for it in the free hot sauce they have on each sticky table.  It's another reason to get the frescas.
author: Chris T.

description: Their tacos are amazing! I love the chorizo, chicken, or carnitas sooo good. fast and friendly service
author: juliana m.

description:
An institution!  The best tacos in the city.  I just bought an $9 burritto and it was worth every penny.  You get what you pay for.  

Hint:  Get steak and load up on the hot sauce.
author: Lulu M.

description:
Come here for the tacos.  

This is my favorite taco place ever.  The biggest most plump delicious tacos anywhere.  Almost burrito like in huge size but tasty soft fresh corn tortilla.  Perfect for vegetarian food esp cuz I hate wheat tortillas.  Very generous with avocado.
author: Maya C.

description:
This is my favorite burrito place ever. I have yet to try anything else on their menu after 10 years of burrito-snacking here, but for some reason I don't mind.

The only downside is the wait in line and crowded place. I recommend placing an order on the phone 10 minutes prior to picking it up! You cut in line and get out quick.
author: Rae A.

description:
Two stars is GENEROUS for this place. Why? 1) Two burritos (one chicken, one only vegetarian) with sour cream, cheese and avocado came to over $15.00 (that didn't include the two dollars that I WISH I had not put in the tip jar.) 2) These overpriced burritos had not a single grain of rice in them. So does that mean if I had not PAID extra for sour cream, etc., I would have had only beans and salsa on the veggie? The lack of rice and the extremely runny consistency of the beans made for a real mess, also. 3) I asked for spicy salsa and what I got was certainly not anything resembling spicy. I've had spicier salsa out of a jar from Trader Joe's. Sad. 4) They were f-ing SMALL. I mean, I really don't have a big appetite... I almost never ever finish a burrito in one sitting. I was still hungry after this one. I wouldn't be so irritated with the size of the burritos if I hadn't spent over $15.00 on two of them. I'm not the only one on Yelp who seems to feel this way. 
The two stars that they did get represents the general good flavor of what I actually got and the speed in which I got in and out. If I had eaten them there, I would have addressed my general unhappiness of the product while there and either gotten a refund or had them re-make them. These burritos pissed me off that much. Since I live across town, it really wan't worth the trouble to return them. The only reason that I was there in the first place was the fact that I had gotten a cake at Dianda's. I won't bother going back to La Taqueria. There are far too many good places to get a good burrito in town. If I were you, I wouldn't bother. LAME, LAME, LAME.
author: Zoe K.

description: Do you have a strong aversion to cilantro like i do?  If so, DON'T COME HERE!!  I was in a hurry so ordered a burrito to go, no cilantro add cheese(additional charge, as its not standard).  i hop on the muni and bite into a mouthful of cilantro.  one burrito into the dumpster.  to top it off, seems like they screwed me on the cheese i paid extra for also.
author: Timothy L.

description: Carnitas burrito con queso, aguacate, y crema, por favor!
author: Paul M.

description: A great place for authentic Mexican. Our group went on the recommendation of a chef from another shop down the street. Our group had some diet restrictions which were easy to accommodate without any menu changes or special orders! Very good and will be back.
author: Izzy F.

description: Full disclosure: I'm not the biggest fan of Mexican food. But, in my opinion, La Taqueria is about as good as it gets. My husband dragged me here when some out of town friends asked to get Mexican, and I was glad he made me go! The tacos are great with lots of flavor. This is now my go-to spot for Mexican.
author: Laralynne B.

description: Delicious, simple, clean, quick, and cheap! The homemade green chili sauce is the best (in bottles at each table). Tacos here are my favorite, and the burritos are pretty damn good too!
author: Chihee K.

description:
People with light appetites, big budgets, and an aversion to spices seem to rave about this place....and for good reason.   Their quality of ingredients is second-to-none in the realm of Taquerias, and their creative use of spices and seasonings borders on near nil.

People from the Northwest (a.k.a. Snowbirds) will love this place.  Cheapskates that like big servings and spice-levels that violate OSHA safety standards (like myself) have found no shortage of better priced alternatives....
author: Mike W.

description: Carnitas were the best choice. Go for that. and add the quac and sour cream. thats it.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Yeah, I know that not everyone loves this place.  But I love it.  I'm sorry.  It is just solid.  The carne asada and carnitas are delicious, the tacos are fantastic, and the guacamole is oh so nice.  Sure, there are better burritos out there, but La Taqueria's flavors are pure meat and there is nothing wrong with that.  
Go ahead, disagree with me.  I'm fine with that.  I just think you are wrong.
author: Blake W.

description:
I realize that i begin most of my reviews saying this, but i'll do it again: i grew up in Houston, TX and went to school in San Antonio, TX. 

In this specific instance that means that i love tacos. Like, really love tacos. Sometimes a little too much. Much like BBQ (yet another of my culinary loves), tacos are inherently a modest and humble food. They don't take well to being dressed up and are best enjoyed with a beer. At the best taquerias, white collar guys in suits rub elbows with construction workers eating the exact same food during their lunch hour. Its a beautiful thing. Quality street food can be the ultimate equilizer.

So naturally, after moving here and seeing the rave reviews for La Taqueria on yelp, that it was Zagat rated, and even made Michael Bauer's list for the SF Chronicle of the 100 best restaurants in the Bay Area, i had to check it out. The only problem, was that i was unwilling to drive up to the city just to get tacos. The Red Bull soap box derby last weekend looked like a great opportunity, as it was in the Mission district. So after checking out the cars, we walked over to La Taqueria for some tacos before the races got started. 

The place may have been humble, like a regular taqueria at one point, but now it just feels kind of stuffy and full of itself. I honestly didn't think a taqueria could get this way. And the prices reflect that attitude. Tacos start at $3.50, and thats with nothing on them. You want avocado? Add $1.20. Sour cream? Add $1.00. You can work your way north of a $5 taco pretty easily, and where i come from, thats unheard of. 

The GF and i ordred four tacos (2 carnitas, because we really love pork, 1 carne asada, and one cabeza, because i like that kind of stuff). We got all four tacos with avocado and no other extras. Add 2 small fountain drinks, and our total for lunch was $25. We can eat at our default taqueria in RWC for just over half of that. 

Granted, the tacos were solid, i'd even say very good. The carnitas lacked that crisp that happens when all the braising liquid evaporates and the meat gets seared, but thats a technicality. I pretty much have to cook them myself to get them to do that. But to spend that much on 4 tacos and 2 drinks, those tacos had better be the best i've ever had. 

Thats not to say that the place isn't good, it certainly is, and i'm sure that 15 or 20 years ago it was just about perfect. But it seems like all the attention has really gone to their heads a bit. Maybe i was expecting too much, but i was slightly disappointed.
author: Travis D.

description: I live in Southern California and have had my fair share of amazing tacos. Unlike traditional street tacos, La Taqueria serves their tacos with beans, guacamole and salsa. My favorite are definitely the carnitas tacos and right behind that is the carne asada. Definitely the best tacos I have had in the Bay Area and may rival my top picks down in Orange County.
author: Thomas D.

description:
The downside:

This place is ridiculously expensive, even for SF. 
The burritos are average at best. 

The upside:
These are the best tacos in SF, no question. The only place that compares to them is Super Taqueria in the South Bay. 

If you're ready to spend $13 bucks on two tacos and a drink, go for it, the meat here is incredible. But like I said, the burritos are average. Go to El Farolito or even Cancun if you want a burrito.

PS. Do yourself a favor and get some papusas from the Salvadorian place next door. Your heart will hate you but your stomach will love you.
author: matt f.

description:
I don't do the best burrito thing, because I go to different burrito joints to fulfill different moods. 

But that aside, I took a few friends from NY here (I took them to every burrito joint I could find because that's all they wanted to eat...) and being that they were a group of males with the social grace level of a 3 year old it proved to be an interesting trip. At the register one of the guys saw an add for a club gig, or some kind of "Latin Oldies" thing with a half naked girl on a low rider hood. Something compelled him to scream out CULO! with much excitement. At that point, the staff looked at me, and my entourage and laughed. In defense mode, I immediately began speaking Spanish and explaining that he had been released from a long hospital stay right after. When he asked what I was doing, I told the CULO yeller that I was ordering a watermelon agua fresca.

Fast to fill your order, always crowded so nothing sits in vats too long, and agua frescas are off the hook. Not necessarily mt favorite, but good for a change.
author: Niki M.

description: I really love their tacos but you have to eat them there.  They will get soggy if you take them to go.  They are yummy!  The only down fall is that the place is pretty expensive.  I paid $7.90 for one steak taco and a fresca.
author: Ammala B.

description:
Just went back to this place after not venturing this way for 4 or 5 years. I don't know why? Just not a corner on my map these days.

It's nice to see some things stay the same! Still the best goddamn pinto beans in the city. Perfect tacos, perfectly seasoned beef and no crap to bulk it up. Yeah, still sticker shock at the register, but what a great brunch.
author: John C.

description: Great mexican food.  Fresh, healthy, tasty & not greasy.  This would easily be my favorite mexican restaurant if it wasn't such a rip off.  They charge you for every topping so if you want a burrito "deluxe" or "supreme" with the good stuff like sour cream, avocado, tomato, lettuce etc....you have to shell out almost $10.  If you ask me that is way too much for a burrito.  Other than it being way overpriced, food is great!  Will keep going to El Farolito uxcept when I feel like splurging.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
This place rocks my world.  I love to roll up on a sunny weekend afternoon, pull up a stool at the outdoor bar, and watch the chef butcher the hell out of some carne asade with his giant meat cleaver.  From what I've seen on my 5ish visits, his entire job is to transform great steaming hunks of grilled beef into bite sized morsels for your taco or burrito.  And what fine meat it is! 

I recently made the mistake of bringing a veggie friend here, only to discover a veggie taco at la taqueria consists of beans, cheese and salsa.  No grilled zucchini here, folks.  Come for the monster burritos or gorgeous carnitas tacos.  Good aguas frescas as well.
author: nicole l.

description: a SF landmark which used to be great. The original owners retired long ago and hte children run it. The daughter sits at the register and is always on the phone when she figures your tab (I HATE that). The meat is VERY salty and everything is overpriced. Go to La Cumbre.
author: Alex B.

description: Best Tacos and Burritos in SF! I have been to many taquerias and you can't get better than this. I will never go anywhere else again!
author: Kristie S.

description: its my methadone!   i dont care how much it costs!   30 years invested, just like most of the guys behind the counter!  its part of my fiber and something i can always rely on!  carne asada burrito, con queso, con chile, and plenty green sauce and ice cold bohemia!
author: Patricia B.

description:
My favorite Mexican place in S.F.
Get a fruity drink or horchata to have with your amazing tacos or burrito. Grab a seat and people watch or take it to go; either way you'll leave happy.
author: Kyla L.

description:
one of the most popular taquerias, just not my style.  falls into the category of el farolito, taqueria cancun...etc.
don't want beans in my taco.  pricey at $3.50 plus extras cost.  the carnitas flavor was good, but need to chop up the shreds of meat more.  salsa watery, having the inside taco of the double wrap crisped does make a difference.  chunky carne asada.
author: Rob C.

description: I have always loved La Taqueria and I expect I always will! Went back last night for the first time in many months and I was not disappointed. Though many bemoan the fact that their burritos lack rice, this is what I love about this place. I'm in good shape and try to eat healthy so rice to me, generally represents empty carbs. I'll make an exception for the warm, soft flour tortillas that La Taqueria uses. Hey, we all have our vices. Yes, they're pricey and yes it does suck that you have to pay extra for items that are standard at most burrito places, but as grandpa always said, "you get what you pay for." I feel that La Taqueria makes exceptional burritos that are totally worth the price.
author: Jen S.

description: This is my favorite place for tacos and tacos only. My mom has been taking us here since I can remember. Carne asada is so tender and well marinated. And I love their green hot sauce. I've contemplated stealing a bottle of it right off the table. Everytime I go there I get the same flavors and portions.
author: Jenn M.

description: I was raised on La Taqueria. This place seriously holds a huge portion of my childhood memories. When my mother moved to the city in 1979, this was the first place she ate. The rest, my friends, is history. No joke, my mother brought my sister and me here about 2-3 times a week starting as soon as I could eat semi solids.  I would get in huge trouble for stealing my moms quarters to buy a "mandatory bouncy ball" from the toy dispensers in the back of the place. My order matured with time, I believe my original order was a chicken bean and cheese burrito with a fresa. Now my staples are either carne asada tacos or burritos, occasionally one HAS to get a chicken burrito because it is the best chicken ever. There is honestly no way you can go wrong, and it is worth it to try everything.  This is, hands down, no contest THE BEST TAQUERIA IN THE WORLD. Of course I am biased, as every Native San Franciscan should be when considering their favorite Taqueria. I will say, their prices have definitely gone up over the years, but I welcome that change as long as it keeps La Taqueria in business forever. I hope they never get priced out of San Francisco.
author: Molly C.

description:
Oh how do I love thee Carnitas?!?!?!  Crispy, juicy, flavorful and tender succulent pieces of meat...  I don't really care how I get it; in a burrito, in a taco, in a quesadilla, all by itself...  I'm all about it.  

Here's the deal, the Carne Asada is really good too, but I can't seem to order anything but the Carnitas.  Sooooooo....  If I want Carne Asada, I'll order two tacos, one Carne Asada and the other, you guessed it... Carnitas!  Love the green sauce, wish I could take a bottle home with me.  Mmmm.  

I love this place!  I always go with my favorite person in the world, grab some chips and guac, a melon agua fresca, and anything with Carnitas and I'm set.  It makes for an awesome meal.

This is a SOLID 4 1/2 stars, but dagnabit, Yelp does not offer half star increments.
author: Kelly K.

description:
LOVE. IT.

Eating in: Tacos w/everything on em. Don't forget to get a cerveza.

Eating out: Chorizo burrito w/everything on it. I recommend popping a Beano beforehand.

Expensive, but second to none.
author: Simon S.

description: Tried their crispy tacos yesterday and loved them.  They fry a tortilla to make it crunchy and melt a slice of cheese on it.  Then they shape it and put it in a soft tortilla and fill it.  I got mine with carnitas and my girlfriend got hers with carne asada.  Both were really delicious, but I think the carne asada was the winner.  We both had them put everything on it, which made the taco absolutely amazing, but really expensive.  It came out to about $6 a taco, which is a little crazy.  Also, the hot sauce they have is really good with a solid kick.
author: Aaron L.

description: The carnitas tacos are pretty damn good.  I had cheese, sour cream, and guacamole on it and it came to around $6 a taco which is expensive.  El Farolito is better and cheaper.
author: Matthew P.

description: Seriously?  $10 for a kid sized super burrito? That was about $5 worth of food!.  It was just ok - a bit bland compared to El Farolito, Cancun, El Tonayense, etc.  How La Taqueria stays in business is beyond me.  Local nouveau riche?
author: Matt P.

description:
I can't even write a review of these amazing carnitas burritos  without drooling all over myself. And did you know you can get them grilled? Yes, they'll freakin' throw your burrito on the grill and crisp it all up. Oh my god, I've got to wipe this up! 

 I have to mark down this most superior of all taquerias due to the intense salt that forces me and my high blood pressure to settle for rather infrequent rendezvous with my forbidden silver blimp of carnitas sin.
author: michelle b.

description:
The service at this place is friendly and fast!

The carne asada burrito is heaven on earth, and I suggest you get it hot (spicy) and also have them put jalapenos inside as well.

Also have them ditch the tomatoes/salsa (not that it isnt tasty) and load on the guacamole and sour cream! Thats just how I like it!

If I come back a second time and it is this good... I will add another star!
author: Jason P.

description: Living in the Bay Area, I've had my fair share of Mexican food -- and this place makes the best tacos and burritos by far! Expect a bit of a wait, they only take cash and seating is limited, be prepared to share tables with others. But the food always has me coming back.
author: Nicole B.

description:
"Wolves travel in packs numbering 7 to 30 members.  There is a definite hierarchy in the pack centered around the Alpha pair, who mate for life and are the only members of a wolf pack to breed each year.

Howling is the type of vocal communication for which wolves are most famous.  The sound seems to captivate our imagination and remind us of the mysterious aspects of nature.  Wolves howl to greet one another, signal location, define boundaries, and call a pack together.  Before a hunt, howling may serve to excite and unite the pack members before setting out.  When chasing prey, wolves can run up to 30 miles per hour.  When hunting, wolves pick out the sick or injured animals as prey, leaving healthy, strong animals to reproduce and flourish."

This is one wolf of a taqueria.  The burritos are good.
author: Ian G.

description:
This place only makes tacos a single way... their way.

You can either get a soft tortilla taco or a strange combo of a crunchy fried tortilla wrapped with a soft tortilla with cheese in the middle. I got the crunchy combo taco with carnitas. The carnitas were delicious, soft, not too salty and full of the flavor, but I wasn't a very big fan of the beans in my taco. The tacos come standard with beans unless you're willing to spend an extra ($1.20) or so. Also condiments like cheese, sour cream and guacamole each run you $1 or more per taco, that's a bit excessive when you're talking about $3.50 tacos. 

But, though they are a bit pricey, the tacos are pretty good.
author: Juan P.

description: I had a beef head burrito with avocado. This place is SUPER overpriced probably due to the attention it gets from tourists and out of towners. Good food but I dont think its worth the premium. I paid $11 for an anemic burrito and a drink. TOTAL RIP OFF.
author: Genaro R.

description: The burritos were certainly not "the greatest burritos in the world", although they were fine (if a bit small). Looking over this page, it seems I should have gotten tacos instead.
author: Grant M.

description:
Why order a burrito at the best taqueria in the city?

Skip the burritos and go for the tacos.  That's what they do best here, I'll make a trip from the East Bay for these awesome tacos.  My favorite - carne asada, "dorado", with cheese and avocado.  If you've never had one, this is the place to try a tongue taco, just order it with cilantro and onion.  Mom always asks me to take her here when she visits.
author: Naomi T.

description: fantastic burritos, always a struggle whether to get it with or without avocado.  tacos less good, but still decent
author: Di Yin L.

description:
Best Taco Ever....

If you got some place better, let me know.  

You will pay for it, but not to worry I find it worthy.
author: Curtis G.

description: love love love this place.  Best tacos and burritos in the Mission by far.  Moving to NYC next month and I will miss it dearly.  A definite must for anyone coming to SF for the first time.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Okay, I came to the Mission to eat serious Mexican food.  I'm from Texas, so I'm mildly experienced with this stuff.  I have no idea what the hype is about this place.  The tacos are decent, but there are way better places than this in the Mission.  It's just a tourist thing at this point and people who have just been going there forever. I don't get the hype. 

The place is also a rip-off.  They charge for every little extra thing, but then forget to put half of it on the taco.  My boyfriend ordered a taco with guac, cheese, crema, etc.... ended up paying $6 for the taco with no cheese or guac on it.

I'd rather go to Taqueria Cancun on 19th.  Way better carnitas and agua frescas.  Better salsa, better beans, better service.
author: Lauren A.

description: Best damn carnitas tacos I've ever had in my life! My girl and I travel miles to experience the flavor explosion of these meaty masterpieces. She actually brought me to this place the day after I met her when I woke up in her bed, and it's all history after that. We're here now, and she says I have to go eat! Bueno!
author: Ben R.

description: There's only one thing you come here for. The crispy carnitas tacos. And I ain't talking the hard shelled tacos. I'm talking soft tacos but crisped up on the grill with melted cheese and possibly the best carnitas you can get. This is an authentic joint too. If you wan to get the extra stuff like sour cream, guac, salsa, etc... you gotsta pay for that stuff. They want you to eat the crispy taco in it's purest form because that's how you're supposed to eat it. And you know a taqueria is good when you're the only non-latino in the joint. Did I mention the crispy tacos are huge? Yeah, they're huge so two is perfect but if you're extra hungry maybe try and squeeze in a third.
author: David C.

description: Crispy tacos (beef or chicken) with everything! Absolutely delicious! The combination of different textures and flavors is out of this world! Cheap, quick , filling and perfect for what it is!  Coming from New York I had not experienced Mexican food like this. I miss La Taqueria!
author: Danielle M.

description: Great tacos, loved the atmosphere too which was bright and sunny and buzzing at lunchtime.  Obviously a popular place - the queue inside went all the way to the back of the restaurant and around the corner but we were still able to get seated at one of the long, shared tables and it was worth the wait.  We even queued up a second time to get some extra tacos to go after trying the first few.  We'll be back.
author: Robert S.

description:
They do good/great burritos (with no rice, which annoys some purists (how can you be a purist about burritos?)), but this place is really all about the tacos. Absolutely amazing, fresh and just a hint of crispness to the soft tacos. 

Don't hold back on the great salsa they have at the tables either!
author: ed s.

description: BEST MEXICAN I've EVER HAD!  Go for 3 different kinds of Taco's!  Chicken (insane) Carne Asade with hard shell and cheese and Carnita's with Guacamole.  All not to be missed!
author: T W.

description:
Generous portions of quality meat. Efficient service. 
Pretty expensive compared to other burrito shops but it's a premium product. Grab a handful of napkins and sit down with a crispy carnitas taco. Yummy! 
If your a vegetarian, go somewhere else, this place is about the meat.
author: Puffy P.

description:
The BEST Burritos , tacos and; quesadillas.  The BEST fresh strawberry juice EVER!  We makes special trips to SF just to come eat here. The lines are usually long & you do need to keep an eye out for an open table! But long lines are always a good thing at a Taqueria.
They have a location in San Jose & it is great also!
author: Sonia R.

description:
This place has been around for a long time but I just don't understand all the hype. It gets so crowded that you end up eating outside or sharing tables. It isn't cheap either, a fully loaded burrito will run you close to $10?!?!!? Extra's like sour cream, avocado, etc. are way overpriced. 

The burrito's aren't bad but not worth the hassle of looking for parking and not be able to eat comfortably.
author: Frank H.

description:
I have eaten here twice, once for a burritto, once for tacos. The burrito was good. The tacos were bland and unexciting.  While a good burrtio is a good thing, there are many good burritos out there, and you can eat them anywhere in this city. 

Maybe I'll give it a second chance for the carnitas, but the lack of a flavorful basic chicken taco is pretty damning in my book.

Update: went back for the carnitas tacos, and they were better, but still not fantastic. three things did stand out about la taqueria this trip, though:

- you have to pay extra for chips.
- no salsa bar.
- $3.50 for one regular taco. $3.50! Cheese and guac are an extra dollar each! That means for one super taco, you will pay $5.50, more than a regular burrito. That, my friends, is wrong.
author: Tom H.

description:
Went here for the first time a few days ago and ordered a chicken burrito and the carne asada burrito.  

The Chicken Burrito was delicious!  The chicken was nice and tender and the ratio of all the ingredients seemed to blend in your mouth perfectly.  

The Carne Asada was pretty good, just a bit salty.  But still the ratio of everything else in it was perfect.  

I would definitely come back.
author: Delilah B.

description:
The holy cow burriteria of San Francisco thanks to its status as the token cheap Mexican restaurant that has convinced the food editors of our local rag to name them one of the top 100 restaurants of the Bay Area year after year.  A generous bribe?  The place isn't half bad at all but to put it out front of every other Mexican restaurant, I mean, let's get real.  Too big for its pants, I think, the menu is stripped down to the very basics even for a buritto joint -- tacos, burritos, and if you're very, very lucky maybe a quesadilla.

Had a burrito al pastor here recently, always something of a  bellwether.  On the one hand it was very tasty.  On the other, literally, was a stream of fat and grease dripping out the foil the likes of which I've never sean.  I've eaten lots of burritos, hoagies, scrapple sandwiches, you name it, in my life, and I've never seen anything that leaked like that.  I mean, if you lit up a cigarette the car would catch on fire.

I'm giving it four stars because it's definitely an above-average taqueria.  Let's just ignore the hype, okay?
author: Gil S.

description:
Not sure why people love this place so much, there's several other taquerias that I would much prefer to frequent.  They definitely stick it to you on all the extras...nothing is included with a taco or burrito.  Also, it's not cheap to begin with!

This place is good, not great.
author: Craig E.

description: I apreciated la taqueria.  Their burritos are not as massive as other places, no rice.  But the meat is great.  A really tasty burrito.  I had carnitas.  I like the movie posters on the wall too.
author: Darren H.

description:
3.5 stars

With the plethora of fantastic taquerias in the area, it's a bit of a wonder to me why this place seems to be so popular.

They have fairly clean-tasting and bland fare, where the soft tacos are a tad larger and better-wrapped than the average and the burritos definitely more disappointingly smaller than the average.  I suppose I've just been spoiled by the burritos of El Farolito (http://www.yelp.com/biz/el-farolito-san-francisco-2#hrid:h3niGsGIwtPSncL4MFM7NQ/query:farolito) or La Bamba ( http://www.yelp.com/biz/taqueria-la-bamba-mountain-view#hrid:U_Qm_HOFLrh6y-fX_zJcCA/query:la%20bamba) ilk, where one flour-wrapped missile of rice, beans, meat, salsa, aguacate and crema is enough to get me through lunch and dinner easily.

The extra half-star comes for the exceptionally clean and clean-smelling restrooms.
author: Claudine C.

description:
Hands down the best carne asada burrito I have ever had. 

When I received it, I felt for a split second that it looked a little small... but once I was finished eating the most delicious burrito I ever have had (I am a burrito enthusiast of sorts), I was completely satisfied and did not need anything else. 

Standing ovation for the best mexican food ever!!!!!
author: Dominico A.

description:
My roommates brought me here one afternoon in the Mission after hearing about it the whole way there. The taqueria lived up to its reputation. It was packed and everyone there knew what they wanted--not easy accomplishments in a neighborhood packed with taquerias.

I ordered the lengua burrito with no extras. While mine was cheap, loading a burrito up with the a la carte options quickly makes a humble burrito into an expensive order.

The flavors were simple (lots of cilantro, a good amount of onion, beans, possibly rice, and lengua). In my opinion, it's the simplicity of the burrito here that makes it so damn good. The flavors are incredibly fresh and fragrant with just cilantro and onion in the proper amounts.

As with most taquerias, the drinks here were excellent too. Nothing beats a fresh fruit juice with chunks of fruit.

One of my roommates ordered a quesadilla. I wish I had ordered it too after seeing an incredibly thick behemoth packed with more meat than I think was in my burrito. It was as thick as a torta, which reminds me--this taqueria doesn't have tortas. Minus one star for them.

I'll likely visit again whenever I'm in the area. I'm glad to know that there's one in San Jose too. Hooray!

====

Rubric: 5 = Mindblowing 4 = Excellent 3 = I see the charm 2 = Disappointing 1 = Never again
author: Eric K.

description: I have been eating here since I was a kid, when they were actually in the building next door, and even after all these years they are by far the best mexican restaurant...period! The ingredients are fresh, the meat is tender and seasoned to perfection! They make fresh fruit juices daily and they are filled with fruity bits. Strawberry is my favorite. I bring all my friends here and their reaction is always the same, "This is the best I have ever had!" I highly recommend eating here to see for yourself how good it really is!
author: Ashling C.

description:
The place is ridiculously cramped and the appearance isn't that great.

It's probably my fault for ordering tacos instead of burritos, but what I tasted certainly isn't the best in San Francisco, let alone anywhere. The carne asada taco was okay, but not worth its price. Had their chorizo taco (which was greasier than their carne asada taco) which was tastier, but again, not worth the price.

I do, however, approve of the spicy green salsa bottle.

I'll make sure to update when I go back and try their drinks and burritos.
author: Ryo M.

description:
it's like they said,  "hard work good, and hard work fine but first take care of Head".

I would skip the burritos (sub-normal for me)  and try to cabeza (head) taco, which is real good and not available on many of the taqueria menus around town.
author: Mazi S.

description:
HELLA GOOD. 

quesadilla suisa + sour cream & guacamole = HEAVEN

a teensy bit pricey for a taqueria, but DAMN WORTH IT. everytime i walk past this place, i salivate. 

quick service, sometimes hard to get a seat, but outside is absolutely perfect on a warm day.
author: Coco C.

description:
Total hole in the wall a Mexican friend of mine introduced me to some years ago. Until then, my experience of Mexican food was Taco Bell and Chevy's (Mexican food wasn't that big in London). Until then, I thought Mexican food was just lardy and gas-inducing. 

Ta da!!!! Finally, a real taco. At real prices. Thank you, Diego.
author: Mi M.

description:
Huge props for the best carne asada in the Mission, and whatever they're calling the chicken recipe they use. Great meats. Juicy, flavorful stuff all around. I seem to recall their carnitas being awesome as well.

Huge props for no rice in the burritos. HUGE.

Don't take anything I'm about to say the wrong way, cuz the food is delicious... but what's with the lack of guac? Avocado is the only option? Oh well. And what's the deal with the limp, sloppy burritos?

And no Al Pastor? You're breaking my heart.

Delicious, though. Someone get me a Dos Equis Amber right now.
author: Angelo B.

description: I ordered a regular Carnitas burrito. It came with salsa, pinto beans, and carnitas on a flour tortilla. Simple but yummy. There's a spicy sauce too!
author: Jamie C.

description: Not only the best burritos and tacos in the city but it one of the few places that also serves my fav drink, jamaica. I have been going here to eat since I was a lil kid. I gotta say they are like family. Born and raised in the city and I just gotta say there ain't nothing better.
author: Anthony P.

description: Definitely best meat quality I'n the neighborhood but foes come off skimpy due to the lack of rice. A "skinny" burrito ain't really a burrito... So not a fair burrito comparison but still a great tasting meal - which this is all about.
author: Peter K.

description:
So Damn Good!
I usually stick to my two favorites since i was a baby. Either the beef burrito or the chicken quesadilla. This place is a little slice of mexican heaven. I go there whenever i come from the airport, it has become a tradition. i step into that line and experience the greatest build up in my life. The meat is so juicy, it just runs down your face and arm. (not a great place to take someone on the first date, really messy, and can lead to you smelling like meat.) The salsa is so fresh and just the perfect spiciness. The green hot sauce is made in the store and truly amazing. 
The only thing that sucks is their hours. But i don't care, it just makes me lust over them. I still don''t understand why i don't weigh 500 pounds. 

i usually have fights with people on the best mexican place. People try to say some crappy shit is awesome, but one i open the door to this place and have them experience the great atmosphere and awesome food, they melt. People respect you more if you take them to a good place to eat. It's the key to any relationship, is to get them right in the stomach.
author: chenelle S.

description: Went here not too long ago to try the highly hyped tacos and it was just OK for me. I had one carne asada and one carnitas and to be honest it was good but nothing spectacular. I went back another time and got a burrito and it was actually alright, they dont use rice in their burritos so it was just meat in every bite which is nothing to complain about but then again its not filling.  It does get crowded around lunch time so be sure you have time to spare if your going around that time. Parking...well its mission so good luck! I would come here if every other spot is full just because i know the food doesn't suck but its not somewhere i would go if im trying to impress anyone.
author: Julio S.

description: These guys are too close to El Faralito to make an average burrito. Sure its a more pleasant experience, but for the burrito, get me some Faralito!!
author: Vivek N.

description: oh my!  get it crunchy.  do it.  tasty, filling, clean.  that's what she said.  But is was sooo damn good.  Carne, Chicken, Carnitas, oh my
author: Jordan S.

description: My favorite Taqueria in San Francisco.  A burrito and an agua fresca = happiness. :)
author: Michael S.

description:
this is the best burritos on mission street no questions asked. i grew up on mission street and as a young kid this is the only Mexican food restaurant we would go to for burritos because it tastes so good you will be licking the juice off your fingers. 

if you don't believe me drive/walk by and notice that it is packed every day all day with a line that is out the door and that should be proof enough that it is delicious. there really isn't anything else i can say except once you go once you will be hooked all the way down to the mints they have near the register.
author: Richard C.

description:
There is a reason for the five stars. 

"!Carne asado taco con todo!"

Remember those five words, a star for every word, and you are ready for food coma oh, remember to say "dos". One isn't enough or it's actually a teaser and you'll want to have another taste. 

It's like taco crack on the streets. You know it's bad for you but you can't help it. If you like the burritos same thing, don't skimp on anything and have them grill it so the tortilla is crispy!!!

Go and get you some of that taco crack.

AB
author: Anthony B.

description:
Damn good eats for next to nothing!

Watch your back as there are more than a few unsavory characters hanging inside/outside, but this is definitely a rockin' late night hot spot and the perfect place to get your Mexican eat on!
author: Aaron N.

description:
Aiyiyi.... my mouth waters just thinking of this place. Can they do right by pork and beef?! Mmmm hmmm. 

Delicious carne asada & carnitas served generous and simple dripping from your tortilla. Sit down with that green sauce and savor it --- own it! Now don't forget that taste when you queue up elsewhere in the Mission.
author: Antoi C.

description:
This place is why I sometimes HATE Seattle.  I've been traveling down to SF 2-3 times a year for the last 10 years and I have always gone out of my way to come here and wolf down some authentic Mexican goodness...Holy crap- it's the real thing Ma!

I used to gorge myself on the burritos but the past few visits I have turned to the soft corn tacos...and I have yet to venture back to burrito land.  I've generally stuck with the chicken, but have tried all the various meats including the la legua - which was pretty yummy...when someone can do up some tongue right- you know this place has gotta be good.

The strawberry drink always is refreshing touch to a near-perfect meal.
author: Knathan R.

description:
I effin' love this place!  On my first visit to San Fran we were walking around the Mission and found this taco mecca. We had dinner reservations later that evening but we were starting to get those hunger pangs that usually kick in during the 3-5om window. What the heck, lets have a "light" snack. One taco each, deal? Noooo way!! Have you tasted their carnitas taco? BEST EVER. Or the carne asada. How about the lengua? Burritos, u say?  

We knew after the first taco that our dinner would have to be in liquid form.
author: Alias M.

description:
If you're by the 24th st BART and get that hankering for a taco or burrito, La Taqueria is your friend. There's not much to address that 500 earlier reviews haven't covered -- it's cheap, it's quick, and it always hits the spot.

One problem: they're only open until 9pm -- when you get that late-night craving, you'll have to make a run to El Farolito instead (also delicious!)
author: Chris M.

description:
You're Simply the Best!  Better than all the rest!  - Tina Turner

Crispy Taco's were amazing this time!  Love the chicken, carne asada and that wonderful green sauce!

Yummy!
author: Scott S.

description:
The tacos have beans in them, which is an abomination in the eyes of God. The chips and salsa is a pile of too-thick corn chips covered in watery salsa so the chips get soggy. There is no salsa bar or big jalapeno jars. The meat is bland. 


The agua fresca is made of win.
author: Merci V.

description:
TACO coma...
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
Okay I'm awake! Try the "Dorado" style tacos and you'll never have another taco anywhere else in SF!! It's pricy for a taco but worth every frijol in the dam taco! I'll starve for days just to come and have a taco here! I wish that they could deliver all the way out here to little Windsor CA!! When you get there... you can't really come alone... u gotta hustle to get a table... so u play rock-paper-scisors to see who's gonna wait in line while the others go out n hustle.  Then when it's your turn to order u gotta make it snappy because there's lot's a people waiting behind u... so then u turn around and look lost till u n ur friend lock eyes "eey over here" with that silent chicano nod. :)
author: Angelica R.

description:
Okay, so I would first off like to acknowledge that I am probably one of the last people in San Francisco to have not tried La Taqueria. I guess I just don't normally find myself that deep in the Mission. The thought process of my first taco experience:

"Wow. I can't believe it was $26 for two people to eat here. I'm probably going to have to minus a star for that. Yum - this watermelon agua fresca is amazing. WOW this taco is amazing. The perfect combo of crunchy, salty, ooey gooey cheesy and carnitas. AWEsome."

I can't wait to go back. Seriously. But I might have to go after payday.
author: Carissa R.

description:
Great chicken burritos and great Watermelon juice! 

This is a cute fast food tacqueria type place but it was a little weird since I wasn't used to not having rice in my burritos. The chicken burrito was watery everytime I ordered from here but nonetheless, it's pretty good. Price is pretty decent.
author: V M.

description:
I saw Pancho Sanchez and his band eating here once. 

Oh and the food is F-in amazing.

I'm moving to SF.
author: Philip K.

description:
So if you've browsed through my reviews, you'll find that i rated the La Taqueria in San Jose as 5 stars....OH MAN was it a happy day riding the 49Mission Bus and noticing that there's a La Taqueria in SF.  

I am a HUGE fan of the burritos at the joint in SJ, but here in SF, its ALL about the Taco's.  Not to say that the Burrito's here in SF are any less special or kick ass than the place in SJ, but the Taco's here are something to write about.  Now going through some of the reviews for this place, i noticed that a couple people gave it lower ratings for their taco's and/or meat, but im assuming that it just depends on the given day, and that isn't any different from any other Restaurant in the city.

If you notice, i gave the La Taqueria in SJ 5 stars, and this one in SF 4 stars, this is mainly for the price hike in the SF spot compared to the SJ spot. I know its SF, and i expect it to be more expensive than SJ, but IMO its definitely still noticeable enough for a ratings drop.  And to be honest, unfortunately probably keeps me from coming here as often as i would like.

A smaller part of the ratings drop can be attributed to the service.  Its not that they aren't nice, or are particularly mean in any way, its just that the staff here seem to be more neutral.  It might just be because the staff in SJ seem to be happier overall and more personable, but either way, i think neutrality warrants a small ratings drop.

I've spent almost my entire life in So-cal where great mexican food is commonplace, so it says alot for me that i can find a good spot for mexican food here in the Bay Area.

Most definitely worth a visit at least once!
author: Mark R.

description: best carne asada burrito and tacos in the bay area.... sorry, I've had the rest this is the best... south bay heads may say Super Taqueria, well those same heads changed theirs minds when I took them here. The meat is tender, and that's all I can say about that. Trying is believing, so just go to 2889 Mission and try the best burrito.
author: Christopher J.

description:
theres so many mexican restaurants on mission but yet theres always people in here so that is always a good sign.

when im in the area, i usually come here. the steak burrito is what i usually get as their steak is quite tasty and juicy(saucy).

the burritos are on the smaller side though if you dont get extra addons.
author: Alex H.

description: Not the best but very very good. And they don't put filler in their burritos, just meat and veggies. 2 tacos will fill the belly but 1 taco is a great snack. Quick, easy, good.
author: Roger H.

description: I mean, I've been coming here since I was like 4 or 5 years old, how can I not love it!  There are always a ton of people here (including tourists :-/) but they usually move the line pretty quickly and serve quickly.  I love the burritos and tacos and chips and salsa (though I wish there was not an additional charge for that).  Their burritos and tacos are "wet" which I love...so they are best eaten right away.  Tasty tasty tasty.  Hands down my favorite in the Mission...El Faro-who!?!
author: Selena G.

description: As messy as it is delicious.  I always eat too much and then have to go home and put on stretchy pants.  Go with the chicken burrito and the beef tacos with EVERYTHING.  Also, the chips with the salsa and avocado are great.
author: Lauren M.

description: Everything at La Taqueria is top notch and it's inspiring to see the pace at which they work considering the quality of their food. I hope the pictures do this place justice and if you have never been there before you are kidding yourself.
author: Daniel P.

description:
I've been eating these tacos, and no other tacos, for years.
I have tried other tacos, and none can compare, as far as my tastes are concerned. (Note-- Nick's Crispy fried fish tacos can now compare, but their veggie tacos most definitely do not).

I recommend a veggie taco add cheese and avocado and sour cream.
They melt the cheese and get the tortillas all warm after dipping them in, um, oil, I think. They put good whole pintos in  there, and heap on the salsa and avocado and cream all thick.

The first few bites are a miracle-- warm and cool. Very flavorful. I can't talk while I'm eating these, or read either. They demand my full focus.

Aguas Frescas are A+ as well. Many flavorful choices, and they are way full of sugar too!
author: Jenny H.

description: this may sound silly, but i am not a fan of big menus and endless options, that's why i really appreciate their clear, simple, no nonsense wall menu. got the veggie burrito and i must say, it was pretty darn good. the refried beans were tasty and the burrito was oozing with cheesy goodness. it's garnered many awards and i can definitely see why.
author: Melissa Y.

description: Hands down the best carne asada burrito in SF!  I think the ingredients are top quality. 10 years ago a co-worker told me that this was her favorite place and it quickly became mine.  The burritos are smaller in comparison, but that's good for those who are all about portion control.  I think one time I ordered seconds.  Also, I don't have that semi-sick feeling after eating there, probably bec. it's not as greasy.  Haven't been there for a long time so I need to go soon...like this week!  Parking is hard, but it's BART-friendly.  Be prepared to spend more, but it's completely worth it.  Hope it becomes your favorite spot too!
author: Chad A.

description: Tried this place again, and again the only thing they got right about my food is that a burrito comes in a tortilla, and I had to pay $10 for the pleasure of finding this out. My friend got 3 tacos with a soda and somehow that came out to $20? Wtf. Don't waste your time.
author: Beth D.

description: I really have quested for the "burrito"- well the hunt is over I found it here. So many people have mentioned this place over the years, but it wasn't until my boyfriend took me to it did I get it. This just simply is the best. I loved  all  that tasty meat that came in my carne asada burrito- wow!
author: shelly m.

description:
This is the place! It, the food, is always fresh and plentiful. The place is ablaze with people from all walks of life and nationality. The owner is "hip"
and the menu reflects his ideas. It is a cool place to take people who have no idea what Mexican food  is all about. This is an American influenced cuisine which makes it great. You may call it Tex/Mex but I think its the San Francisco version of good taste.
author: Elan D.

description: Good burritos, but they're small compared to every other taqueria in the Mission, and not really justified by the usually ridiculous wait.
author: Nick B.

description: Yum. The chicken looked soooo pretty in the metal container floating in a beautiful orange sauce. It was soo tender. I wish they had more cheese in the burrito but it was still so good and the mango agua fresca was delicious!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: O K.

description:
One word:  OVERRATED!

OK, so it's definitely not bad, but I just don't get the allure of this place.  It's tiny, crowded, expensive, open-air (so COLD), and they charge extra for every little thing.

Do your wallet and taste buds a favor and head up to Casa Mexicana (on Church Street, close to the big Safeway and N-Judah stop) instead.
author: John D.

description:
I'm a burrito purist. Grew up in East LA where a good burrito has to make it on rice, beans and meat. Places like Pancho Villa and La Corneta are like sterile clones from a bad sci-fi movie.  My favorite places are like El Castillito, El Farolito and the taco truck in Oakland I always forget the name of, where you won't pay more than $5 for a burrito and the place smells like Pine-sol and piss depending on where you stand.

But La Taqueria humbles me. I want to hate them--I really do. The burritos can cost $8 and they're modestly sized. I want to roll my eyes and walk away but EVERYTHING about their food is amazing. Their meat is tender and tasty, the beans are wonderful, their guacamole is perfectly blended and they serve freshly fried tacos! I didn't know there was such a thing as burrito juice and I never thought I could become a burrito juice junkie but La Taqueria will turn you into one! 

This place is amazing. It really is. If it weren't for the anonymity of the Internet I wouldn't even say this but since none of you know me: I would make sweet love to a burrito from La Taqueria!
author: Mario T.

description: What can I say ? I was in SF for five days and ate at La Taqueria four times. It is carnivore nirvana. Getting off BART at 24th and Mission, I could sense wafts of burnt flesh from my favorite joint. I don't miss the rice, just more meat to enjoy. It is more expensive than the other taquerias in the neighbourhood but I think it's worth it. Lastly, the aqua fresca (mango highly recommended) is awesome ! There should be a large and extra- large size.
author: Stephen Y.

description:
I love the pork here. Its shredded, not at all like kibble bits. And the veggie tacos are inSANE. & The tortilla is fried, and its all the greasy goodness to get you through that hangover. MMMM yum. 
If you like avocado, then you would appreciate it here; because they don't turn it into puree. Leslie and I saw that they also may charge you for no beans, which I think is a ludicrous request anyway. Oh yeah, they close at 9pm. I pity the fool who's arrives too late.
author: Danielly A.

description:
I've only had their Tacos.  There is nothing like them on this Earth; simple, delicious, and fresh.  Juices are awesome, too.  

Only bad thing:  in SF with very limited parking.   Could ya open up on the Peninsula??  Please??
author: Sparkely K.

description:
I just returned from wolfing down the best carnitas taco on the planet. This place is the best taqueria in San Francisco. I can't wait for my next
trip over to mission and 25th. The wait staff is helpful and the green sauce that is on every table is pretty sassy. Don't wait until tomorrow, 
head on over today.
author: Cindy J.

description:
Wow. The best carnitas tacos I've had in a long time.

I found the recipe online, printed by Sunset magazine and the reason why its so tasty: cooked in lard until tender.

But it's carloricious!

Though my meal was a little pricey by Mission standards. I had two tacos, with the works (sour cream etc) and a small aqua fresca (which was delicious, not too sweet, just right) and I paid about $14.

I'll go back, but it wouldn't be a regular visit.

Plus, their salsa on the tables was AWESOME!
author: M O.

description:
I'm a vegetarian but I'm thinking of losing my meat-ginity on a one of their chicken tacos... my saliva glands are running marathons just imagining it... in cohorts with a strawberry fresca, I'd be so guiltily happy. 

P.S. Screw rice. I'm asian and even I know it's cheap filler. I'd take juicy, delicious glop over dry any ol' day. If your hands aren't messy by the end of the meal, its not worth it.
author: T.Z. R.

description:
Want a great taco? Perhaps the best in the City?  Go to La Taqueria.  A friend had been talking it up for years before I finally made it and I was not disappointed.

Wanna know why the taco is so good?  They put cheese in between two taco shells and then fry the sucker.  The result is beyond awesome.
author: cindy p.

description:
You have to be rich to eat at this place, I mean, $1 for avocado? $0.50 for NO beans? If you want your taco or burrito "con todo", be prepared to pay like $2 or $3 more! 

Ok, now the positive stuff. Super fresh, nice staff, love the mints = ) , I love the tacos dorados YUMMY and best place to eat after happy hour at the Phone Booth.
author: Anabelle B.

description:
People really like to debate about the best Mexican food in SF.  There are many options, but for me, the best TACOS in the city are found here.  Take my word.  If you like pork, go here and order exactly this:

2 Carnitas Tacos, with cheese, extra crispy, with avocado and extra cilantro.

Wash it down with a large mango agua fresca and you will be a very happy person.  Simply put, one of the best meals I have ever had in my life (and I've ordered this exact configuration 50 times in the past 10 years!).
author: Geoffrey A.

description:
Pretty much what others have said so far...its a tad on the spendy side, but can provide some excellent logs of meat for your enjoyment. The extras will kill ya...a carne asada burrito with guac and cream ran about $9. However, I did have quite the meatgasm that evening (then passed out on the couch from carb overload).

Pay the extra $2...you'll be glad you did.
author: Sean C.

description: Wow, picky people giving 4 stars following effusive praise and no criticism.  These are some of the best tacos I've ever had, and the prices are great.  Plenty of food, possibly leading to an early onset of heart attack, but hey life's short anyway.  Big fan of the agua frescas (have had strawberry and horchata) as well.
author: Chen C.

description: THE best Mexican food I have ever had! Family owned business and the owner is nothing but a sweet guy. Must have the carne asada burrito or corn quesidilla with carne asada and salsa or just plain corn quesidilla with just cheese and salsa!! Oh and don't forget to get a large piña. Yuummmmmm!!
author: Christina T.

description:
still the best taqueria ever!

try the chorizo quesadilla on corn tortilla, a grease flavor bomb using the freshest of foods. crisp tacos that are to order and cannot find a comparison on this earth. good times great food, worth the money and be real you cannot make this at home and if you can I want to come over to eat at your house!!!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Really good tacos.  The staff is super friendly and the atmosphere is nice.  The only reason i didn't give five stars is because i think it's a tad too pricey for what they offer. besides that, good stuff!
author: Sam C.

description: Carne Asada tacos.  That's all you need to order.  Skip the chicken (not much flavor).  Goooooood stuff.
author: Denise M.

description: We were told that we had to try a burrito in the mission, so we scooted on over here Sunday afternoon before we were getting ready to leave.  This is definitely authentic Mexican food and it was pretty good! I dont know if I was just tired and ready to get the heck out of San Fran or what, but I wasn't overly impressed with the food here. It was good, but it wasn't out of this world good. I had a chicken burrito with beans, sour cream, cilantro and cheese, and it was definitely filling.  My boyfriend had the tacos and he said those were good as well. I dont know, maybe I had my expectations set super high, but it just wasnt as good as I thought it would be!
author: Kori E.

description: Really good tacos, really lame service.  I would go back, but only for the food. Fresh and authentic.
author: Ruben A.

description:
While visiting San Francisco, we went for lunch after viewing the murals on nearby Balmy Alley.

Great burritos!  Made to order, with fresh ingredients. You have to like a place that charges extra for not including beans!  The agua frescas are good as well, especially the pineapple.

Business was brisk, but it didn't take more than about 10 minutes to order and get our food.  Luckily we found a table to eat at.

We really enjoyed our meal.  I'm sure we'll head back if we're in the area again.
author: Brian H.

description:
I ordered the  crispy carne asada and their strawberry drink.

The meat is rather tough and tasted like 2 day old meat.  It is definitely not high quality meat by any means and  the experience of eating the asada left me feeling dissatisfied and the the strawberry drink was not the greatest.  

They add way too much strawberry and ice and I didn't pay for ice ( which is about half the cup, if you order a large)  and sludg-y strawberry droppings!!!  

I would not come back but the wonderful thing about mission is that there are an abundant amount of Taquiera's to try!!
author: J J.

description:
best mexican food in SF . the end ...no rice no enchaladas , tamales, quesadilla, none of that..... just tacos and burritos fuckin good ones at that.
i dont know how they do it , but ive never had better..round of applause for la taqeria...(10x better than el farolito)
author: Ruca R.

description: I was a little disappointed with La Taqueria.  I've heard such great things about the place, but I wasn't wowed.  I guess I was expecting it to somehow stand out amongst the other taquerias, but I found it fairly unmemorable.  I also couldn't believe the prices.  I've had equally good food for far less.  But the thing that wil keep me from coming back anytime soon is that they charge if you ask for no beans.  We have an 8 year who doesn't like beans or most things other than cheese, meat, and tortilla.  Her taco cost us $1.25 more because she didn't want beans.  Rip Off!
author: Rebecca M.

description: My family and I stopped here after searching the net for authentic Mexican restaurants in San Fran. We recently moved to Cali from Mass and really wanted to get a true Mexican experience. After pulling up we noticed the place was packed! I wanted to try elsewhere but my wife insisted that it was packed because it was good...boy was she right! My older son who doesn't even like Mexican took one bite of his burrito and instantly blurted out "this thing is amazing!" I had the chorizo taco and the carne asada taco. The tacos here aren't your average, they come filled with sour cream, guacamole, beans, meat, onions, cilantro, I mean everything. To top it off the shell has both a soft exterior with a crispy warm inner shell. My wife's burrito was equally as good, so much so we are now calling it "our go to Mexican spot" and we live in Vacaville!!! A must visit restaurant if you are in San Fran and are in the mood for a Mexican treat!
author: Jason W.

description: Oh man.  We went here based on the Man v. Food TV show, and I have to say, I can't wait to get back to SF for another crispy taco.  It's basically where I imagine Taco Bell got the idea for a crunch wrap taco.  It's big for a taco and features a crispy (deep-fried, but not greasy) taco shell packed with meat and a soft tortilla wrapped on the outside.  Add guac and cheese and order another, cuz you're gonna want more.
author: Eric S.

description: The best. Lengua, cabeza, carnitas, chorizo, all excellent meats for your yummy burrito/taco. And the aquas frescas are a treat on a hot San Francisco day. (All two of them SF gets each year.)
author: Guillermo K.

description: Best tacos in town? Hell yes! Heart attack waiting to happen, but totally worth it!
author: Joshua L.

description:
These guys nail it every (!) single (!) time! I have never had a bad burrito, taco, quesadilla, anything at La Taqueria. It's hands-down my home base for Mexican food in the Mission and the city in general.

I love that they don't put rice in their burritos. You may find them to be a bit soupier than other places, and some days it is frustrating enough that I silently wish they would discover the slotted spoon (or make better use of it), but this in no way diminishes the best flavor and the fresh vibe of quality that just oozes out of these things. The soupiness is never a pool of grease; Unlike some other places -- I never feel unhealthy eating here. 

Honestly, I've been wanting to write this review for probably the better part of a year, but putting into words just how awesome the food is here is a daunting task. I hope I did ok  *heart*
author: Emily B.

description: Came here on a recommendations from Food Network.  It's ok.. nothing special.. simple taquieria.  Hard to find seating since there are sooo many people.
author: Zivago L.

description: Had a delish chorizo burrito today--meat was well seasoned, salsa-well balanced, and portions generous.  My only complaint was that it seemed a tad expensive, but the quality definitely rivals some of the better taquerias in LA.
author: Risha L.

description: La Taqueria has good burritos, but I prefer the ones at El Farolito one block over.
author: George L.

description:
Maybe I just suffered a terrible run of bad luck, but the three different burritos I've had here have suffered from a blandness so mighty that the tortilla was by far and away the most flavoursome ingredient.

I even include the time I ate here when drunk, which is normally when my tastebuds put on beer goggles and tell me everything they touch is the best thing ever. Disappointed, but I'll keep trying.
author: Glen M.

description:
This is a place I crave. All the time. ALL the time. And just watching the guys work is amazing. 

I didn't know the secret until the last time I went. If you order your tacos "con todo" your taco shell is actually two, count them two! corn tortillas with cheese melted in between. 

The carne asada is great, and so is the pollo asado.
author: Julia P.

description:
No doubt in my mind. La Taqueria is my favorite Mexican place. It's really all abou the meat. What other place so generously puts so much meat (the most expensive ingredient) into their product? Taqueria heaps the meat on while blending fantastic tastes. Be sure to put some of their green hot sauce on your burrito or taco for an extra burst of flavor (not that spicy, usually). 

Get aguas frescas, the fruit drink. Well worth their price in any flavor but particularly cantelope.

Parking is reasonably easy to find but beware of going down Mission; lots of traffic.
author: R K.

description:
I can see that La Taqueria isn't everyone's style of taqueria.  They don't have meats floating in sauces, they don't have rice to act as a filler, and they don't have refried beans (this is a shame).  However, what they do have is a collection of skillfully prepared ingredients to create some of the finest tacos and burritos to be found.  

The carnitas here are the best I have found, period.  Crisp and chewy exterior masking a soft, dense, juicy interior with depths of porky goodness.
