description: It's a bit of a wet burrito for my tastes, and the absence of rice came as a bit of a shock.  Yet it is truly delicious.  I need to try the tacos because I've been stuck on the burritos.  And the avocado addition is really good.  It's all very good.  If a bit wet.  Yet tasty.  Hmmm.  It's almost lunch time.
author: Laurel B.

description: I love the tacos here.  You can't go wrong with the carnitas or the carne asada.  The guacamole is damn good and well worth the extra charge.  Meat, beans, guacamole and corn tortillas.  Who says you can't eat good food gluten-free?
author: L C.

description: The pollo (chicken) crispy taco with the soft shell on the outside tasted delicious. The guac and salsa tasted fresh and I could literally taste the chucks of avocado. Not too spicy, so you can add the green sauce to your liking to add a little heat to your taco and spice things up a bit. The carne asada was a bit over cooked and dry in my opinion. The strawberry agua fresca was the best that I have tasted. Fresh strawberry juice/smoothie like taste, not watered down at all, love in my mouth after all that heat! It's pricey for a taco here, but worth your hard earned pennies.
author: Tracy T.

description: Tasty but ridiculous prices.  Paying $32 for tacos for 3 people is criminal!
author: Rob K.

description: Best carnitas (pork) burrito in town.  Love that they don't add rice.
author: Nate B.

description: Yummy is all I can say... My man I stopped here for lunch yesterday and it was great. We ordered the tacos which came loaded with Meat, Monterey Jack, Guacamole, Salsa and Sour Cream...With every bite I fell more and more in love with this place. The drinks were freshly made and the service was on point. Although the place doesn't have the best set-up in seating, the food is worth it. This place is a little high in price but the portions are what you pay for, they don't serve a regular taco its more like a super taco.
author: Carolina H.

description: yeah it's a little overpriced, and they don't serve the mission-style burritos.  but the food is still good, and the restaurant, extremely clean.  the agua frescas (jamaica and tamarindo) were also a pleasant surprise.  not so sweet with nice strong flavor....
author: Randy D.

description: This place is SO good.  There quesadillas (I get mine with everything) are delicious.  The man who owns this place is such a nice guy.  He and his son remembered me the second time I went back and it had been several months.  A family owned-business with tasty food gets my vote!
author: Rochelle G.

description: Excellent carnitas tacos, and the quesadillas are also worth a try.  In many ways, the food is like other taqs in the area, however the ingredients seem to be of slightly higher quality than the ones I am used to.  I guess that justifies a higher price.  Also, the atmosphere lacks that unsettling layer of filth that I often (and lovingly) associate with taquerias.  I'm not sure if that detracts or adds to the experience, but I'm not giving this place 5 stars anyhow due to the alarming level of suckiness of their chips and salsa.
author: Mr. G.

description:
La Taqueria is the real thing!!!

This place has the best Tacos and Burritos I have ever had and trust me, I have tried quite a few places.

To begin with, this place is super clean and every ingredient looks and tastes fresh.  Their carne asada has the richest, most pleasing flavor that I have ever tasted on a taco or burrito.  It is not plain like El Taco Loco or El Farrolito.

I really like the Cabeza tacos with red sauce.

The size of their Burritos is smaller than many other Taquerias but that's only because other places stuff their Burritos with a bunch of rice and beans, but very little meat with no flavor to it..  

At La Taqueria it is about quality over quantity.  If you just want something big to fill you up and not really enjoy it,  then I do suggest you go elsewhere.

If you want to treat your out of town friends or family to something good, then take them to La Taqueria.

This place is really bussy for lunch on the weekdays, but the service is fast!!!

The owner of this place is also really nice.  He is hardly ever there, but when he is, he chats and jokes with everyone.

The only thing that I do not like about this place is that it is overpriced and they never give you a receipt unless you ask for one.  Sometimes I do wonder if they have overcharged me. Specially when I buy a Burrito and a Taco for about $13.00.  WOW....

There is also a La Taqueria in San Jose, but Ive never been, so I can't say much about it.
author: Carlos M.

description:
I don't understand what the big deal about this place is.  I figure it must be that I'm vegetarian, and can't try their meats.  Because the rest of the food they serve is kinda crappy...

There are *so* many better taquerias within two blocks.  Well, for a vegetarian at least.
author: Jeff W.

description:
Local religion
Come find taco nirvana
Rice not an option
author: HaikuReview X.

description: Been in the Mission 5 years and these are still the best tacos in the city. A $5 dollar taco if you get it with everything. But hey, you only need one.
author: Lisa K.

description: This restaurant was the one bright light in an otherwise horrible 8 hour day of traffic school.  I got what i usually get at a burrito place, carnitas and everything except sour cream. Total came to $8.98, which in my opinion is super expensive for a burrito, but omg it was so good. I guess since my other burrito experience has usually been richmond district stuff like gordos and chinos, i might not be an expert in the field, but this burrito was full of win. Definately worth the $9 in the end.
author: Eric W.

description:
I dunno-
 I had wanted to order veggie burrito, but I have learned that wherever I go, I have to ask what a veggie burrito comprises: the good places replace meat with grilled or steamed veggies. Lesser taquerias leave out the meat and don't include anything in its stead: you get a burrito with beans and lettuce, basically. And that's what you get at La Taqueria.
So I opted for the carnitas burrito, which  cost nearly ten dollars and had no rice in it, and mushy, tasteless guacamole and gristly pork.
author: larissa A.

description:
(my tribute to wallace & gromit)

this is the best taco is san francisco - but you have to get it WITH CHEESE!  just in case you didn't hear me.... WITH CHEESE!!  you know why you have to get it WITH CHEESE?  because if you get it WITH CHEESE, they fry one of the tortillas  WITH CHEESE and wrap it around the other soft tortilla - the result is crispy goey goodness WITH CHEESE oozing out the sides as you bite into your juicy mexican heaven.  i recommend the beef and (surprisingly) also the pork.  and also the pineapple drink to wash it down (not for the diabetically challenged).  

prices have been slowly creeping up so that is why i took away one star.
author: Josie M.

description: I love love LOVE their veggie tacos crispy style! How you can you not love homemade salsa, homemade, guacamole, homemade tortillas and cooked veggie beans for $2.25? I know. It's hard to believe. Trust me on this. They even have orange fanta. Man I feel like I'm in Texas at my grandmas house. What's next chorizo con papas for breakfast and Big Red soda with tortas con chiles for lunch?! The only thing missing is nopales and we have my families house! Go check it out. What are you going to lose, $2.25?
author: monika l.

description: Not much to say really. Hands down best Mexican food in the city (except for at my abuelita's house!)
author: Enrique O.

description: killer food. burritos are the bommmb. Get the chicken one. You might need to fight it out for a table but its worth it....or just sit down with some random people if they have room at one of the looong tables. Give them a sad puppy face and wave your burrito at them. How could they say no? I would give 5 stars but last time i was here, i was on a really bad date...so now i have weird memories of this place. haha
author: Spencer N.

description: Okay, coworker's birthday and it was suggested let's go eat at this really good taqueria off the 24 Street BART station. Okay, let's get some mexican food!  We arrived there in good time when it wasn't too busy.  Food came quickly and it was delicious.  However, I found out they do not include chips and salsa, which I had grown accustomed to whenever I eat Mexican food.  Kind of a bummer but no big deal.  Then I found out the Pollo Burrito (chicken) I had ordered was soooooooo soggy the wrap was already soaked.  Not liking that.  Each bite had me checking to see where all the sauce was shooting out to (is it on my coat?  Did I hit my coworkers with sauce??)  For these two reasons (and the fact I can find some good Mexican food closer to work), I'm just giving this place 2 stars.
author: Wayne C.

description: Hands down, favorite tacos in the city.  I can't say about the burritos, as I've never had them, but MY GOD, the tacos! Overflowing with meaty goodness!  I order mine with avo and cheese, which bumps the price up a bit, but YUM.  I've also had the veggie tacos, which were phenomenal!  *yums*
author: Jennifer L.

description: The best taqueria in SF. Don't listen to anyone who tells you different.
author: Jose P.

description: This place is BOMB they have the best Mexican food hands down.. The only problem i have with this place is that their burritos are on the small side but very very tasty.........
author: DANNY B.

description: I like coming here with my dad because he always reminisces of the days when he used to live in the city and frequent this place.   We like to stand there and watch them chop up the huge mound of carne asada.  The tacos are mighty tasty and so full of meat!  They are a  little spicy too, but I love that!  Sometimes your stomach may hurt too a bit afterwards, but that's only because you know you should have eaten one taco, but couldn't resist and ate both with the guacamole, beans, cheese and salsa!  Mmmmm.  Although it's almost always packed, the line moves rather quickly.  Paying almost $10 for just two tacos seems pricey, but it's La Taqueria and after you're done, you feel like you've eaten a lot more!
author: Leslie U.

description: I grew up in Mexico and in my opinion this is the best and most authentic taqueria in town.  Been going there for over 10 years and love it every time.  I must confess I stick to the tacos and have never had a burrito there. I don't remember ever having a burrito growing up in Mexico, and I don't remember ever having sour cream at a restaurant in Mexico, so it's a bit odd that they have it that at all on their menu.  This coupled with the fact that they charge extra to have NO beans in the tacos (wtf?) is -1 star for me, but their tacos are awesome.
author: cecilia g.

description: Quite simply my favorite taqueria in the city. It's hard to say why it's so delicious, but there's no doubting it. Sometimes hard to find a seat. The cook gave our hungry-looking dog some (nice) meat scraps through the window while we were waiting. Every time I go here it's a treat.
author: Charlie C.

description:
I used to live on 24th and Folsom and let me tell you ... my husband and I had take out from La Taqueria at least twice a week and we were dirt POOR!

I always had the carnitas burrito with guacamole and sour cream.  The no rice and beans REALLY made it yummy for me.  It was nothing but greasy pork goodness.  I always say I'm full when I get half way through one of them but it so good I can never stop eating!

My husband always gets the carne asada with nothing in it.  Go figure.

I never ordered a taco for myself until one day they gave me the wrong brown paper bag.  Someone walked out with my carnitas burrito and I walked out with 2 of their beef tacos.  I was disappointed and thrilled at the same time!  It was a little greasy from the corn tortilla but boy was it GOOD.

It's definitely worth the wait in line.  We got there so early once that I think it was still breakfast time!  HAHA
author: Angie C.

description: Best burrito in the MIssion and SF.  The chicken is probably the most impressive, its drippy and flavorful not dry or tough.  Although tastier than other places you pay for it.  It'll cost you $8 instead of $6 and the portions are smaller.
author: BeeryMcGymrat X.

description: This place is my favorite!  The best burritos in the city hands down!  I've been going here since I was a little girl and it's still the bomb! They're burros are no bull shit burritos...They're are the juiciest and most authentic burritos you will ever have.  Keep in mind, this place is cash only! yum!
author: Danielle V.

description: Every other reviewer has already stated the obvious.  This place is the BEST.  Best Tacos, best Burritos.  I moved away and lived in Boston for 15 years and when I would come home to visit, La Taqueria was the first stop from the airport, EVERY TIME.  I just wanted a chance to give it 5 stars.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Yum! I love this place. I know people bitch about there being no rice in the burritos but, really, that's a San Francisco thing. Nobody else eats them like that. True, there are no burritos in Mexico. But, still, we're gabacho idiots and we eat burritos. I digress....anyways, even in New York City, they call burritos with rice, "San Francisco Burritos."

The seating is cozy and have fun with the leather weave stools that, if you're fat, will leave you body oozing through the weaves. Eww. Just kidding....(sort of).
author: Tracy Y.

description: I'm secretly obsessed with the sfgate top 100 restaurants list, where I first heard about this place.  As an ex-Houstonian, I consider myself an expert on Mexican food - and this place has the best tacos in the city, hands down.  Some of the best I've ever had.  Try the carnitas with everything.  (Just beware of extra charges for each extra on your taco).  It's worth it though.
author: Erin D.

description: this couldn't possibly be the best mexican in the city...  every single person i've asked "where can i go for good mexican in the mission?"  replies "go to la taqueria--get _____". so i do.  disappointment.  same conversation w/ some other random person--they tell me to get this instead.  so i go back and order it.  same story.  at some point i need to just give up on this place and accept that good mexican just doesn't exist here.  maybe i just need to be piss drunk next time.
author: Terri M.

description: The vegetarian tacos are really good, even though there's only one option: tacos with pinto beans and other stuff.  Still, I happily farted the rest of the day away after eating my two vegetarian tacos, one with guacamole and one without.  They tasted like real Mexican food.  I'd definitely stop by again for a quick lunch whenever I'm in the Michon.  It's good, quick, informal, and the people are cool.  I liked it a lot.
author: Mister M.

description: I'm craving a carnitas taco with fresh guac right now! Burritos are like bricks.
author: the L.

description: Good tacos.  I'm super picky about what I want in my burritos and more often than not this place messed up my burrito, so I decided to try the tacos.  Way better than the burrito - I like the beans they add.
author: Maria F.

description: Quality meats and produce! You know it's good when people who left the Mission years ago still bring the kids back through on weekends just to stop in. If you're not getting a burrito this is the spot to go.
author: Mingus R.

description: I was not impressed with this place at all. I'll start first with the positives: the beef in my burrito was pretty tasty and I looooved the Strawberry fruit drink, and I thought the atmosphere was good. Now for the negatives: WHAT THE HECK? NO RICE IN MY BURRITO??? After I got my burrito I went up and asked if I could get a side order of rice and they told me that they didn't have any. WHAT KIND OF MEXICAN RESTAURANT DOESN'T HAVE RICE??????? Jeeeez!!! Also, my burrito was WAY overloaded with beans... mehhh. I've DEFINITELY had better Mexican food. The only reason that I'd ever come back to La Taqueria is if I'm in the mood for a really good fruit drink. Otherwise, I don't think I'd go back. Way too overrated.
author: Lizzie B.

description: These are the best tacos I have ever had. Ever. Yeah, they're a little expensive, but it is totally worth it. I might even say that La Taqueria is the most consistently good restaurant I have ever been to. Yum!
author: Nicolette G.

description: This truly is *la* taqueria.  Seriously, if you've lived here long enough you've definitely heard of this place.  In fact, you've definitely been to this place.  It's a true mission landmark; after all, it's been here for 30 years.  And it remains on just about everybody's short list.  Just look at how many Yelp reviews it has!  The meat here is especially flavorful and well-cooked.  Keep in mind that there may not be room to sit here, so be prepared to get your tacos to go.
author: Wes M.

description: La Taqueria burritos are like a college basketball team made up of tenacious freshman: lots of potential, but not fully realized.  Don't get me wrong, compared to almost every tortilla-wrapped Mexi-goodness I had in Chicago, this is the winner.  But, with so many great-sounding/looking joins in the Mission in particular, I'm holding my 4 or dare-I-say 5-star review for something better.
author: Eric S.

description: I went here the other night to try something new.  What I got was an overpriced burrito!  I think that this place thinks they are the best so they have to charge more than the other taquerias in the area.  650 for a burrito and if you want avacado or cheese or sour cream it is another 3 dollars!!!  The chips were good though and so was the salsa.  I think I will stick with the old standby up the street where the prices are fair and the food is better.
author: ben G.

description: Best taco in the city...carne asada, no beans, hot salsa, and guac...mmmm, yummy
author: Reza E.

description: Papa, what's heaven like? My son, heaven is a carne asada taco with guacamole and cheese. Their tacos are literally the truth. Perfect. I 'm sure religions have been started around these tacos. I've heard the burritos are good too, but i can't see myself ordering anything other than two delicious tacos filled with juicy flaky perfectly grilled carne asada so good that it could possibly cure cancer.
author: Gabe b.

description: It's been a while since I've been here but went back last night and it's just as good as I remembered.  I love their burritos -- good chewy tortillas with flavorful and juicy meat and not too many beans.  I think they used to use guacamole instead of avocado in their burritos (the guac is really good) so that was a little disappointing but it's still delicious!  I might even venture to say this is my favorite mexican in the city...
author: Mitzi C.

description: San Francisco locals know this is the best spot to go for Mexican in the city. If you're getting tacos, be sure to get carnitas in all of them. I've had a few friends get 1 carnitas taco and 1 chicken or something else and everyone's always disappointed they didn't get all carnitas!
author: Sydney L.

description:
DAM....food is as good as the food in Guadalajara! 

I end up missioning to the mission (lol) at least every two weeks for this bomb ass food!  

Its simple straight up mexican, fresh and BOMB.

Try some of their juices, they are so great!
author: Dillon G.

description:
close to being the best taco ever, close to $5 a piece though.


seriously.

why do people need to write an in depth review about this place.

GREAT TACOS. those two words are enough.
author: Michael A.

description: Beans on my taco, an interesting idea, however they took away from the flavor of the carnitas. The meat itself was tender, but not cripsy throughout which was kind of disappointing. Other disappointments were the huge amounts of pico dumped on the tacos and the not crispy enough "crispy" tortilla hidden underneath the soft one (which isn't on the menu). Unfortunately, $11 for 2 carintas tacos (with nothing added) and one tacate seems a little pricey for a taqueria...
author: Nicolas H.

description: There is nothing I can add that at least 200 other reviews haven't already covered. However I will add this , BEST TACOS EVER!!!!!!!!!
author: Jerry M.

description: Now this is the proper way to make a lengua burrito! But for $8ish (w/avocado)? Come on now!
author: Maximillian M.

description:
I've been eating here since early 1980's, going there after school with my allowance to get a burrito to compensate for the nasty cafeteria food I had for lunch (what is up with the square pizza?!?!).  It has the best carne asada burrito ever!  I moved to Los Angeles area in the mid 1990's and believe me, LA has got some awesome Mexican food places - especially those roach coaches and taco trucks.... YUM... So, I've had my fair share of great Mexican food (not just in LA but in Mexico too!).  However, for all the Mexican places I've been to (note that I said places not restaurant cuz some of these places are literally hole in the wall or just some stand on the corner of the street by Santee Alley or Toy District),  La Taqueria offers the BEST carne asada burritos because the meat is so juicy!!!!  It's never dry like most of the carne asada in the other places.  The salsa is just right, not too chunky and has lots of flavor.  Their hot green salsa is so great that you can add a little or a lot depending on your tolerance for spiciness.  I usually top it off with the Fresa fresca (strawberry fruit drink)... it hits the spot for me!  I recently move back to the Bay Area and one of the place I made sure I introduce my boyfriend to was this place! 
Now, I do agree about the price.  Although the food is as good as I remember it the price sure has sky-rocketed.  I mean, I was able to afford the burrito and the drink with my elementary school days allowance (and it wasn't a lot) back in the 80's!!!!  Well, I suppose if there's a demand, the price will never stay low!
author: Judie N.

description: Ate a carne asada taco that was awesome.  Had a carnitas burrito that was tasty but would have preferred a bit more crisp.  Next time an asada burrito.  They do not use rice in their burritos which I enjoyed.  More beans and meat.
author: Eric D.

description: Fantastic service and food! Thank you, Miguel, for making my family's experience at La Taqueria amazing! We loved every type of meat we tried (favorite was the chorizo - delicious seasoning) and our jaws dropped upon tasting the strawberry agua fresca! I'm sure we'll be making sure to stop by La Taqueria every time my brother and sister-in-law are visiting and I'll be back anytime I'm nearby. Highly recommend!
author: Susanna C.

description:
Best carnitas tacos - ever!  Order the carnitas w/ cheese and avocado and request some slices of lemon/lime to squeeze on top.  Folks rave about the burritos here, but the tacos are amazing.  The carne asada is fine, but the carnitas melts in your mouth.  The agua frescas are solid, too.  (Just typing this makes me miss living in the City.)  
Minus one star because this place ain't cheap and you have to pay extra for everything.  I easily exceed $10 for my meal of 2 tacos and a drink.
author: Eddie S.

description: The best tacos I've had in the Mission. It's a little off the beaten track but it definitely beats Sancho Villa, which was the one I usually went to before.  There were cops in there when I got there, which is always a good sign. The carne asada taco was great, but if I went again I'd get the chicken burrito, which was fresh and delicious. As someone else said, they charge you $1.30 for chips and salsa instead of giving them to you for free like in other taco places, but in my opinion they were worth it.
author: Hans K.

description:
I don't think it's right to charge six bucks for a tortilla, meat, and three beans. I'm not stupid. This place charges extra for cheese, sour cream, guacamole, etc. You name it- they'll ding you for it. I got the "basic floor model" with a cheese upgrade and a beer, so my intimidating burrito cost me ten bucks. When it came, looking like a toothpick and soggy to boot, I sucked it up and began eating. There was no cheese, nor did they stuff the money that I spent on upgrading (this is ridiculous) my burrito inside. I asked the lady inside to make me another, and had to wait until all the other customers' orders were taken (it was like the floor of the stock market). She told me it was in the bottom of the burrito. At this point, I could counter with "you don't know which side I started with" but I held back. This place is in it for the money. It is a joke to see the burritos they dish out. Traditional my butt. I'd rather eat Taco Bell and that's saying something!

Pros: it is a far drive from where I live
Cons: everything
author: Sam L.

description:
Not that this place seems to need much more talking up...

I'm accustomed to the "everything and possibly a kitchen sink" super burritos, which this place does not do. Your burrito will have meat, rice, beans, and salsa. And it will knock the heck out of any other burrito you've had. It's the haiku of burritos. The zen koan of mexican food. The single espresso to the rest of the world's zebra mocha. This is the burrito stripped to its essence. Infinitely harder to accomplish, since there's nothing to hide the true nature of the burrito - no cheese to cover up middling meat, no sour cream to make up for tasteless salsa. For this burrito to succeed, it must do so on the strength of the shop - and man, do they ever knock it out of the park. 

I'm really upset it takes me an hour to get here.
author: Eric D.

description: This place annoys me now, what with their charging extra for every little additional ingredient you might want to add to your already rather overpriced very basic taco. I used to be all over this place-- I mean, the food's certainly tasty enough-- until I realized there are many other (cheaper) places just like this in the Mission. I think La Taqueria's gotten a little too big for its britches.
author: Heather M.

description: I have been eating at La Taqueria since I was a toddler, and it is STILL the best place to get a burrito in the Bay Area, if not the world. And I have inhaled a lot of burritos in my life, having lived in the Bay Area and Los Angeles. The carne asada is to die for, whether you get it in a burrito or taco. A La Taq burrito is the food I miss the most when traveling abroad, or even outside California!
author: Alexi S.

description:
the best expensive burrito i've ever had.

they don't put rice in the burritos, which means its all beans and meat the way a burrito should be. i pay extra for cheese, sour cream and avo. mmmmm.

great taco's, one and a half is enough for me, but i can't leave a fallen soldier.

aqua fresca is yummy too.
author: Amanda M.

description: I live right around the corner from this place and definitely the best tacos I've ever had. I'm a vegetarian so have only had the veggie tacos, but man are they good. The tortilla is just so good. Also had the strawberry aguas frescas which was very chunky (straw didn't suck up most of the actual strawberry chunks) but super fresh. A little pricey (as everyone knows) so if you want the avocado and all the works it'll cost you $7 for a couple of tacos, but still worth it I think.
author: Lili L.

description:
crunchy taco goodness.  

service = what?
tacos = excellent
price is medium high

the perfect evening consists of several hours at the climbing gym followed up by taqueria. life doesn't get much better.  get two crunchy carne asada tacos with the works and a coke. It will cost you  
$12.86.  yes. It's a little pricey but well worth it!
author: Garyn W.

description: I heard on the street about this place on my first trip to San Fran. When we were standing outside looking at the line out the door, we thought let's go somewhere else, and starting discussing where. but a man outside eating on the patio asked if we weren't from around here we have to try it, said it was the best Mexican food in the city. Let me tell ya, he was not wrong. This place is amazing! The food is cooked right in front if you and it tasted fresh. The line moved fast and we had our order taken while waiting. It was a great experience and I would recommend it to anyone.
author: Michael S.

description:
Arguably some of the best Mexican food in the bay area, and they know it, hence their higher than usual prices.  Too bad it's become so gringoized and yuppy, I've been eating here since I was a kid.  

Very sad to see that its overall star rating is only at 4, which puts it in the same league as Nick's Crispy Tacos, which I also just rated and would have rated at 0 had it been possible.  Or might it be that some people can't discern between good and very bad Mexican food?

I've read some of the reviews of this restaurant on this site.  Most Mexicans I know (here in the States, burritos aren't eaten in Mexico) prefer no rice in their burritos, I don't mind it, but I prefer no rice, it's a filler to save money on meat expenses.

Regarding the extra charge for no beans.  It's because if you order no beans they have to fill the tortilla with more meat.  However, I prefer to think that there's a surcharge for no beans to discourage the whiney and picky patrons who show up at Mexican restaurants and have to order no beans, or no salsa, or no whatever, and walk away with burritos that I call "why bothers."
author: D C.

description: Best carne asada in the city. Hands down. This place has ruined me because I CANNOT eat a burrito anywhere else now.
author: JM C.

description: I'm pissed because I'll never fully enjoy eating tacos when I get back to L.A. This place puts almost all other tacos to shame. The carne asada con todo with homemade tortillas is perfection.
author: Alex d.

description: This has got to be the top five taqs in the SFC!  Carne Asada burrito is the bomb. A little pricey but worth  it. Im a big fan of this place.
author: Daniel C.

description: Best mexican food in the city. Nuff said.
author: Mo G.

description: So coming from san diego I was not really excited about getting anything from almost any mexican place in san fran. I was having withdraws so I needed a fix after that 8 hour drive. Last time I went up to Frisco there was lettuce in my burrito. That's a big no no. I have to say la taqueria changed my mind. I thought it was a pretty ok pollo burrito. It wasn't the best I've ever had but it was the worst either. I feel like I should have just gotten tacos instead. 10 bucks for a drink and a burrito is a bit on the steep end also. Although the piña was tasty.
author: Clementine M.

description: Yeah not so good. Overpriced. Small portions. Cash only. Bland flavors. I was recommended this place by a mission newby and tried it out.  My native san franciscan intuition bells were ringing but I ignored them. This place is like a California roll...entry level.  If you want the dragon roll of burritos, search elsewhere
author: jacob s.

description: I'll admit, I'm rarely in the mood for Mexican food. Probably because I'm not into rice and beans. This is the only Mexican food I ever crave (EVER!) and will go out of my way for. Most likely because of the lack of rice and beans and also because they serve beefhead tacos smothered in goodness and fresh strawberry agua fresca. The beefhead is so moist and juicy it slides right down my throat without requiring any chewing. Unlike the fresca, which is somewhat chunky in texture, but in a good way.
author: Victoria N.

description: Definitely worth the trip out to the Mission for La Taqueria.   I had the Carnitas and Chicken tacos and they were super grubbing.  They are really big and you probably don't need to add on the extras unless you are looking for a food coma.  I know there are endless Mexican Restaurants in the Mission but this one is worth a try.
author: Brian L.

description: I wasn't a fan of their carne asada burrito.  I am still on my 4 year quest of finding a burrito in sf than can beat a carne asada burrito from the dreaded so cal.  So far only gordos on 25th has the best that I've eaten in nor cal.
author: Fatty A.

description: Consistent, tasty, clean but... I feel as if there are better examples of every single item on the menu elsewhere. Not one thing I've had here was exemplary. I almost always can say to myself, "self, you know you love the lengua at Cancun or maybe you should take yourself to El Farolito for the chicken or El Castillito for the carnitas. All those places are a dollar less for 50% more, too, self."
author: patrick g.

description: Their tacos and burritos are really good.  But it costs too much!  There I said it.  If you don't mind high priced tacos, eat up.  There are those of us who just cringe doing it.  I have to say that their charges for sour cream, guacamole, chips, and salsa is out of control and can double your costs if you add these condiments.  It's leaves a bad taste in my mouth.  I am not against taqueria's earning their keep, by all means do so.  I just hope their staff get's their fair share in decent wages.  I think twice before going recalling how much I pay for two tacos.  Because their food is delicious and one of the guys at the register is hot, but overpriced, I give it three stars.  I grew up eating tacos and know $11 for two tacos is overpriced.  Que...que buey!
author: Adrian N.

description: Having moved to the Bay Area from San Diego, I found it difficult to find a taqueria that served good SoCal style cusine. My search ended at La Taqueria. This place makes the best carne asada burritos in the Bay Area, bar none (better than my favorite places in SoCal even). Unfortunately, these burritos are also some of the most expensive in the Bay Area (and prices have steadily increased over the years as well). My personal favorite is carne asada w/ guacamole. Ask them to brown the burrito on the grill before they give it to you. Be sure to slather on lots of the great home-made green salsa (warning! it's spicy!).
author: Sunny Y.

description: Three stars for being over hyped. I got the "special" off-the-menu dorados and was disappointed. It was filling, but it didn't move me the way I hoped for. I don't think I can judge this place fairly for the other menu items, but I think it's convenient if you live in the Mission - not really worth the trip otherwise.
author: Karen L.

description: Once upon a time when I lived in San Diego it was pretty easy to find those delicious burritos where the chunks of carne asada swim freely in a tubular pool of guac, beans and sour cream.  Moving back to San Francisco a few years ago, I was saddened to see that every Mission taqueria sought to landlock the meat in absorbant and unnecessary rice...all except for La Taqueria.  This is a place that lets the meat swim free.
author: Aaron S.

description: The tacos are indeed excellent (yes, dorado), but I have to admit that the prices are a little jarring.  I know, I know, how many yelpers warned me already, but I just assumed they were whiners annoyed by paying an extra dollar or two compared to El Farolito or the taco truck.  4 little tacos with everything (my 2 tacos did not fill me up) and 2 beers totaled $34.  They'd be 4-star, but they were also pretty rude.  And with prices like that, maybe my partner  who was outraged they were cash only actually has a legitimate gripe.
author: Leo C.

description: after being away from SF for several years, I went back to La Taqueria for my favorite Mexican food FIX ... this place is still the BEST, love it ... great carnitas.  Try the corn quesadilla with avacado, yum.
author: Mike M.

description: Finally went here last week to see all the hype about the rice-less burritos. And I must say, while not an all-the-time burrito, I was quite impressed and would definitely go back. And since I'm small, I found it a personal victory to finish all of my burrito and not feel completely disgusting. I had carne asade and the mr. had carnitas.  I vote carne asada.
author: Nima K.

description: Very good tacos - best I've had in SF. Lengua was by far the meat of choice, but chorizo, carnitas, and carne asada all great. The salsa verde the serve at the tables, along with the crema, makes these great. We got three each, but 2 was probably plenty. Highly recommended!
author: Justin G.

description: I used to swear by La Taqueria, eating here at least once a week (and sometimes twice) on the way to band practice on Folsom and 25th Streets in San Francisco. It's been a couple years, but I felt a little let-down on a return visit this afternoon. The burritos were pricier than I had remembered and the carne asada fattier. I think La Taqueria is good because their tacos and burritos taste like no other, but nowadays I think I'm a little spoiled on the fare of places like Picante and Cactus. Still, La Taqueria is loads better than most other Mission taquerias like Cancun and El Farolito.
author: Cory G.

description: Old school, best tacos in SF, but probably the most expensive in the Mission.
author: Adam Z.

description: This place would be good... if you were in Kansas and it was the only Mexican place for miles. In Mission, throw a stone and you'll find a better restaurant. Check out the clientele, it's the only taqueria in Mission packed with non-Mexican people consistently (white-washed). The burritos are overpriced and small. The taste is also mild (white-washed). You know, safe and not with too much of those Mexican spices. They might as well sell hot dogs.
author: Jay N.

description:
I really enjoyed the carne asada taco and part of a carnitas burrito (eventually all of of it) from our first visit to this BUSY Mission restaurant.
The steak on the taco was flavorful and plentiful and it was all wrapped in a soft and hard tortilla shell, topped with pico de gallo and sour cream and wrapped in a butcher paper square.  Kicked Taco Bell's butt!
The carnitas burrito was also very good although the flash steamed and quickly filled flour tortilla gets soggy when you go back to finish it several hours later.  But, I did go back and finish the whole thing.
The chips & salsa were house made corn tortilla chips with 1/2 salsa and 1/2  avocado (on request and added $).  Adding the SPICY salsa verde from the ketchup squeeze bottle on the table into the mix made for an endorphin filled lunch that was finished perfectly with a Dos Equis Ambar beer in the bottle.
My partner thought there was too much cilantro in his chicken burrito, but on a beautiful, sunny Sunday afternoon...it's one herb or the other and cilantro just wasn't the herb he wanted at the time! Ha!
Overall, it was very good.  Next time, I think we'll try Taqueria San Jose which was much less crowded, may have been less expensive and looked like it had a wider variety of menu items.  We'll see.
author: Sean M.

description: Just very average in my book.........but hey...different stokes for different folks! I think I bought into the hype a little too much!
author: tom h.

description: Best taco I've had from the Mission.  Double tortilla, so much cheese, delicious, falling apart in your mouth meat that's been cooked all day...awesome.  Cheap beers too.  Worth a visit at least once a week.  Need a little more salt in their guac, though.
author: Emma H.

description: This is my go to place for quality burritos. The Al Pastor is the succulent and  I love the fact they don't put filler rice in their burritos so it doesn't weigh 5 pounds. Quality over quantity.
author: Mike A.

description: La Taqueria is fantastic for both the atmosphere and the food.  There's a great community feel for the diners, fun music and happy stomachs.  This is the one place that I've ever found a chorizo burrito.  It's smokey and rich and takes burritos up to a special level.  They are expert wrappers so you can be sure that your burrito will stay intact to the last bite.  They use pinto rather than black beans, which is a strike against them for me, and I've gotten them a bit mushy before, but I forgive them.  If you are in the Mission and looking for an authentic quality burrito, this is the spot.
author: Thomas T.

description: All I can say is that this place has by far the best carnitas tacos I have ever had. Of course I add cheese, guacamole, sour cream and ask for them crispy...heaven.  I arrived back from two weeks abroad today after 24 hours of straight travel.  I went to La Taqueria within hours of my arrival home the craving was so dire!  You will not be disappointed. It is important to note that La Taqueria doesn't do tacos the way you might see them elsewhere- they add beans and the cheese (optional) is melted to the bottom of the taco. Such innovation!  I feel so lucky to live so close to such a wonderful establishment....Check it out.
author: Cecelia B.

description: I've been coming here for over 30 years (yikes!) and have never had a bad meal.  The carnitas tacos are sublime.  When my kids are getting over being sick and don't want to eat anything, they will ALWAYS manage to polish off a taco.  Before I got the results of my amnio, I knew I was having a girl when I switched over to chicken tacos after decades ) of carnitas and carne asada.
author: Nicole K.

description: Mmm hmm.  I had a carnitas burrito, and albeit not health food at all, really truly was the best I've ever had.  We showed up right as they were closing and the owner still let us in to eat, now that's top notch service!  Orale!
author: Samantha B.

description: Everyone points to La Taqueria as the best burrito joint in SF.  Yes I do agree, it's the best I've had so far.  If you're thinking of a typical grungy burrito place with the more grease, the later the hours and dirt cheap prices then please walk your ass down to 19th and mission to taqueria cancun.  I would say the carne asada burrito is very good.  You can actually see raw meat being grilled behind the counter, a true carne asada.  The guac is fresh, the salsa fresca is awesome, and the hot sauce is damn hot.  Just watch out for all the extras.  A base burrito is about $5 but if you walk in and say "I'll have everything" on that burrito, you're bill quickly add up to $7-8, a little high for the late night drunk crowd.  One last thing that I take amusement with is the fact that it costs a dollar I believe, to ask for "no beans, sin frijoles".
author: Jordan S.

description: I went here for lunch on a weekday when it was not as crowded as it usually is.  When trying a new taqueria I get a carnitas burrito along with guac and chips.  The burrito was excellent along with the guac.  It was easy to get a table and the restaurant was clean and well done.  I can see why people give La Taqueria high marks.  If I'm anywhere near this place and hungry I will definitely stop by again.
author: Tom C.

description: This is the place you want to take people from out of town, if you want to enchant them with a mission taco or burrito.  Clean, simple, and the best.  #1 recommendation would be the taco durado with everything.  Not on the menu.  Just ask for extra crispy.  If you eat pork try it with the great carnitas.  The burritos are excellent too, no rice, but they really don't need rice.
author: oliver w.

description:
La Taqueria is one of my favorite restaurants in the city so I thought it was about time I gave it a proper review. This is one of the great places in the city where you can get a great meal for ten bucks!
*A caveat here- I am a vegetarian. I hear the carnitas are to die for. I wouldn't know about this. However, the veggie tacos are amazing.
What is so delicious is that they grill them up "crispy" like- two tortillas grilled with cheese inbetween. YUM! Then they fill them with pinto beans, smack some fresh pico on top and send 'em on out to you. If you order chips and guacamole it is just as casual- a pile of chips with seconds old guacamole on top. Wash it all down with a horchata aqua fresca. Delicioso!
The burritos here are unremarkable, but the tacos are the best in the city. (Nick's crispy tacos a very, very close second.) Depending on when you go, there could be a bit of a line. It is worth the wait! Don't forget the quac!
author: Kelly C.

description:
my coworker suggested this place for lunch.  what a great idea!  this is your authentic street-style mexican food joint.  Cash only though.  There's an ATM.  But it being my first time, she suggested I go for the gusto: 2 carne asada tacos with ERRRRvrything!  I think it'll take months of caloric expenditure to make up for these warlocks!  But this ish was GOOOOOD!  the place is crackin at lunch, i can only imagine what it'd be like for dinner.  The tacos are double-tortilla'd -- and allow for a delightful crunch.  The carne asada was seasoned well and not salty.  The salsa was spicy with a mild heat.  the guac is fresh -- no frills here!  Come out to the mission if you can!  

Oh yeah, i'm setting the price range as "moderate" since it was $12.34 for two tacos.  worth the scrap though!
author: Juliet P.

description: I came here when i was told they had really good tacos. Good lord were those some expensive tacos! $23 for 4 (2 carna asada, 2 chicken, with sour cream/guac). I'm used to the people who go up the street with a bell yelling "TACOOOSSS" back home (and they taste fantastic and are $.75). They were all right; big, messy, but not all that. The chicken meat was dry. I think carne asada would have been better. Still, a disappointment.
author: marcella r.

description:
I order the Chicken Burrito with some chips (with salsa sauce). The waitress asked me if I wanted to have my burrito with our without cheese, avocado, sour cream. She also wanted to know if I wanted it spicy or not. That way you can customize it your way! I like that convenience :-)
As lots of ppl already said their burrito doesn't come with rice, but this is completely fine for me!
We order some chips with salsa sauce for 1.30$ as a side for the two of us and we haven't finished them. After the burrito we were full. It was a good one!
The place was clean and not very crowded when we came here. I would recommend it. However I haven't tried other similar place around (I've heard good review about El Farolito - on 24th and Mission), Probably for next time.
On the price side, it was a little bit overpriced if you compare other taquerias on Mission. But the food was good, fresh and for me it was definitely very affordable compare to the other place I am used to go for diner, (FYI we paid 8$ each).
author: Cedric L.

description:
i love you 
i love you
i love you

ive tried many mexican restaurants, especially in the city mission area...and i have to say to me the carne asada is the best ive tried til date...i usually dont order beef at mexican joints..but i had no other choice...the chicken is boiled...and I DO NOT do boiled chicken especially in my burrito or taco...so hence the grilled steak is my only other choice..since i dont eat swine...

anywho...its muy delicioso its flavored with good spices to take away the bland taste of beef and no fat on the beef..which is a plus and cut into small cubes so its easier to chew......(fyi i hate to eat tasteless beef...actually i hate to eat tasteless ANYTHING...what a disaster that is..ugh)  ...and the salt is perfect...and i love that they dont put rice in the burrito, to me rice tends to make you extra full and have this feeling like youve O.D'd on a burrito...too bad they dont have black beans which i prefer..but thats okay...pinto beans are fine...not the re-fried pinto beans but just the regular...

they are a lil pricier than other taquerias in the area...and they charge you for the "salsa verde" if you take it togo, they only give you one or two of those lil plastic containers...and God forbid if you ask for more...i prefer extra verde on my burrito...is that a crime?...cheap-skates! but if you dine in u could use as much as you like! which is why 4 stars

damn after writing this review..im ready have myself  one of those tmrw!
author: SammyWammy S.

description: Amazing vegetarian tacos!  I think there menu is limited for vegetarians, so at times I find myself heading to Valencia to have Papalote's.
author: Jay S.

description: Best Taco stand ever. No downside aside from the price. But that's what you pay for the best, and you're living in SF anyway, so you're used to getting effed in the rear.  5 stars!
author: Jonny W.

description: Always fresh and tasty, especially the carnitas and salsa. Really love the burritos and tacos, but beware, the add ons can be pricey. Can be packed at certain times but the service is good and they get you your order pretty quickly.
author: S E.

description: I listened to a fellow yelper and added cheese to my carne asada taco and I can't express my gratitude for that. The meat was cooked fresh, the outer layer perfectly grilled to a crisp and the salsa and cheese acted as enhancers without overpowering the meat of the taco. Please open up a location in NY...PLEASE!!!
author: D N.

description:
Growing up in the Mission I can tell you there is no better taqueria.  If your coming here for a burrito you have already messed up.  This is a place is for taco and meat lovers only.  The meat is never dry and always full of flavor. As for those who believe that El Farolito or Tonayense is better, they are but, only when you're drunk or....  True it is a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for. In my lifetime I've probably eaten 100s of tacos from here and never ever been sick from it, something that can't be said about other taquerias .  The only other place that could contend with La Taqueria in the Mission is Pancho Villa Taqueria, but that may be like comparing apples and oranges.
Oh and if you do go to Pancho Villa...it co$ts too.
author: Jorge C.

description: Excellent veggie burrito.  The prices aren't as expensive as a few other well-known taquerias, and they don't seem as arrogant and shoddy in their craftmanship and quality as a few other well-know hyped places (Can-cun, lookin' at you).
author: Cooper S.

description: I don't know why it took me so long to finally try this place... I was totally missing out. This is my new Quesadilla/ Taco spot. No Doubt. I had the Carne Asada Quesadilla, This thing was no joke, there had to be at least 2 lbs of meat. I also tried the Carnitas Taco. Goddamn!
author: Karlee D.

description: After reading all the great reviews for this taqueria on yelp, I decided to take my little sister here while she was visiting. Did NOT expect to get off at the wrong bus stop and have to walk a great many blocks in the heart of the Mission in order to get to our destination. Let me tell ya, It's a heap of fun being a 20 something girl who looks Latina prancin' around in short shorts in the heart of the Mission. Thankfully despite all the cat calls we made it and I was not disappointed. Mmmm the carnitas burrito and fresa agua fresca. I would gladly make that trek again if need be to get me some of that comida.
author: Jen O.

description: Everyone has their own opinion about who makes the best burrito in SF.  For my money, it's La Taqueria, and it's not even close.  The real keys to their outstanding burritos are the quality of the meat, the excellent salsa... oh, and the fact that they have the sense to leave out the rice (which should never, EVER go anywhere near a decent burrito, unless you're a vegetarian).  The carne asada -- marinated to perfection and grilled while you wait -- is absolutely phenomenal.  Don't miss the Aguas Frescas.
author: Andrew E.

description: Ive been eating at this spot since I was wee one. And i still love it. I always get the tacos, so good with the cheese melting on the bottom of the tortilla. Ive occasionally gotten the burritos here, and theyre good too. Cheap, authenic, cool decor, and still delicious over 2 decades later.
author: Mollie M.

description: ALL I CAN SAY IS WOW!! I went here with my sister and we bought a carne asada burrito with everything in it. The steak was so juicy and had so much flavor all together. It has got to be the best burrito that I have ever ate and possible will ever eat. This is no doubt the place I will come to for a burrito.
author: Nelson G.

description: People: Rice is just filler, especially at the vast majority of burrito/taco shacks around the Mission where it's not even seasoned. The food here is tasty and filling, and the frescas are really fresh and delicious. If you want a burrito the size of a log that is packed with an indistinguishable hodgepodge of "meat," but is otherwise mostly rice, go elsewhere. If you want something that actually tastes like the ingredients that go into a burrito, come here.
author: Jess F.

description:
carne asada taco, crispy with the works

strawberry aqua fresca

awesome owner, and you might see mos def here!

20 bucks for 3 tacos?  I DON'T CARE!  JUST HAND THEM OVER!
author: Carol C.

description: So consistent, so delicious. I love watching the countermen chopping up the giant slabs of cow while they hum along to the mexican soap opera theme songs that always seem to blare.  The salsa can sometimes be a little insipid, but the beans, and other fixings never fail. Even the vegetarian options are stars here.
author: Stellah D.

description: This is actually 4 1/2 stars...but only for their crispy chicken tacos as they are to die for. They're messy as hell, but you get over that real quick as your taste buds become alive with the first bite. Make sure to ask to get it the crispy way as it makes the taco much more enjoyable and delectable. Their chicken is seasoned to perfection and their salsa is amazing and goes well with all the other fresh ingredients they pack in there!
author: Kristy M.

description: Taco heaven! They're only $2.75 each here, and I usually get one chicken and one beef, and add a mango agua fresca, and I'm happy. They have a branch in San Jose as well.
author: Hao L.

description: Hands down best tacos/burritos. This is not everyday fare, but rather a special treat. I treat myself, especially when I know they are going to shut down for a month at Xmas. Remember to get a melon or strawberry drink. No rice in this joint, only legit mexican!
author: Phil M.

description: Mmm... how I've missed this place.  I'm sure I'm saying nothing not said by others, but especially after trying to find a decent burrito in NYC and failing, the 5.25 carne asada burrito made my day.  It seems like this sort of food should be easy to make, and easy to replicate, but I must be wrong, because I've never had a successful imitation of the carne asada burrito from La Taq.   It will always be one of my first stops on any trip to SF.
author: Jason C.

description: Disagreed with a boyfriend, no, I knew the best tacqueria in the City.  Turns out La T had a second outlet in those days so we were both right.  I married him; that's over but I still love La Tacqueria.  Reliably fresh clean ingredients may be the reason . . ..
author: Carma K.

description: This is my favorite taco place in the city, but this is important .... make sure to order "EXTRA CRISPY WITH EVERYTHING" tacos. All the meats are great. This place is my taco fix. It's messy but worth it. They make good burritos too, but I tell you it's  the tacos that are worth dying for.
author: Roland S.

description: I can't give this place any less than 5 stars, I can't. Any place that requires me to drive across town, find parking, and fork out a good $12, as soon as I get the craving, has to be doing something right. No it's not the burritos. I'm perfectly happy going to several other taquerias for the burritos. IT'S THE TACOS!  It's the perfectly seasoned and fried carnitas in the double layered tortilla with cheese melting everywhere piled with whole beans, guacamole, sour cream, and hot sauce. Yes, whole beans in a taco. Weird but delicious.  I don't bat an eye to the fact that my taco's cost about 5 bucks a piece ( to many people's suprise once you add everything on it that taco jumps from 2.75 to 5 bucks) I just make sure I have money in hand.  It's so worth it.
author: Tim S.

description: I love me some La Taqueria.  I haven't found a better burrito, taco, or quesadilla in town.  And the green sauce is to die for.  I just wish it stayed open later.
author: Jason D.

description: No rice in the restaurant, as it's just filler. Best burrito in San Francisco, possible best I've ever had and I'm from Texas.  The carnitas and the carne asada are the only things to get.  The tacos are awesome too, but for some reason I just think the flour tortilla sets off the flavors better.
author: matthew w.

description:
Okay, I was skeptical when I came in to order my usual veggie burrito, only to discover theirs only consists of beans and cheese.  So I asked for salsa and sour cream to be added and got myself a side of chips.

But when I got my food and I took one bite of my burrito, I was surprised that this simple burrito was one of the best I'd ever tasted in my life!  Delicious!  Not to mention their chips and salsa is more like salsa with some chips underneath...just the way I like it : )

Also, the people who run the place have a great sense of humor and they come to your table and talk to you.  It's fun.
author: Cat J.

description: You know you've got it bad when you have cravings for food from thousands of miles away. La Taqueria is one of our first stops any time we're in San Francisco. Life is just about as good as it gets when you're in the Mission enjoying burritos and tacos and freshly squeezed juices.
author: Jessica R.

description: I've been going to this little place for years... and I mean years!  I love their burritos and tacos.  I think it's their salsa that makes them and the gracamole is mucho avacado instead of that green runny stuff you get in other places.  One of my favorite things to order is a quesadilla with salsa (using a corn tortilla).  Simple, refreshing, and fabulously delicious!
author: Theresa J.

description:
Skip the burritos, that's not what you're here for.  Go for the tacos, which are some of the best in town, and priced accordingly.

Taco: $3.50
Avocado: $1.00
Without Beans: $1.00 (what!?)
Cheese: $.50

Congrats, you just bought a $6.00 taco.

Pretty damned good, though.
author: Matt F.

description: Tacos from La Taqueria are my absolute favorite!!! ... I mean, the best i've ever tasted!!! I've been coming here since I was a little girl... LOL. For real!!! My dad used to bring me here and I never stopped loving their tacos. I always get super excited when I come here because I'm NEVER disappointed. I've also gotten quite a few people hooked on this place. I always order 2 beef tacos, with avocado, cheese and hot sauce. Oh, and if you ask them to make them "crispy"  they are even better!!! The prices are a little much but worth it!!! I think I will grow very old and still come back to this place. Oh, and how can i forget... The staff is GREAT!!! Some of them have been there for as long as I remember and they are absolutely the sweetest!!! Thank you guys!!!
author: Aurita U.

description: I used to live a few doors away from there. Always crowded. Especially during the lunch hour and rush hour. Fast ordering and my fave mexican restaurant of all time.
author: C G.

description: Their tacos are great but if you are looking for a burrito this is not the place to go. I do not recommend the burrito and it seems that the majority of patrons were savvy to just having the tacos.The burrito is tiny partly due to them not using rice as a filler. Price to quality was good but when it came to quantity the burrito was lacking size (quite a disappointment to my appetite.) The Carne Asada is fantastic, grilled fresh and chopped in front. The chicken taco was great and reasonably priced considering it was loaded with all the goods. I like the fact that they start off with corn tortillas add cheese, beans, meat and will top it with a heaping portion of avocado sour cream and salsa. Tacos definitely hit the spot when custom tailored to your preference with a ton of options. Their strawberry natural juice was great as well with chunks of strawberries and crushed ice being quite refreshing. The place is generally packed but the help certainly know how to pump out the tacos.
author: Trev D.

description:
BEST BURRITO IN THE ENTIRE WORLD. I have been going here since the early 90s and no other taqueria in the city compares. The prices have gone up significantly but still worth every penny. Every bite is so fresh, the meat is so juicy, and everyone is so friendly. It really deserves 10 stars.

Why do you need rice? Rice is a filler. 

Must we be so gluttonous people?
author: carmela g.

description: Really delicious, though a tad pricey for tacos and the like.  The carne asada tacos are delicious!
author: Tim A.

description:
this place rivals el farolito for sure. i ate here for the first time a few days ago at the recommendation of my always overly enthusiastic friend who, a lot of times, tends to exaggerate the awesomeness of things. 

man, he was not lying when he said the carnitas tacos were bomb. seriously. he was also not lying when he said that just one would be enough. so effing good i almost peed my pants.
author: Al I.

description: This are the things I like when I eat Mexican food; simple but tasty menu, strong pure flavors. No need for non fat, slightly fusion, fancy glass served margarita, crazy decor... And that is what yoou get at La Taqueria, fast, good service at a good price. This is one of the few places where I can eat a veggie food and do not consider it decoration or snack and get hungry after 20 minutes. The Veggie burrito is tasty and fills you up, and usually get it with agua fresca (strawberry and watermelon are good). Just remember this place is cash only
author: Candido B.

description: Hands down, best burritos EVER! My step mom is Mexican, so I've been to Mexico more times than I can count and eaten at Mexican restaurants even more than that. I've tried most of their items on the menu and they were all amazing, but my favorite is the carne asada burrito. I haven't found anything to rival it. Just perfect!
author: Silvia B.

description: Made my way to the mission to see what all the hype was about.. after looking for parking and waiting in line to try thier tacos... gotta say it was well wortht he trouble..  I have tried a lot of mexican joints and I was wondering how his place differentiate from the rest.. The carne asada and carnitas was good but the cabeza.. ooh!.. thats another story.. if you are open and adventurous when it comes to food the beef head  (cabeza)is where its at!..  too bad this place doesnt open late enough for after hours. 4.5 Stars!
author: DON G.

description: This place is always a little crowded but has pretty tasty tacos. Their service is relatively fast, and the amount of food is good for the price. In addition, the serve tacos sans rice, something not always common at taquerias, so for those looking for a little less carb this isn't a bad option.
author: Heleena H.

description: What can I say about this place that hasn't been said before?  It's absolutely amazing.  The food -- in large part due to their extremely high turnover -- is always fresh and piping hot, the atmosphere is friendly, and the owner is hilarious.  There are a couple of issues -- the space is a little too small for the turnover and prices may be a little higher than some of the other tacquerias in the area -- but overall this place is fantastic.
author: Nils J.

description: I was told upon moving into the Mission a couple years ago that this was the best Mexican in the city and I ABSOLUTELY had to try it. I went once and never bothered to go back, it didn't impress me, I happen to like rice in my buritto. It's weird, the 'best buritto' discussion in this city seems to be more of a heated topic than religion or abortion. I've just learned to keep quiet and like what I like and not be too vocal about it. Except on Yelp, that is. Not my favorite. There. I said it. Please don't hate me.
author: Michael E.

description:
HEAVEN! My fiance took me to this little sanctuary on Saturday and I am in love. I am probably one of the pickiest eaters ever. Whether the meat is not tender enough, fat on my meat, or the seasoning is not done well. I didn't have any room to complain. This is by far the BEST Mexican food I have ever had. 

I had two tacos-steak and chicken and my bf enjoyed a steak burrito. We were both in awe since it had been a while that a meal "hit the spot". 

Its not cheapest alternative but not super expensive either...totally worth it and I can hardly wait to go back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: muneet g.

description: I love this place because they give me all the meat I want without trying to bulk up their burritos with fillers like beans and rices.
author: Amber L.

description: I've never seen so much people standing/waiting at a taqueria like that before.. The food was pretty good. I had a quesadilla and it was packed with beef.. Lots of sour cream.. the way I like it.. Next time I'll probably try the tacos..
author: Juliane N.

description: Arguably the best tacos in the city!  My aunt brought me here as a kid and I am still a satisfied patron.  The lines are always long, but for a reason.  It is a bit pricey for tacos, but well worth it!  Get the super carne asada taco "dorado" and you won't be disappointed!!!!
author: anne m.

description: My favorite of the Mission taquerias.  It's really the simplicity that makes this place so great.  Small menu and they don't add unnecessary items to your burrito like rice (hello filler).  Plus, the salsa is fantastic.
author: Paul W.

description: Wow. No burrito quite like this in SF. No rice in these, but man is the meat good, and there's a lot of it. Get the carnitas. Agua frescas are all pretty bad, though.
author: Don H.

description: As totally _interesting_ as the rice-vs.-no-rice debate is, I'll skip it to say that La Tacq has a wonderful chicken burrito and good tacos (w/ cheese), but their prices have far outpaced inflation, and I always leave feeling like my nose itches from too much grease.  I go here only  because I can't find a better SF-Mex joint.  Any suggestions for a better taco?  I'm dying to cheat on this place.
author: Nom D.

description: Yumm yummy yummy - no rice.  Yay!  The sans meat  burritos really are the best EVER!  Try the tacos al dorado - it's a secret prearation method.
author: Reggie G.

description: First off, full disclosure.  I am vegan so I know that this place isn't made for people who choose my diet.  It is many of my meat eating friends favorite place.  For vegetarians and vegans you should note.  They don't have rice or lettuce.  My meat eating friends love this, because they think that rice and lettuce is just filler.  Me however, this leads to a taco with pinto beans, salsa and guacamole.  Not very exciting.  Even though it does have some of the best guacamole in the city!  Also, the last time I went there I got a burrito and it was filled with so much water, my plate looked like soup and the tortilla tasted like bleach/cleaner.  This only  happened once, but that should never happen!
author: Charlie S.

description: I dig it!  Their burritos are huge, and they don't compensate by filling it with rice.  In fact, there's no rice at all...just beans, meat, and tortilla.  They have some handmade fruit juices.  I had the mango, but the other ones that I sampled from my friends were just a great.  That's a way to win my heart...mangos and carne asada!  The guy at the counter was extremely personable!
author: Mark D.

description: There are a lot of great  burrito places in the city... After you've been here for a while (I've been here 8 years), you tend to settle around your favorites.  This one is overall one of the best.  I come for the carne asada.  Def. sample all of the agua frescas (pineapple and cantaloupe are not always available at other places)
author: Chris M.

description: Esta es uno de mi favorite burrito places in SF! i LOVE the burritos and salsa, i love how they shout out your number in english followed by in spanish (think, "fifty one!.... cinquenta y uno!", and I even love that they charge more for "no beans" than they do for beans. I even love that I walk outa here smelling like a burrito joint (and for me to say that, you KNOW i love this place). This place has been around for ages, and is a keeper!!! :-)
author: beth l.

description: If I could give la taqueria 6 stars, I would.  Favorite, favorite, favorite taqueria of all time.  I grew up in San Jose and there's one down there too... and the first time my mom took me, I fell in love--and the love is still strong after all these years!  Pretty much any opportunity I have to drop in, I take it... I even go sometimes at lunch (i work in the financial district) which makes me crazy to some people at work--that I would travel all that way for a burrito or taco.  But I think it makes complete and total sense!  It's so damn good!!  If you like tons of junk in your burrito (lettuce, rice, who knows what else)... and you like your burrito to be super super gigantic, this is not your place.  They stick to the basics--beans, salsa, and meat.  My faves are the regular chicken burrito and the veggie tacos.... oh boy, i wish i had some of those tacos right now!!
author: Yvette H.

description: I was a little shocked when the bill came to over 29 bucks for just two hungry bellies present at La Taqueria. They really know how to reel in extra cash in on the "extras". Tried the soft tacos in chicken, carne asada and chorizo. Get the chicken, forget the rest. Add the "extras" and get a pineapple juice. Leave happy and full.
author: Judy L.

description: If you go for food, go for the tacos, they are what all the hype is about because you only really need one with everything, or if you are a hefty eater two.  They have year round fresh juices of all sorts, they are quick, and most of all, they are fresh!  Small batches of guacamole, salsa, etc are constantly being made.  So basically, THAT is what all the hype is about.  As far as the neighborhood, never has been a problem for me, a 26 year old white chick walking alone usually at night so...yeah.
author: Melissa W.

description:
why would you ever chose to go to la taqueria if you're in the mission?  the mission is taqueria heaven!...
just because this place is named 'the taqueria' doesn't mean that it's 'the best'...
first of all, their prices are considerably higher than the other ones... they charge for every added ingredient you want on your burrito when other places you can just get the 'super' option...
they don't put rice in your burrito! wtf!?!
i'd rather go to el farolito or la corneta any day... even though this place used to be closer to where i used to live, i'd walk the extra block or two for some better eats...
their agua frescas aren't even tasty... nor are their tacos...
author: charlotte s.

description: I'm not a taqueria expert but the tacos here are pretty damn tasty.  I can't believe it's taken me so long to get there. The tortillas are the winner for me. mmmm....No free chips and salsa, though.
author: Thanya S.

description:
Today's dilemma was what to have for lunch.  I had been craving for a lengua (beef tongue) taco, specifically from La Taqueria, for the past week or so.  I compromised on that choice for dinner earlier in the week, instead willingly tagging along for rotisserie chicken.  So, the decision today was easy for me.  I didn't think I could wait another week to satisfy my cravings.  

Fortunately, it took us less than 5 minutes to find parking, which is close to a miracle around this neighborhood.   It was packed inside with hungry diners, but the line to order wasn't bad at all.  After about a 5 minute wait for the preparation, our food was ready.  I had a carnitas taco, lengua taco, and a cantaloupe aqua fresca.  For the 2 of us, it was close to $18.  Not a complete bargain, but you won't be disappointed with the tacos.  The lenqua taco is two tortillas, filled with lengua, and dressed simply with chopped onions and fresh cilantro.  Add some of their hot sauce, and you're set.  The carnitas is mixed just with pinto beans, chopped onions, and diced tomatoes.  The avocado, sour cream, and cheese are extra.  No need to add them though, since that would mask the flavors of the meat.  The carnitas isn't dry or overly salty.  The lengua is meltingly soft.  It is so tender and not at all chewy, as some other preparation of it would cause it to be.  

I've had the burritos before,  but they weren't that memorable.  I go here for the tacos.  And the agua fresca, of which they have a nice selection.
author: CE Y.

description: It's become really hard to eat burrito's elsewhere, since they have acheived the perfect burrito. Finally someone realizes that the arroz is totally unnecessary and the focus is on the (slightly oversalted) meats, artisan hotsauce and 99% avocado guac. People who bitch about the price can walk down the street and get a rice bomb at Cancun and keep the lines shorter.....don't forget to order a fresca (half pina and half mango), and get your burrito or taco with avocado and hot sauce. Bueno!!!!!!!!
author: Matt H.

description: the carne asada melts in your mouth.  right before the salsa blows you away.
author: Ash T.

description:
The best. Yes, it's expensive, yes it's crowded, but the people are friendly (especially considering the crowds they have) well organized about getting your order, and patiently amused with my attemps at ordering in Spanish.
The food is plain, simple, and fantastic. No fancy beans, foody-veggie specials or crap like that, and no free chips with your order. Only the most perfectly seasoned, melt-in-your mouth carnitas, delicious carne asada excellent well-cooked chicken and fantastic green hot salsa. Also it's one of the only places that will melt the cheese on your taco (in a delicious fried way) if you get the extra cheese. Although some may not, I actually like the riceless manageable-sized burritos, and also that they use fresh avocados instead of the sometimes questionable (and weirdly spiced) guac found in some other taco places.
Absolutely fabulous.
author: l x.

description: My sister turned me onto this place when I was growing up and lived in the noe valley area in sf. I now live in pacifica and will take a drive down for these tacos. Best tacos I ever had.  Pricey but worth it! The carnitas tacos are my favorite. Tacos are HUGE!  They wrap a soft and crispy corn tortila on there tacos. Shredded carnitas, tamato and cilantro salsa, sour creme and avacado with green hot sauce.
author: Freddy B.

description: The best tacos. Now I'm gonna get a lot of shit from Nick's crispy taco lovers but I think good ol' Nick was an avid La Taqueria customer before opening his restaurant. I like la's better though.
author: Dave R.

description: Gotta give it 5 stars for being my very first burrito in the Mission. Coming from the Midwest with your Qdoba's and Chipotle's, you can't even imagine my amazement in how much better this burrito tasted! It's also close to the 24th & Mission BART and the guys always smile at you. :)
author: Susan L.

description: I'm Switzerland neutral on the whole rice issue.  As long as you have a little green sauce to hit each bite of the burrito with, it's pretty solid.  The aguas frescas are absolutely unreal.
author: Ficus K.

description: These tacos are so good that when I brought my friend here for his first taste of his native Californian food after being in Boston for three years, the first bite of the juicy delicious carnitas tacos brought a tear to his eye. Hell, they even bring a tear to my eye just thinking about them.
author: Cathy T.

description: This and La Corneta are my favorite taquerias ever, ever, ever ever.  Seriously, I can't even explain it to you until you try it.  Delicious.
author: Catherine K.

description: La Taqueria's crispy tacos and green sauce are the ultimate taste sensation.
author: Alison B.

description: Reliable and close to home! I really enjoy their vegetarian tacos, which consist of pinto beans, cheese, and pico de gallo (avacado and sour cream are extra $). On a hungry day I can put away two of 'em! The strawberry agua fresca is also money! Fresh, good stuff!
author: Shannon R.

description: I've been here 3 times, and the burritos are just amazing. La Taqueria is officially my favorite burrito spot in SF. The place is always crowded, and I've heard that the reason they close so early is because they end up running out of food to serve--not sure if this is true, but I wouldn't be surprised. The food is moderately priced, especially considering the portions, and the juices they serve are quite refreshing.
author: Edmund C.

description: Los Tacos Dorados! This is the only thing I order when I come here.  They are seriously the best tacos I've ever had.  It's definitely a little bit of a drive for me to get here - but I don't mind it at all.
author: Cherlyn M.

description: The sign on the wall boasts the world's best tacos and burritos, and I have to agree they are a little bit of fantastic. Order two tacos and try 'em with cheese and everything else they put on them. Beware of sticker shock, but trust me it's worth it!
author: Angela G.

description: amazing carne asade burrito. The orchata was a bit light but pretty good too. I would add extre carne and I ordered mine w cheese guac..
author: Manorah R.

description: this is just the bomb.. kinda pricey but who cares its worth it
author: Meezie B.

description: Best Mexican, period, that i have had, so far in life, without going to Mexico.  My wife and I went here after a random visit with a massage therapist, who lived an hour away, recommended it.  We were visiting from Pittsburgh for 10 days and wanted to dive into the food culture.  We tried everything we could around Sonoma, Drakes Bay, San Francisco, Novato, Muir Beach, and a few others.  This establishment, by far, had the best tacos ever and it really comes down to their freshness and flavor.  They use real steak with great seasoning, fresh guacamole, fresh salsa, and people who know how to prepare food well.  The menu picture here on yelp is all there is for a menu and, really, thats all they need.  No rice to weigh it down and distort the flavors.  I had three and went back for more because i couldnt resist, even though i was stuffed. GO HERE!!  I also love the seats because they are all made with leather strappings that are interwoven.
author: Ryan H.

description: The most expensive taqueria in the Mission but DAMN the meats are absolutely delicious and fresh. Everything is good here, I really like their tacos though. I used to work right by there and I sometimes miss it but I'm actually glad I don't because it made me gain a whole mess of weight. Plus...REALLY expensive to the point of almost being a rip-off. But it is really good...I don't knock it out completely from my love of tacos.
author: Gina R.

description: Best taqueria in the city period! & Everything has always been good! From lengua, asada to alpastor.
author: Brenda A.

description: best taco's in sf bat area, order the carne asada taco but order them dorados, one tortilla is fried crunchy and the out side one is soft, gives it a better flavor and their green salsa is the best, great flavor with just the right amount of spicyness
author: Mario C.
