description: Their neon sign in the back doesn't lie, "The best tacos and burritos in the world."  Like others have said, get carne asada, chips and salsa (and add beans and guac on top if you want to look like an insider), and melon or strawberry.  Other secrets:  ask for your taco 'crunchy'.  Don't forget to consume at least a 1/4 bottle of the green chili sauce.  If you have never been here, beware, you may become addicted.
author: John W.

description: I love fresh, melt in your mouth roasted chicken off the bone instead of that dried-out minced variety disguised with sauce that you find at so many Mexican joints.  The service is quick, the food is cheap and the burritos are fresh!
author: Max C.

description: Sure, it's pretty good in that it is consistent, but it is a bit spendy for a taqueria. Walk yourself down Mission to El Farolito, rock steady food that comes cheap.
author: Travis W.

description: I heard it was the best burrito in town and I wasn't disappointed.
author: Lindsey W.

description: alright I want to preface this that I'm also and primarily an El Farolito fan, but when I am by myself and I don't take it to go, this is the place I will eat at. The crowd is of the less dodgy kind and the tables and seats don't look like McDonald's hand me downs. BUT, in the take away case, or if its past 8pm & I'm with a group, its EF all the way.
author: Helen J.

description: Awesome quesadillas, I love them, non greasy, crispy and the meat is simply delicious. I never have burritos but I know that they do them the Mexican way, without rice (check it out and let me know). Carne asada is amazingly good also and really has a barbeque taste, smoked at the right point. They also have a small counter and two little tables out of the door (you know, just to preserve your clothes from smelling for days of fried food....).
author: Dario B.

description: I grew up eating burritos in this city. Take it from a true SF native --- Mission burritos are the best and La Taqueria's burritos are the best of the best!
author: Kimberly C.

description: The best tacos I've ever had come from here.  My favorites are the carne asada and chorizo crsipy tacos.  Get the tacos will all the fixings, and prepare to have a party in your mouth.  After devouring one too many tacos, their watermelon agua fresca hits the spot.  There's another location in downtown San Jose, which is just as good.
author: Peter C.

description: I was brought here with a friend and was completely surprised how big soft taco's were.  I ordered three thinking they were the typical small size soft taco's one would normally get at a taqueria, but was I amazed by the size.  I ordered the carne asada and was I happy to see how tender and flavorful the meat was.  Great place, excellent value and don't forget to grab a bottle of cerveza to complete your meal!
author: Jenn C.

description: La Taqueria is the best burrito or taco in San Francisco.  I don't order many quesadilla's, but they're amazing there also.  They use super fresh high quality steak and chicken (you can watch them grill it).  There's zero sketchy factor (unlike El Farolita).  And they've been reviewed by Zaggat's (yes, true Zaggat's is not known to have a penchant for cheap Mexican burritos).  There burrito comes without rice, which may seem strange at first, but you'll be wishing others were the same after having one.
author: Evan A.

description: If you love all meat burritos and no rice then this is the place for you! and the best part of it is that Dianda's is right next door. Great carne asada burrito!!!
author: Christina and Jaime F.

description:
best burritos - get all the stuff on them.

but if you like rice in your burr, not for you
author: Erika Y.

description:
I have to say, I have lived in or near the Mission for 21 years now, and I just don't think this place is all that...I've had better carne asada at San Jose, better Pastor at the Cancun on Mission near Fair, and generally more flavorful tacos most other places..including the fabulous taco trucks that hang near 19th and Harrison.

If you feel the need to separate yourself from a lot of cash, then come here, but otherwise, I'd say go with the above, or El Metate, or any number of other places.
author: Darien W.

description: Busy neighborhood and hard to find parking, but worth the trouble. If you're on this side of the city come here. If you're closer to downtown, go to Nick's.
author: Charles C.

description: YUM...the perfect lightly grilled corn tortillas wrapped arround the hot freshly sliced carne asada with melting jack cheese and topped by perfect blend of tomatoes, onion and fresh cilantro.  Pure mexican heaven and the people watching....mucho gusto!!
author: Barry K.

description: I go once a week.  No it's not for the tacos.  Why would you get tacos at a place called La Taqueria? :)  No, I go for a gut busting burrito.  Chorizo, no cheese, no sour cream, no guac. Just me, my meat and my beans.  While I wait, frothing at the mouth, I chill with some chips and salsa and zone out thinking about the tasty food log the good folks are about to bestow upon me.
author: Jeff R.

description: I would drive to get some tacos from this great tasting, delicious place. Carnitas is flavorful and service is quick. If you are in a rush it is better to order and pick up as parking and the line inside might be very long (good sign)!
author: Christina B.

description:
say what you will about the prices:  yadda yadda yadda.  just order a carnitas crispy taco, sit back and enjoy the magic.  hulaboy is also a fan of the chorizo burrito but i can never say no to the carnitas...
plus, who doesn't love somewhere that charges for no beans?  love that.
author: nic f.

description:
the most expensive and best tasting tacos you'll ever have.  during my stint in the east bay i would cross the bridge for these things.  huge and tastey, i'm starting to salivate!

p.s. order them crispy with the cheese melted between the two tortillas.  yum!
author: jen b.

description: What can I say about this place that doesn't sound like I'm kissing it's ass. I can't help it. No I can't. This place has the most amazing tacos I've ever eaten... Super taco was about $3.00... I wasn't very happy about that, seemed kinda hole in the wallish, so I thought it was overpriced initially. So I got 2, since I'm a greedy shit. I almost burst towards the end. Would have been happy with just one. Brought 4-5 friends... despite my repeated warnings, they all got 2 tacos. I actually got 2 again too :) We all almost burst and I got a lot of points for recommending this place. It is fantastic. Go there. Now.
author: Anish B.

description: Where is the best burrito in San Francisco? Its here at La Taqueria in the Mission! What do I order? A carne asada burrito please. The burrito comes the way an authentic burrito should come, with no rice, plenty of meat, guacomole, beans, and salsa. The tacos here are very good as well, but I love burritos more. I have flown my stunt plane through every burrito shop worth mentioning in SF, from the Mission to the Sunset, from the Financial district to the Marina and I keep coming back to La Taqueria for the food. The price is more than other burrito shops and taquerias, but your paying for quality. Enjoy!
author: Michael G.

description: The food is alright but not as good as El Farolito. $6 for a burrito and you don't even get cheese, sour cream, or guac. It's an extra $2 to add them on. My recommendation is to walk the extra 50 yrds or so to El Farolito.
author: Cristofer P.

description:
for my money, this is probably the best burrito in the city.  i hear all these people talking about the prices, and the fact that they have no rice cooker, and i'm like, have they tasted the thing?  who needs the rice to gum up the works?  the carne asada burrito with everything and hot sauce is really one of earth's perfect meals, in my humble opinion, with the carnitas as a razor close second.  and the strawberry agua fresca is out of this world.

and, bonus, the bathroom is clean.  i mean, we are reviewing a taqueria here.
author: brian g.

description: Absolutely the best steak burrito I've had ever. With the strawberry shake and fresh guac, I'm in a guaranteed food coma.
author: Faith C.

description:
dude, this is THE original taqueria. opened in 1973, fer chrissakes, when i was but a gleam in my mother's... ok, i was 4.  

they close at 9pm (why?) but even after they had put most of the food away, they still made me another veggie taco sans attitude, and didn't even want to charge me! 

the owner came and sat at our table, ingratiating us with tales of the early days, how he was an auto mechanic and didn't know how to cook, how he crafted the wooden tables and chairs himself 35 years ago. he told us that even though they were closing, we were welcome to stay for as long as we wanted. sweet!

the tacos are great because they're served slightly crispy and rolled up in wax paper, very easy to eat. 

note: they don't give you free chips and salsa, but i don't mind because i usually pork out and regret it later. 

yes, prices are a bit high compared to other taquerias, but take a step back and consider: a fresh, delicious meal at a locally-owned, historic establishment for under 10 bucks? 

exactly.
author: jean w.

description: Don't get excited for this place if you're a vegetarian... form what i understand their slow cooked pork is the best thing to get in your burrito.  My boyfriend was disappointed with their beef.  It's also kind of expensive, but their food is always really fresh, and nobody beats their delicious green sauce.
author: Jeannie P.

description: Damn good food for cheap.  Large clean eating area.  Sky lights so warm sunlight seeps through on a nice day.  Not much more I can ask for.  I'll be back.
author: Angela S.

description: Carne Asada Burrito and Negro Modelo: Pick up, eat,and go.  The best burritos and tacos around and the closest thing to Alberto's in SoCal.  Actually better in some respects.  The hot sauce really brings it all together.  Simple and to the point.  The atmosphere is "hole in the wall" casual, and there is no unnecessary friendliness, glamour or flare.  It is just obscenely good food that I have driven an hour and a half out of my way for.
author: Diana L.

description: This used to be my favorite Taqueria when they were on Valencia.  Consistently good food - yes, every.single.time.  Since they have moved to Mission I don't know if they have retained their status but I do know that I have a new favorite that I just happened to stumble upon that is giving them a run for their money.
author: Dee B.

description: I've been coming here since I was a little kid and their vegetarian burrito + avocado covered with their delicious green salsa is a work of art.  The abscence of rice just brings out all the wonderful balance of flavors.  They do not skimp on the avocado!  Also, the strawberry fresca is among the best I've had anywhere.
author: Ben G.

description:
This is the best carnitas taco around here. The carne asada is very tasty as well but I prefer the roasted pork--mainly because most Mexican spots use the skirt steak, which is cow's diaphragm and that grosses me out. You won't remember the chicken, and they have tongue which may be tasty but you won't catch me trying it (hey, I'm a bona fide WASP, alright?). As for the hotly disputed extras: I order it with just sour cream and add hot sauce at the table (or order it as a topping for to go orders, and yes the hot sauce is free of charge). The tacos come with meat, a not-spicy tomato salsa, and beans, which to me is just perfect.

The beans are a nice touch because they are wet, so they add a gravy-likeness to the meat between the two grilled, corn tortillas that all comes wrapped in a wax paper sheath. Another note on the beans, they taste as though from a can, so on a burrito with no rice I just don't get it. There is nothing better than homemade, properly seasoned pinto beans coupled with smoky, buttery, tomato-based Spanish rice. I am so accustomed to the "Mission-style" burrito, that this lack of a carb filling, coupled with canned pinto beans on a burrito is simply unacceptable. As is true with most restaurants, I believe you must order certain items and only those items from a given menu, but this is more extreme (okay, to the tenth power) at taco bars. So, IXNEY on the burritos here--they are just plain weird.  

A little word on the chips: while they are not free, they are much better quality than Faralito's one block away. You can tell that they are sliced corn tortillas that have been deep fried and lightly salted, probably on site, whereas Faralito's chips are from the factory (often stale) corn maize mush that has been prepared in a similar manner to Pringles. And the salsa is always fresh, although they are heavy on the cilantro (yuck...tastes like Dawn soap), while light on the salt. Some would appreciate this, although I usually add salt to the salsa and work around the stems and larger pieces of cilantro. And the guacamole is very thick and simple, not the seasoned tomatillo-blended style.

Bring cash and go for a carnitas taco, without tons of extras (i.e., pick one), the chips, salsa, and guacamole, and a Modelo or a cantelope drink. I've been doing this once a week or so and am addicted.
author: e f.

description: Best place ever! The hot sauces are perfect! You know it's gotta be great if you get all the vegetarian ingredient right.
author: Yessica M.

description: Best place for Burritos and Tacos in the city. The only thing I don't see here is the shrimp burrito but either ways; I love the food here. Very scrumptious and beyond doubt delicious!
author: Lloyd F.

description:
Food: 2.5 Stars
Decor: 2.5 Stars
Service: 2 stars
*Ratings adjusted according to price

Located conveniently near the mission and 24th BART station at the edge of San Francisco's Latino neighborhood is one of the highest rated Mexican Restaurants in the city. But for those of you who go looking for real Mexican food will be sorely disappointed as La Taqueria seems to do anything it can to present itself as a true Mexican restaurant when it is simply an Americanized watered down version of the real thing that could only get high honors in a major city over 300 miles from the boarder.  I think if they would just rename the place, "The Taco Shop" people like myself looking for a real Mexican Taqueria will be less disappointed.

If you are looking for a more authentic Mexican experiance but aren't quite ready for the taco truck, there is a spot not too far from here with quality ingredients and much nicer decor and service at about the same price (yes they have rice and beans too), try El Metate.
author: Michael G.

description: I had hoped for more. Maybe I went at the wrong time...? More likely, my tacos were LAME because I got them to go.
author: Carrot C.

description: definitely decent, I went with a friend who knew the place well, her order sounded good, grilling it made the difference, we lucked out with seating, I finished it in one sitting, first time a burrito left me wanting more
author: Neil A.

description: Swell place, with this caveat: Whenever El Senor Amable is working the register, count your change.
author: Anton W.

description:
An exceptional taqueria.  Sure its more expensive than some of its Mission brethren- it's worth it.  The quality of the food and consistency is higher than any of the other contenders for best taqueria in SF.  A few things worth noting: 
1) no rice.  burritos not as belly-busting as, say, Castillito but still plenty big with more of the good stuff and no filler.
2) quac is simply mashed avocados, nothing else.  amazing how many otherwise decent places get away with fake, just-add-water quacamole.
3) no refried.
4) they do a lot of business so the food is always very fresh.  You're not going to get meats that have been sitting in a bin all day. 
Hey Farolito and Cancun are exceptional.  This place does things a little differently but is still 100% genuine Mission taqueria through and through (sorry Papalote).  If I was taking an out of towner to one place this would be it.  Actually, now that I am an out of towner myself this is the one place I go when I come back.  Or maybe Tonayense... or possibly San Jose...
author: William M.

description: OK guys I have been going here since was in high school which as you can see was a long time ago...yes the prices have gone up but I don't care. THE BEST CHORIZO with beans,cheese,and guacamole taco ever...I don't care how greasy it gets...there is nothing better. Oh yea, and the agua fresca is the best too.
author: Dee D.

description: If I'm looking for an AUTHENTIC, "gringo burrito" de asada, I head over to La Taqueria. Honestly, I can't find a burrito like this. Maybe people like sour cream, beans, and cheese loaded on a burrito... but little do SanFrancisians know that a real gringo burrito comes with pico de gallo and pure asada with a dash of lime. That's only the burritos... you can only imagine what the rest of the menu is like... DELICIOUS!
author: F B.

description: I like the Agua Frescas here.  Since location does help, I guess I never really noticed if the food is tasty or not.  But since I don't remember ever puking from their food, it's safe for me to say that the food is not bad.  My taste buds don't have the power to distinguish between bad and good burritos, so as far as I'm concerned, they're good.  Don't forget to walk a few steps to Dianda's while you're there.
author: brenda b.

description: TACOS TACOS TACOS...I usually get the carne asada with all the fixings....Try the crispy carne asada and it will FAIL to disappoint you. Crispy chorizo is my 2nd fav...
author: Michael C.

description: MMMmMmmmMm... Best soft tacos, burritos, quesadillas... yummier if you eat them right there... I find them better and tastier when I pay extra and add the cheese and avocados... The problem is you can't just have one taco... So with the extras and drinks, it does get up there in price especially because when I go there... I usually buy enough for the family or friends. They all want some....The drinks are also worth a try.
author: jane f.

description: So fucking good. I love this place. I used to go to the one in san jose (when I lived there) multiple times a week. Now I go to the one in the mission buy 4 burritos, eat one and stick the other three in my fridge. There frijoles are like no other and the aguafrescas are delicious.
author: Ruth R.

description:
may be a strange first visit, but once you understand how to order, there is no turning back. i don't just crave burritos now - i crave la taqueria, and drive all the way across the city. my order is the vegetarian burrito con sour cream and guac - which is a pile of fresh avocado. they melt this addictive cheese on the tortilla, and use no rice, nor fry any dish. its simply divine.

first heard about the place in San Francisco magazine, where the writer said she had no burrito preference in the city before happing upon la taqueria. and i completely agree.

its a one-stop snackery; not dinner or for celebration, or many choices for that matter. but it don't matter, 'cause nothing beats it. period.
author: Alexia P.

description:
seriously the best veggie tacos in town, hands down! now even though i fell off the wagon about two years ago and started eating chicken, the veggies are the only thing i would even consider ordering at 'la taq.' i once strayed from my beloved veggie taco with guac order and found myself going mad dreaming of the greasy bean-cheese- corn tortilla-guac concoction that is a veggie taco for weeks after. their salsa is pretty tantalizing to the taste buds as well. 

and who doesn't love standing in a line that reaches all the way back to the bathroom and fighting for a seat. stuff like that just lends a hand to the experience that la taq is.  

in the words of the great KISS...you'll want to lick it up (the taco bits that fell into your basket as you devoured this little bit of heaven)! trust me you will be happy.
author: Zoe s.

description:
quite possibly the best burritos, tacos, and quesadillas in an area full to the brim with choices.

for those of you wanting a little adventure in your life, they have tongue on the menu and it's delicious.  for something a bit more mild, you can't go wrong with a chicken or veggie taco or quesadilla.  very yum, baby.  very yum.
author: hillary h.

description: Just ate a chicken burrito and it had alot of meat and was HUGE i though for sure that El Farrilitos was the best but the NEW SPOT has a huge good burrito too but this place is now on the top of the list!!!
author: Travis G.

description: While I haven't tried the taco's that people seem to rave over, I did try steak burrito, which was pretty good.  I don't think I could ever give 5 stars to burrito place, but I was satisfied with the quality and the taste.  No rice makes for a different flavor but they only had pinto beans which i am not the biggest fan of.  They also charged for every addition with a baseline price of $6.00 per burrito.  So realistically you can easily get to $8 after some simple additions, which is a little high considering at 8.95 down the street at La Corneta will get you a super steak AND prawn burrito with all the sides and chips for FREE, not for a $1.30.
author: Eli Z.

description: First let's set the frame. A burrito experience has to be noisy, packed, with  a service that does not understand my English (I have a strong European accent), neither does understand my Spanish (cause I'm from Spain and not from Mexico). And finally a burrito experience is about aluminum paper full of colored stuff with an overall unidentifiable taste (every time I eat a burrito I feel like holding a recent born baby). SO La Taqueria fits perfectly the frame AND has one interesting thing, their burritos are huge but they are not filled with tones of beans (some ok, but tones no thanks). Actually there's even an option of no beans at all  (you pay an extra). Burrito experience=la Taqueria.
author: Alex A.

description: I'm just not feeling this place. On the plus side, the carnitas are amazing. On the minus side, i actually LIKE rice, and it bugs me that they don't have it. and it is wicked-expensive, as many other people have said. i'm a la corneta girl, myself - just a block or so down.
author: Erica W.

description: This is not the cheapest taqueria in the city, but it is unquestionably the best.  Order a super taco, and make it crispy, pick your meat, add a little green sauce and enjoy the flavor explosion in your mouth.  There is always a line but it moves quickly, and as you stand next to the kitchen, you witness the freshness of everything that is served. Quesadillas, burritos, everything is delicious, and the staff just gives off the vibe that they enjoy serving the best tacos in the city.
author: Scott R.

description: I've been going here since I can't remember when.  Best damn taco I ever had.  Their tacos are *unique* and the best in SF ... and I'm a native.  I didn't care for their burritos because I order my burritos without beans (I'm the only person in the world that hates beans).  But that's just me, and you shouldn't let that stop you from trying one of their burritos.  Oh and all you need is one taco and you're stuffed...unless you're my husband.
author: Gina G.

description: The best burritos I've ever had are from La Taqueria!  My favorite is their chorizo, which is not at all dry and crumbly like at other places.  Very moist. Their aqua frescas are to die for and are made with real fruit.  Everyone I know whose eaten here rave about the food.  It may be a bit on the pricey side for a burrito place, but it is well worth it!
author: Serena L.

description: Nothing especial about this burrito...  Not sure why this place is so populare.  There are def better taquerias around.
author: Kurosh H.

description: I'm a meximut and have been very pleased with this place. The food is good, fresh and doesn't cost too much. I really like the homemade green chile' they bottle and have on the tables. Most anglos would call it green salsa, it's chile' y mi abuelita made it the same way; jalapenos, green tomatillos and a hint of cilantro. I enjoy going here, but am usually stuffed for a full day. Be prepared to wait for a bit, there is usually a line and I hope you don't mind sharing tables, it's comfortable and social.
author: Michael E.

description: Simply the BEST taco dorado I've ever had!  So perfect with carne asada just off the grill and fresh guac, wow!  I thought I could eat two but one was enough.  The pico de gallo is killer too.  This place is a million years old and still stands out in the crowd.
author: La C.

description: The best taqueria ever!!!, well at least I have been too. I love the burritos. I crave them. All their meats are good from lengua to chicken. No rice which is a good thing. Warning it is super addictive...
author: T J.

description: I have been going here for over 20 years.   The tacos are the best and I love the Strawberry drink.   The only thing I hate is the parking situation.  I wish I stilled lived around the block.  I lived off the tacos when I was in college.  I love the steak taco and the steak burrito.  Definitely the best tacos in the city (yes, better than the taco trucks).
author: P S.

description: I learnt this place from a Mexican friend.  He lives in San Mateo and will make trip just for the burritos.  It is a little pricey but I don't mind for a great burrito.
author: Terence C.

description: Oh boy-the carnitas here is ridiculous.  Seriously, they know how to make a burrito.  A few beans, and the rest is meat.  No rice, not sour cream, no cheese, no BS.  Just get it made the right way (you can add all the other stuff, but why would you ruin it?), sit back, add some green sauce you find on the tables from time to time, and sip on a negro modello to offset the spice on a regular basis.  There isn't much for decor, but you are there for the food.  It's always packed, but they are efficient and get the food out quickly.  This is one of my favorite mexican restaruants in the city, and other locals will agree.
author: Chad S.

description: A great place for cheap eats. Not only is the food fantastic--authentic Mexican--but, for around $5, you are full! The lines get long, but they move fast. A definite must eat if you are looking for great Mexican.
author: Micki S.

description: Holy Mary Mother of God.  Marc, damn you and bless you for giving me my first taste of this true beauty, for now I know what love truly is, and am mired in obsession with a thing that can never love me back, never come to visit me.  The steak taco with cheese and avocado and I, our love can only be one sided, and I feel I will forever pursue her, and each day I am without her I am filled with an uncontrollable longing, as my stomach and heart ache until my needs are satisfied.  But they can never be fully satisfied, for no many how many times I come crawling back to her, no matter how many times she satisfies me in a day, one, two, three if I am really in need, I know I will always come back for more.  I love you, my darling steak taco with avocado and cheese.  Please say you'll be mine forever.
author: Jesse H.

description: Excellent Burritos.  They are real messy though, so make sure you get lots of Napkins.
author: Pele N.

description:
If I had to pick a  place I would eat at everyday I would pick this place. This is probably the only place I will ever give a 5 star rating to except the French Laundry. This is the best taqueria in the city. I dream of their fresh tortillas with beautiful grilled carne asada or Carnitas, fresh avocado and sour cream, creamy pinto beans and cheese. I have to mention that I think this is the only taqueria that takes the time to melt their cheese. 
       I hear people complain about the prices and I have to agree they are expensive for a taqueria. It doesn't matter to me because they separate themselves from all the other taquerias. They also give you a taco with more carne asada than any taqueria I have ever been to. 
I read that the burritos are the best in the city and probably more economical than ordering tacos, but I can't get past the tacos and Quesadillas. 
I just wish this place kept the same hours as El Farlito!
author: Fernand P.

description: I always order the chicken taco, extra crispy =)... It's so full of yummy ingredients, juicy chicken and sliced avocado that just one is filling enough for me.   I've introduced people to this place only to find that this is the only "fast food" place they ever eat at now. My only complaint is that they close early, I remember my roommate and I being so excited for tacos one night only to walk up at 9:00 and have them say, "Sorry..." Other than that this place is perfect.  Hmmm...I'm thirsty for a strawberry fresa.
author: Nicole L.

description: Im conflicted i want to give it two stars but the this place has the best Carne Asada in all the mission, That goes a long motha luvin way. What sucks about this place is that if you want beans, or rice or salsa, the cashier starts performing a wallet biopsy and extracts...man, the price for a meat burrito, this is the kinda place you go once and move on...
author: Joe J.

description: Home of the Five Dollar Taco and worth every cent! The meat is super fresh and it's amazing what fresh quality salsa and avocado can do! not so fresh salsa gives you indigestion and worse....salsa bars are tempting but you're better off here. la fresca! also what I really REALLY dig is the attention to LOCALS by the staff. as you know this is a tourist HOT SPOT. thousands of awards by Zagat, SFBG, Food Mag and the like have revealed this taqueria to the masses. but if they know you .your taco will be ready first and you'll be out the door. as happened to me the other day. my tacos came b4 those of this huge tourist crowd. and i was so grateful. i'm not anti-tourist by any means, i'm one myself when i leave where i'm living i just don't want to wait for em.
author: shanestar h.

description:
this place is flawless ... and by that I mean that it is devoid of flaw. 

it is the only taco place in SF that I can think of that toasts the tortilla in the right way ... putting it on the griddle with ample butter and enough time for the cheese to completely melt ... so they get 5 stars right there. They seal the deal with their fantastic meats, fresh ingredients, and yummilicious guacamole. Be careful of the hot sauce - IT'S HOT!

you people complaining about price need to suck it up. there is no comparison to the crappy tacos served at most SF divey taquerias. Since tacos are a tiny fraction of my overall dining budget, i happily pay double for the real deal.
author: Scott H.

description: DUDE!  This place tastes like home to me.  Good, fresh meat on a corn tortilla, and a large Jamaica. For you dummies, that's pomegranate juice without paying that "Pom" drink price.  I've had me some shitty days, and a carne asada taco is the real fix.  And it doesn't hurt that el Guapo is hooking up that fresh guacamole, neither!  Small crush on that vato.
author: Sheila G.

description: The criticisms are valid--it is a little pricey for a taqueria without all the normal amenities you'd expect (chips and salsa?). But the food IS really good, and at the end of the day, that's what you care about. They run the In and Out model for a taqueria--simple menu that's good and fresh if a bit pricey. Best carne asada in a burrito ever. I always get the burritos... better value than the tacos. Definitely add avacado. I like to go without sour cream because they tend to be a little on the juicy side already, so no need for added moisture. Aguas frescas add even a little more to the meal, but make a perfect complement for the food. Oh, and definitely try the green chili salsa.
author: jim o.

description: Okay, so I like to eat variety meats. Okay, so they're also called offal. Okay, so only peasants eat these left over cow parts. Okay, so I also like animal feet and tails (pig trotters, oxtail, chicken feet, fish maws etc) Hey, it's okay here because they serve cow head too! Anything they put rolled up or folded in a tortilla at this joint is freaking amazingly delicious. Okay, the bathroom is iffy. Okay, the floor is sticky. Okay the ambience is nada. Okay, the seating is a bunch of stools and planks on legs. Okay, the service is....there isn't any. Okay, I am hooked on this place. Try it and you will be too. Okay?
author: bongo c.

description:
There's a reson why they named this place "La Taqueria-" it's THE taqueria in the city.  Best Mexican food is served here, and it's the closest to what I grew up with in LA.  I mean seriously- they put cheese in between the two tortillas on your massive, unbelievably tasty tacos... who does that?  Their meat is all from Neiman Ranch, their food is exceptionally fresh, their horchata kicks ass, and nobody in the joint speaks English!  Perfect!  That's what I expect from a real taqueria.

Bonus- they have trippy little stools to sit on while you fill your beak with the wafting sensations of your giant $5 tacos...  Well worth the price unless you are one of the rock-throwing yuppie-haters.
author: Jason B.

description: Not as good/consistent as years ago, but still one of the best in the city. Crispy carnitas taco and quesadillas are my favs.
author: steve c.

description: Great tacos!  I have had the chicken tacos, and they are delicious.  I like that it's white tender meat, not fatty.  Guacamole, cheese, and sour cream are extra.  This is a great place for Mexican, whether drunk or sober.
author: Sarah F.

description: Carne asada and carnitas tacos I had for dinner with guac and sour cream wiped the bored look off my face. I've been whining there is no really tasty Mexican in SF. There is hope. Homemade tasting tortillas - I could taste the manteca, dense, no healthy ingredients here, which is good, because as much as I like eating healthy, er, not on Friday night. Aguas frescas were exotic - I had fresa, chunks of strawberry and crushed ice. Only one type of salsa, tomatillo green, I thought that was confident and ballsy. Not a billion salsas like other places. Just one perfect one. Just don't wear blue or red and you will be fine.
author: Steve B.

description: Cabeza tacos and a cold beer..... Yum!
author: Sabrina L.

description: Burritos are awesome, but a little soggy.  Also, everything is pretty expensive for a mexican place.  Like 1 or 2 dollars too expensive.  Like who charges $1 for sour cream; that should come free.
author: James C.

description: Taco fabuloso!  Perfect burritos every time.
author: Ed S.

description:
I was introduced to La Taqueria after dating a fellow that grew up in the area.
La Taqueria is only part of the reason I fell in love with my love.
Let me explain.
La Taqueria is snuggled in the Mission, filled with locals and newbies.  Seating consists of long tables, benches and,  small tables w/ chairs if you're lucky.  Tables and benches lends to the atmosphere, an elbow on the table, balancing your burrito while reaching for freshly made hot sauce.
The Grub: I swear by the flour quesadilla.  A light squirt of oil on the griddle offers a light crispy crust to oozing cheese.  I do my own stuffing of salsa to lessen my chances of soggy a quesadilla.
The boyfriend gets the carne asada burrito, which is a staple on every visit.  By far his favorite and best he has ever had.  
Staff is friendly and fast paced.  Don't be alarmed by the line, just copy the person in front of you that looks like they know what they are doing.
La Taqueria is from the days of the old Mission, while new Mission eases the trendiest of souls, this place will feed the masses!
author: Becca P.

description: Fabuloso.  The meat in the carne asada taco was among the best taco carne asada I've ever had.  The carnitas, also great!
author: 'toph G.

description: Love this place!! Was tired and hungry after a fun-filled day at sundaystreetssf, and wanted to chow down on some authentic Mexican food. My friend suggested we go here since she's been coming here w/her dad since she was a little girl. Had the vegetarian taco (gotta love SF for catering to us veggies!) which hit the spot. The best part were the aguas frescas though (fresh fruit, water, and sugar). As the name suggests the juice was FRESH, just the right amount of sweetness, and it reallly quenched our thirst! The owner gave us a sample of ALL the flavors (strawberry, mango, canteloupe, pina colada, watermelon). I loved all the flavors and got the canteloupe---the only flavor we weren't huge fans of was the pina colada. OH and the manager (se llama Miguel--I asked him en espanol HAHA) is super nice! He gave us roses (taken straight from the vases by the cash register but hey it's the thought that counts LOL)! Will definitely be a returning customer. !!Gracias Miguel!! =D
author: Diane G.

description: Hands down the best. The crispy tacos should not be missed. I dream about this place.
author: jason l.

description: After sampling 4 burritos in a one week period since moving to the area, I think this ranks as Best in Show..
author: Derek Y.

description: My favorite food is Mexican, and my favorite place to eat it is at La Taqueria, hands down! I have to have it once a week or I go into withdrawl. I always get the veggie taco with avocado and a cheese quesadilla. No one else makes quesadillas like this...and the green hot sauce on the tables ROCKS!!!!!
author: K L.

description: Ordered a veggie burrito here and my oh my, was that thing huge. Delicious but completely filling , though without that uncomfortable feeling of bloated belly afterwards. We had to wait a while for a table (group of 11) but by the time we got a seat the service was lightning fast. And I'm not a huge fan of mexican food to begin with but I'd recommend it. Spicy enough to open my sinuses and the beer wasn't half bad either.
author: Lydia H.

description: The best carne asada burrito/taco in the city. No filler here, just good red meat marinated to perfection. All I need is a carne asada burrito with avocado and some salsa verde and a lil' place to hide while I scarf it down.
author: Clara I.

description: A bit pricey but worth every bite. The ingredients are fresh and it is no wonder this place is always crowded!
author: L P.

description: I know it's got 400 some reviews, but it's still worth saying this place is the bomb.  Well made frescas and I like the quesadillas best.  Best to eat there as the food doesn't travel well because it's so wonderful and fresh.   I agree with Nathalie, reasonable (delicious) portions don't leave you feeling like you never want to see a burrito again.   Get real, eat here!
author: Big Toe ..

description: I crave the beef head tacos.  Luscious, flavorful beef atop little tortillas with a sprinkling of cilantro, which gives the taco its high note.
author: Ginger C.

description:
Only a place with great tacos and burritos could get away with as generic a name as "La Taqueria"! La Taqueria does not disappoint - the steak burritos here are absolutely the best. These babies need two hands to pick up and will fill you solid. On top of that, they've got a great mix of sauces and plenty of meat. Wash it down with an agua fresca (I had the Pineapple one myself, it was great).

Every time I've been there, it's been fast, efficient service. Watch out for the lines though - at peak times, getting a seat is a long wait.
author: Henry H.

description:
This is God's food.  No better burrito or taco or quesadilla anywhere.  If I was on death row and had to pick my last meal for under $20:  it would be this place hands down.  

Chorizo, carnitas and carne asada are what this place is about.  If you are a chicken or veggie person, stay out.  We don't want your kind here.  The guacamole is not really guac, it is mashed up fresh avocados.  This is as it should be.  The green spicy sauce is the nectar of life.  

Usually I respect the opinions of others, but if you have a carne asada burrito here with everything, or a chorizo taco with everything, and don't like it... well, I'm sorry for you because your taste buds are obviously broken.
author: Brendan R.

description: Updated... I still love this place, but dropped it from 5 stars to 4. Still awesome, and I love the CARNE ASADA SUPER BURRITOS.... but I just wouldn't say it's the 'best' Latin American food in the Mission anymore. (I've been hooked on the Salvadorean joint, La Santaneca, down the block!)
author: J K.

description:
Simple, classic, tasty.

Food is fresh, Service is quick and friendly.
author: Omar J.

description:
The carne asada tacos with the works and a large pina make me do the Mexican Hat Dance!!!  The add-ons are pricey but worth it!
Simply Delicioso!
author: Clay R.

description: I love La Taqueria! I've been coming to this spot since I was a little girl! My parents always took us here as kids! We would get our burritos and go eat them on the grass at Dolores Park. The carne asada is the best!! The meat is full of flavor and juicy! I always get the carne asada burrito. It's the simplest thing in the world, meat, beans and pico de galo. It doesn't need a whole bunch of salsa or guacamole like other burritos. It's just a damn good burrito...probable the best burrito that I've tasted so far!  So after eating a yummy burro...go get a cream puff at Dianda's Italian Bakery next door. Now, that's an awesome meal!!
author: Suzette R.

description:
This place is absolutely AMAZING! You don't need another review saying just that, but it's so good, I HAVE to share.

A friend and I used to make it down here at least once a week. Now that the funds are low, we don't go quite that often...but I do daydream about their vegetarian burritos with salsa, cheese and sour cream almost on a daily basis. Oh I almost forgot, a CRISPY vegetarian burrito, with a large Horchata to wash it down. If I died choking on their burritos, I'd die a satisfied, happy soul.

And thanks to other yelpers, I have begun to order the taco dorado. Deliciously soft and crunchy at the same time, with one fried tortilla wrapped in a soft tortilla, and all the goodies on top. So good, I now have to order the taco dorado and the burrito, so I don't feel like I'm missing out. 

Five stars for the awesome staff (we once got a rose from the cool guy at the register), the super fresh salsa (so good, you won't care that it's always running down your chin and onto your clothes) and well...just the tastiest burrito I've ever had.
author: Kanani M.

description: I seriously love this place.  When I go on vacation and come back to SF, this is where I want to go.  I take people from out of town here and they love it.  I come here for lunch.  I come here for dinner.  I think about La Taqueria when I am hungry, and when I am not hungry.  My mother tells me I was eating La Taqueria in utero.  Get a crispy taco (not on the menu), or a burrito.  Try their agua frescas.  Slather some of that green sauce on whatever you get - it is delicious!
author: Mara K.

description:
the BEST mexican food in the city.  a mate dragged us here once and didn't believe the hype then ate the food - wow.  hands down easily the best.

caren asada and carnitas tacos rule.
author: david s.

description: Dope chorizo tacos.  I'm serious.  The asada taste pretty fresh too, which is always good.  I'd definitely recommend.
author: Rafael L.

description: This place is delicious and though the line is long at lunch time, it moves fast. Really good tacos. Vegetarian friendly.
author: Rachel B.

description: I'm from the city. This is the best Taco place in San Francisco.
author: Pink G.

description: Tasty burrito, way too expensive compared to other places around it. For my money, I'll stick with El Farolito down the block.
author: Bryan B.

description: My favorite has to be something that is not on the menu...the crispy tacos wrapped in a soft flour tortilla!! Love them...they are just delicious....like nothing that I have ever experienced before and I am of Latin decent!! Go figure?!
author: josue p.

description: Order the tacos "dorados", they are the best in the city.  Fresh ingredients, and delicious aguas frescas.  Only drag is that it closes by 8:00 pm.
author: Teresa H.

description: If there's a better burrito in town, I have yet to find it.  The decor of this joint leaves much to be desired, but the food is truely amazing.  Treat yourself to a carnitas burrito or soft taco and an ice cold cerveza.
author: Joe L.

description:
I know many will fight to the death to defend the wonder that is the La Taqueria taco.  I won't be among these folks, though I do think La Taqueria is one of the best places in the mission to get a veggie burrito.  I tried the veggie tacos, but too much filling -- it ended up all over my hands.  I get the veggie with all the extras.  I know it is more expensive than other places, but really, still a very cheap meal.  The salsa and avocado is yummy, and I love the cheese that they use.  Their decision to avoid rice is very smart -- I don't feel like I'm going to bust my gut when I am done here, though I do think about when I'm coming back next.

Bottom Line: Yummy, yummy in my tummy for not much money.
author: L G.

description: Straight up: It's all about the meat. They don't use rice, so it's a little soupier than most. But you don't get those dry rice patches, and the whole thing is rocking with flavor. It's also not cheap. Expect to drop $7 on your 'rito. To me though, this is the best meat--carne asada or carnitas--in the city, and that makes it the best burrito.
author: David K.

description: I grew up on these tacos. I have literally been eating their carnitas for a 20 some-odd years. The best carnitas, chorizo and carne asada around. yummy.......and the place feels so authentic!
author: Andrea R.

description: After all the hype I've heard about this place, I give it a "Meh."  The crispy tacos are stellar and worth the trip, but a taqueria that can't handle a simple burrito is fatally flawed.  Limp tortillas, no rice, no cheese, and orders do not come with chips.  And overpriced.  WTF.
author: Ana C.

description:
YUM! I would have to say this is the best taco place in the area. The meat,salsa and beans taste fresh every time I eat here.Yes,the tacos are expensive compared to other locations...but you get what you pay for! The meat is juicy,tender and I never get any pieces of fat on my meat.,like other burrito shops.I have never tried the burritos here so I can't say much about that.

Do expect to pay additional overpriced fees for any extras that you may want or for any substitions.The place is clean and airy.

PROS: fresh,quality meat

CONS:expensive (bf and I ordered 4 tacos,one with avocado and  cheese = $20)
no free chips or salsa with your order
author: fancy-schmancy S.

description: The best taco in the city.  Everything else is good, but the Tacos put this place on the map!  You have to order either a beef or chicken taco with everything.  There big so the $ is well worth it.  I'd give it 10 stars if I could
author: Cupcake X.

description: La bomba.  This place is great!  Food is very fresh --  big chunks of fresh avocados in your burrito, fresh cilantro, and tasty salsa verde on the tables.  Not the cheapest of the taquerias, but one of my favorites.  My true favorite?  Well I'm not ready to tell EVERYONE just yet.  :-)
author: Danielle B.

description: I've been coming here for tacos since I was ten and didn't even live in SF (won't say how long that's been!) but this place is amazing!  Seriously the best tacos I've had since my travels south of the border, and that's saying a lot!  The carnitas are my favorite, the chips, salsa and guacamole to die for.....mmmmm....I think I might have to go right now.
author: Amy P.

description:
The best tacos ever known to man. I used to get the veg burrito regularly, but the chicken is very good and the carne asada is great also. My mom loves the pork but I usually don't get that myself. But truly the tacos are to die for, you must get guac on whatever you order. You can ask for your tacos to be crunchy if you like that, and basically they fry one of the corn tortillas and melt cheese on it. It's nice. Also the fresca is so good. I like the burritos here also probably the best. No rice, pinto beans are the only option and it's just so fresh and to the point. Downside is that it has gotten so much more expensive over the years, but still so so so worth it.
I only wish they didn't close for such a long chunk between thanksgiving and new years every year.
author: Alana L.

description: All I can say is BRAVO!!! My wife and I had heard about La Taqueria from a friend so we yelped it and decided to give it a try. We drove 1 hour + from Stockton. We found parking across the street I am on crutches so finding close parking a major plus. My wife asked a lady in line how the order process worked we ordered and I hobbled outside to wait. While waiting outside the owner could see my wife had never been there because she did not know where to wait for the food. I have to say this is one of the best restaurant owners I have ever seen, my wife told him we drove all the way from Stockton and he was flattered. He gave us a sample of one of his specialties, wished us a safe trip home and a speedy recovery of my knee. La Taqueria just gained two more customers for life. You guys are awesome, thank you.
author: Joe B.

description: I fell in love with this place in this last year.  I work nearby and quickly learned to order the Dorado tacos.  Fantastic when done with lean meat!  However, the last two times I've eaten here I've bitten down into fatty pieces of meat.  You know the kind you can't break with your teeth unless you gnaw through it.  Yucko!  I grew up in San Francisco with the very best food and before these two visits, La Taqueria was the very best for Mexican food.  At all the others, including La Corneta down the street, there was risk of biting down into a fatty piece of meat.  The problem became much worse during the recession.  The cuts of meat dropped a grade or two.  I loved La Taqueria because it hadn't happened there.  Now it has.  Twice.  Sigh..
author: Annie G.

description: I have been coming here since I was in the womb. Growing up, if my sisters and I had our choice of where to eat we would always choose La Taqueria. Best F'ing tacos in all of CA. A little pricey but you get what you pay for. AMAZING!!
author: Santiago T.

description: i really enjoyed my chips and fresh salsa as well as my carnitas taco, the chicken taco had cartilage in it which i had to pick out while eating but all the other ingredients were very tasty and cooked well. i will for sure come back. everything was affordable except the additions, $1.50 extra to have avocado on your taco was a little steep considering the taco is only $3.50 to start. i heard great things about the burritos from my friends.
author: Barbara C.

description: The best f***ing burritos and tacos within the best city in the U.S.! Need I say more?
author: Jim M.

description: I've been back several times for the carnitas burrito (with all the fixins) and it is just as amazing every time.  I don't know what they do to their meat, but it's fantastico.  And the chips and guac is awesome...very fresh!  This is becoming my official staple burrito joint.
author: Michael S.

description: Since I was a little girl, my parents always took me to La Taqueria, but at their other location in San Jose. It has always been my all-time favorite, and there's also. Now that that location is closed, whenever I need my Mexican fix, I always go to it's other location, all the way to San Francisco to taste a piece of heaven - this restaurant. I have converted all my friends to this taqueria, because it is truly, the best. I try to go here at least once a month, even though it's a pretty long drive because that's how good it is! I love their quesadillas and burritos! Don't forget to use the green sauce on anything you order! Mmmm! And also, to quench your thirst, you should try the Cantaloupe fresh drink. I love it, and I love this place.
author: Rachel N.

description: soooo good and good value.  definitely get the agua fresca with your food.
author: Michele P.

description:
This is not a bad restaurant -- however, with so many other nearby places which serve better *AND* cheaper burittos and tacos, why would one go here?

This place is quite over-rated.
author: bong b.

description: Good burritos and great agua frescas (melon is spectacular). Pricey for Mission burritos, though. A friend ordered 2 tacos with avocado, I think, and was out almost $10.
author: Liboo K.

description: Deep down in the mission lies this wonderful, glorious, scrumdidliumptious hole in the wall called "La Taqueria". I cannot find enough good things to say about this place. I was first introduced to this place by my sister and immediatly fell in love. Never in my, Mexican food filled, life have I had such flavorful, mouth savoring tacos. The hot sauce is to die for and every time I go I serious contemplate nicking one of the bottles, that's just how good it is. If you haven't found this little gem yet you are definitely missing out.
author: Danielle A.

description: I was introduced to this place by some co-workers about 6 years ago. Every so-often one of the girls in my office will ask if anyone wants to get "Mission St. tacos". Everyone knows what they are referring to and will ditch any other lunch plans post-haste. For some reason we always get the tacos. We never have strayed from that. Some get the Carnitas, some the Chicken and some the Carne Asada. Most everyone orders (and eats) 2, though we can only comfortably consume 1. No one walks away dissatisfied. Normally I'd mark down for pricey-ness, but when it's sooooo good, ya just don't seem to mind spening 10-12$ on lunch. If you live, work or play in SF, you've got to check this place out! You won't be dissapointed! =0)
author: Johanna O.

description: They simply work some kind of magic here. The food is amazing. Whatever the size of the line, it's worth the wait.
author: Ryan C.

description: La Taqueria is the best burrito place you'll find in S.F. It has a lot of reviews posted on the wall and if i was a critic i would give it a 10 out of 10 and you can't get anymore perfect than a 10
author: Ezra R.

description:
What's not to like?
Best place in the city, hands down, for burritos, tacos, or quesadillas (which is all they have).  It's all been said already, and it's all true.  Some people whine for lack of rice, and all I have to say to them is: real burritos aren't for you.  I was raised on the food from this place, and remember when the food was actually cheap, around $4 for a burrito with everything.  Nowadays that'll run you close to $10 unfortunately.  That's really the only bad thing about it though...and even so, I keep coming back.  I'd rather pay for a burrito and a large fresa from La Taqueria than have a free banquet and my own tropical island given to me.  .Nothing else I've had in SF or elsewhere is the same.

Also, their hot sauce is amazing (I wonder how many people steal those hot sauce containers off the tables?)
author: c b.

description: my review is solely for the carnitas!!!!!! HOLY CARNITAS! i had a carnitas taco with everything- of course- and it may have been like $4 which is ridic but the minute my tastebuds got a feeling of that taco.. i was willing to pull out another $8 for 2 more hahahah! delicious :)
author: Lisa Z.

description: I went to la taqueria for lunch today.  It was good but not amazing.  I would rather go to Pancho Villa.
author: Sesily M.

description:
BEST BURRITO/TACO in SF.

Don't ask them for rice either, they don't waste precious tortilla space with that stuff.
author: Derek D.

description: I gotta givre a little love to la taq as the sign says on the door the best tacos and burritos in the world but they are also the most expensive and really are only the best when the guy with the thinning hair makes them.  Hint if you order your tacos dorrado it means crispy and it's goood.
author: James S.

description: They have the best soft tacos here and the carnitas tacos is my favorite.  Forget the burritos and stick to the tacos when you eat here.  This is one of the best taquerias in the city.  It ROCKS!
author: Oscar F.

description:
This Taqueria is the best I've ever had!!!!!  The first time I went in I couldn't stop at one burrito, I had to have two.  That was about ten years ago.  The food is outstanding, flavored just right without any rice.  Mmmm....just the way I like it!  

I have taken every friend I have to eat at La Taqueria and after one visit they're hooked.  

This taqueria is the best in the bay!!!!  Enjoy!
author: Bre G.

description:
The best.

Juicy burritos without rice filler, OMG!  

Carne asada with avocado is my fave.
author: Doc B.

description: My favorite.  If you can't take the rice-less heat, then stay out of La Taqueria.  La Taqueria is where it's at baby if you want delicious tacos, quesadillas, burritos, guacamole (no nasty guac here, only fresh avocados). Seriously, I can't think of anything I don't love about this place.   Don't forget to bring cash!
author: Christina C.

description:
Worst Burrito Ever.  Way too much cash for some bland chicken and a couple beans.  No rice, veggies, or salsa and it wasn't tightly wrapped and fell over as I was eating it.  They charge extra for everything, and were rude when I changed my order because I didn't want to spend $10 for a burrito.  Also they sent me on my way with no salsas.  Never again.

On the other hand, they were super fast and their tacos looked better than my burrito turned out.  But there are so many better spots than this crappy place.
author: gina v.

description: Maybe this place is good for tacos, but for burritos, no, why would you go here if you could walk a few blocks and go to Cancun, or walk even fewer and hit up La Corneta. It's about two dollars more here for the same super burrito w/ meat that you get at Cancun, and it's missing the awesome green chile/avocado salsa.
author: Maria M.

description: Best strawberry agua's fresca's and best carnita's taco's in the bay.
author: Joaquin S.

description: Good but probably overhyped. I'm expecting the best carnitas taco ever... good, but not great/amazing! I know it's different style and price point but I still love Nopalito's carnitas tacos the best.
author: Jeannette L.

description:
I LOVE THEIR CANTALOPE JUICE.
Damn, I would drink that everyday,any day. 
Oh, their burritos are good too, they sorta small though, especially for the price.
author: Cameron S.

description: Five stars for the carnitas tacos, minus three stars for the nasty and unhygienic stuff going down in the kitchen. I'm no germaphobe, but I do appreciate people handling my food with at least a minimal degree of cleanliness. But there I was, sitting outside at La Taqueria, thoroughly enjoying my carnitas tacos, when I witnessed serious nastiness. The grill guy picked up slab after slab of RAW meat and slapped it on the grill. Then he grabbed a dirty ass rag from his apron, rubbed his hands on it, and proceeded to pick up all the tortillas from the grill and put more on the grill. All the while I kept saying to myself, "Please, just wash your hands; please wash your hands..." After that, he used said dirty ass rag to WIPE DOWN the area where he was putting the cooked tortillas down. So now the same rag has been used to wipe raw meat juice from his hands and then to wipe down the area where they make the tacos. EW. In a true testament to the goodness of their tacos, I'm not sure witnessing this will keep me from eating here, but I will definitely know who to blame if/when I get sick...
author: Bess K.

description: If you want a great carne asada burrito without rice come here. Rice on a burrito is just a filler for a mediocre burrito. They don't put rice on their burritos here because it DOESN"T NEED IT... its that good! The tacos are great too!  Don't forget to order some chips, salsa and avocado with your burrito and/or taco and order a fruit drink or Mexican beer to wash it all down. YUM!
author: M R.

description: very good.  i am slightly biased with carnitas from chicago, but i do admit, la taqueria can compete. only tried the carniats taco, and that was enough to impress.
author: richard p.

description:
been coming here for 10 years or so
by far the best taco ever. 

get it with cheese, guac, sour cream, and whatever meat is your favorite. 

won't go anywhere else for a taco in SF.
author: leslie y.

description: I've been going to this place for over 2 years now and just last night while I was enjoying my tacos with the hubby I realized that I never wrote a review on it. So here we go.... Hands down the BEST place in SF for tacos!!!! At least from what I've tried so far...I honestly can't imagine how it could get any better. Now, I've only tried the tacos so I can't really speak for the rest of their menu but I'm guessing if their tacos are that good and they pretty much use the same ingredients in their burritos then those must be the best as well. Be aware that their tacos are NOT those small dinky ones that you can eat a whole bunch of. They are pretty hefty. I usually get 2 but can only finish both of them if I am REALLY hungry. I typically get one chicken and one carne asada both with cheese. Soooooooooo delicious. Chicken is so juicy. The hubby always gets carne asada tacos with cheese and avocado. A bit pricey for tacos....$3.50 for a standard...add $0.50 for cheese and $1.20 for guac! But it is sooo worth it. Can't wait to go back!
author: BrElla4eva H.

description: This is far and away my favorite taqueria in San Francisco. The tacos are impossibly good. I love the weird extra $1 charge for no beans. Order the carne asada taco with cheese, avocado, and no beans. It costs about $6 but it's big enough that you really only need to eat one. Especially if you go to Mission Pies afterward for dessert. Best meal ever.
author: Eliza B.

description: The 2 star description is perfect.  When I tried it, "Meh" was the first thing that came to mind.  That's what I get for having high expectations due to all these reviews.  I'm sorta surprised.  San Fran is a foodie town with a sizeable Mexican population filled with residents having discerning taste buds.  Guess people in the City just don't know really good Mexican food.  Don't get me wrong, the food isn't bad.  Fairly decent, bordering on good.  But Taco Bell, while clearly using inferior ingredients, is just as enjoyable.  I've had much better Mexican food in Sacramento, a city not as known for food and where the Yelp reviewers are waaaayyy less discerning IMO.  If you're ever in Sacramento, check out Chando's Tacos.  Similar to La Taqueria in that there's no rice filler, but Chando's doesn't have bean filler either.  It's meat, salsa (spicier with more flavor than here), and quac.  Slightly smaller portions, but cheaper as well.  Value is overall about the same, but Chando's flavor absolutely blow's La Taqueria away.  I don't claim to be some Mexican food expert.  I mean I grew up around it being from LA, but I'm generally easily pleased.  That said, La Taqueria didn't really impress me.  If you're in the area, sure, check it out.  But don't make a special trip out to it like I did.  Not worth the effort even without the parking issue (parking was an incredible PITA).  I tried the tacos and burritos.  Carnitas and carne asada.  I liked the asada better, but just by a bit cuz it had some flavor.  The carnitas were cooked well (hard to do actually so that's impressive) but really lacked flavor so it had the texture but not the flavor.  The asada chunks weren't too impressive looking, but at least they had a decent amount of flavor.  Nothing great mind you, but the carnitas are clearly overrated.
author: Richard N.

description: Excellent tacos, great prices, speedy service, and the only place that wraps the tacos so you don't make a giant mess without having to resort to a fork and knife. What's not to love?
author: Kelley P.

description: I was hungry and wanted a burrito. I got a steak burrito and a small drink--which set me back $11!!! The burritos do not have rice, only meat and beans. I had to pay extra for the cheese and the avocado. A burrito and a small drink with no chips included should not be that expensive!!! The burrito was tiny and did not fill me up. The meat had no flavor and there was barely any cheese or guacamole. When you order your drink, you have to be careful that its not stolen, because what happens is when they process the order--they fill the drinks and just leave them on the counter. This is the price I paid for convenience-but i was really hungry and could not hold out----DO NOT EAT HERE
author: alexandria s.

description: debate about the inclusion of rice aside, i think these are The Best tacos in the city - they're always fresh, the service is super fast and whole process efficient, and oooh, their fresca's are a worthwhile sugar high, too.  (strawberry!)
author: April C.

description: I love, or should I say LOVED La Taqueria. I went there with a friend a couple of weeks ago for dinner and while we were sitting at one of the little wood tables - I saw a maggot fall from the ceiling onto the floor, or something that closely resembled a maggot. I was stunned. This was my favor Mexican place in the city. Needless to say - I am looking for a new place. I can accept some rodents - even expect them. Maggots falling from the ceiling crosses that threshold for me.
author: S F.

description: Awesome tacos to be found at this spot.  The tortillas go on the grill for crispy edges (remember to order with cheese because it won't come with it!).
author: Rae F.

description: This is definitely the best taqueria in town.  The carne carne asada burrito is perfect with the amount of seasoning, meat, and condiments inside.
author: Mary L.

description: I HEART (why doesn't yelp allow the less than sign?) BURRITOS and this is one of the best in town. Honestly, the only way to get burritos are with meat, cheese, rice, REFRIED beans, spicy salsa, and guac. This combined with their salsa verde is food of the Gods. Enjoy
author: pankaj l.

description: these are the most over priced tacos ive ever had in my life for someone that grew up here in the city and that has gone to almost every single taqueria in the mission i would have to say blah to this place id rather eat at home than pay close to 6 bucks for a taco that bland. if you want a real taco head towards the taco trucks or taqueria vallarta unless you are afraid of being around real mission district natives.
author: Jared V.

description: i seriously don't understand how anyone can contest that la taqueria makes the best burrito in san francisco.  they are so tasty!  mmmm, carnitas. . . and the size is just right - they don't overcram the tortilla to the point that its a big goopy mess by the time you're half-way through.  their pico de gallo and green hot sauce are delicious as well.   they were closed for a while over the holidays and it was torture.  no one else comes close!!
author: Erin C.

description: Okay... so after being told the legend of this Taqueria, my expectations were high. Finally one day while hunting for tomatillos, I was able to try this restaurant. The prices were a few dollars more than your typical Mission Taqueria, but I figured that the food must be really great, right? Not so... very mediocre taqueria, nickel and dime you for everything, chips, salsa, you name it. They'll charge you for napkins before you know it. Service.... well... you don't go to these places for the service do you? I find Taqueria Cancun at Mission and 19th to be significantly better (quality, and size) and the prices are better too. So there you have it, La Taqueria... demystified.
author: J B.

description: I have yet to have a taco anywhere else that rivals the ones at La Taqueria. I've also had the quesidillas, which are amazing, as well as the fruit drinks. Both the San Francisco and San Jose locations are excellent. This is definitely, without a doubt, my very favorite taco place. Ever. A little pricey, but worth it. And if you skip the beans you get more of the oh-so-delicious meat!
author: Kay B.

description: I swore I would never get a burrito anywhere else after eating one here. Now I'm hooked on the tacos and I wont eat Mexican anywhere other than home cooked. Ive been to Mexico and back and havent found anything as authentic and delicious as this place. La Taqueria never fails to provide the best in quality and pricing. I would gladly make the trek across town to eat here before I spend more for the convenience of a place closer to home. Also, on the way back I'm sure to grab some Mitchells Ice Cream to complete my night in food heaven
author: Kerry C.

description:
let me first say that none of my complaints have to do with the people who work there. they are very nice. 

so I'm sitting there eating my admittedly delicious taco, and i see what appears to be a man who has decided to be a woman (maybe midway through life) and a .............well i was trying to avoid derogatory descriptions here but the dude/chick was a "street trog" basically someone who lives on the street and gets subsistence however they can. 
unfortunately this "street trog" in his version of "hunting and gathering" was "gathering" the green salsa bottle into his street trog mouth and chugging/suckling the upended bottle of table salsa, for a good five seconds before leaving. 
so I'm eating my taco and almost throw up (i had just doused my taco in green sauce.)  NO ONE SAW IT. except me. and some worker went outside and arranged the bottle back in line with the napkin holder............DID SHE SEE IT? fuck man. how many of these green hot sauce bottles have been mouth-a-fied by the tranny street trog. 
WHAT THE FUCK?
ok 
calm down.
I'm sure that i am just seeing the worst of everything in here, I'm sure that no one saw what i saw, and that maybe i didn't even see it. 
..........
no .......i saw it. 
but its not the fault of the workers. they are busy and cant control everything that happens in this taco hole. 

back to what i wanted to say in the first place
this taco hole has violated the code of Mexican food. 
i don't care if JESUS CHRIST is taking my order, and CEASER CHAVEZ is making my damn taco. i have not ever and am never going to pay more than 2.50 for a taco, that is just out of bounds man. 
it is akin to going to american eagle outfitters to buy "THRIFT STORE-ESK" clothes. 
no i eat Mexican food cause it is good and cheap and accessible. 
if Mongolian BBQ was this good and cheap and accessible then i would eat that. 
fuck paying $9.73 for ONE taco w/(small amounts of)avocado, chips and salsa(which i don't need alot of, just a couple bites), and a horchata (small). (one dollar tip is included, cause i've worked in the food industry)
I'm am going to have to go get a real taco later tonight just to hold me over till morning. 
sorry even though the taco was very good, it was still just a taco and now that it is in my stomach it is nothing more than a food lump. i really enjoyed it while i ate. and i really enjoyed watching that street trog upend that bottle of green salsa, but the ride is over, i might go back just to be fair and drop another paycheck on a burrito, but my affair with la taqueria is over.
author: jeff e.

description: Even though I usually get a carne asada burrito here, the tacos are where it's at. Yeah you have to pay more for certain things, but quit being such babies and get over it. After two tacos, you'll forget all about it.
author: Alexis C.

description: At the recommendation of 7x7's 100 Things to Eat, I tried the carnitas taco and carnitas burrito. I'm not much of a Mexican food connoisseur but I have to say it definitely beats Taco Bell!
author: Amy L.

description: tacos here are the bomb.  i had a carnitas taco w/ avocado last night, and it hit the spot.  "avocado" means guac, and there is also a yummy salsa that goes on top.  the only thing i didn't like was that i had to pay $1 to have them not add beans, which i find pretty lame.
author: Helen T.

description: I am from San Diego, and southern California Mexican food is very different from northern California food. There is nothing wrong with it, I am just not used to it. But la Taqueria, in my opinion comes very close. They have delicious burritos, all their ingredients are extremely fresh. Reasonably priced too!
author: Chelsea C.

description: damn good mexican food!!  the burritos are ginormous and the tacos are also soooo delicious (sabrosa!).  i love mexican food and this is definitely my favorite in the mission for a quick meal.  yeah, its no frills and the neighborhood can seem sketchy, but it is WORTH it!!  and its a sure-fire cure for a hangover too.
author: Carolyn B.

description: This place is immensely over-rated & I can't imagine how it got a 24 in Zagat. For my veggie burrito I had no choice of beans (pinto beans only) and you have to read the wall menu thoroughly & quickly to realize that sour cream & avocado are extras as is lettuce, apparently. La Taqueria is packed with people which makes ordering a nightmare, though it does give the place that exciting buzz of humanity. It also seems you make you eat faster!
author: Bill H.

description: best burritos ever.. the steak is tasty.  if they weren't filled with liquid i would give them 5 stars -  i feel like bringing in my own slotted spoon for the guy to use with the beans.  still - nothing beats a Cancun breakfast burrito.
author: marc g.

description: what ARE you people whining about? i go here for TACOS and TACOS only  (LA TAQUERIA, get it?). yes its more 'spensive than your average taco joints but they are delicious and substantial and this is the city! where are you from, oregon? the default medium soda is well sized too. nothing more to be said.
author: Frances L.

description: i've only had 3 things here: the tacos, salsa/guac, and their strawberry drinks. having moved from houston, i hadn't found anything that satisfied my standards for mexican food until i came here. the carnitas tacos with one soft tortilla inside a crispy one slathered with that green bottled salsa is amazing. in addition to a chip piled high with guac, pico di gallo and more green salsa, and there's nothing better.
author: Ellen L.

description: you don't come here for the burritos...it's all about the tacos. even the nachos are very good. i also can't get enough of the strawberry agua fresca. everything's made right in front of you and there's a good mix of people dining in. i'm surprised the taquerias next door are still in business.
author: Chris C.

description: La Taqueria, is probally in the top 5 of all tacqueria's in all of northern califronia.   The place is always busy, so you know you getting some of the freshest ingredients.   I can only give out 4 stars, since the prices are very high.    Tacos and burritos are charged extra for guacamole, sour cream etc.  Two tacos packed with all the goodies,  and fresh squeesed juice can range between 15 and 20 dollars.
author: Robert S.

description: This is my favorite burrito in the city.  I just get a carne asada without any extras because the meat speaks for itself.   For the first year after I moved from San Diego, I would always complain about the lack of quality Mexican food in the city until a friend took me to La Taqueria.  The carne asada burrito is actually better than any of my favorites in SoCal, and I ate ate A LOT of burritos there!
author: t l.

description: tacos de carnitas!!!! have then make it "golden" the inside taco will be crispy and the outside softer. best thing ever!!!!!!!!!! enough said!
author: Renzo L.

description: This place is the best! Their burritos can't get any better. The food is fresh and scrumptious! I recommend the chips and salsa as well. There are other good places in the city but none that top this one.
author: Jackie R.

description: Best taco place in SF.  I took my parents here (we are all taco loving Mexicans from San Diego).  They RAVED about it.  They actually still talk about La Taqueria.  This place is legit, a lttle pricey, but worth it.  And it wont give you a gnarly stomach ache afterward.  You really must go here.
author: Erica S.

description: hands down the best Mexican food i have had in California. prices are a little on the high side but well worth every penny. my carnitas burrito was to die for. the only bad thing about this place is that no other Mexican place can compete.
author: pancho p.

description: I heard about this place from a friend and being new to the area I wanted to sample the best! I wasn't dissapointed it was the best burrito ever! I had the carne asada which I asked for with no beans and this is the reason I am giving 4 stars instead of 5 they actually charge an extra dollar for no beans, i have never heard of anywhere charging for taking away something. Be careful because they charge for anything, no beans $1 extra beans$1 etc So my friend had just the regular burrito at like $6 mine ended up being $9 just because of a few very minor changes which most places do not charge for. If I had known thant I would have just dealt with it the way it came! Still awesome food though.
author: Samantha G.

description: SOOOOOO good.  Delicious tacos with a healthy dollop of the tastiest pico de gallo this side of the border, agua frescas with chunks of fresh fruit in it, and speedy service makes this my go to tacqueria.  There is almost always a line, but they are very efficient and your food comes up fast.  Awesome.
author: mo r.

description: Ok so I placed a huge order here today bc it was my brother's birthday.  I came here bc it's clean and I heard good things about this place.  Let me begin, when I stepped in, the line was long but it moved pretty quick.  I placed my order, she made my food, and I got charged.  Requested a receipt just to double check on the charges.  Sure enough I got charged over $4 extra.  Only got back $1.50 bc I didnt want to argue with her.  Plus she probably wouldnt understand what I am saying.  Got home an indulged, but something didnt seem quite right.  I ordered 2 SUPER BURRITOS and got what looks like a Reg. Burrito.  I expected the burrito to be huge, but it was so tiny.  Apparently there is currently a deal here.  Buy 3 burritos and each will cost $5.55.  Want to upgrade to super (with the works, gucamole, sour cream, cheese, etc) add $1.50.  Happy hour time I believe is from 3pm - 5pm.  Tacos for $1.
author: Mimi S.

description: By far the best tacos I've ever had!  I have been here twice and will definitely be going back.  They also have clean and open seating, which is more than I can say for other Taquerias in the Mission.
author: Katherine D.

description: I like taqueria food.  If anything I wish we had more, cheap, authentic taqueria's in midtown/downtown sac.  With that being said, I have a really hard time rating these places.  The fine line between mediocre, good and great always seems to elude me.  La Taqueria is a perfect example of this.  While it was good, I was surprised to see it Zagat rated as most taqueria's are not.  Anyway, on to the food.
