We were here for just a quick snack so I was not able to sample a whole lot of their offerings.  The carnitas and vegetarian tacos were both good.  Two things I found somewhat odd was the price and lack of free chips/salsa.  La Taqueria is a little more expensive than other taqueria's.  Not expensive to the point of breaking the bank or anything, but still a little more than your average taqueria.  The second thing is that you have to buy chips/salsa.  Big no-no for me.  The chips and salsa were good, the salsa definitely needs more of a kick to it, and the chips were thick and hearty and tasted better the more soaked they were with salsa sauce.  Overall not a bad place, just nothing special either.
author: David L.

description: Definitely the best carnitas tacos in the city, love 'em here and I'm not usually into the swine.. A give and take with this place- probably not your "go-to" taqueria in the Mission, but more of a "splurge" taqueria (a term that didn't exist before Wall St. torpedoed the economy). Yes, the tacos are pricier than the average Mission taqueria, but they are also bigger. If you're not ravenously hungry, one should do the trick. Yeah, you gotta pay for chips & salsa, but the salsa is fresh and delicious, the chips are warm and tasty, and the serving is large- well worth the $1.20.   It's the extras (cheese, guac) where they really get you price-wise, so do without if you can. Do they  really actually charge you $0.50 if you don't want beans? Seems extremely pretentious if true.
author: Jonathan M.

description: despite the fact that I am a dedicated omnivor, I feel compelled to admit that the vegetarian tacos here are simply amazing.  the tortillas are pan fried and then filled with sauted vegies and lots of cheese, it absolutely delicious!
author: greg B.

description: basically the best taco joint in the mission!
author: Sole A.

description: Love this place - the cheese flour quesadilla with guac and salsa is divine.
author: Jim C.

description: This is the very best burrito joint I've come across in SF yet.  Loaded with meat, beans, cheese and salsa, not a single grain of rice in sight, just like I like em!  Even tho the line to order stretches down the way, everything comes out quickly from the grill, and you can watch them work as you wait.  Their grilled carne asada is superb, as well as the quesadillas...incomparable!  Very casual and informal, a good place for a first date.
author: Jeff C.

description: good experience for the non-hispanic person. I thought people give complimentary salsa and chips at most mexican restaurants but not this one. They pour the salsa over your chips in the same box container, thus makes your chips "soggy". The burrito was a little "wet" with the salsa water running out of it as you bite on it. If you like juicy burritos and wet chips, this is the place!
author: godzilla m.

description: Grilled garlic Shrimp burrito is my favorite. One of the best salsa bar....Great place.....Yummmy..Found on yelp...
author: Only H.

description: like some others, no long review, but just my vote (democracy rocks) and a blurb.  get the tacos with whatever you love.  watch the fastest taco maker in the city bring the ingredients together into one mouth watering package.  unless you're vegetarian, when you catch a waff of the carne asada's aroma while they're cutting it on the table, you can't help but urinate just a little from the excitement.  you've been warned.  i bring all my out-of-towners to this joint.  nobody has ever left without declaring their love for the meal.
author: Kazuo L.

description: I have spent years living in the Mission and I have spent years living in Southern Mexico.  I know Mexican food in its many variations, from the slop of re-fried beans with greasy melted cheese on top in the worst of Mexican places in the US, to amazing fresh caught Huachinango fish tacos cooked on grills in the sand in small coastal villages, to fancy and superb restaurants in Mexico City.  I will say unequivocally that La Taqueria has the best tacos  I have ever had (make sure you ask for everything on it).  Now these tacos are not exactly "Authentic Mexican" tacos because they don't make tacos with so many ingredients on them in Mexico, but they are a perfect blend of authentic Mexican and Mission District Mexican.  What makes them so great is the amazing quality of the ingredients, the fact that they place a secret crunchy tortilla with melted cheese inside the tortilla they wrap it in, their special tomatillo sauce on top, and the fact there is not a grain of rice in the entire building (American restaurants use rice as a filler in burritos that add no flavor, if you ever get a burrito somewhere else besides La Taqueria order without rice).  This is the best place to take out of towners especially New Yorkers who suffer through some of the worst Mexican food of any big multi ethnic city in the states.
author: Mark W.

description: I don't know, guys. My brother and his girlfriend were in town and for some reason he insisted we go here, maybe because he went here the last time he visited SF, a couple years ago before he had a sister who knew better.  I figured I might as well keep an open mind... I stepped up to order, a carne asada with no beans. I'm a little peeved that I have to pay to get my beans taken *off*, but I was expecting a comparable increase in meat or something. The lady at the counter did her presumably usual thing of asking if I want any extras, I declined, and she said, "So, just meat and salsa".  I replied "... ... ... and rice... ..." in a very confused way because I am apparently spoiled by every other taqueria in the world that gives me some more carbs with my meat and salsa. I'm from New England, so I obviously don't know what a real burrito is, but still... I took my tiny foil-wrapped dinner with the prominent "No Beans" sticker in orange. I admit that it tasted okay, but there was no flavor in it other than a hint of beef, tomato pulp, and cilantro. No heat or spice whatsoever, and watery juice leaked out the other end. This trip to La Taqueria did not dissuade my brother from the bizarre notion that the best burritos are to be found in Brooklyn(!) Next time we're going to El Farolito.
author: Molly C.

description: I'm not a huge fan of Mexican food, but I do enjoy having a good burrito once in a while.  A friend, who knows SF well, took me to La Taqueria a while back and told me to order their burrito with all the extras.....and then ask for it "golden"....which means that they heat/grill the burrito after it's been wrapped.  I'm not sure why it tastes so damn good, but it's by far my favorite burrito.  The old SJ location wasn't as great...but I hear they are out of business now.
author: Jay M.

description: this place is pricey, but their tacos seriously make me cream my shorts. plus they've got the best variety of agua frescas of any taq in the mish-mish.
author: Angie Y.

description: ooo yes please! The tacos here are amazing, get them with hot sauce and just be happy. I tried the carne asada, pollo and carnitas which was my favorite but it's so hard to pick a favorite. The horchata was perfect to cut down on the spice of the taco.
author: Cbr A.

description: best place in the city to get burritos and tacos.  carne asada burrito at la taqueria, rule!  enough said.
author: Wendy S.

description: who doesn't love the double tortilla taco action, one crispy, one soft, melted cheese in between. actually, probably a lot of people don't like it because they think their taco is supposed to come with rice. hooray for rice....now that makes a real taco.  is rice really that important? if it is, there are thousands of mexican restaurants (not taquerias) that will GARE ON TEE real genuine rice with your taco plato. probably  Chevy's for example.  who knew that La Taqueria prides themselves on not putting rice in their burritos and tacos....raise your hands...
author: sarah C.

description: people say you can tell a lot about a person by their favorite burrito place. la cumbre people like healthier food; pancho villa is for those who hang out near 16th and valencia; taqueria cancun fans are basically those who get trashed in the mission on fridays and then eat there at 2 am when anything would taste good. la taq is for those who want a cheap, fast, delicious meal without the b.s. - the burritos are consistent, the agua frescas delicious, and the crowd is a cool sf mix.
author: Lisa M.

description: very avarage i'd rather have el forolito or papalote or maybe the taco truck by best buy
author: NAEL K.

description: I'm going to have to agree with Rick H. No, rice at a mexican restaurant??  Plus the chicken had very little taste.  I would only go here if you were just going to get guacamole and chips.  That was the only good part of the meal.
author: N O.

description: One of my fav taquerias in town but definitely expensive. Still the meat and fixings are delicious and consistently good (have been eating here  over 20 years). Clean place but nothing fancy. Very tasty. The lady who takes orders and runs the register has an attitude sometimes, which is hard to appreciate in a taco stand but w/e!
author: alex b.

description: I thought the food was pretty good. But, the price is way too expensive for a taqueria. I paid almost $9 for a regular burrito with cheese and then $1.60 for chips and salsa. That is a $11 lunch.  How much does a tortilla, rice, beans, and  2 ounces of carne asada cost these days?
author: Frank V.

description: I've been going to La Taqueria for over 25 years and the carne asada burritos are just as tasty, juicy and delicious as they were when I first had them when I was a 5 year old boy with a bowl haircut. Like many others have stated, there is no place in a burrito for RICE, and the folks at La Taqueria have followed this rule to the tee since they first opened. I have enjoyed the many evolving murals that have appeared on their wall over time. As for beverages, I recommend ordering a large Fresa if you enjoy drinking a 20 oz cup of freshly chopped, sweet, succulent strawberries! I subract one star for their unreasonably long (3 week) closures during the christmas - mid january holiday period for remodeling (every year). I have found myself standing in front of LT during this time, craving their delicious burritos with nowhere in sight that can compare. (But then again, I should know better...)
author: John Eric S.

description: i love this place, it is awesome. try their hot and spicey shrimp. out of this world!!!
author: RICK M.

description: I grew up in Southern California where the Mexican food is at it's finest...though...I have never had better carnitas in my life than I have had at La Taqueria. Get the carnitas tacos with everything, chips and guacamole and a Corona and you've got a slice of heaven. I swear.
author: Megan K.

description: lives up to the hype.  my choice for "best mexican food in the mission" (which is a religious debate in this neighborhood).  i'm a chicken burrito guy (with no extras... not needed when the meat is this fresh), but i also agree with other reviewers that the tacos are amazing.
author: Brady W.

description: i have to say this hands down is the best burrito/taco spot in the city...the drive from daly city to this hot spot in the mission is soo worth it~it tastes authentic/fresh/makin u want more,,,,i had the mentality that a burrito always needed rice to be complete~thats a negative....only buzz kill about this spot is that it doesnt open late on fri/sat nites....this place would bank & make a kill if they were to stay late...theyd have all the drunks comin in at 1-3 am in the morning
author: elmer d.

description: did this place closed? i tried to call & no answer?!
author: eastbay p.

description: The customer service is absolutely horrid. I am a Latina woman and was behind several non-Latino/a customers. All three groups/people of white customers received 100% attention from the girl taking people's orders; she gets to me and is completely distracted and actually "rolls her eyes" at myself and my 5 year old son and then literally walks away from me as I'm speaking to say "hi" to a friend, and returns without apologizing and then continues to ask me the same question 3 times (if I wanted something other than the quesadilla and side of sour cream I had requested) As I pick up my order, the sour cream is missing and I ask the owner for my sour cream and he yells at the cashier "did you charge her for sour cream?" she looks at me, rolls her eyes and says, "no".  The owner proceeds to tell me, "you didn't order sour cream, you have to pay extra!" I was so upset I walked out. Food is average, but customer service is absolutely awful. They have lost one more customer. It's truly unfortunate that a Latino restaurant in the Mission appears to respect their white customers and not Latinos. *I've had several Latina friends experience the same thing here* I guess our money isn't as "good".
author: Marta F.

description: Excellent carne asada tacos albeit rather pricey.
author: Quo E.

description: yum, yum, yum. I love this place. Best burrito when you aren't in the mood for rice.  The chips are super thick and the salsa is chunky. Perfect.
author: Jessie H.

description: Comparing with El Farolito (my current favorite): La Taq is cleaner and the ingredients seem fresher, but El Farolito has tastier burritos (maybe due to the uncleanliness?)
author: Tom S.

description: tried the chicken tacos and beef burritos, definitely chose the beef burrito!its all about the carne asada burrito here!!
author: Lina C.

description: Chorizo Burrito. Nuff Said. I can't stress the incredible flavor enough that comes from devouring such a succulent and well-cured chorizo burrito. It's very tender and you never have a fatty bite. For an area of San Francisco that is on the dismal side (as far as restaurants are concerned), La Taqueria and Old Jerusalem are two establishments that truly sing in this area of the Mission.
author: Mindy A.

description: two words: carnitas tacos.  wow, delicioso.  i bring all of my friends visiting california for this yummy, authentic experience!
author: caroline h.

description: yes--big tasty and cheap mexican food--what more can you want?
author: Sue U.

description: This place is awesome.. they got my order wrong and I -still- loved it.
author: Tony C.

description: absolutely the best tacos in san francisco.  the ingrediants are always so fresh!  beautiful avocados always...  I only wish they stayed open longer.  I guess when your business is this booming, you don't need to..
author: melissa g.

description: best tacos in SF.  i always get the veggie taco and either a carnitas or carne asada taco.  load up on that delicious spicy green salsa and a side of avocado....yummy.  ya gotta try the veggie taco if you've never had it. it is a MUST.  then walk a couple blocks away and see some awesome art at receiver gallery.
author: a g.

description: best tacos in town - no, not the cheapest, but the best.  they always use really fresh ingredients and that costs money but it's well worth it.
author: michelle k.

description: chicken taco = yum! carne asada taco = yum! salsa = mmmm!! the guac and chorizo are naste though = bleck. it's def. a bit pricey, specially since it's cash only, but, well it's just so dang good...
author: Toisha T.

description: When I can stand to go more than fifty meters from my apartment for a meal, I go here. Great burritos and some of the best Carne Asada tacos in San Francisco.
author: Derek B.

description: yum, good tacos, and the burritos are unlike the other ones you get in the mission that are full of rice...don't forget to ask 'em to add avocodo...
author: Ginger R.

description: love the super veggie burrito.! crowded and kind of awkward seating. love that it's close to bart so i can visit any time i am craving chips/salsa and my favorite veggie burrito.
author: Jen C.

description: I can't tell you why I love this place, really... While the food isn't remarkable by any stretch of the mind (I've had better, truly), it hits the spot better than any other place I know.  Grease and beans and cheese and meat... Mmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm!!!!!
author: Gigi J.

description: Very good tacos and burritos.  I like to get the carne asada burrito or taco with everything on it.
author: Bryan J.

description: believe the hype.  the carnitas burrito changes the definition of carnitas.  don't blink at the price-- you're paying for what is essentially an entire deliciously roasty, tender, flavorful pork tenderloin stuffed into a tortilla.
author: sunny d.

description: Just crazy good.  I mean, if you're ever down, you just gotta get a taco here.  Freshest, best, simple food with amazing flavors.
author: todd g.

description: Best tacos in San Francisco. Nice and greasy.
author: kk b.

description: The best burrito I have ever had. I love San Francisco, but I miss nothing more about the city than La Taqueria. They use such fresh and simple ingredients. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.
author: Lauren D.

description: This place is a total rip.  I can go to El Farolito and pay half (I really do mean HALF) the price for comparable food.  Though, I think the meat could be marginally better at La Taqueria, but I don't plan to revisit to confirm that.  They should rename it to the El Yuppie Taqueria.
author: John C.

description: Makes the BEST veggie super tacos in the world.  Really.  Even if you eat meat, you should try the veggie.
author: Rosie R.

description: believe all the hype. this place is the best there is. period.
author: Jason W.

description: Very dissapointing ratings here. I have not been hear for several years, but definitely the BEST tacos in SF. Could they have gone down hill that fast? Sketchy neighborhood, stressful atmosphere, but still great eats!!!!
author: Michael S.

description: So I've had many tacos in my life, and these are so far the best ever.  Seriously.  Order the steak or carnitas tacos with all the extras, and you will not regret it.  And don't miss the unbelievable aguas frescas.
author: Molly C.

description: only been there once, but I have to say I've had better tacos for less money within easy walking distance. not bad, just over rated. tonayense on 24th is better. farolito is better. seriously people judge with your taste buds and don't just jump the bandwagon of awards and reviews written by people who don't really know good mexican food. actually, while you're at it, go to the fruitvale/ international district in oakland. that's the real bizness over there.
author: Dan W.

description: No rice, no black beans and the salsa is mediocre, yet this burrito is amazing.  You pay a little more for this one and won't walk away stuffed, but man it is good.
author: Gary W.

description: Oh how I miss living in the Mission!!!  Now that I live in Oakland this place feels so far away.  I can't just walk two blocks for my favorite tacos this side of the Rio Grande.  My fiance doesn't quite get my obsession but I manage to convince him to go to La Taqueria occasionally.  Their burritos are good too, but if you really want to fall in love with this place eat their tacos.  A bit pricier than the other taquerias in the area, but worth every penny.
author: Gabriela P.

description: Man these tacos are good. So good, I've never ordered anything else. Pollo, carnitas, chorizo. The agua fresa is refreshing too. It's expensive for taqueria tacos, but pay a little more, get a much better meal.
author: Ben L.

description: While not un-tasty, every burrito I've had here has been floppy and underwhelming.  It makes me expect that I'll look up to see that La Taqueria is, in fact, sharing a space with Carl's Jr., as the floppiness is on par with the Green Burrito.
author: Jeff M.

description: This place transcends Mexican food as we know it.  Their blend of simple, ultra-fresh ingredients creates the greatest taco on the planet.  The carnitas is unbelievable
author: Benjamin W.

description: The vegetarian burritos here are to die for.  I have been eating at this spot for over 20 years and have not once been dissapointed.  It is authentic mexican food at a great price.  The aguas and horchata are the best of the city, and dont miss the green chile, it is spicy and delicious and I miss it every day I am not in SF.
author: Aniela T.

description: La Taqueria has by far the best tacos and burritos I have ever eaten. The secret to their success is that they keep it fresh and simple. They figured out a straight-forward menu that works and haven't changed it since they opened. They also haven't changed their excellent recipes, especially for their beans, which are certainly exceptional. If you simply want Mexican food that will fill you up you can go almost anywhere, but if you want quality, flavor and burritos and tacos made with fresh ingredients you should definitely check out La Taqueria -- and try the mango juice while you're there!
author: Alexandra A.

description: How I ended up in the Mission eating mexican food after drinking too much in Potrero Hill I don't know...or maybe I do.  Whatever.  I (think) the food was amazing.  It was late, and the food still tasted fresh and GOOD.
author: B J.

description: it's bad when you have a burrito in the mission for 8 bucks.  it's worse when you walk away feeling hungry still.  ??????  what on earth? i get the fact the meat is high quality and that they don't waste your time with rice, but maybe i like the rice.  that's what makes burritos so delicious or at least part of the reason.  lunch for me and the lady was about 18 bucks and even she wasn't full.  that's sad.  she gets full on 2 tacos usually.  everything is more expensive and not as satisfying as farrolito.
author: shar d.

description: Looking for a good place to have lunch? Drive around San Francisco and look for all the goverment employees and find out where they're having lunch!  Who can resist a couple tacos, 1 cabeza & 1lingua, and a cold beer?
author: Jeff B.

description: I have lived in san Francisco for 18 years and have gone to college at USC for the past 2 years... I have had so may different kinds of great mexican food and haae been to some of the the very besy Michelin and zagat rated restaurants and eateries in the world... But I've only ever had 2 cravings in my life, one is for new York pizza and the other is for the burritos at la taqueria. If your tryin to find decent food at a cheap price don't come here, but if want the best burrito or taco you've ever had, la taqueria is the place. I've had burritos and tacos thousands of times in the us an Mexico but still nothing even comes close to la taqueria. It is the place to go for mexican food and nothing else in the world ca. Compare to it. If you have 10 bucks to spend on food go to la taqeria, you won't leave disappointed. oh and btw they're hot sauce is amazing. trust a true San franciscan here who could t lve without this place. I've brought about 20 socal friends here and they love it. It's the best mexican food in the city
author: Ben I.

description: when i go to a mexican restaurant i usually get a burrito. i have never even had one here, but the tacos are easily the best in all of the bay area (possibly the whole world). the staff are friendly and the dude who  occasionally works at the register is very funny. it is slightly expensive, but if you want a good taco, then you must go here.
author: Aaron E.

description: best tacos in SAN FRANCISCO hands down! jus tacos! burros here is not the spot! can't picture my burro without rice! anyways... their tacos here are to die for. that fresh salsa they put on their tacos! OOOHH man! carne asada and chorizo are the best! chorizo is really greasy! but GOOD! also that green salsa on the tables hits the right spot! also their agua frescas and beer selection are up tasty! female up front at the register kinda pushy and hurries u up! attitude problem but besides her this taco spot is the best! indoor/outdoor seating good esp them nice sunny frisco days! parking is not that bad, everytime i go their find parking within a block.  but make sure to bring cash and lots of it! tacos here are bank! look at the toppings menu, i started laughin when i saw that if u dnt want beans on ur taco they charge u for that! HAHAHA! that sucks! toppings are bank! cheese, extra meat, no beans charges! WTF! i spend money in this spot ordering 3 tacos and a beer/agua im over 20$!
author: Jay R. R.

description: carnitas tacos crispy with avocado and cheese. a side of chips and salsa and avocado. a fresh fruit drink. this place is my comfort food stop when the world's been pooping on me.
author: John L.

description: this is the heaven of burrito lovers.  anyone who complains abouot the prices is obviously just looking for cheap food, and should just go down the street to fartalotos.  this place is so good i cant even really review it.  holy holy shit.  also next door at diandas the cookies are sweet.
author: Andy R.

description: clearly better quality and consistency than other taquerias in the mission. love a veggie burrito w/ avocado.
author: J M.

description: the best burritos ever. i grew up around the corner and have been eating here for years.  i always get chicken, and have never once gotten a questionable piece of meat. seems like everywhere else i do. every time. they've got the best pineapple fresa too! i dont know why everyone's bitching about the price, its still a delicious meal under $15. can't beat it!
author: erin e.
